Text Review:
Our stay at this amazing was beyond all our expectations. The service levels standards
and detail to service was beyond all our expectations. From the time we arrived to the time we left both management and staff were incredible. Facilities and amenities of the highest standard

It was a pleasure staying at the Taj Exotica. The hotel is laid out over a mix of lush greens in the front and dense landscaping around the villa rooms. Food is excellent throughout. We had a great meal at Li Bai and at Miguel, we got a great demo of excellent Italian food. Children's activities are an integral part of the experience. Very unlike a small 'kids play area' as in most hotels, TEX KIDS as they call it is a mini playschool by itself. They run 2-3 different activities plus a movie every day. For the grownups, there are yoga sessions, dance classes and enough sports options to last a fortnight! Archery, golf and cricket are standouts. A special mention of Jai at Eugenia, Shailesh at Li Bai, Rakesh, the yoga instructor and finally, Kunal at the front desk.

The best part about this hotel is that it truly demonstrates the humble yet sound service culture of Taj, one of the world's finest hotel companies. Every bit of the hotel has their distinct stamp and the property is one of the most well-maintained that we have seen - given that it is not brand new! Lets look at all aspects:

1. Rooms - are spacious with all amenities that you may need. Just the perfect gardens behind the balconey (ground level works best for that)
2. Housekeeping - very prompt, never say no attitude. Turndown of course is a given in such properties.
3. Breakfast - elaborate spread, all cuisines, many options, works best for kids who may or may not stick to one cuisine. Surprisingly, the live counters were super quick and efficient .. no delays reported by anyone .. a lot of staff members available, which can be annoying if you just want to sit and eat without someone asking "do you want something" .. having said that, turnaround is super quick.
4. Beach - clean, less crowded, very fine sand, safe, well-serviced.
5. Pool - quite big .. leela kovalam was better because it was an infinity pool . but this one has a separate spacious kids pool and guess what, a water slide for them .. addictive!
6. Restaurants - all of them are wonderful .. excellent chefs and recipes .. 2 restaurants (Eugenia & Miguel Arcanjo - a celebrity chef from Taj Palace, Bombay) are dedicated to specific personalities and that makes them special .. Li Bai oriental cuisine was awesome, with a pepper icecream as well.. Lobster Shack had a good sizzler offering + catch of the day in excellent ambience of the beach
7. Activities - a lot of options like Archery, Cycling, indoor games, Tennis, Yoga Center, Spa, Golf, Cricket, etc. I have waited for a long time in other hotels for the Golf Carts but here it was quite efficiently managed .. except for once or twice, the carts were well on time and quick to attend.
8. Kids play area - staffed with 2 ladies, with activities everyday, movie screenings, slides and other games
9. Location - we did not leave this hotel even once in the 5 days that we were there .. so not sure if the location is good or bad :)
10. Business Center - i had to use it for some work, very well made peaceful place, good connectivity, excellent board room

So overall, 5 relaxing days .. always a busy property but still not chaotic .. very peaceful .. smooth service .. no hiccups .. when the staff is always eager to help.

I need to mention Mr. Manoj Mishra and his team led by Mr. Narayan who made the stay comfortable for us.
Also the front desk team, the check-in process started from Airport and as we entered the hotel, everyone was prepared for our check-in which means they were all informed about our arrival, pickup, timing of alighting at the hotel, etc.

So no cribs, no complaints. Make sure you bicycle through the property, spend enough time on the beach & pool and have some non-buffet exotic dishes at their restaurants.

Spoilt for now.

We stayed at this hotel as a 3 night extension to a guided tour of India. We travelled with Voyages Jules Verne (VJV), the whole trip was a fantastic experience. We had spent the previous night at The Taj Mahal Palace Hotel in Mumbai and were very disappointed with our experience there - it did not live up to our expectations; a separate review will be posted of our stay there.
From the minute we arrived at the Taj Exotica everything was magical. We were greeted with a welcome drink and, as we were early, we sat in the bar for about 40 minutes until our room was ready. The service throughout the stay was impeccable. We were driven to our room in a little buggy. Our room was enormous yet cosy and comfortable. Our VJV tour guide who had met us at the airport even rang after 1 hour to check that we had settled in ok. Our room had its own garden area and included a hammock for relaxing in the shade. The first night we dined at the Lobster Shack overlooking the beach and a very helpful waiter, Flavian, helped us select our main course from the live seafood in the tank. He even recognised us when we went to the bar the following morning for our 11am drink and knew our room number and what we liked to drink - outstanding service!
We were also looked after very well by Chayanika in the buffet restaurant. We were only there 3 nights but she made an effort to get to know us and always found us a good table to sit at. I recommend the Kathi Kebab for lunch and the Dosa for breakfast- extremely tasty! It was surprising to see some European tourists sticking to very plain food - they were missing out on so much.We did not eat at any of the speciality restaurants as the food in the buffet restaurant was so good. The fresh Mango juice was delicious and all the food was cooked form products that were in season.
The grounds surrounding the hotel are green and full of flowers. There is a small course and cricket matches arranged most afternoons. The swimming pool was clean and at 4pm every day we were given free ice creams - a nice touch. You can also sit on the beach; the sea is warm and was fun to swim in as it has some waves. Pool towels are plentiful and the security guards check you in and out as you walk down to the beach. 
This hotel is so good that we have already booked to go back next year and have persuaded friends to join us. I just hope we get the same room as it was in a perfect location.It is unusual for us to go somewhere more than once so this tells you how good it is. This is quite possibly the best hotel in the world!

service is quick. clean room, tasty food. ambience is beautiful. went with frnds. stayed here for few days, people can stay with their family or frnds. beautiful places nearby. it is located in benaulim,

Fabulous property, well maintained, good and helping staff. From 20 May 2016 we stayed in this property for four nights. Staff is excellent, they are there to help u all the times, housing keeping is prompt. Front desk and business center staff are helpful that they make ur stay comfortable. Lot of choices in food, staff in restaurants are so nice they treat u like ur at home. Somehow I forgotten my specs at swimming fool area next day they returned to me, nice people, u can trust them. They provide electric car for in house transport, drivers of the same are so good they always enquire u for drop. Special mentioned about one driver Mr. Sanju he was so cooperative and helpful. All this make our stay excellent and we enjoyed lot. This is place worth visiting, and we will definitely visit again.

First we like to start by saying this is a fabulous resort. Our experience could not have been better. From friendly staff, to exotic foods from all the restaurants onsite. We so enjoyed the wonderful grounds keeping, which was immaculate. Although, we have found that the bedding situation (mattresses) mainly seem to be the desired style for the east continent with firmness, being they are not so comfortable. However manageable. Anyhow, it was a vacation worth mentioning on the trip advisor site. We went during off season but this was not a major concern as there is plenty to do on the grounds with activities being offered by the resort. The children can be kept busy at Tex kids, and there is a variety everyday for the children. Bicycling, archery, tennis, table tennis, are just a few to mention to keep those minds going. There is not a babysitting system available so if you bring smaller children you must manage with them during activities. Overall, we had a pleasant experience at this resort and if we come back to India, we may return to Goa at the Tal

Wonderful place. Super spacious. Comfortable villas. Food is above average and can be better. One of the must visit places in the quiet areas of Goa. Away from the usual Goa tourist traffic. Best time to visit : winters 
The staff is good and very helpful.

It was a very good experience in that resort. When you entered they will treat you like queen or king or else prince n princess. They will not only to take of you but they are there whenever you needed them to be there. Otherwise u have your own spece especially for couple. You must visit it once you will definitely enjoy it. N the food was too delicious. Very neat n clean the looby area n all over the resort.

The hotel location is just fantastic. The staff, right from those who welcome you to those who help you for breakfast, at your rooms, at the pool, at various restaurants and those who help you check out, are just amazingly wonderful people.

We stayed at this exotic place for 2 nights in August.
This is a wonderful property ; 140 rooms spread over green 56 acres of well maintained landscaped garden.

The property has tennis court,Golf course,cricket,Table tennis ,archery etc activities.

The lobby is huge with excellent ambience and has pool tables.

The rooms are clean,spacious,well maintained with flat TV screen,working desk,safe,spacious bed with balanced hardness/softness of mattress.
The bathroom has shower area as well as bathtub.

The property has swimming pool and bicycles are available on complimentary for total 2 hours per room.
It would have been great if bicycles are provided on complimentary basis for the entire duration of the stay rather than 2 hours per day.

The staff is outstanding in terms of hospitality.
The staff across main entrance,main desk,restaurants,activity desk,housekeeping,beach access gate is warm,polite and eager to assist you for your needs.

There is a direct access to the beach which is manned and towels are provided at the access gate.The beach is very clean and guarded.

The restaurant has amazing food with daily change in menus and live counter serving different delicacies.

We enjoyed every moment of our stay.Would like to return next time to stay for more number of nights.

Overall a amazing relaxing experience!!!

Can a hotel surpass itself? It can. This is my second visit and the third for my wife and each time the experience has surpassed itself. 
The property is beautiful, maintained with care and love. The lawns are neat and the pool is always sparkling. The rooms are tastefully done with a subtle touch.
But what is striking, and this is true of every single Taj property is the quality of their service. It goes beyond routine and touches your heart with warmth.
The checkin is super efficient and amazingly courteous with Siddharth Jain leading the way.
What amazes you again is the personalised service in the restauraunts. While everyone was great, I would like to mention Mr Ganga, who with his care and attentiveness feel really welcome , every single day. Words cannot describe his talent and skill. Mr David and Aslam were good as well and the ability of the restauraunt manager, Mr Sailesh ( sorry if I have got the name wrong) to supervise with a smile was amazing. He demonstrated great ability to make you feel wanted and wanting to return again.
The housekeeping was wonderful, silent yet superbly efficient.

Keep it up Taj Exotica. You are the best in Goa and ofcourse we will be back again next year. Hope you continue to do well...it would be difficult to be better than what you already are because you have set such great standards for yourself.

Short Version:
Beautiful property, Amazing hospitality with attention to minutest of details, Great food, Clean and private beach

Long Version:
This was our second visit to a Taj property. Taj, I believe spoils you, you get used to highest standards in hospitality and luxury. When expectations are this high, there is always a chance that you can get disappointed. Taj Exotica even beats such high levels of expectations! :)

Amazingly beautiful and expansively green property! They have great food options. Their private beach is clean and a great experience.

If you have read this far enough, I don't think so you ll need additional convincing. Go there and check out what the fuss is about Taj Hospitality! You ll be surprised, pleasantly and happily :)

Excellent ambiance, very good property, well appointed rooms, very well maintained lush green lawns. Overall an experience of a life time.. It was my second visit there. There was a special occasion for which we received very memorable surprises from the hotel sid.

My husband and I stayed at the Taj Exotica in March this year for 6 days. I stayed previously with several friends at Park Hyatt 2 days (see my review).
At first I was a little disappointed because, compared to Hyatt, the hotel seemed deserted.
But in short time I realized that, in fact, the hotel was offering the extra peace and relaxation we needed before we returned home to our usual activities.
The hotel (at the same level rooms) was much luxurios and the gardens more manicured.
The golf course is well maintained. Pool, beach very clean and quiet.
The staff is very attentive, courteous and eager to serve you and help you.
Breakfast was impeccable.
We dined at the resort's restaurants only three times. In the first two evenings we ate in two restaurants nearly empty. When I saw the prices, I realised why. They were much biger than at the other very good restaurants in India. Most of the hotel guests ate often at restaurants near the hotel owned by locals or at the Lobster Shack, one of the hotel's restaurant that was very good. We had lunch there several times and dinner in the last evening of our stay.
We remember with pleasure our stay at the Taj Exotica and, if my husband and I will wish again to come in Goa for relaxation and a wonderful and peaceful place, we will definitely return.

One of the best luxury hotels in Goa . Though it is little bit costly but mind blowing experience u will get here . The welcome by the hotel staff was too good. The rooms are absolutely fantastic . This hotel provides u great services including laundry , wifi , spa , bar , swimming pool , gym and so many others . The food is also good but Indian food is not too much good . Overall it was a very nice experience staying here . But one problem is that it is not in the middle of the Goa city so markets are far away from this hotel .

Stayed August 2016, travelled with family

I stayed here for three nights. The cottages are lovely. The property is green and facing the beach. It's perfect for families with young kids or couples. We were there on a work trip. The property has many outdoor activities; football, cricket, golf, cycling, archery, super swimming pool. 
Service and food are excellent. The rooms are a bit old now but nothing to complain about. Can't wait for the new renovated rooms which will be available this season.
The property faces the beach. You can take a walk at the Pristine Goa shore or simply laze in your room.
The Jiva spa is a must visit and free yoga sessions are good too.
Perfect relaxation!!

We have chosen Taj Exotica to celebrate my 60th birthday alongwith two more birthdays in family. The experience was beyond our expectations. The Taj people made our celebration a memorable occation with all thier personalized services and hospitality. Taj is Taj one must say.

Taj Exotica is the flagship resort of the Taj Hotels group and it really lives up to its reputation as being a flagship resort. We took a family vacation to the hotel and stayed at one of their villas with the plunge pools. And the experience did not let us down one bit. From the arrival at the airport itself when we were provided a car to get to the resort (very helpful driver named Abdul), to the check in at the hotel...everything was handled extremely professionally and smoothly. The hotel itself was amazing...right on a wonderful beach (and quite a clean, uncluttered beach as well), with so many activities that you just don't have to leave the property to enjoy. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. Extremely courteous, and helpful, everybody made sure that our stay at the hotel was comfortable. Special mention needs to made here of the staff at Li Bai restaurant, who took special pains to cater to the different tastes of me and my wife (I like my food to be a bit spicy while she wanted a completely non-spicy dish). The chef (Mr. Rawat) was also extremely nice. The other staff, at the buffet (especially the chefs at the live counters who made all the wonderful stuff for me...double thumbs up), and the staff the children's center, and generally everybody was wonderful. I would rate the hotel and the experience as one of the best (if not the best) that I have experienced...and would love to come back again and stay there longer. If the staff at the hotel read this...thanks to all of you guys for making our stay so pleasant! Keep up the good work!

It was a great tym there is really loved it i hope to go there again??? and we really enjoyed our stay there....and I would say more people should go there and I am sure they will enjoy their tym ......thank u for ur service ....

It's always great coming back to the Exotica... their staff is warm and friendly and they remember each request you have ever had! They welcome us with custom made surprises and the fact that it's DOG FRIENDLY and fabulously LUXURIOUS makes it the perfect vacay spot!

The local Goan cuisine restaurant is really really brilliant. The hotel is spread out and provides optimum privacy and serenity. A perfect place if you wish to disconnect for a few days, from routine.

I can recommend very highly this hotel . Everything is perfect and the staff and the surrounding are excellent. Garden, beach, etc. are I must say the best in South Goa. During the season the tourists will enjoy the shack on the beach which is a must during the day or Sunset for a cocktail and dinner. You can select your own sea food and very fresh.

I had visited this hotel on the holiday trip of my company then I checked in and this hotel had a great employees and their services are excellent they will provide good food so I suggest every one when you go to goa their it has a very luxurious swimming pool please check into this place

If you visit the goa to spend your holiday then you can visit the TAJ EXOT to spend your holiday with bast of cost, I told you if you visit the taj, then it is the best moment of your life , I believe it is true.

We planned our Family get-together at Taj Exotica Goa, this year, We had cousins
from all over India, Nepal coming to Taj Exotica. We stayed from 6th to 9th August 2016. We were welcomed by a welcome song, they gave us scented towels to refresh ourselves. We stayed in room no. 524, nice spacious rooms, with a balcony, Bathroom with tub and Bath area. Few Apples and Banana in the room, nice computer table and chair. Separate fridge with cool drink, beer available. Coffee, Tea, Green, German tea, coffee, water bottles are available. Forest essentials Aloe Verra, soaps, body lotion, shampoo were excellent. took a few home. :) 1st Day we checked in at around 3:30 pm, and had a late Lunch, Chicken Katti Rolls and Biriyani. We entered our rooms, and took rest the 1st Day.. We had special Goan Dance program by the Staff of Taj which was enjoyed by Grace & Samantha, then we had a our 1st dinner Buffet with the family. 
Day - 2 - 7th August 2016, Got up early, to have my jog by the Beach, Cool breeze, the sound of the waves, the staff wish us Good Morning!. Had my morning coffee, devotion at our room. enjoyed the Buffet breakfast, Ham Bacon, Chicken sausage, pork sausage, Boiled fish, cut fruits, regular south Indian food, Varieties for Mousse cake, Dosais, special omlete, and many more. After breakfast the kids enjoyed the time with the cycles. We had a time for photos with the entire group. After the cycle ride, we got into the large swimming pool, which has a slide for Kids. We played volleyball, throwball in the pool with all the cousins until 12 noon, took bath to be ready for Lunch.. Enjoyed the variety of food items, and went for our afternoon nap.. slept till 4pm. Day - 3 - 8th August 2016, As usual, wake up, Go for a morning Jog in the beach, the waves, collect shells, wish everyone Good morning. Go cycling, and enjoy the breakfast. There is Cycles for all ages, 3 to 60. My kids enjoyed the cycling. After breakfast hit the swimming pool with family.

We usually visit Goa every year to visit friends and to relax for 2 weeks. We always visit this property for lunch, and to have a drink by the pool. We are always impressed that the staff remember us even though we only visit once a year.
Grounds are immaculate, and there is direct access to a prestige beach.
Prices are more expensive than the norm for Goa, but good value nonetheless.

One of the best Taj hotels across the country. Exotica is located at South Goa - Prime location. Has a massive builtup and resort area. 

(+)
Very nicely built. 
Massive garden area
Private beach
Refreshing architecture 
Very good food
High standard of hospitality 

(-)
Located far off from North Goa, where actual Goa action takes place

Stayed here after a tour of northern India for some relaxation and we couldn't have chosen a more perfect place! The staff couldn't do enough for you, very friendly but remaining professional. The facilities were superb with a spa and activity centre, and a fantastic range of restaurants covering all cuisines. The bar area was delightful with a great range of drinks on offer and a daily 'special'. Golf course, pool, beach, all very well tended. It was an extremely relaxing stay and everything was of the highest quality, which is why it is very popular with Bollywood stars and Indian sports stars. Some guests clearly chose to eat and drink outside the hotel every day on the cheap, not sure why you'd stay in a beautiful hotel like this with fantastic restaurants to then trail out for standard fayre and cheap booze.

Absolutely lovely hotel. Would come again. Very nice room.. courteous staff and well managed. Lovely hotel to stay and good rate according to hotel brand name. Front office staff are friendly and smiling face.

Great relaxing stay at this Taj hotel. Service is great and rooms comfortable and clean. The hotel is undergoing a refurbishment and the rooms are beginning to look a little tired - especially the bathrooms.

We stayed one night at Taj Exotica and since we checked in until we checked out everything was just perfect. Hotel staff is very friendly, polite and always smiling. We used the Spa for a couple massage and it was a wonderful experience. We had the Tea timing at the swimming pool and it was very nice. The amenities of the hotel are just breathtaking and the garden something to be seen. I really recommend this hotel.

Perfect Luxury that was reasonably priced. Perfect location, serene beauty with lush green landscape. Great Spa, Easy beach access with all bells & whistles. Will certainly recommend this place to friends & family. Thank you to ALL the staff members & Management for a great experience.

This is the fourth time, I have stayed at a Taj hotel. This is the fourth time I can say the service has bee. Excellent. The food was also in all restaurants fantastic. I can only congratulate your hotel on the very high standards. I particularly want to praise Santosh who every night cleaned our room. His politeness and proactive approach was excellent. Also your buggy drivers were all helpful and indeed security who were increditwhen by mother in law thought she had lost her bracelet. The effort tak n to look for it was more than one would expect. Finally I think his name is Sathivraj. He was always very helpful at breakfast. I know how busy you are but I e had a large family and three Kodachrome need 5, two weeks need 2. He always helped broker my things. It is unfair to name individuals however, as I have to say that all staff have been a excellent. Eg I could add Ashton at the Lobster Shack. The list is endless. 
The only criticism I have is that the room bathrooms could do with a little modernising. They look a little dated now. 

However otherwise it has been a fantastic stay.

Just back from a 4 night holiday to this property. The place is amazing, wonderful blend of nature & luxury. There is a renovation in progress but u wouldn't even notice. Stayed in the luxury sunset view villa with private pool which was very nice although the bathroom was a bit dated. The air conditioned area of the restaurant should have more tables & the buffet should have more non vegetarian options for meat / seafood lovers like us. Staff is very attentive, helpful & cater to all your whims & fancies, u can't go wrong with this place - just go for it!!

Stayed May 2016, travelled with family
Less

This was our fist stop over in Asian holiday.it was an placenta stay in taj.very friendly staff little bit disappointed on front desk but over all we enjoyed.room is very big and big flat screen tv perfect.
Huge breakfast on buffet thank you very much

The hotel is a mini Goa by itself..beautiful locale..good food..friendly staff..overtly a pleasure stay...away from the maddening crowd of North Goa...pure rest in a clean environment...if you are looking for a holiday for self or gifting someone a royal holiday this is the place to stay

After reading all the excellent reviews we stayed there for 2 nights, and the experience was GOOD but not EXCELLENT. We were made to wait for more than 1.5 hours to get the room even when we were travelling with an infant and were staying at the pool villa, The booking we got online was without breakfast, and when we asked the Front office folks to give us some package for meals ( like Breakfast + Dinner ) etc which is common at Goa, we were replied with a NO. there was no flexibility no WOW factor offered to us. My 3 year old daughter asked for welcome drink but was not offered by the steward who was serving to other adults. That was quite unacceptable behavior. The Property is good its massive. Humongous Swimming pool and Green areas are there to welcome all guests. There are Kids activities as well to keep the little ones busy. The food is OK but is SUPER EXPENSIVE. There is no discount for the in house guests as well. A property which could have easily been rated 5* had they focused just a bit on Customer service.

We visited for 4 days in Mid April, to attend a wedding celebration, and found the Taj to be a spectacular property with stunning grounds, and access to a beautiful beach. Most of the rooms are large bungalows(or two storey Villas) cleverly located in amongst the tropical gardens. The central Hotel building resembles a Maharaja's palace with a spectacular atrium, where a magnificent Buffet was served to our party on the first night of our stay. Indeed all the food served at each meal was outstanding. The hotel staff managed the wedding day in an excellent fashion. Our only small issue would be that upon checking out bills for most of our party had been prepared using standard charges, rather than the pre arranged discounted rates for our large party.
After some discussion the Manager agreed to rectify his error.

I had visited the restaurant for lunch today with my family. The sea facing view is excellent. Worth going once to experience this.

The ambience and the service was very good.

The F&B manager was very co-operative.
Thank you for for nice hospitaiblity

Have been at this hotel before. Layout and service is just great. I love this hotel will definitely go again. Prime minister of India and President of Russia stayed the same week. Don't have to say much.

Loved the humongous property and its "family like" staff. Food and drinks were a bit expensive but you will know where that extra money went when you taste it. Location couldn't be any better. We stayed in the Garden villa room, the view was great, mattress and pillows were comfortable but bathroom was not up to the mark. Check-in and check-out were smooth. Smiling staff and great pool. They deliver fresh fruit basket and news paper everyday in room. We were allowed late check-out as our flight was later in evening. They came to see us off when we were leaving which is a nice gesture.
Totally recommended. 
Special thanks to Kunal on the reception for making our stay memorable.

I had attended an Int'l conference here in 2002. I promised myself to return again sometime again soon since it was a rushed week. Finally I was able to return here after 15 yrs. I noticed many changes since last visit. This property was barrier free then, but not anymore. Must be due to security reasons. I enjoyed my overall stay at this hotel. Wednesday night was buffet night and there were variety of delicious food. If anything to suggest, do not visit during the monsoon season. It being low season they were also repairing their property therefore no sleep until late morning, which was not fun for a person on vacation. I had few bad experiences due to weather and construction related issues which was unfortunate but the Resident Manager, Siddhartha did his best to accommodate and make sure my stay was memorable. Looking forward to visiting Goa's Taj Exotica again during the spring season soon. I just hope that I won't have to wait another 15 years to visit this beautiful property again.

Travelled here in December was nice to see the staff welcoming especialy Namits.Amazing situ on Benaulim Beach. Plenty of loungers on a great pool . Great service throughout. Loved my staff.Arnab helped me with food options.Ganga at coffee shop was excellent he served us really well.will definetely come back.

Fantastically located hotel in front of Galle Face. We stayed in the club rooms, which are spacious and give access to the Executive lounge and benefits. The hotel has a pool and gym, the breakfast buffet is fantastic. At times and in places the Taj is looking tired.. I guess when the new hotels they are building next door are complete they will have to up their game to compete

I went to celebrate the new yr and it became the best yr of my life by visiting there the staff members were very good in nature as can be seen by there talk and it also pocket freindly so i request to uall also visit and enjoyHope to visit soon as i loved the facilties...

Good place for a relaxing stay, with the view and the grass. Golf course OK with good coach (Vijay). Breakfast not enough International. You can diner on the beach in the area (better than in the restaurants inside the hotel). Room comfortable, but you can sometimes hear the neighboor.

Located far from the colourful hustle and bustle which is Goa, this property is perfect for a relaxed family getaway. We were a family of 6 adults, there to celebrate my Mom's 75th birthday. Lovely huge rooms and baths. In fact, the luxury rooms and suites are better than the villa rooms with plunge pools. The villas have the old vintage style decor, so the baths have the look and feel of old, outdated fittings. Our preference is for the modern, updated style, so had the folks moved out of the plunge pool villa to an executive suite. Food and service excellent as usual. The extra arrangements of a cake and room decorations were wonderful too. Two thumbs up!

We stayed for 2 nights with kids at this place. We had a villa with garden view for one night and ocean front the other which are recently built (or renovated) and looks more modern. Beach is about 200 meters away from the property. South Goa beach are usually not crowded. Kids enjoyed pool and children's activities. Staff is good. If you stay for 2 nights or more ground transportation to and from Airport or Train station is free.

I have been visiting this hotel for 10 years. The staff have become very greedy, food price has increased by 10 times, There were no beach beds as they were banned by the government which they did not inform the clients. Very Poor show on hotels part

Great property, great location. BUT The service is not as great as expected. They don't have their own fleet of cars and drivers, it's all outsourced so it's a luck of the draw if you get anyone decent. Our airport pickup was not very professional. Made us walk for about 10mins on the road weaving in and around moving cars and then left us to wait in the middle of a junction where cars started going around us, like we were a roundabout, quiet an unnerving experience. The car that picked us up was filthy and the driver was not professional!!
When we arrived at the hotel the welcome was not very warm. We had to wait 6 hours for our room. We were not even offered water or refreshments while we waited! 

This hotel also will not organize any tours for their guests, guests are expected to organize everything themselves!! We were just given a map and told to call up and arrange ourselves!!

I also noticed most of the staff on the ground are motivated out of fear! I asked one guy who was cleaning to give me directions within the hotel and he told me he couldn't walk me to the area I wanted to get to because if he was seen with me his bosses would swear at him and insult him. I feel bad paying premium rates to an organization who treat their staff this way. Taj Exotica, This is 2016!!
This is our first experience of Taj hotels, will unlikely stay with them again.
To complete this review with a positive, the food is good, but some of the restaurant staff clearly do not have the training. It's not their fault, it's the management!! 
The breakfast crew were the best !!

Stayed in the Taj Exotica for 5 nights between 5th and 10th October 2016. Originally we had booked for 9 nights, but before we even left Scotland, we had a telephone call from the lovely Indira (Sales & Marketing Manager) to explain that the BRICS Summit (world leaders and trade politicians) were taking over the hotel on 12th October, and we would have to be moved to another Taj Hotel. As it turned out, we actually left 2 further days early, because the BRICS Summit was so invasive, so noisy, so disruptive and so inconvenient. I have to emphasise that Taj Hotels had no control over this - in fact, we felt really sorry for the hotel staff who were being controlled just as much as us. Restaurants were being closed; bars were being emptied; furniture moved; security was becoming intense; and our peace and privacy was being taken over by construction workers, media people and officials. Basically, the hotel was being taken over by the Indian Government under very strict security, and we had no recourse. I cannot thank Taj Hotels enough, for their tolerance, their understanding and their service, during this very challenging period.
The hotel is very beautiful - a little old in places, but our rooms were really lovely, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The 5 days and nights we had at the Exotica were good. We were moved to the Vivanta by Taj Fort Aguada in North Goa, where we were given amazing upgrades by way of compensation. The hotel staff, and Indira D'Lima in particular, could not have been more helpful. However, the hotel was being renovated around us, for the BRICS summit - everything was being painted, mended, cleaned and smartened up. My friend went to the Spa for a pedicure and her feet were coated in silver paint from the foot basin - not a good experience.
All in all, I am sure this is normally a lovely hotel, but we saw it in very difficult circumstances for tourists, and although Taj Hotels did their very best for us and we totally appreciated that, the Indian Government should be ashamed that they treated their tourists so badly, to make way for world politicians. I would normally rate this hotel good or excellent, but on this occasion, it has to be poor.

Rooms are old and need to be refurbished, cleanliness of room really average. During my stay, constant motor noise of grass cutter or high pressure water jet. food of the Indian restaurant is average (only the Chinese restaurant Li Bai is good), staff is friendly but not really skilled. Price is too high for the offered services.

There are better places I believe to choose.
This is not the Taj which we used to experience . I am thoroughly disappointed with the the way they manage the guests.
First of all they don't care for room preference when I asked for a room close to beach they gave me the farthest what's the point paying such steep price.
Although the servicing folks and are nice . Front desk persons lack experience. Don't care for any choice of the customer.
My colleague had a horrible experience they complained that he spilled ink on the bedsheets which is cheap allegation , they even asked him to pay money . I think pretty soon they will ask you to pay for so
Spilling water in the bather and sand in the room. This is not Taj !!

My wife & I visited here in April 2016 for our anniversary meal at the Miguel Arcanjo restaurant. We had booked in advance and informed them this was a special anniversary treat for us and we had travelled a long way to get there. They had kindly accepted an Amazon package the day before for us, which contained a present for my wife in it.

As we arrived, I asked the Maitre D' if I could please have quick access to the hotel wi-fi connection for 1 hour as I needed to check an email.

He returned and said that it was not possible for a non-hotel guest to access their wi-fi network.

I asked again nicely and he said he would get the IT guy to try.

The IT guy then comes to our table and says that is is impossible for us to get access to the internet.

I ask him to please check with his boss and see if we can please quickly go online.

Some time later, he returns and says that we can access the wi-fi network,but it will be 900 Rupees for 1 hour.

I then ask the Maitre D' to please check this, as this seems a lot of money for 1 hour of wi-fi access. 

He returns and says it will be 900 Rupees. I ask him to check again as I don't think that is reasonable and we will leave if that is the case.

He checks with his manager and returns and says that remains the case.

My wife and I leave the restaurant and go home. Why?

1. We were about to spend 12,000 Rupees on a lunch. To charge 900 Rupees extra for the internet is ridiculous.

2. At 900 Rupees per hour, it would have been cheaper to get a room and become a resident, as 22 hours of the internet would have been 20,000 Rupees which is less than a room there.

3. We had just left Johncy's bar in Benaulim 2 km away, having bought 1 Kingfisher beer for 80 Rupees and had free wi-fi there.

Petty. Small-Minded. Poor customer service. Wi-Fi costs the hotel nothing to share with a guest like us. Good luck to them.

Spent the long weekend with the wife and kids this month. 3 nights 4 days. 

First the good bits. Sprawling beach front hotel over 56 acres with well manicured lawns and spacious rooms. Great people serving guests in most parts of the hotel (see not so nice bits for terrible staff). Child friendly with a number of activities engaging kids through the day. Clean beach and beach beds offered on the beach by the hotel. 

The not so great bit. Had a nasty experience at their restaurant near the beach. The lobster shack has a manager with a foul mouth and nasty temper who threatens and says stranger things unprovoked. The restaurant ran out of potatoes (yes this is not a typo - POTATOES) which were on the menu. The manager of the restaurant walked up to us telling us that we are in "a sea food restaurant and we shouldn't be expecting vegetarian food" On pointing out to him that its on the menu he said "i'm talking to you nicely .....". Restaurants run out of food sometimes (even 5/7 star hotels such as these)- no problem with that - the attitude however is unworthy of the hotel rating and the price they charge, the rudeness is totally unacceptable ever from a road side shack. I am not sure I am doing justice in explaining the nastiness of the experience but I can tell you this that im not one to get impacted by undertones. 

Request to meet the General manager was turned down and director F&B met with us apologizing for his colleagues behavior. Usually Taj hotels have very high standards of service - having stayed in a number of taj hotels across cities.

It was not as great as we thought it was going to be, especially the dining. Service was very slow and each course didn't arrive at the same time especially main courses. The side dishes took at least an additional 10/15 minutes after the meat/fish arrived so the meal was not hot or warm. We ate in the same restaurant as breakfast is served. Very disappointing.

Pre-stay emails were handled curtly and professionally. At first, a rate sheet was sent and I was later urged to book an expensive room. Taking hints and advice from fellow reviewer's, I did not sway and stuck to the Garden Villa. We went for the Monsoon Package with all meals and airport transfers. I am a Taj Gold Inner Circle Member so I had expected a few extra's. That happened in the form of moving rooms thrice in 2 days. From the Iron Griddle to the Frying Pan and then straight into the fire! Let me summarize my review into the Good and the Bad.
Yes, I would be very critical in rating this property when it markets itself as being a 5 Star resort and charges customers so heavily, being arguably the best property in Goa?!
After the dilemma on what rating would be apt, I settled for Poor. Read on!

The Good:

- Professional handling at the airport. We were escorted to a private car for transfers to the Hotel. 45 mins and we were there
- Beautiful property spread over 50 acres of greenery
- Hats off to the staff that maintain it. Surely difficult to maintain this vast expanse!
- Service extra-ordinaire from everyone around. Selfless and very courteous. That itself would win a 5 star rating. 
- Good public swimming pool and a relaxing stretch of private beach. All very nice. We were in Heaven!
- Plenty activities indoors. We tried Archery. There is Pool, Tennis, Cricket, Gold and others.
- Evening entertainment programs were good
- Live Goan music. A nice touch in the room with balloons, a customized pillow and birthday decorations since we were there to celebrate the birthday of my wife.

The Bad:

- Shoddy cars for airport transfers. Very old, poorly maintained. Dangerous drivers both ways who used the "brake" very freely and only wore seatbelts until we were in city limits. Amazing!
- Far and secluded in South Goa. Nothing outside and a taxi ride to the nearest habitation would cost at least 300-400 Rs single way. Basically you are at the mercy of onboard food. More about it later!
- No recognition given for my Gold status. You guys should take lessons from the Hilton, IHG and Marriott Groups in regards to Status Recognition offered to higher tier status members at Check In and throughout the stay!
- As already said, we moved 3 rooms. First day was a Luxury Room- I would have expected that upgrade anyways since I was a Gold member, but they demanded an upgrade voucher, so I gave that to them.
- Anyway- the Luxury room- Dimly lit, old tacky furniture, not child friendly- sharp fruit knives on Table, old and dilapidated. A century old washroom in tatters. The selling point was the Jacuzzi in the washroom, which we tried to use at 10 pm. Old mucky and smelly water splurged out. Housekeeping was busy till 11.30pm trying to clear off the drainage by refilling and emptying the tub. The doors to the verandah could not be locked leaving the room open and hence a chance towards breach of security. Of course that was fixed too. The bed was soft n soggy. Very poorly placed electrical outlets. Overall non-ergonomically viable. 
- Next room change was to the "Sunset Villa" with a private plunge pool. Okay, this was given to us as a favour of a "real" upgrade- from 3pm on Day 2 to 12pm sharp on the next day of check-out. We were told that they would join two twin beds- that's the best they could do. Apparently this hotel of 140 guest rooms is always sold out, even on a Monday!
- Anyway- The "Sunset Villa"- old and dilapidated- again everything in tatters. The so called plunge pool had sticky floors, wonder when it was cleaned the last time. Just the feel of that made me feel yucky and dirty! So the "Upgrade" went to waste. The holder for the showerhead in the washroom was so loose that the telephone shower dislodged itself from the holder when the shower would be turned off and would hit straight on the head. I hurt myself badly due to this, but learnt the way the second time around. I had already spent enough time with maintenance teams in my previous room, so I did not bother to go through it all over again. This Villa was a big disappointment.
- So we wanted a late check out and we had to exit the Sunset Villa. The front office staff did us a huge favour of giving us yet another room and forgetting that I was entitled to a late check out as a Gold member. Anyway, we went though the troubles of a room change again at 12 noon on check out day and this time it was the worst room of the lot!
- Yes, a small dingy twin bedded room with a horrible shower. The room was tucked in a corner with a view of a concrete wall outside the window. I had requested the guys to place me into the Jacuzzi Room they had given us the first day but obviously that wasn't honored. So enough about the age old tacky and dimly-lit rooms.
- Moving onto food- another great disappointment, with only a few sparks of brilliance.
- The Lunch meal at Miguel Arcanjo left us hungry at the end. And angry too! Such small portions of beautifully decorated average tasting food. Common guys, buckle up! Need I say more? 4 Course set menu's in lieu of the buffet option at the Coffee Shop. These guys tend to forget how much has been already paid as part of the meal package!
- Rest of our meals were at Eugenia, the 24 hr Coffee Shop. Yes, we didn't dare to try Alegria (Goan Food) or Li Bou (Chinese) after the horrific experience of tiny morsels of food at Miguel Arcanjo. We didn't wanna end up hungry with a 2 year old child as there is nothing to offer outside the Hotel premises and food indoors is heavily expensive if not on the "all-meal" plan.
- At Eugenia- Dessert's were always impressive, sparks of brilliance at the Live Counters. But the regular buffet was very average. Again this left us high and dry. Traveling to Goa, locked in a Resort with nothing outside, at the mercy of food indoors, all meals paid for and yet no sea food, no Goan fare, no feel of Goa. Common guys, at least see how much you are charging and what you are offering in return! Absolute loot and not justified!

In Conclusion- The rating dropped down from a 5 to a 2 (Poor) only because of the poor quality of Rooms and Poor food with NO GOAN feel whatsoever. We do not buy the excuse of planned renovations and planned up-lift. Sorry, but you do not charge us any lesser for your planned renovations!
We paid through our nose to get treated through a shuffle of 3 rooms, each worse than the other and the worst part was that the reception made us feel that we were in for a huge favour! Nope, the customer notices every nuance of how things are being dealt with and we are not prepared to pay huge amounts for a shoddy stay! The Gold status for Taj Inner Circle is the biggest waste as there is no recognition whatsoever and we would not like to be treated as any other customer if we are loyal to the Taj Group to make it up to Gold!
There is lots and lots of scope for improvement. I hope the Management does not write back an empty apology with promises of upcoming renovations or this stay being an aberration to the usual high standards!
And no, we will probably not visit again!

The first and foremost priority in a hotel is good service. This is primary for any hotel. I really feel you were not up to the mark in this. In my stay I had to continously face one or the other service issues due to which I just did not bother to notify the staff anymore, rather feel to put it on trip advisor or expedia where me and my friends book the trips and I am sorry I would think twice recommending your hotel. I was so impressed with Taj Vivanta Hari Mahal that I chose to stay in Taj Exotica but I had to experience the following issues Day 1 Bad quality of food provided in the room. When reported to the chef and manager I was sent some desserts that also without any cutlery when I again phoned to ask for cutlery I was provided with table spoons instead of tea/ dessert spoons. I did report and I was assured by the Chef, Assistant Manager In dining and the very next day the resident manager that I would not face these issues. Day 2 The breakfast fruits and cookies where not in my room where as the other room 115 had them both the rooms had no cutlery again. Day 3 I ordered some snacks from in dining on that evening in that the sauce was missing. I called up the indining to check and I was sent the sauce and the boy who delivered said sorry that he forgot. Day - Checkout It is a nice gesture of you guys that you provided the kids with complimentary pillows with their names on but on the day of checkout we left the pillows on the bags so that kids could take them, somehow they were missing again. A service issue which we faced. I think your housekeeping staff will be well aware of what things need taking and what stays back??? I really feel that paying service and luxury tax on my stay was worthless and waste of my money. Also would be rethinking of my next holiday stay in Taj properties. As an expatriate who lived abroad for many years we go on brands which have built over years it really makes me wonder now if you guys take the brand value as seriously as we do in west. The only positive thing I have to say about you guys is about the security team where they went over my expectation and got back the walking stick of my father who left it in one of the hotels. We really appreciate this and thankful for it. Hope you improve upon your service.

Needs complete re-modelling, SPA is inadequately sized with tub sized hot and cold pools. Swimming pool is very small. Hotel gives a very run down feeling. Although the staff is nice and polite. Buffet layout is very restricted.

Flies on the extensive buffet spreads, plastic bottles, milk packets , shoes and all other kinds of rubbish you could imagine on the beach( made you want to sanitizer your feet after taking a walk there) - standard reply from the management- "it's the monsoons. Nothing we can do about it"
- welcome to the great monsoon experience at the Taj!!

My wife and I went there for a short break in May, 2015. We had reserved online and called ahead to ensure that we got a first floor Luxury Room. We didn't. The had kept a ground floor room for us which we did not want. So with a promise that they would give us what we wanted we settled for a lower category first floor room for one night.

This room had a blocked/slow running basin outlet and a shower diverter that kept popping out several times during a bath. We were glad to leave the room after the first night.

Next day we moved to a luxury room on the first floor - out of the frying pan into the fire!. We spent two very uncomfortable nights. The main problem was the entrance to the bathroom. You had to go through a very narrow passage passed the shower enclosure to reach the wash basin and other conveniences. This meant stepping on the bath mat if one had been spread. And the shower! There was a small wire rack to keep your shampoo, etc. which was damaged and not replaced. So the shampoo and conditioner kept falling off. Worse, the slope of the shower floor was towards the door. This led to water accumulating every time one of us showered and water would also seep out onto the bath mat. Also shampoos that fell down would be floating in the dirty water and so had to be washed out or discarded. So we got a stack of bath mats which we had to change every time we used the shower. And to wash our as yet dirty feet we had to use the jacuzzi at the other end of the bathroom. 

The attached balcony was nice though the mosquito control had not been up to the mark. We were covered with bites after our two evenings sitting there - smoking is only allowed in the balconies and not in the rooms.

The rest of the hotel is of Taj standard though what we ordered at the restaurant (Eugenia) was not that well made. The pool is also just barely passable.

We may go back after the property is renovated but not till then.

Very old hotel. After renewing it will be much better. And they start it already. Not enough privacy on villas. very poor and not tasty breakfast. And for 5 star it should be much better. But the price like 5 star hotel its cheating. I will not recommend this place.

Goa is gorgeous. The beaches are incredible, the shacks with delicious food and drink are lovely, and I really thought the Taj would complement this experience. Sadly, no. Day 1, we were woken up at 5 a.m. by trucks at some refilling station. 
Day 2, we were told that the hotel was fully booked, and we couldn't move rooms right then, yet, there were guys taking radiators/air conditioners out of the room right next door. But then we were later moved further up the hill.
Day 3, there was a pube in my teapot.
Day 4 we were charged for water at the other restaurant we were relegated to because the main resto was too busy for breakfast.
Day 5 there was an intense natural gas smell in the bathroom of our new room. The manager didn't understand what this could possibly be, and said he'd check it out. But people didn't come.
Day 6, FINALLY LEAVING DAY, there was a big ole roach in our room. At this point I was just sort of numb from it all, so I didn't even really freak out.

Overall, everything was kind of dirty and dingy. Staff was so-so on pleasantness. I kinda get that after witnessing the way they were treated by young wealthy Scandinavians and Russians. But jeez, what is this place?!?!?

Management tried to make amends with some fruit and some Indian wine (dear heavens...Indian wine...)
I wouldn't go back. I would spend more money at a great shack on the beach, the one next to Calamari.

India is fantastic, I can't wait to go back and stay somewhere more local.

I have reflected on whether or not to write this review for some tine. And i feel I have a responsibility to share my experience.

Basically being sick there from their good cost me several thousand and after a week thinking about it i realize they should pay me!

I requested struct ayurveda cuisine weeks before and was told no problem.its not complicated and basically healthy ...

I was sick and on bed the entire duration from the food. 5 fays

The service was non existent until they knew I was sick. For example

Arrival - given sugar drink i expressed allergies to 

No awareness of my dietary needs

Waited 3 hours after checkin for pot hot water and lemon

Was told they have a strong program fpr yoga when i booked and after there learned 45 minutes a fay only which is not even enough time for a reap class

I was interrupted for room cleaning continuously when I expressed I was sick and not having

Many staff do not speak enhlish -but they say yes so you wait for hours to learn nothing being good


After the hotel doctor visit everyone was kinder and more helpful

I wrote a note to management about my illness and never had a response- no response whatsoever 

The only good thing here is the bed linens

Unless you like to waist money- stay away 

Go to a Marriott or 4 Seasons trust me

Amazing property but rooms are outmoded. Good place for family holiday especially for kids, riding cycle in such a scenic greenery was a wonderful experience.The beach is just 5 mins away from the hotel.Staffs were excellent and very courteous.Food was also good. Greenery is just mindblowing and eye-catching,well maintained. Only thing is pool villas are quite outmoded where we stayed and even wifi was not working properly.

e were to stay at Taj Exotica on the weekend of May 6-8 for celebrating our daughter's bday.
The hotel not only cancelled our reservation without checking but also never informed us about the cancellation. No call, no email, NOTHING!!
We learnt about the hotel cancellation when we called the hotel for arranging the airport pick up. We talked to three different representatives; including Floor Manager at the customer care center (Mehak) who never called back despite the promise of the same. At last we talked to Sonia from the Taj Exotica Goa, who came back with the offer of a downgrade in the room. Thanks but no thanks TAJ. We booked a room at Park Hyatt instead but the whole experience was disappointing to say the least. We chose Taj over Park Hyatt initially solely on their golden service standards, this experience was a huge let down. I am glad we made that call to confirm the airport transfer else we would have reached the hotel unaware of this goof up and ruined our happy occasion.

Rakesh Sarna needs to get this hotel in shape staff are great, the managers are on the fiddle big time. Have ruined my daughters first trip to india. The managers are over charging and changing invoices. So you think you have a set price booked from uk, but then the managers change it and add extras. My daughters experience was ruined, 5 hours fighting with managers they missed there trip that was paid for. On top of that they were given another bill for s day with extortionate prices.. Rakesh Sharna its your move.

Bad, bad, bad Taj ........ this is now you!

I had a meeting in Goa near the airport yesterday and it was over by 12.30 and my flight was at 5pm so I decided to have a treat and go to Taj Exotica (have not been here for over 10 years) and have a nice relaxing lunch.......

Drove the 40 minutes from airport and arrived only to be told by security that all restaurants are closed today ........ Hotel ..... All restaurants closed? Not possible ..... something must be open ....... No all closed!

Why asks I ...... Reply just closed and non residents can not come in!

Ok Supervisor plse ..... and name of GM plse ...... they refused to name the GM but supervisor came and repeated all restaurants closed ...... Pushed the issue and he said private party on so no outsiders ........

I choose to go to another property ....... my choice was not good but at least I got lunch.

This is not acceptable for a 5 Star property at all ........

Bad bad bad Taj

Six of us were in the Taj exotica lobby lift. We were there with group of friends to attend a function on 17th October 2015. It was around noon. The lift started and abruptly halted in between the floor. Every one in the lift panicked. We pressed the emergency buzzer as well as called through lift intercom.

For good 15 minutes no one turned up where as the lift is right at the corner of the main lobby.

Even when they came, they could not open the door and hence started to manually pulling up the lift.

The resident manager who would have come by now assured us that lift is blocked , it will not move up. He gave us stool to help climb us up as the stool is lowered to the lift floor.

We were very apprehensive of this as we have been observing Taj staff's inability to control the lift. Amongst us we discussed the situation as we know lifts are known to start in between and person getting crushed leading to fatality. We were very afraid as nothing was happening.

Out of 5 two were women and they started panicking more and also feeling nauseous. 

Resident manager assured us to come out using the lift as it won't move. Seeing no other option, as the 5 of them climbed up and moved out of the lift, the lift began to move down. That was what we feared and resident manager assured us sighting everything is under control. Clearly they were not up to the task and were unprepared.

I am sure, had I also climbed ,I would have crushed between lift door and on rushing floor.

the lift started sinking with me inside,everyone panicked again .

As the half ajar lift doors started approaching basement ,I jumped down to the floor beneath not knowing whether doors will open or not as lift touches ground floor.

My wife was in a complete state of shock fearing worst happening at the basement so as my other friends.
However our ordeal was far from over.

When we asked about lift details , it's maintainance, safety measures , the resident manager stone walled us.

He even refused to provide a compliant form saying Taj hotel doesn't have this process.

Here we are coming from a near fatal miss situation and now facing very unlike Taj official ,refusing to even register it leave aside offering an unconditional apology..

We were very tired after the cricket event and more so after the lift incident, so decided to leave.

The entire episode left a bad taste .

We will surely take this matter to logical conclusion.

We are a big fan of Taj exotica and have been here in 2011. On my current trip to Taj exotica, we found that the service has gone down considerably. We got two side by side villas with a garden right outside. One of the rooms locks was broken so it took them an hour to fix. As soon as we entered the other bathroom, we realized that the flush was not not stopping. It took them 2 hours to fix all that...soon after we realized that the bulb in the same bathroom was flickering and there was a small cockroach as well in the bathroom. Since this is a garden villa, we were ready to forget all of this and move on. Next day, we noticed that even though this is a garden style villa there were no garden chairs. So we asked them politely. The room service said since this is monsoon season they have taken them away. We reminded them that there are chairs in other villas...well sir thats only for pool villas!!! Hmmm....we are not really paying that much different, are. They politely refused and it really put a bad taste in my mind. I am here for a week and have booked two villas. There is a garden in front of my villa and i want two chairs!!! thats its. And they did not want to budge. Does not seem like the same hotel we visited four years ago. A little disappointing...

1. I made this booking over the phone & quickly received a confirmation code on my email - 87243142. I was told that I will soon receive the bank details so I can deposit the amount. This booking was made on 11th June, 2015 at 6.15 PM.
2. I waited till 12.30 PM of 12th June, 2015 but did not received the bank details. Then I sent an email to the reservations team but there was no reply. Then I called up the property & spoke to Ninotschka. She quickly sent the bank details to me at 4.47 PM on 12th June, 2015. Till then the bank was closed.
3. I was further told that the booking will be held till 12th June. HOW CAN I PAY IF I DO NOT KNOW THE BANK DETAILS???
4. It takes 24hrs for the beneficiary to be added. Moreover I do not use a Credit CARD which I feel no one needs to force me for this.
5. I visited the BANK at 10.30 AM today i:e 13th June, 2015, stood there for an hour & got to know that cash cannot be deposited because its a UBS account. Now how on earth do I know what is an UBS account? I am told I need to visit the HEAD BRANCH of HDFC, Pune. This is not possible as the bank closes at 12.30 PM.
6. The best thing was the people whom I wanted to speak are being guarded heavily & you just cannot reach them at all. There are these morons who keep saying they all are in a meeting!!! This is the sad story in INDIA that people just keep attending meetings & have no time to speak to the customers.
7. Please guys its your duty to let us know that you have a super secret bank account which does not accept cash from any branches of HDFC other than the head branch. The person on the phone quickly said that I cannot speak to the GM Mr. Saleem Yousef-- which I do not why??? and then its not their fault about the bank account...its the fault of HDFC....INDIA is just amazing....ZERO marks to the daft people working for TAJ Group !!!!!!

If you book and pay in advance then watch out. I made a booking and then requested to move it out by two months. This was due to my wife's Visa being held up in the Indian High Commission (despite having no problems with 3 previous Visa's).

They insisted that moving my booking was the same as cancelling. I made it clear that I would pay any differential amount and understood that I might not get a similar room to the one booked initially.

Totally unsympathetic. They just took my original money, for three nights stay and told me nothing could be done. If you want to deal with people like that then go ahead and book a holiday with Taj hotels , at your peril. I of course will not have anything to do with this nasty little hotel chain.

This was our last stop on our tour of India. Lovely welcome from the Manager who chatted to us on arrival. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was very large with a fabulous bathroom. The views were just amazing over the lagoon. Lovely breakfast buffet with plenty of choice. Beautiful private beach with attentive staff. Thoroughly recommend.

Very few places, even amongst the most luxurious of hotels and resorts, make you feel at home. That luxurious yet cozy, relaxed and warm feeling. Courteous staff, delicious F&B, well-decked up rooms, amazing property. It has been a couple of years, but I know I'll come back here again and again.

We actually visited here in April 2014 but wouldn't let me select that far back. Absolutely beautiful resort. Rooms were huge and gorgeous with the ponds right out the windows. All inclusive we had too, Ahh sooo much lovely food. Ahh the food and the puddings. And the bed!! Oh the bed was amazing. And the beach, lush too, and the rooms, did I mention the rooms? And the size of the bath, and the room service and buggy's to drive you around. :)) where do I stop!! Fantastic and probably one of our most favourite stays ever!!

I booked this hotel on the recommendation of friends and our travel agent and we have not been disappointed!

The lagoon terrace room has everything we need, no point to upgrade, our Room 265 is relatively nearby to the hotel, the setting is overlooking a stunning lagoon, but keep the patio doors firmly closed and take lots of mosquito repellent as they definitely bite!

As far as comfort goes, the bed is extremely comfy, with lovely linen and a pillow menu on request. There is good air con and a large fan over the bed which does a good job. There is also plenty of wardrobe space which is important for a stay of more than a week and which is not a given in every hotel.

At night, there is muted blue light around the buttons which is actually soothing, and the thick curtains allow you to have a good sleep.

The bathroom is perfectly adequate with a great shower, a nice small mirror for makeup as well as large wall mirror.

Bottled water in abundance each day in the room, and the wi fi which is free if you join Discovery club, is perfectly adequate for emails etc.

There is also a nice dressing table area, the only thing that could improve is the hair drier which is not very good! But there is also a full length mirror in the room too. 

The pool is lovely but you need to reserve beds before breakfast. The food at breakfast is great, and the service everywhere in the hotel is excellent.

We attended a Republic Day Buffet around the pool one evening, where the food was fantastic and good value too. We also ate at the Beach BBQ evening which was also a fab evening.

We had a beautiful meal with some friends at the Riverside restaurant which is Italian. on the river. They arranged a romantic table for us actually on the river bank, for my birthday, and it was a very special night.

I cannot rate the hotel enough, suffice to say that we would love to come back again soon. If you want to relax with beautiful views and surroundings, a stunning beach, good service, and comfort, then this is the place for you! 

Leela, you are certainly 5 stars in my book!

The Leela, Goa is a grand experience. Lovely landscapes, breathtaking views and excellent hospitality makes it a must visit place. The pristine beaches, lush green gardens, excellent staff and mouth watering food make it all together unforgettable experience.

Typing this eating my final breakfast at this wonderful resort. The rooms, facilities and staff are excellent. The food is wonderful as are the grounds I cannot praise this hotel enough. A special thanks to the concierge team including indira, ovina and himansu who were fabulous. And also to Ryan our waiter who looked after us at breakfast. My only complaint is I did not book to stay longer. I'm sure we will be back very soon

Its a must visit hotel if one happens to be in South Goa.The property is beautifully maintained with excellent staff service and care for all your needs.Everything from our stay to food to departure was perfect.There play area for kids z quite engaging.They treat there guests very nicely.Overall a gud experience.Also i had requested for a room as per our interest. They took gud care of it and provided us room as per our view. The property has so many activities that one do not need to step out of the hotel.Keep it up guys....Will visit u soon...Now its our permanent stay whenever we visit goa next.

If you are looking for the ultimate hotel this is it. From the moment you arrive you feel you have been transported to a different dimension. No waiting to check in you are made comfortable brought coconut drink and they bring everything to you. Great start. Rooms comfortable great view from every room. So peaceful. Good food. Food is pricey but you would expect this. Good restaurants 2 minutes walk away. Great jeweller on site. Beaches fantastic. Everything spotless clean. We loved it and will be back

Well, we spent 8 nights in "Leela" on a half board basis, in a Lagoon terrace room.
The room was amazing, the surrounds are the most beautiful I have ever seen in a hotel.
Maintenance-perfect. Food-perfect. Staff-perfect. Beach-perfect, peaceful, clean, wide and welcoming.
One night we were offered to participate in a BBQ instead the regular Buffet at the main dining room. Well, the food was nice but the entertainment program was quite poor and not appropriate to such a resort. I would not mind having a folklore show to accompany dinner (like in many other resorts, all around the world. In this way one can learn about the culture and the culinary environment all together).
The gardens are kind of a zoological garden, Heaven for birds from so many kinds. You can spend hours trying to spot a Kingfisher doing his thing and the sky is full with different kinds of kites (a bird of prey).
Another thing you might do is- do nothing, which will make you real thirsty, but drinks are never too far away, although they are a little bit pricey (but it is not something you might not expect from this kind of resort). Anyway, beach walks are always a good solution to hang out, meet some locals, collect sea shells and as recommended, simply do nothing and relax.
The "Leela"-most recommended resort. Don't miss if you are in Goa for relaxation and style.

We checked in on our anniversary and as soon as we got back after food, what we see is a complimentary bottle of wine and a small tasty cake. To be thoughtful and arrange such warm stuff within hours of our check in was a pleasant surprise. The gardens and golf course is beautiful with small lotus filled ponds. Every cuisine we ordered was great, especially the nicely done sea food. Strolls by the beach were a revelation too. They also offer some great movies to set the mood, just in case one wants to enjoy in the room itself. Off season and early bookings can get good deals as well. Overall a really wonderful experience

We came to the Leela after touring India in need of cosseted rest and relaxation and we found that at the Leela in quantities. It was a near perfect location and the staff and management could not have done more to look after us.
The location is near perfect and the rooms are of a very high standard (we had a lagoon terrace room) immaculately clean and true luxury. It is over 32 acres and they have a good buggy system and bicycles for the more energetic.
The weather in January was perfect with daytime 34-36C and constant blue sky.
The only issues were really twofold. Firstly we were full board and the 'multi cuisine' restaurant is fantastic in a great range of food but there was little that was not a curry variation. They have alternative restaurants (Indian,Seafood and Italian) but they are at additional cost and whilst we were there were deserted. Eating at nearby restaurants is probably essential for any long stay and the Beach Shacks are nearby and have great food from across the world.

All the prices in the hotel look reasonable but are now subject to local and central taxes that increase the bill by up to 40% (and the outside restaurants and shacks do not seem to charge the taxes)

It was a great holiday and we will go back !

Just returned from our stay at The Leela and have to say it fully deserves the 5 stars. Amazing staff ( who really made the stay memorable), magnificent beach and wonderful food all within tranquil surroundings that immediately make you feel relaxed.

Our one concern was the very loud music coming for the neighbouring hotel for two afternoons which was extremely annoying as it completely ruined the ambiance. We did complain to the hotel but were informed nothing could be done as it was before 10.30 at night .That said we have still stayed with the 5 stars as we had a terrific time! Thank you to you to everyone at The Leela.

Visited the Leela Goa after close to 10 years and must say was pleasantly surprised.

The property is so well maintained and looked after that one feels it was but a few years back.

We were staying at the Lagoon Suites which are very spacious, have a nice balcony facing the lagoon and a decent sized living room.

The lagoon area and the surrounding gardens are very well maintained. The spa and swimming pool also excellent. Restaurants and bars have plenty of choice and shall satisfy the most discerning guests.

Must experience Leela at its best at Goa.

Hire a bike , tiddle about the hotel ! But the best exotic marigold experience is found , through the golf course, to the beach , turn left , walk till the sand runs out !!!
There you will see more eagles , birds of prey, and any other creature of flight, looking for drying fish freshly caught , than the Attenboroughs could ever imagine !
All life IS there

The Leela Goa is a world class resort (Cond Nast top 100 Resorts Worldwide), and provides its guests with every amenity possible, and virtually every activity one could want, from archery to parasailing to golf to tennis and on and on. Multiple on property restaurants provide excellent variety in cuisine (and many local off property restaurants provide additional options). The management and staff are exceptional in every way, and wonderfully responsive to client care. Full Review:
(Scale: 1 (awful) to 10 (outstanding))

Exterior Appearance: 10+. Beautiful lagoons full of water lilies and white egrets. Gardens and flowers everywhere. Three kilometers of beautiful, wide, clean beach. A beautiful golf course. 

Interior Public Space Appearance: 10+. the lobby is massive, open, elegant and welcoming. A long pool containing carp and other fish bound the south side. Numerous stone, bronze and other works of art decorate the lobby. 
Interior Public Space Cleanliness: 10. Impeccable. 
Reception/Cashier Attitude: 10. Friendly, professional and efficient. 
Reception/Cashier Efficiency: 10
Overall Staff Attitude/Professionalism: 10. Extraordinarily professional and warm. Anything to make your stay a wonderful experience. Well above the norm even for luxury properties. 
Concierge Quality (if applicable): 10
Room Decor: 10. Beautiful and comfortable. Elegant luxury with beautiful views onto lagoons full of water lilies and birds. Comfortable beds and day beds. 
Bathroom Fixtures: 10. Excellent 
Room Cleanliness: 10. 
Daily Room Servicing: Impeccable and diligent cleaning services.
Quality of Bathroom Supplies (shampoo, etc.): 9
Hairdryer in Room: Yes
Safe in Room: Yes
Entertainment Equipment in Room: Yes, TV and CD MP3 player. 
Wifi: Yes, three levels of service. Bottom, slow level is free. Free level is not good for web browsing or any significant data downloads or uploads or web searches. 
Spa: Yes. Excellent. 
Gym: Yes, and full spectrum of exercise equipment with a trainer in attendance. Yoga as well. 
Pool: Adult and children's pools. Nice environment. Seaside beach accommodations are excellent as well. Lovely, clean beach. 
Restaurant Appearance: Four primary restaurants (Italian, Indian, seafood/beach and multi cuisine, all very good. 
Restaurant Food Quality: 9. Very good. 
Restaurant Service: 10. Excellent. Staff and chefs go out of their way to present guests with a memorable experience. 
Special Attractions: boating, parasailing, golf, swimming, archery, croquet, biking, yoga, tennis, and more. Hair salon and spa. 
Accessibility: 9. Generally excellent though the Indian and Italian restaurants are not wheelchair accessible and the hair salon is difficult. 
Other Comments: An extraordinary resort worth the trip. 




Stayed January 2017, travelled as a couple

Visited with family, still here till 15th January. Awesome hospitality and prompt service. 

Welcome was very warm, hot the coach for pickup from airport. Met Indira at the the reception for check in. Very warm welcome and quick check-in. Indira was very warm and gave all detail information of the Hotel activities and inclusions of our trip which we enjoyed to the fullest.

The bar at the pool side is a very relaxing point which gives experience of awesome warmness and they pamper you like your own family. Nityanand at the bar pampered well.

The Restaurant, which offers buffet, has good variety of multi cuisine food. The staff is very prompt, aware and warm for our requirements.

In all the hotel offers a whole in house activities, entertainment and keeps everyone occupied in one thing or another to enjoy. The beach is really clean and nice, just 2 min walking form the hotel.

Only one thing needs to be taken care of, is the Golf facilities and the Gold equipment. They charge Rs. 1500 + taxes to play Golf which is a 12 holes Gold course which is well maintained but lacks Good Golf clubs/ sticks. The Gold sticks are pretty old, rusted and not maintained at all, over that the playing fee is quite high for the Hotel guest itself. This aspect should be taken care for golf lovers, as my daughter is a Golf Champion and loves to play golf but she could not find a good golf set to play with, nor her size was available too.

In all its a thumbs up stay for us

Rooms - AWESOME
Service - AWESOME
Spa - JUST AWESOME
