I cannot find anything to fault with in this experience. Leela made my visit to Goa worth it!!! I would love to go back. The spa was the highlight - hygienic, friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet spread was designed for all appetites. Evening entertainment was refreshing - loved the classical ones.

There is little this hotel doesn't offer. The staff are the best I've seen, they care and pay attention. Polite, friendly and can't do enough for you. This hotel is located in the South of Goa and away from the hustle and bustle. It's a perfect place to relax with good quality food, stunning rooms (we had conservatory rooms overlooking the lagoon - better than the club rooms personally).

We've already booked to go back.

Though I stayed here many times couple of years back this time it was an official offsite get together for three days and it was a wonderful experience at one of the premium and Luxury hotels in India. 
The Leela Beach Resort - Goa gives an amazing feeling and experience has been magical. The resort is located on Mobor beach in south Goa, and has its own private beach and a 12 course golf course. The airport is around an hour away from the resort.
Breakfast which is complimentary has many delicacies included from Indian to Continental choices. Pick up and Drop off from the airport in a car is also included in the package. 
The hotel experience from word go....was an ultimate and very professional in providing the quality accommodation. Room had a beautiful balcony which opens just next to a pond. Room was very clean with soft and smooth blankets, bed and pillows along with towels. The bed sheets were changed twice a day as you would expect in a five star hotel. The room had clean and neat bathroom with everything you can imagine in a bathroom. The staff members were very friendly, polite and helpful. 
Free hire of bicycle was there to roam around the resort and landscape of the hotel. 

The beach was clean and the service on the beach was beyond words and pleasant. Food was yummy and delicious with multiple choices during all 3 courses. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay of 3 days here. Good Job Leela Goa...! Keep it up..!!

No recommendationsdefault choice

Having just stayed at the Leela Palace in Bangalore, we had an inkling of what was in store for us at this establishment. They have recently been bought by a Malaysian family and we were keen to compare the two properties. This hotel did not disappoint and was all you could hope for. Excellent quality everywhere, staff friendly and attentive (Ovinda and Indira at front of house were exceptionally helpful). The many restaurants were warm and friendly and served a variety of international cuisines. The buffet breakfast catered for everyone's tastes. The swimming pool was immaculately kept and the resort itself is beautiful. Fish swim in the various lily filled lagoons, photo opportunities everywhere. A stroll to the beach where you can utilise beautiful lounges and take advantage of the bar service.....they make a lovely pina colada cocktail! The food choices at the beach are somewhat limited but covers even the most fussy eater. There are water sports available at this beach. If you stay at this hotel you are less bothered by the local beach sales people.......in fact in two full days we weren't bothered at all. My only advice is to NOT stay during the Russian Christmas period, from around 2nd Jan to 7th ish the place is packed with literally hundreds of Russians enjoying their festive season.

Amazing property and beach. I loved the personal service by the staff, along with the beautiful grounds and the kilometres of deserted beach. I went here on a solo trip in an effort to unwind and get away from the chaos of Delhi. The quiet tranquility of the lagoon and gardens, as well as the soothing sun and sounds of the sea, combined to provide the perfect cure for my soul. I highly recommend Goa and the Leela Goa.

I have just returned from my first visit to the Leela hotel, Goa with my daughter who is 9.
From the moment we arrived we were treated like special friends coming home.
The kindness and warmth of the staff was so special, with no hint of pretentiousness. We arrived in the very early hours of the morning and were greeted as though it was the middle of the day. Check in was swift without being rushed and we even got our beautiful garland of marigolds which were a lovely touch without being over the top.
Our lagoon room was magical. on opening the doors we were presented with a breathtaking view of giant red lily flowers standing tall amongst huge floating lily pads, egrets and many types of birds swooped here and there, and the divine scent of jasmine and vanilla filled the morning air.
Our bed was deliciously comfortable, and there was even a pillow menu to chose from.
Every detail had been thought of, from the toiletries provided, to the bath salts beside the mammoth sized bathtub and fluffy towels and robes. 
Each day the wonderful Francis kept our room spotless, and homely. My daughters Teddys were always sitting happily on her pillow and bottled water was in ample supply continuously.
The pool was stunning with a swim under waterfall and little cave to swim through. Staff were continuously on hand to take drink or food orders and provide towels, without being on top of you or annoying. There was always time for a chat and friendly word, and all the staff seemed genuinely interested in how our stay was going and where we were from.
Breakfast was an absolute treat, every palate catered for in a beautifully laid out buffet that included the most fabulous array of fruit.
The beach was so clean, and went on for miles.The sea was warm and we spent many hours playing in the waves meeting other families doing the same thing. The hotel has a lovely restaurant on the beach or we could eat at our sunbed. Or we could chose one of the beach cafes for a change. Pearls was excellent, wonderful fresh fish daily, and a great buzz.
I managed a couple of treatments in the Ayuverdic Spa, and I have to say, it surpassed all my expectations. For quality of treatments and time taken, the value for money was incredible. My therapist was so kind with a genuine warmth and caring nature, it really added to the whole experience, as I was made to feel totally relaxed and at ease. Not an easy feat in a new environment. I wish I could have had a different treatment every day. The list was huge, and the products totally natural using Indian herbs and plants.
The property is breathtaking, bridges link various areas, all offering stunning views of foliage and the natural beauty of the place. At night time the lighting adds to the magic, as Indian music comes wafting from the lobby lounge bar, where one can sit and relax with a drink before dinner. My daughter loved the 'moat' that ran around the outside of the main building, as it was teaming with Koi and other fish. Everything is done with such taste and respect for nature. The property is totally safe, so I never had to worry about her going for a walk to the room, or disappearing to follow the fish around.
Chocolate milkshakes by the pool was one of her favourite things, and I have to say they were delicious.
There are a variety of restaurants to appeal to every taste. The Italian Riverside was a lovely experience. The Indian food was also spectacular for any lover of the local cuisine. 
The highlight has to be the New Years Eve gala, which was just above and beyond anything expected. Dancers, singers, all sorts of entertainment for young and old, plus delectable food from every corner of the globe. The work that must have gone into it was mind blowing. Thank you to each and every member of staff for making that evening so special. 
So, in conclusion I want to thank everyone at the Leela for showing me how a perfectly run hotel should be. To the GM, Mr Nair, who deserves every accolade that he receives. To Ms Sandy Anil, for being so kind to me when I needed kindness.
For top class quality, value, beauty, relaxation and all that one could wish for from a holiday, I applaud the Leela, Goa.

We just loved the Leela. After 2 weeks travelling around large, bustling Indian cities, we just wanted to relax and be pampered. The Leela was just what we needed and we'd have loved an extra couple of days there. There's nothing gimmicky about this place. 
The Leela has so many staff your every need is easily anticipated and met. 
The rooms are lovely and the Service first class. 
The buffet breakfast is first class. 
The gym is really well equipped. 
If I could moan, I wish the pool was bigger and that you could throw a ball in there (it was often empty apart from us and it would have been nice to have a "bit of excitement". 
Don't go here for an energetic holiday. 
Do go here for the best place to relax, unwind and recharge your battery.

A super family holiday for 7 of us. A fantastic location with the sea close to the property and swam on all 3 days in the sea which is always a bonus. A great gym which we all made use of along with the lovely swimming pool ( a bit cooler than expected in december!)
On the downside-had booked with booking .com and somehow had booked 3 rooms with 1 person occupying it, but the hotel staff ironed out that problem
We had paid for all 3 meals but standard of breakfast buffet was super but lunch and dinner buffet best avoided.poor choice-taste questionable-also suspect chicken and fish in the same dish- chicken goan curry with portions of fish added in !!
the service, housekeeping,property were definitely 5 star with nearby beach shacks to make the visit more interesting!

Simply stunning, my family and I walked into this hotel in awe. It really lived up to our expectations and surpassed them as well. We stayed here during christmas and the gala dinner for new years was really good. We had access to a nice private beach as well which made it all the more enjoyable. Top service from the staff and management as well.

We attended Leela Goa from Dec 20th to Jan 2nd. What can I say.. a magical place to be with the family at Xmas and New year. Staff were all amazing. Being vegan and vegetarians they really catered for all of us and went out of their way to make our stay the best. We attended the Xmas and New Year gala dinner which can be quite over priced, but it's all about the experience and had to be done. Thumbs up to Leela Goa.

This hotel is in a tranquil setting and the staff go to extra lengths to make your stay an amazing one. The rooms are one of the best I have stayed in throughout the world. 
From the moment you arrive you are treated like royalty and this continues throughout your stay.

Beautiful mesmerizing .
We were at The Leela Goa for our anniversary.Had great time there.The complements on anniversary by The Leela was great.Thanks to all.All the staff people very good special thanks to Vijay (Asst.Manager F&B)Great place to stay.
Thanks all and Happy new year.
J. Ahuja.Himachal

Great hotel, lovely rooms, excellent service, rooms are situated around beautiful lagoons 
and I loved the little Egretts walking around, really cheered me up.

The slight downside was that the beach is polluted with oil or something so I 
personally would not swim in the sea or walk along the shore line. 
You don't see this sitting on the Leela sunbeds but the grounds within the hotel are so lovely it was not a big thing. Great pool, would have preferred it a bit warmer.

We booked the Leela Goa after having a wonderfull experience at the Leela Palace in Udaipur 2 years ago. The Leela again did not disappoint. Our room was great and had a little private conservatory that looked onto a pretty lagoon. The Indian restaurant was great and the chef came out and spoke to us and for the next two nights created dishes specially for us. The breakfast spread in the morning was amazing the biggest selection I have seen anywhere. The beach was beautiful and service everywhere was great. A special mention goes out to Surat at the little beach bar, he was fantastic. The Leela is not cheap but well worth it!

Stayed at the Leela over New Years. Beautiful hotel with lovely rooms. The food and service was immaculate. Catered for our three year old daughter and best of all was the staff. Very polite and willing to go an extra mile. Highly recommended.

The Leela has a wonderful peaceful welcoming atmosphere. They make you feel part of a family. The service was outstanding and nothing was too much. We were upgraded and had our own butler. We even had our own disco one night. The pool is one of my favourites all one height and so easy to be in. I think I left a little of my heart at the Leela. Shridhar Nair, General Manager is quite amazing. Despite being full on busy he makes time to stop and talk to you. He made our stay on my birthday truly a wonderful experience. The bar area is a lovely retreat in the evenings and the sunsets are to a memory to treasure. A must if you go to Goa.

There is a reason why the Leela Goa is ranked at the top ten of Cond Nast list of best hotels in the East.
From the time you arrive at the airport your greeted with a fresh towel and a bottle of water you know you arrived at the apotheosis of indulgence. The ride is long but when you finally arrive all that fades in a distant memory. You are whisked away to be seated while you are checked in by a friendly host and are dotted around with an air of fine staff that are ever ready to serve you just at a blink of an eye. You are just mesmerized by the beautiful surrounding and ambiance. The lagoon Terrance rooms are well equipped with its recent renovation and state of the art light switches ample space a stunning bathroom so I want to leave ? 
Overlooking the idealistic lagoon in its splendid array of bird life , tropical flowers this is so surreal .
The service is outstanding and the food at breakfast is on par with the best. Generally the service is par excellent and one can't fault The Leela . It is a well run and manager hotel . The spa was a welcome respite and the beach super gorgeous. 
We ate at the fish restaurant I would say a bit casual die dinner and not much of a fish restaurant but fish is what we wanted and we opted for the fresh fish of the day trust me you won't regret ordering that , which ever fish you choose all were very well prepared and very tasty. The breakfast at the restaurant was so good. My only complaint is that the balance of the restaurants can do better. The golf carts in an about should stop for guest that are walking and not just zoom by . The amendments in the bathroom could include combs ,toothbrushes, mouth wash.
I highly recommend the Leela Goa it is place you would want to return to over and over again. Well done to the team keep up the excellent and hard work that goes into making this a great hotel

It was a perfect holiday destination because of you Leela...nice hospitality very delicious food.. humble and very helping staff, ...thanks for ur services and thnx for the help to find out the best visiting place in Goa...:)

we have been there for wedding..one of the excellent property in goa..best five star hotel..huge resort with private beach..huge rooms with all modern amenities..staff,,service,food was very nice..amazing stay

This was our first stay in Goa, having stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world over the last few years. From the moment of arrival, it is clear that the hotel sets its service standards very high in every part of the hotel. Superb rooms, all overlooking the lagoons, furnished to an excellent standard and impeccably cleaned and maintained.
Best - Service with a smile from every member of staff and it would be hard to single out individuals (although Niti at the pool bar and Shane and Kinley in the Club Restaurant, and Dr Arun (for his true professionalism) were stand out members of the team).
Location is truly beautiful, with aspects to the beach and river providing breathtaking views.
Worst - Noise intrusion from functions at the hotel next door (although I believe this may be seasonal and The Leela is currently working to stop this). In any case, I doubt it will be sufficient to spoil your holiday.
This is a faultless hotel and we would not hesitate to return. Hopefully soon!

Could not have picked a better location and Hotel to celebrate my 65th Birthday. Hotel staff gave a very pleasant surprise on the big day!
Excellent location. Superb views from the Room.
Wide choice of food. Good "watering hole" that is popular among the locals as well.

Best place to stay with family at The Leela Goa Great food nice beech Big Buffet ,,, Nice Service At the restaurant ,, Specially Thanks to Chef From Pastry Mr Arijit for Nice waffle and Pancake... we will back very soon when we get time for Relaxing,,, Thanks again to All Leela Staff they are very friendly and familiar......

The leela resort goa is a beautiful place and the restaurant and coffee shop are lovely and the awesome lobby and the food which was serviced over there was tasty and also the room over there are awesome and the logon over there near the room and nice facility

The Leela Goa is a very peaceful and fantastic place to stay. Very beautiful and luxurious place. The staff was very good. Rooms very very large. Great variety of food. I must say this is the best hotel in Goa.

Paradise on earth! Very peaceful, fantastic setting, lots of choice for breakfast and basic room very large and luxurious. It was my husbands birthday a couple of days ago and when we came back to the room in the afternoon there was a cake and a bottle of wine with a card from the manager. We have stayed at some top 5 star hotels around the world and this is one of them. We will definitely be back. The staff are lovely and friendly and I am looking forward to feeling thoroughly pampered for another 7 days still to go! I am in heaven!??

The Leela review
I hadn't done too much research before booking The Leela and had concerns with a couple of the recent reviews here. Now having spent a week there, I'm so pleased I booked it. I'm not sure where the bad reviewers were staying, but it certainly was not here!

This is THE place to stay if you're looking to recharge your batteries. At the bottom of the sleepy south coast, it's a beautiful setting. All rooms have great view either across the lagoons (full of things to see) or of the golf course. 70 acres of land and great facilities. We spent most of our time at the beach. It's quite something. Lots of choice for food options both in the hotel and outside. For eating outside the resort, I'd recommend the Fishermans Warf. The food is OK, but the service and setting are well worth the short walk.

I found the staff and service to be exceptional. Not only remembering your room, but what you had to eat on previous nights. Going back to the lounge bar and being asked if we wanted our usual drinks, was a nice touch. The staff really care. Sure, not everyone says hello, but the people who do (and care about their work) more than make up for it. They are motivated and seem to enjoy what they do.

In summary, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Leela. It's not cheap, but when you see what you get and the attention to detail, I'm sure you'll agree it is value for money....and a beach you won't forget for a long long time.

Best hotel in Goa by a long shot. From the pick up at the airport to the great service, amazing rooms and delicious food, Leela is a great place to get spoiled. It's not someone on a budget, you pay for what you get.

We had just spent 8 days doing the Golden Triangle tour so we were really looking forward to chilling out for a week. We knew the hotel would be nice but we just weren't expecting it to be so luxurious! We were picked up at the airport by the transfer bus and given a bottle of water and refreshing towel. There were only two other people on the bus. When you arrive you are welcomed with a garland and guided into the beautiful open plan lobby/bar/reception area. No need to queue at the check-in desk. It comes to you! We were seated and given a coconut water drink (in the coconut!). A lovely girl took all our details and then we hopped on a golf buggy to our room. It was amazing!! Gorgeous white linen, bath robes, slippers and a bathroom to die for. We had a room overlooking the lagoon with lovely seating area. The grounds are beautiful. A real tropical paradise. The beach is lovely with cushioned sun loungers and waiter service. The breakfast is fantastic. Such a choice!! No matter what part of the world you come from there is something for everyone. The staff were all amazing. Couldn't do enough for you. I can't recommend this place highly enough!

This is wonderfully luxurious hotel, voted No. 2 in India and No. 9 in the whole of Asia, by Conde Nast Traveller magazine. (The Taj Palace at Udaipur is no. 1 in India, if you are interested). The outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. From gardeners to Manager they are all equally welcoming and helpful - clearly a culture that has been successfully implemented across all the Leela staff - and it is so very noticeable.

We had a lagoon suite which was spacious, had everything you could want on a holiday, the pool was nicely laid out and is exceptionally large. We like to swim lengths early in the morning but this circular pool has a diameter which is massive. The pool is definitely cooler than the sea, and more refreshing in the heat.

The other outstanding feature if this hotel is the food which is extremely high quality but also generous in portion size and also in diversity as to what is available. Even the poolside snacks are gorgeous such as vietnamese rolls, Club sandwiches, which, for a single order, is usually enough to feed two people.

Recommended suites to stay in are around lagoon 1 , on the same side as "The Club". This is definitely the quietest area of the hotel complex. Despite the lagoons, which are beautiful, there are remarkably few mosquitoes, but spraying up at night is still recommended.

New visitors will benefit from President Modi's new road which runs directly from the airport at Dabolim all the way to the Leela Hotel. This is because there was a BRIC conference at the hotel in Oct 2016 which included the president of China, Putin, President of Brazil, India , Sri Lanka etc, and Modi arranged for it to be totally rebuilt with modern things like cat's-eyes and street lighting, which you won't find on many other roads. So the travel from the airport is fast and smooth.

Overall if you staying Goa this hotel is the top of the list. We have been to Taj Exotica and Taj Fort Aguada and this hotel beats them hands down on every aspect. And we will be going back very soon.

This hotel is beautiful, everywhere you look you're presented with a fantastic view and just pure luxury. The rooms are spacious with a balcony over looking the gorgeous lagoons all around. Food is fantastic, particularly the fish restaurant on the beach. Cocktails at the beach bar are the best way to watch the sunset - the best pina colada I've ever had! 

A great variety of activities too, a stunning gold course as well as meditation and yoga over on honeymoon island.

All the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, and the private beach is incredibly beautiful and peaceful.

Our 2nd visit to the Leela and from the moment we arrived we were made to feel like long lost friends. We had asked in advance for our favourite room and this was given to us and was ready on arrival. The staff are exceptional and some even remembered us from a year ago (and they really did! Even recalling what we had ordered in the past). The food in every area of the hotel, pool bar, all restaurants, breakfast buffet, was excellent. Rooms are beautiful but it is the staff that make this hotel my favourite. I absolutely love this place, it is quite outstanding. Book with confidence.

We stayed with our teenage old son at The Leela Goa on recommendation of friends. Beautiful resort indeed with a white non-crowded beach, stunning gardens, and modern well equipped rooms. 
I personally liked the reception area best which has a distinct Asian feel to it, while the rooms around the lake were more Portuguese in style. The gardens are stunning with an amazing variety of birds.
Loved it. We are coming back, but will not take half board anymore as we felt that the lunch/dinner buffet was the same every day, which got a bit boring after a few days.

Once I went to this hotel on my friend birthday I had a lots of fun there Evan the interiors are extremely good we stayed there for about three hours and the food items are astonishing we enjoyed every movement the they had a transport facility to the airport I loved to be stayed there more highlighted in hotel is pool every one should go there

My husband and I visited the Leela at the end of October (late anniversary holiday). Our son had been a couple of years ago with his wife and two young children and they absolutely loved it so it came highly recommended and we were not disappointed. From the moment we were greeted upon arrival at the airport we were made to feel welcome. The hotel is beautiful and the gardens are an absolute delight to walk through. Accommodation, facilities and restaurants are all very good, in fact we could not find fault with anything. The only slight disappointment was that the beach restaurant had not yet been granted a licence to open (so were informed) by the local authorities but other than that there were 3 others to choose from. We also ventured out to the Fishermans Hut which is a short walk outside of the hotel complex which is frequented by lots of locals as well as hotel guests from the Holiday Inn hotel which is near the Leela. Generally 5 star hotels can plateau and in our experience the differentiation is down to the staff, in the case of the Leela the staff are all extremely well versed in how to look after guests and nothing is too much trouble they are polite and courteous at all times, so congratulations to the management. Overall our holiday was relaxed and we enjoyed it immensely. We highly recommend this hotel.

We had a great holiday@ the leela goa. Magnificent landscape added so many treasured moments. The lagoon and beautiful water birds flying around were a treat to eyes. Couple of days can be easily spent on the humongous property. Good activities through the day. Beach area is very well maintained.

Let me be upfront on my benchmarks - I travel to Goa every year and have stayed at all the Taj properties there and Park Hyatt. The latter along with Taj Exotica are Gold standard to me, while in Goa. So when I review Leela, I have those benchmarks in mind for a property which positions itself as such.
Now - while keeping those parameters in mind, I find Leela to be a good resort but nowhere when compared with Taj Exotica or Park Hyatt.
The service standard is great as is the food - but rooms are not villa style as they are in the benchmark resorts. I get a feel of a business hotel cum resort, while at Leela which is not what I want when on holiday. Otherwise it is an ok option.

Amazing hotel in absolutely stunning surroundings...perfect holiday!! Staff were friendly helpful and always very polite...ate out most evenings but when we did eat in the hotel it was lovely..this hotel definitely deserves its 5 stars!!

I visited here last year in July(with my Wife and Kid) after 2 Nights of stay in Park Hyatt Goa. I would say Both the Resorts are beautiful luxurious properties and the service and hospitality at offer is premium.
A Day before i was about to check-in i got a call from Reservation Desk asking for any special request that i have. It felt really good that the they were already putting that extra effort to try and make our stay comfortable. I requested for a Crib and High Chair for my kid. They confirmed for Crib and Said that they will try to arrange for High Chair.
When i reach at the resort, the Check-in process was quick and smooth and the room got allocated with 5 minutes or so. Was really happy to see that both Crib and High Chair (of premium quality) are already present in my room.

The room as well was beautiful, very fresh and really modern, with all you need to make your stay comfortable. The Bathroom is luxurious and super.
Room sizes are a little small if you compare it to Park Hyatt rooms but good.

The Mobor Beach was a 5 minute comfortable walk from my Room through a nice small golf course that the resort has. It is a serene, clean secluded beach, although not private but well guarded by Hotel Security. If you can walk for long then do try going to Left End of this beach where the River Sal meets the Ocean. It is a beautiful place. 
The Swimming Pool here is again nice and clean with water temperature nicely controlled. Although it is not very big if you compare it with Park Hyatt, which has one of the most beautiful pools you would find in any five star resorts in India.

Now comes the part that i liked the most about this resort: the Food and Restaurants. It has a beautiful and comfortable restaurant which offers a great variety of cuisines in their Buffet Menu (Be it Breakfast or Dinner). The Spread is huge and the taste is really good for what most of the Five Star Resort Offer.
Though, I personally liked the international cuisines more than the Indian ones, but the variety and taste was really good in general. Here i would say Park Hyatt got beaten comprehensively. 
The Checkout process was also smooth and was pleasantly surprised when they arranged complimentary Toyota Camry for Airport Drop which was like an cherry on top of the cake, making our trip to goa end in a pleasant and comfortable way.

To Summarize: 

Pros:
1. Excellent Spread and Taste of Food
2. Great Fresh and Modern Rooms
3. Nice Clean Beach
4. Big and beautiful Property

Cons: (Most of them in comparison to Park Hyatt, but otherwise not really bad):
1. Swimming Pool.
2. Lawns and landscapes joining the resort to beach are prettier in Park Hyatt
3. Rooms even though beautiful are a touch smaller than Park Hyatt.

This hotel is lovely, it's perfectly manicured, we stayed in a club room so had our own pool for people in the club area and restaurant.
The only thing let thing that let the hotel down was the staffs obsession with payment, to the extent that we were accosted in the pool several times to pay instantly and settle bills.

A very nice resort on the beach in South Goa. The location is a little far away from the city, but the hotel and innumerable activities available inside make it up. The beach is also very good and clean and not many outside visitors. There are lot of activities for the children in the hotel itself.
Only issues we had were the buggies which take a little time to come and the food quality could also be slightly improved. But the service of the entire staff is outstanding and always ready to help. Golf course is also very good and had a good training session over there.

Stayed here for two weeks in february and had a wonderful time. The hotel is spacious and clean and the staff were very attentive and polite.
The only downside is that it's very isolated so if you're looking for varied nightlife and trips out you'll have to get a taxi.
There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance the best being Bettys Place. We ended up eating here nearly every night as it's great fun, wonderful food and a fraction of the price of the Leela.
Overall we thought the Leela was wonderful.. a little piece of paradise.

The location of the hotel is very good, the ambience is excellent, it has huge area with lagoons around and approach to the beach is perfect, the pool and the spa is fine , you can enjoy good spread of breakfast during your stay

an elite hotel and as a regular i expected a great deal more from the staff
love the beach and the food but no pint eating in a place where guests are not taken care of .
the lobby staff is courteous but rest everywhere they are a shame to the property.

A beautiful property spread across a wide area. With a beautiful and clean private beach, with little crowd, there is nothing else you need more here. I was there for an office off-site, and the overall experience was excellent.

The only negative thing about this hotel is that it is far away from most of the happening beaches of Goa and far from the airport too. But the private beach makes up for everything and it's heavenly in night if you are with the right people. The general features of a hotel like recreation facilities, swimming pools, etc are also there but the natural beauty is something to be attracted to.

The hotel/resort is spread out on a huge area & it is wonderful. Rooms are spacious, clean, bathroom facilities are modern includes a bathtub. Bed is comfy & you can choose your pillow if you wish from their varied collection. Food is good/OK as far as the buffet is concerned. The Bar/Play area is good. Conference hall/banquet facilities are good. Staffs are OK. Many of them are good but you may face few who are not well trained. So, all put together this place will be a good choice for both- corporate events or family vacation.

3 advantages.. one.. the size is huge and next to the beach .. second.. the way it's made with lagoon facing rooms.. third and most important is the lovely leela hospitality... 
One big disadvantage.. the distance.. except for a fisherman's wharf which is walking distance, zeeboob and Martins corner are almost 40 minutes away. Nothing much to do close by. North goa is again more than an hour away.. Recommended for people who want to relax and use the property and not for people who want to party..

I along with my husband and 19 month old son stayed at the leela for 3 nights in July(a leisure holiday). We enjoyed the stay, however nothing spectacular. Overall the staff avoided eye contact or any kind of communication. We took a package of half board. The buffet lacked variety and the food was boring. Usually there was a lot chaos during breakfast. It lacked the charm of a 5 star. Room was done twice a day which i really appreciate. We were not offered any cot for my son. Even newsapers were not delivered as promised. The presentation of in room dining was not appealing. Beach was very clean and we enjoyed our walks there. Pool can be enhanced. The kids room didnt have quality toys and was not very clean. The lady in the kids room looked utterly bored. Also the hotel's bar lacks the zing thing..i mean they are boring. Also not much activities to do in the resort. In future i would prefer park hyatt over leela.

I was on a company trip recently (Aug 12 - 15, 2016) and would capture the pros and cons below:-
Pros
1) This is a huge property. No wonder there are carts to take people around.
2) Lots of greenery with water bodies around. I think the property is maintained very well.
3) Spacious rooms and overall ambience is also great.
4) Has a nice beach too

Cons
1) A lot was left to be desired in general service at the restaurants. Servers took a lot of time and it seemed they did not understand the request a couple of times. E.g. Asked for a glass of water, after 5 mins again followed up and yet again (after 5 mins). By the time a glass could be arranged I had gulped it from the bottle. Apparently this was not an exception as some of my colleagues reported similar incidents.
2) Wifi was a paid service which I was expecting to be provided complimentary.
3) Food could be better. Specially the indian fare.
4) Few of my colleagues (across separate rooms) faced problem with their room doors which did not recognise the card. Though I trust it must be a one off thing.

Fantastically oppulent hotel setin acres of gardens. Has own beach. Rooms are wonderful as are all of the staff. Without exception.
The food is spectacular and suitable for large parties. Ok it is pricey but you get what you pay for. If you can possibly afford it then its a great place to stay as we really rated it highly. We have only given it a four because it was a bit out of the way and my husband is not able to walk far and we had to use taxis. Only reason. Fantastic place.

It's a nice experience.. Lovely property with great ambience. We expected some rain during the stay.. But we were lucky. The staff were very good, always there to help. The rooms are spacious... The bathrooms could have been better ..operationally.

The hotel ressort is extremely nice, staff is well trained and the service very friendly everywhere! Overall atmosphere is wonderful and food is very good. The ressort is embedded in a beautiful freen garden, full of flowers. Yoga lessons, the SPA and ayurvedic treatsments there are extremely nice. We enjoyed the fantastic beach with only one exception: There was plenty of tar coming from Arabic Sea brought by western winds... Worker continously tried to clean the beach but this was a kind of Sisyphean task!

The hotel was top rate, all the staff could not do enough for you, we found the meals to be expensive in comparison to the surrounding area, but cannot comment on the standard, we visited at the end of the season so quiet everywhere we went, wasn't impressed with the quality of the food in the beach shacks and got bad stomach on several occasions, we found a taxi driver called Alvis who was very good and took us around where we wanted to go full day for around 40, overall very nice holiday spoils by missing a connecting flight on the way home.

The hotel was a very beautiful property with lush greenery and especially the lagoons.
I was at a lagoon suite which was indeed a very big and beautiful room.
Now comes the thing.
The staff was not very good . They were unsmiling and were not able to comprehend very well. 
I would recommend taj exotica over the Leela as I stayed there 1 year back and it was a much better property or u can also choose taj fort Aguada if u are travelling with kids.

Well there are too many reviews raving about this place and I could be just one more of them, but I would rather point out few points which could make it better for my next visit here.

1. The property is huge and somehwere I felt lost in the lagoon! With so much land to offer I feel there should be few activities thrown in just to break the journey within...if there had been few benches overlooking the lagoon or something else I dnt know. .should be thought about. Many times I felt to sit down but did not have any place to sit.

2. A leisure hotel or resort without hammock is unreal....hello they need to be propped up in key areas without asking for it.

3. A hotel in india should have a jet spray...no one wants a lesson in western culture here ;)

4. Maybe it was off season but I could not see the spirit of holidaying. 

5. Morning tea should be complimentary and meals could be more reasonably priced.

Well just to conclude I appreciate the lagoon which is a living ecosystem and well maintained with fishes, birds, snakes, frogs, tress , shrubs lotus and many other flowering and fruit bearing plants lined up everywhere... nature's delight.
The kids play centre was a blessing, pool is of good size with a hideaway tunnel and the breakfast is amazing.

And the best part my kids enjoyed the stay.

Hope to come back soon !!!

The hotel was really busy as soon as I arrived with my family. I felt like I wasn't paid enough attention but given the rush I can understand. The front desk were curious and helpful. Food and rooms were good. Overall a very satisfying stay.

it was a pricey but good experience. good food,staff,sleep,ambiance,water,people,beer,swimming pool,boys,hash,beaches. PS: Still not out of my trip.wold love to visit again.soon, if they give discount.

Beautiful property. Very good room and decorative bathroom. The property has variety of trees and plants all over the area. The breakfast was excellent.. This was our first stay at The Leela and had great expectations of the place and I must say we were not dissapointed with it....it was a truly great experience. A must visit hotel in Goa. Will Certainly come back.

The property is very good, conveniently located. Rooms are large and very spacious with all modern amenities. Hospitality and welcome was excellent. The spread of breakfast was best and includes everything one could imagine in 5 star restaurant breakfast . The swimming pool and gym were good to have exercise and relax. Cycling within the property was a real fun and good to burn calories. Overall very satisfying experience.

Stayed at the Leela for 2 nights for a business meet-up. While the trip was excellent for the most part, I wouldn't go back because there's definitely other properties to choose from which are better than Leela. 

Pros - Loved their traditional welcome with flower garlands and coconut water. The property is old but its got a charm of its own. Each suite comes with a view to a beautiful pond. The food was the best part - buffet spread (all meals) were the perfect balance of Indian, Asian, Western food - and all of it good enough to tantalise your taste buds. Didn't get a chance to visit their spa, but it seemed fairly priced. 

Cons - The wifi they offer can be connected to a certain number of devices at max. I don't appreciate that considering the amount of money one pays to stay there is not cheap. Piece-meal costing for small things always annoys me - particularly when its for essential/basic things like wifi. Another downside, there's no bar within the hotel that stays open until late night. And of-course there's nothing outside of the place.

We started with a reservation adjustment for a longer stay which they accommodated fully. We arrived to a full bell service staff helping with our bags etc. We stayed in a Lagoon Suite. Per the Leela website, it is the same room, see room description on their site. Housekeeping was amazing, room cleaned daily and a turn down service also tidied the room before bed. Room service was consistent delivering our orders, very attentive. The property has a kids club and a nanny if needed. A playground and separate kiddy pool. The golf course is 12 hole par, reasonable pricing, putting green which was fun as I was showing up my husband :) It was monsoon season so the beach was not set up with the seasonal restaurant (Nov-May) Beach was patrolled with security, well kept beach, clean, and maintained. Wonderful sunsets. Property was clean and maintained, walkable, but they did offer golf buggies if you needed them. Pool was very relaxing with towel service and a pool bar. Food we had was good but does not compare to Leela Chennai. Standard breakfast buffet served, same with lunch. Staff was very helpful with the baby and his individual needs. Overall it was a very pleasant stay ending with a longing to stay even longer. I recommend and would stay again. Maybe in the Club area for more privacy.

I must congratulate hotel authority the kind of hotel maintainable in terms of greenery they have made as it is really hard to keep that much of green in best of its state..... Staff was really cooperative and we really enjoyed our stay.... Plenty of small water bodies to take a dip..... Kids can also enjoy in different pools and kid zone..... Food was also Gud and affordable too.... Airport pick up and drop facility was available

Everything about this resort is beautiful and lavish.. staff is courteous and it was a pleasure to interact with them.. food is good.. and almost everything about our stay was perfect..
Just don't expect to have a good time at Aqua if you plan to party.. they don't follow the schedule or the theme for the night and even if they did the place was boring (more of a recreational activity room than a lounge)
But if you want to relax and enjoy the calm surrounding this is place you would want to stay at..

I have started writing reviews for luxury ones too. I used to avoid talking about those in past.

This is my second visit to this hotel after 8 Years and I can say it has not changed much.

Here is my review:

Location: Located in south Goa around 2 hour drive from Airport crossing villages and road is bit bumpy. If you are thinking to go to other side of Goa for partying it will take you around 3 hours.

Property: It's a big property spread over 70 acre with tropical look and feel. You will enjoy the walks and view for sure.

Rooms: Decent size rooms with option of balcony. The property is so big that few rooms are far away from reception and you have to walk a lot to reach reception/pool/beach.
Bed and bath are nice too.


Food: Food is good though not exceptional.


Staff & Service: Very helpful however you will find a delay in service on busy days/season.

Pool & Beach: A big beautiful pool which is a standard for these kind of properties. Beach is around 200 meters walk from Pool\garden area. I don't think this is a private beach but access to this beach is very close from hotel.

Amenities: Gym, pool for kids, nice restaurants.

Overall this is ideal place for couples and corporate events.

We visited The Leela, Goa in September 2016 for 3 nights from 10th to the 13th. 
Plus points:
Fantastic service, with a smile. 
Property is clean and maintained, fit for Gods. 
Food was good, though would have appreciated more variety in fish and beef dishes. 
Staff is courteous, be it the kids play area, the breakfast or lunch staff or house keeping.

Looking forward to our next visit again.

The welcome was good. The rooms very small for the price they charge. They need more golf carts to cater in house guests. Their breakfast was simply amazing. Do try the mysore dosa. Kids activity room was fascinating. All in all a one time visit.

This is a great hotel with large guest capacity but the greenery and architecture hide it well giving it a feel if a smaller establishment and discreetness and privacy which guests may prefer. Normal rooms overlook lotus pond, and have an independent balcony. It is quite relaxing. Lobby is stunning in the Hampi style with a lot of large stone carvings around the hotel. The hotel is more in the South Indian style and does not represent local architecture. The pool, gym and spa facilities are good. What is great is the vast beach expanse in a very quiet part of Southern Goa.

First time to South Goa, the Leela is and Oasis of beauty. The grounds are stunning and the beach is heaven. The hotel rooms are somewhat tired and lack lustre but overcome easily by the lovely facilities the hotel has. We had a serene balcony which looked over to honeymoon island. Depending on how the wind blows you can get the smell from the river which can be quite pungent. The lobby is stunning and welcoming, the staff are attentive but don't always follow through on the Leela reputation of service. Simply it is those who have worked there for years that you see the quality of service. We did the 5 day spa package and it was great value for money and treatments first class. The actual spa area is very lovely but not exceptional as they are limited for space. No where to relax after treatment, like other leading spas, spa staff are mostly from Kerala and are fully trained in fabulous Ayurvedic treatments. Sindhi in the spa has the best smile of anyone I have ever met and her service was perfection. The personal yoga session was also a memorable experience. Be wary that the full board package limits you only to the buffet restaurant, we cancelled after we discovered this as there are so many other nice options in the hotel and outside close by. Breakfast is very hectic and buffet style, the hotel does Happy hours in various places which is nice. Jamavar restaurant was our favourite, exceptional service from Joaquin who has worked at the hotel for 25 years. Food was also stunning and the view on the terrace lovely. The suesago restaurant that is seasonal on the beach sadly lacked romance and sparkle but overall was satisfactory. The pool bar is lovely and Protus who works there really makes the difference. There was also lots of large conferences and weddings going on which others may find annoying but added entertainment for us to watch the massive set up on the lawns and beach for fully staged performances and fireworks. Overall I would recommend this resort but don't expect it to be perfection. It's a great Goa beach luxury experience that is a little rustic in parts. Next time we return we may try the club area to see how it differs in experience.

This is a lovely hotel set in fabulous landscaped grounds next to a long secluded beach. It is fairly isolated and if you wish to visit central Goa then a taxi trip will cost you in the region of 35. However if you want piece and quiet you will enjoy it here. We arrived just as the season was starting and two privately owned shacks had just opened on the beach close to the hotel. At these you can get relatively cheap, good quality food and drink. The hotel has a number of restaurants and bars all of which are first class, however if you are not on half board it is fairly expensive to eat and buy drink here. (They do have happy hours in some of the hotel bars). Just outside the front gate ( a 2 minute walk away) is The Fisherman's Walk Restaurant which is excellent, very reasonably priced and well worth a visit.
When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised to be given access to complimentary WiFi but many of the other guests were not and were less than pleased with the additional charges. Apparently you get 30 minutes free per day then you have to pay approximately 300 Rs per hour, which for a 5 star hotel is not on. 

However, we really enjoyed our stay as this is a lovely place to chill out for the weary traveller.

The Leela Goa is a big property with its own golf course. It's a perfect luxury experience. I had been for a biz conference and everything was properly maintained. The beach is very clean and has a long coastline, ideal for jogging. 
The Fisherman's Wharf, famous for its sea food is located just outside the Leela main gate.
Overall I had a good experience during my stay.

The resort is very beautiful, the lakes, all the green areas, everything... and the room is very spacious and well decorated. Everything as you might expect from a high end resort.

The staff was also very friendly and always ready to help us with any request. And the breakfast was amazing.

But honestly we were hoping for a little bit more, specially when we had 85% of the beach "closed" due to an event there, and they were still removing the temporary building, with lots of workers there all the time (day and night).

And when the beach was one of the major reasons for us to select this place, it would be "nice" if the resort at least tried to compensate us a little bit, maybe with some dinner discount or even offering the wifi. But no, nothing at all.

Finally regarding the prices. We know that when we select a resort in this price range the food and other services there might be a little expensive. But we have already been to several similar places and this one was a little bit over the top, which ended up with us only having 1 dinner there. And if you wonder about doing something special with your loved one there (like a dinner in the beach), you can quickly forget about it, the price just to book the space is ridiculous...

As expected awesome hospitality. Good food. easy transit to dambolim airport. Much better place than Marriott. If you want to enjoy then you can visit arpora or calangute. a good place to stay with family or colleagues.

A very awesome hotel with all facilities and service. The hotel is located in a very peaceful area near beach and water bodies. The service and the staff were so nice.They offer variety of food and is tasty also. They have swimming pool also which a added star to hotel.

Good place n nice restaurant for the people who love to eat a variety of foods. Really the service of the hotel is really good and all the service is very fine. All the service is really good. All the staff of the hotel are very soft and kind spoke person.

The location of the hotel is very far away from the airport, as well as the city, so if you just need to relax for some time, this might be a good option. The facilities provided are quite good and expected out of a reputable brand of hotel.
There is a huge spread of breakfast buffet which is sumptious but taste tilts towards continental. even the indian food tastes continental.
They have a clean private beach which is well maintained and they also have bicycles in case you want to explore the resort and also get some physical exercise along with it.

The rooms are well equipped if you are coming for business, and all the needs would be taken care off.

but given a choice between Taj aguada and Leela, i would anytime pick the former, Leela somehow doesn't come across as the ultimate luxury abode in Goa.

Visited for 3 days. We are a couple with a 4 years girl and an infant. Stayed in a consortium room which is nice but a bit small for a couple with two kids. Breakfast is good, a la carte menu is great, but buffet is poor. Don't choose full board or half board options. We liked outdoor facilities a lot with a good pool and a great beach. Kids room and playground are fine although small. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Had been wanting to stay at Leela since after all it's Leela- got excited and booked ourselves into the property. 
Interesting property- beautiful water bodies all over, lovely view from the room, great food but still not close to Taj when it comes to hospitality. 
The kids loved the activities and the pool (it's definitely No. 1 on their list of properties to go to in Goa), but I must say I missed the personalised greeting smiles and services offered at Taj Excotica and Holiday Village, where I just don't feel like a guest. 
Would recommend it but in case you're looking to feel truly pampered and get that wow feeling of hospitality, I would recommend Taj Exotica

The hotel is amazing in customer handling. Food is delicious and also we came across some superb friendly customer service. Staying in this hotel is really enjoyable and amazing. Good hygienic rooms and amazing view.

This is a very good property in south Goa. We were in Goa for a week and stayed at The Leela for a weekend. The hotel has a private beach with some water sports, however the water sports are not by the hotel but locals. Nothing wrong with it. Food is good. Overall a good 5 star hotel but not giving 5 rating as in hospitality it is not the best. Anyone who has stayed with Taj will feel something lacking in hospitality. For instance we were given reminders over phone and in writing that we are to check out on so n so date. It was just not done. The guest knows the check out date and even if they have to be reminded, it can be handled better.

Supap restaurant in goa the leela ND near too all destany in Goa good service in good rooms in this hotel low cost and best five star hotel like a Raj mahel facility good pace ND I like most beautiful ND tasty it's hotel food

Just finished a week at the Leela in Goa after attending a wedding just north of there. The hotel lobby, grounds, the rooms, the pools and the food were all fantastic. It was a top notch experience. If I had to change a couple of things it would be they seem unnecessarily obsessed with trying to sell you more on something or another. I found this to be annoying and beneath the reputation of the Leela. Only other negative was the wine storage must be a problem - We sent 5 bottles back over the course of our stay. They have some work to do there. Otherwise, the place is really special.

The hotel and the surroundings are beautiful. The room was extremely comfortable, balcony over the lake was peaceful and relaxing. Great range of food for breakfast. With us spending 12 days traveling around India the verify of food available was great, and the food we ate in the hotel was excellent. Staff friendly and helpful. Would recommend it but be aware of a few things that disappointed us. We had to pay for wi-fi, I was already paying 250 a night free wi-fi should be available! 
We were disappointed with the trouser policy, you were able to wear shorts in the main dining hall but the Indian restaurant which is part of the hall you had to wear trousers, pointless rule!!!

We stayed here for 3 nights and everything (almost) was perfect.
The perfect part
Right from the communication prior to traveling, to the pickup, the check-in etc, everything was flawless. My wife is expecting and they offered us a cake and wine which was really nice. Further, my wife and I were returning to different destination at the end of our stay and due to some delays in my wife's flight, they were nice enough to allow her a slightly late check-in. Most of the staff was very courteous and professional. A special thanks to Ovina who was most gracious in her dealings with us at every step.
We loved the resort which has a beautiful entrance, makes for a lovely walking path (via the spice gardens etc), the beach (the sunset and lazing on the chairs through the afternoon), cycling (30 mins of a complimentary cycle ride each day), the gym, the breakfast spread, the live music every evening in the lobby, the staff, the pool (albeit it was a bit too cold given the weather), the room (we stayed in a lagoon view room which was immaculately designed and had a nice bathroom with a nice large bath tub). The balcony overlooked the lagoon and the view from it was beautiful albeit the balconies of other rooms were visible which made privacy a slight problem but it would be a bit harsh to expect it to not be the case as once you see the lagoon, one can understand that this can't really be helped. The resort was not fully occupied (occupancy rate during our stay would be half per my understanding) which gave us more space than had it been had it been full

The not so perfect part
My only complaint (which seemed to be a sentiment shared by a German couple we met during our stay) and which seemed evident from the sight of the near empty hotel restaurants was the high pricing (especially if one grosses it up for taxes) in the hotel restaurants. it seemed almost prohibitive for me, and I personally thought it to unreasonably high tbh. Further, the all meals or half board plans (which we didn't opt for) has the option of dining only in the main restaurant and does not give an option to try out the other restaurants. This is in contrast to Leela Kovalam, where the all meals plan gave guests an option to try out other restaurants albeit with a set 3 course menu. Eventually, I felt the pricing was counterproductive and forced the guests to eat somewhere else or worse still made made dining inside the hotel seem like a rip-off, neither of which I'm sure the management really aims for. I'm not sure if this will change and in case it doesn't, may I suggest those looking for options outside the hotel to try out Betty's place which is a two minute walk from the main entrance. While it isn't as well known as its neighbouring joint "Fisherman's wharf", we found it to be more homely, better value for money and able to provide similar quality of dishes (the steak, and the butter garlic prawns especially)

Overall, I would recommend a stay at this magnificent property to anyone looking for a relaxed retreat into nature combined with luxury. However, I wouldn't recommend dining under current conditions for at least value conscious non-millionaires like yours truly :)

I had one of the most memorable breakfast buffet with my husband. We are foodies, and we kept on eating for over an hour. 
We stayed at this lovely property for 2 days after 3 days busy stay in North Goa. We just wanted to relax, hence The Leela, Goa. 
The beach is cream beach, where an entire day can be spent sleeping/reading.

We stayed at room 601 from 30-11-16 to 03-12-2016. 

Overall we had a good stay with some aspects of the hotel being good and some being plain average.

To start with the positive aspects the room is awesome. Much better than taj exotica however taj have recently renovated there rooms also. Bathroom was also massive. Wifi was quick and included in our package however I am not sure if this is available without extra charges for everybody. Spa was also excellent. Airport pick and drop off was done very well in a big and comfortable van. Some of the staff like Mantoo at the restaurant and Indirha at the reception were excellent and a asset to the hotel. The beach was good and not crowded although it was not very clean and a stray dog was always around.

The major issues we faced were with the food. We were on the all inclusive food package and this includes all meal in the buffet restaurant. We were bored eating there daily as the majority of the dishes are vegetarian. For seafood there would be one main dish and one starter. The staff did provide us with a few seafood starters. There are good restaurants within walking distance like Fishermans Wharf and we regret being tied up to the package.

Secondly there was a Bajaj event on the first and second day and a wedding event on the third day when we there. Since we were visiting with family in kids it was highly inconvenient at times. The breakfast was very crowded and some times a coffee would have to be requested three or four times before we received it. At times I felt that the hotel was catering more to events than to individual guests.

During checkin we had informed that we need a late check out since our flight was in the late evening. On the second last day we directly received a letter stating that we need to check out at 12pm. At the reception we were told that the hotel was 98% full because of the events. After some repeated request they extended the time first by 30 minutes and than by an hour. On the last day when we went to settle our bill they agreed for check out time of 3:30pm. I am not sure why they created a scenario where this seemed impossible in the first place.

Over and above I would consider this hotel if it works on the flaws since some of the staff work hard to minimize the flaws by certain staff and procedures. Having been to Taj exotica multiple times I would rate the food and service of Taj to be of a higher level than Leela.

2 aspects- stay and food. Disappointed with stay after burning 60k for 2 night, where one fine afternoon we were humiliated and embarrassed by the staff that we were non guests at the hotel and we aren't allowed to roam inside premises. How the hell did the staff know we were non guests. Turned out to be a mistaken identity when confronted with the management team, though the damage was enough to raise a question mark on governance and policy of the hotel where they themselves aren't sure of their own guests or visitors. This was highlighted to the GM who was kind enough to send us the bottle of sparkling wine as an apology. Staying in Leela was anyway a second option compared to Taj which unfortunately was booked for the dates when we travelled and only have reinforced our decision not to choose The Leela, where there is a saying- first impression is the last impression. 

Secondly we had taken option of lunch or dinner, where we tried lunch on one day and dinner on the second where the food was very oily and this is something least expected. Breakfast is something we liked.

Maybe i am the unfortunate one who went thru this ordeal.

We visit such places to relax and enjoy .. but there was this event to be conducted and for that reason they were doing maintenance work .. polishing the floor, polishing the bridge and the construction work was going all around.. it was so disturbing .. the noise.. due to high alert and international event there was a security.. number of army guards , and other members from the event management committee were roaming around.. in short it was so crowded. 
We were expecting a nice private beach but because of this event and security concerns they limited the beach .. and again there was construction going on . We are very disappointed with this trip. 
Other things like room ..food was up to date .. 
the only thing where i get some quiet time was the kids play room .. 
Other than this was so noisy, crowded and disturbing.
I know this event is important and it is also important to prepare and present ourselves but they must have to inform this at the time of booking because its a costly trip .. 

Thank you.

As my experience was bad i will narrate that first

Cons: 
When we entered our room the fruit tray was empty despite our room was handed over to us after 40 min as they were making it and we had to wait in lobby, But thats ok as later they placed it in our room when we went for lunch.
After lunch, when we were having siesta our door bell rang 3 times, finally i had to shout and yell that "we are sleeping".
Again the door bell rang after few hours on opening the door two guys standing on the door, one in police kind of a uniform and other a hotel guy giving a letter about checkout timing and asking if we need airport drop despite i had clearly given the details at the time of checkin to the incharge about our airport plan as we had our own car and had told that we will checkout at morning 10 a.m.
After two hours it rang again and there was someone again at the door to place things in room with a security guard. First time i had seen in a hotel where you see two people come on your door. Both of them entered to place it.
Next day in the morning when we wanted to check out, our door got jammed and we could not open it through our room key card, neither the master card with the housekeeper could open it. Finally a metal key was bought to open it this delayed things and we had to wait for 20 min. to get out luggage out.
The pool is very small for a 200 key hotel, other hotels i have stayed in Goa have huge pool where you can get some privacy especially when you are travelling as couple like Park Hyatt and Zuri where I had stayed earlier.
I found the approach of some staff not very polite.
My overall experience was not as i expected from a brand like Leela.


Pros : Breakfast spread was very nice and elaborated.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Totally disappointed by the service of staff here. Following are the reasons for disappointment:

1. Understaffed: Right from valet to waiters to house keeping, there seems to be a shortage of people serving the guests. I had to wait 20 mins for my car to be brought from parking which was 2 mins away from the lobby. The driver didn't know how to drive an AT and there was ONLY one driver manning the valet counter.
We had to wait another 20 mins for the buggy to pick us up from pool area to drop us to the room in heavy rains. 

2. Attitude of the staff: They all tend to ignore you rather than offer help. While looking for umbrella, three of the staff members saw us but none of them offered help. In fact they themselves were using umbrella when guests had none left in the bucket. The attendant at breakfast asked me to speed up as they were closing down the buffet. Asking this is fine but in the manner they tell you is very cheap and comparable to a 2 star hotel.

3. Breakfast: I have been to many 5 star and 7 star hotels; never have I seen that the chefs are not having assistant to take orders. The dosa counter chef was working alone and had no one to take notes of orders. This was causing delays. Also, some of the counters are so far away from where one gets to sit, it is a task to get the food to table and still have it hot. The idli counter had no chutney and one needs to go to dosa counter to get it. Unbelievable. Again the feeling of this hotel being understaffed is evident when one has to wait forever to get attention of waiters.

4. Buggy service: one has to be lucky to get the buggy to travel back to your room from beach. Almost always it takes more than 30 mins to get one.

5. Baby pool: No shower near the baby pool. One needs to go the main pool for shower even if using the baby pool. How hard it is to have another shower near this pool when you have 78 acres of land?!

6. Reminding you that you have to leave the hotel: Right from check-in, the staff keeps reminding you that the check-out is at noon and that you are leaving on so and so day. I understand that they want to arrange the transport but then why during check-in??! Also, I told them twice that I have my own vechile but they seem to have no co-ordination at all - very poor show for a 5 star hotel (or is it 7 star?!)

The only good thing we found, other than the spacious and comfortable room, is the clean beach and greenery. The beach which is so called private has salesmen all over it. The watchmen seem to have some arrangement with them as they never object the selling. Also, don't be surprised to see dogs on the beach (so much so for the "private beach").

A complete no - no for another visit to this hotel....

You can find much better Hotel in Lower Prices.
I checked in on 15th June in Conservatory Room with my wife and Son and was welcomed by a LIZARD in the room.
Next morning we planned for swimming but the Pool was DIRTY 
Restaurant is totally mismanaged 
You will be very Lucky to find a table as the sitting is not enough 
Menu is poor 
You can't sit near the Pool or Garden in the evening as lot of Mosquitos are there.
The Property is very beautiful but with this management will not last long.

We checked into The Leela after having a great stay at The Taj Vivanta, Fort Aguada and realised vast difference in service. An example, the moment we entered into the restaurant, we were served water without asking but in the leela, we had to plead multiple times, seems that they are under staff and untrained staff. 

The good variety is also not great. Though the property is huge but the finesse and courtesies is completely missing. 

We stayed at the Conservatory Room.

Finally I would never prefer to stay in this property provided they improve their service. 

Thanks.

A good hotel managed very poorly. A big thumps down to the staff. The dress they wear, specially in the Restaurant gives you the impression that you are not in a hotel but in a govt. hospital. The restaurant manager is a big liar. He will promise you everything but will not fulfill any. They do not take proper care of the customer belongings. Rates are exorbitantly high but it does not match the service provided. The only thing they take good care of is the payment you are suppose to make. I have vowed not to visit this hotel again even if they are free of cost and will suggest all my friends and acqintances to stay in any of the many other hotels in the list.

My wife and I booked at this hotel after some days in north Goa and to celebrate our anniversary. When we arrived everything seemed perfect, but the perfection was quickly dispelled with rather long check-in procedure. Of course the hotel took note of our anniversary (the next day). We made a reservation at the beachside restaurant (the Riverside restaurant was fully booked with a corporate event) and were assured 'something appropriate would be arranged'. 

We asked for a quiet room but we were accommodated near the hotel entrance close to the road. The room dcor was rather dark with a slightly damp smell. 

The next evening we dined at the beachside restaurant and no special arrangements had been made. The fish was overpriced. The food in general was rather poor and definitely not 5-star, the breakfast was particularly disappointing and in-line with 3 star hotel. Leela management should take the time to investigate a true 5 star hotel experience such as the Fourseasons. 

On the plus side the hotel staff on the beach were very good, the beach itself is clean and well maintained. 

Rather strangely as we left the hotel and had checked out, the hotel delivered a chocolate cake and champagne - the worst possible timing, it was hot and we were departing for the airport. We gave it back to them. 

Overall an uneven experience and not in line with my previous experiences at the Leela Palace in New Delhi. Would I return - No.

Visted this hotel in late January 
First time in Goa 
Where to start 
The room was very nice but that far away from the reception that we had to get a golf buggie to take us back to the room 
The pool was a bit cold and as we thought for that time of year it would have been heated 
Nice gardens but I am not a Gardner ? The sun beds were 30 meters from the sea edge 
In all the hotel was set in a lonesome area which had nothing going on and ever night we were in bed by 11pm
It advertise a disco but it was not open and no other entertainment in there

Very quiet ? Too quiet most people were50 years old and above not suitable for the middle age group

The core of a chain runs through its properties - like the hospitality of Taj stands out across its hotels - similarly at one hand the magnamity of the hotels stand out for Leela at one hand , the inconsistency of the service remain the same which means that in a service sector you cannot just thrive by just good infrastructure 

Our stay currently on at Leela goa symbolises just that inconsistency - great room service coupled with a poor concierge !! A five star hotel that cannot manage a good all round service is a disaster to my mind 


Another sad area is the highly transactional nature of the hotel - unaccomodating to the departure times of guests and dealing with the situation by flinging a rate card or ensuring you are told of a high penalty charge on late return of a movie!! I mean just compare this to Taj where a movie is served to your room once you browse it in room not at the lobby and you have a complimentary service of a Coke and popcorn to go with it - costs hardly anything to the hotel but world class service for the consumer !! And Leela goes to the other extreme !!

Probably it does not mean much to Leela to retain guests I guess
Akshay 
stands

My husband and I visited India 2 years back...so this review is a little late, however I still remember how excited we were to visit Leela Goa based on the good reviews. But once we checked in and saw our room we were very disappointed. The a/c barely worked and the room while large was sparsely decorated. When we approached the management about our dissappointment, we were itold we are welcome to leave, which we did immediately.

The Property is Beautiful with a great looking golf course and almost private white sand beach.....The free transfer from the airport to the hotel took almost 2 hrs. thus we missed our lunch...was it on purpose?... The welcome was good and the check in was quick.... But being a big hotel and the rooms at one end and all the facilities at other we needed buggy which was never free or available... The buffet menu was less than a page and was almost same all the time, no choice.... There was no cleaning or making up of the room for 2 days... Humidity was felt in the room with the smell, no fragrance.... Basic essentials like dental kits and shaving kits were missing... And on and on

All in all a bad experience... A rating of 2 only for the beautiful property and quick check in and check out....

.. Rooms ok .. Service ok .. in area food could be better ..!!..
Prices a little higher than should be .. beach services not as promised .. generally I would say it could be better, family was not so impressed and frankly I would like to try something else next time will visit Goa ..!!..

Stayed with family in 2 suites plus 2 rooms. All the rooms had similar challenges . The luxury resort must fix the cooling in their rooms and buggy service. The restaurants need to improve their service . They miss touch of luxury resort.

We stayed here from 18-22 feb 2015 with our little less than two yr old baby. 

First 
The property is beautiful and the architects have made the best use of lagoons and landscape. The lobby and the entrance both are well detailed accessorized and look great and so do the rooms!! 
Our view was fantastic with an extra seating area with glass wall (we paid for everything) overlooking the lotus plantation. 

BUT
The big but is the staff and the policies that are a massive turn off. Right from the super quick rooms cleaning jobs with all the dust that remains on the bedroom benches to the curt ways of refusing to be forthcoming for any unusual requests (in our case one was slim milk, I am allergic to whole milk so when asked the room service to get a glass was curtly told that we only have amul taaza ) 
I walked out of the hotel to the a grocery store 100 Mtrs away and got the milk pack

More than just that the whole demeanor of the staff (barring a couple of them) screams "not welcome" 
This is the only luxury hotel where I have seen blank faces who look thru you standing behind the reception and the concierge. 
The least you can do is smile!! 


Food 
We mostly ordered room service (average) and once had superb food at their Italian restaurant by the river side

The buffet for breakfast also had average not a leela kind of selection but the buffet at dinner that we tried once was one of the worst meals I have ever had. Right from the selection to the tastes. Everything pathetic. 
This place is perfect for foreigners who are treated a notch up even by the guards who will wish them walking ten feet ahead of you and ignore you completely. 

I don't even want to mention the trouble we had to get some food organized for our baby. 

The hospitality is a huge disappointment and have no idea where this attitude stems from. We are connoisseur club members with leela and gurgaon leela has always been very courteous. And we paid a bomb for this crap!! 

:(

The property is beautifully designed and well maintained. We had our rooms close to the main facilities which is perfect. The rooms are large enough for 2 persons. The food is excellent. Huge selection at the breakfast buffet for both Indian and international guests. The ventilation in the bathroom is insufficient and needs improvement. Nevertheless I would rate these facilities with 5 stars if there were no issues regarding the location of the resort. 

Disappointing is that there is no beach service during the monsoon. However, due to the location of the property next to a large creek to our opinion swimming in the sea is not possible. One should realize that in India effluent water is mostly disposed of without treatment. The sea is heavily polluted with garbage and feces (presumably human excrements). If you like to swim in the sea in India it is recommended to find a resort away from cities and rivers mouths. Note that garbage may not be visible after the monsoon, discharging waste water will continue all year around.

Last of the 7 hotels we stayed in and the worst, apart from The Leela in Udaipur which we moved out of after one night....unfortunately not an option here.

Room was a Lagoon suite which was large and comfortable, decor modern and bland.

Breakfast was okay but get there early otherwise there is no service and far too crowded. Did not eat in hotel, did not want to take the risk!

Pool area was noisy and crowded so long trek to the beach but remember to take water from the room as not provided, unlike every other hotel we stayed in. 

Very poor service for a supposed 5 star....did enquire about the club rooms but it appeared that for the considerable extra cost we got high tea (not evening cocktails), breakfast in the room and some free laundry and a car transfer which we did not require.

I haven't covered everything that was annoying but suffice to say I would certainly not stop at any Leelas again.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.
