The first night was absolutely amazing from the checkin to the walk on the beach to everything. The staff was absolutely amazing and very very polite and helpful and always haf a smile on their face when attending.

The second night was good and everything was smooth. Though around 4 am in the morning I wad awoken by some rattling noise. I thought nothing of it and went back to sleep then i heard it again. I turned on the lights to inspect and I wad shocked to see a tail of some creature dangling out of the Ac vents. This completely shook me. I called the front desk and they took sometime understandably to reach.


But once again when they
reached they were all polite and helped me move to the other room.

So there it is. I really do not know what to make of this stay. It was good overall but this major incident left a very bad stay in my memory.

Me & my family stayed in another resort close to Leela and decided to have our dinner at The Leela. OMG, we were in for a shock! We were treated like second class citizens by the staff and security. Definitely, a bunch of folks with attitude problems. The whole experience was so bad that we decided to get out of the hotel without dinner.

I would like to share my experience in Leela.

I stay in this property this week only and celebrated my Birthday. the service which they offered was excellent. but sorry to say after spending so much the airport transfer was horrible in coach.

The A/C was not working, when we complained about this to drive and his helper.... they told us that it will work like this only, AC is automatic as per them but literally that 1 hour for airport was horrible.

I would request please not to book Leela if they are providing Coach transfer. you feel cheated as we had spent thousands of Rupee in Leela.

Its horrible experience ever in transfers. 

Please Please avoid this Hotel if they are providing Coach Transfers

We are regulars to south Goa on business/social trips, on this occasion we were staying in Cavelossim and decided to have dinner at The Leela. As one guest writes below Leela is devoid of any culture especially for such a large establishment, this is rather true. We ordered drinks at the open lounge area, if you havent been here this is an exceptional area but its let down by lack of social ambiance, perhaps all guests were sleeping at dinner time or had gone out. 

Excellent bar service with complementary selection of nibbles provided with drinks whilst listening to the Tabla duo.

We were having Indian so walked through the buffet area (noted flies on deserts and pointed that out to girl who was escorting us, she just politely smiled). The restaurant wasn't busy two couples plus us two and a table of four who were sitting outside but were having a buffet. Rather surprisingly the simple order of mixed kebabs and baby sweetcorn took a long time, soon after we were asked if we were ready for mains !! ah no. My wife did not like them as they seem to be undercooked, the baby sweetcorn was deliciously described but it came out with thick batter and without any yogurt dressing, I am heavily into food but the slow service and food not as described is awful regardless of if your Indian or another nationality.

As this is a review, the issues are; cold plates are being served to guests, food is barley hot, the delicately battered corn is covered in thick pakora batter, no yogurt on the salad, kebabs are okay but not fantastic, the mains were disappointing as the starters, since when did all dishes have cream ? the buffet may have been better, minus the fly trodden deserts. 

I did complain to the waiter who called the manager, and guess what he called the chef over. As the chef was there we had a chat about the quality of his food, I did mention there was no yogurt on the dish, his answer was the yogurt comes from outside and is sour these days, what really chef ? so The Leela cant make the simplest of the Indian ingredients (yogurt). The chef was rather apologetic and offered us further dishes which we declined, we were not there for free food. I did inform the chef about some restaurants in London I am associated to and how we serve food. This is not 5* food, I suggest dress down and eat in a shack instead. 

With some thought I am rating the service average & food poor, I am sorry if this reflects on your overall score, its great if your quality has improved since. 

Booked 28th Feb for Dinner only, your Chef has my name. The Leela please leave an email address if you want to discuss quality of food and service, I hope it improves, perhaps next time can spend some time with your chef if you allow.

This resort is very beautiful but management must have a very weird sense of service and making people feel welcome and special. The team around the pool may as well treat it like a museum. My well behaved teenagers couldn't even throw a soft ball to each other in the pool even when there was no one else in the pool and I was there watching them. No drinking water or anything else that should be made available at a resort of this level. Pick up transfer vehicle is just terrible. Concierge wasn't at all helpful and didn't really offer any advice. She didn't even remind us to take umbrellas during monsoon on a trip that she organised. The Italian restaurant was very nice and staff terrific but the first night we went there we were the only people there. Lastly we used the gym every evening and staff were more intent on acting as security guards rather than providing any advice or assistance. So I just feel management need to empower staff more and give them a bit of space to actually help guests and make them feel a bit special. I felt the whole culture of the place reflected an attitude that I didn't see or feel in any other of the 5-6 star hotels that I stayed at in India on my recent trip. The Italian restaurant was the only difference and it would be interesting to see if they perhaps outsource the management of this to someone else. I wouldn't go back which is a pity as it is a lovely property.

Just returned from Goa yesterday, we stayed at Leela Goa. This was my 3rd trip to Goa. 

Hotel has airport pickup, but Ac on bus was pathetic we were sweating by the time we reached the hotel.
Place is huge and rooms are good with nice ambience
There are water bodies outside all rooms, which causes mosquitos, you cant leave the room open at all.
Only one kids channel on the tv, no pogo channel, so if you are travelling with Kids and they are chota bheem fans carry some cds.
Buffet was good, with a decent number of options. Nice desserts.
No playing allowed in the swimming pools, no softball also. No floats provided near the pools.
They have a good beach near the resort, with recliners which is good.
If you are planning on parcelling meals for your return trip from the resort, be specific else the quantity packed will be less and also they dont pack things properly so do check. I had got sandwhich packed for my return journey and they packed them pretty messily and also the quantity packed was less.

Overall not very happy with my experience there, my experience with Taj in Goa was much much better compared to this, although their property is smaller than that of Leela.

The pictures of the rooms,are not any of the rooms that we took. Nowhere near the standard of the Leela in Delhi. This hotel needs to have a star or two taken of. The staff on the other hand were very good. Spend your money somewhere else

Quite unarguably one of India's best luxury properties till about 7-8 years ago, this hotel has now fallen on bad times. My views are based on the fact that it is an expensive hotel, and hence expectations are very high. When I am paying about $400 a nigh in a hotel in India then I expect a world class property with service levels to match. I had stayed at the hotel 6-8 years back and hence, was very surprised to see the decline. Firstly, I was in a room where the bathroom is the size of a closet, and no matter which way you turn you bang into a glass door or partition. There is barely enough place to stand and brush your teeth or shave. My colleague complained about this and he was moved to a room with a very spacious bathroom - obviously, the hotel has fallen into the trap of mediocrity (will do something if the guest raises a stink). Secondly, on the second day my room was not cleaned till 3:30pm. The General Manager, when asked why this was the case, responded that cleaning starts only at 10am and it goes into the afternoon as well. Thirdly, the gym had floor mats that were layered with dirt (from peoples shoes). Dont think these are ever cleaned. I could not use them. The GM offered to change them (and they were next day). Same issue, If I could see the dirt then how come the hotel staff could not? Fourthly, there was no newspaper on the first day. The GM had the audacity to claim that "their records showed it had been delivered", perhaps insinuating that I was either lying or had somehow made my newspaper disappear. Fifthly, the blinds in my room, the ones that are on a verandah that overlooks a lagoon, were layered with dust. I happened to lean against them and had stripes of dust on my white shirt. Sixthly, I had asked for soya milk at breakfast and 4 persons behind the counter told me that they did not have any. The GM said that I should have asked the Restaurant Manager. I don't know why the entire staff in the restaurant cannot be made aware of such a simple thing (soya milk is no longer an esoteric drink but staple at all top-end hotels). Lastly, the bathrooms on the ground floor (next to the ball room) were cleaned infrequently with tissue papers all over the floor and urinals flowing over. The ball room had carpets that were musty and door frames that were dilapidated. 

On the positive side - excellent food, very wide variety; lovely beach; fantastic property spread across acres and acres; far away from the maddening crowds of Goa; great choice of sports (tennis, golf etc); all rooms opening into a lagoon (I could just sit there for hours hearing the birds).

On balance, I would never go to Leela again. If I am paying top dollar then I expect nothing but the best and I have seen that at the Hyatt in Goa as well as plenty of other hotels in India (including the Leela in Delhi).

I guess when one makes a reservation with a 5 star property, there are some pre - conceived notions one carries , all the more so if one has visited the property before and had a great time!!!
Leela Goa, I must say was a stark contrast to the earlier version when I had visited previously. 

The property still continues to be a beautiful paradise - more so in the monsoons with lush greenery, beautiful settings and freshly done up rooms. What killed the whole experience is the overall approach of staff! Housekeeping was a joke - with the staff talking over an hour and half to address a 'make my room' request! SPA slot bookings done from beforehand have no gurantee of being honoured at the said time!!! Welcome drinks n cake were 3 hrs after we checked in!!! Wrong calls into the room... honestly a jinxed experience! So much for being categorised as a 'Handle with Care (HWC) ' guest! 

There were some positives too..cant be all negative - Food was superlative, bar was a great experience and SPA was a treat! 

Summing it all up, The Leela Goa team has to pull up their socks up in terms of meeting guest requests and ensuring that they are pampered to the extent that it promises!

This place didn't get the little things right.

The feeling of tip hustlers, bad waiter co-ordination on a very special day, mediocre food, average breakfast spread (a first for a large property like this one), unrelaxed late checkout policy, motel-like spa with old plastic doors, no casual seating, reading area or warm tea. 

This place just didn't get it right at all.

The Resort: The Leela resort is huge but maintenance was clearly an issue. The lawns were not manicured properly and the lighting at night was very very poor and absolutely missing at the beach.
Rooms: we stayed in the conservatory premiere room. The furnishing was very modern and the feel of the room was very nice.
Food: the food quality of the buffet was quite poor and not upto five star standards at all. On the other hand the experience in the Italian resturaunt was great. Also there is a nice riverside resturaunt just outside the hotel - the fisherman's wharf - good food, ambience and reasonably priced.
Service: check-in experience was horrible. We arrived at 12:30 as the booking voucher from cleartrip mentioned checking at 12. We were told we would have to wait till 2 as all the rooms were full. After that we were taken to a twin bed room even though we had booked a double. We finally managed to check in at 3. Also, we were eligible for an upgrade due to one of our memberships but were told at the checkin counter that the hotel is booked out - even though online they were showing availability. Would have preferred if it was a more reasonable explanation than the check in manager lying blatantly.
Transportation/ location : the Leela resort is located really south in south goa. However, water sports was open in the river near Leela ( the water looks dirty though) whereas it's closed in the sea everywhere else in the monsoons.
Overall it was quite disappointing. We had stayed at the Leela resort in Kovalam and had a fantastic experience there - which is why we decided to check their Goa property as well. We also stayed at the Park Hyatt just before we stayed here and had a much much better experience there

We have just got back from a long weekend at the Leela in Goa which left us with little desire to go back. The entrance to the property was impressive and the hotel grounds were very pretty and well maintained (much more so than the Taj Exotica). However, the service within the hotel by hotel staff was well below standard. That being said, the staff at the front desk and housekeeping were very helpful (although our bedsheets always smelt of damp and on one day were dirty and did not get changed despite informing housekeeping).

The hotel has a few restaurants but the only restaurant which serves food throughout the day is the coffee shop. The breakfast buffet was cold. Food we ordered failed to come. We went there for dinner and our steaks took over an hour to come during which time no-one bothered to ask whether we needed anything or provided an explanation as to why it was taking so long. The entire time we were there the salt and pepper shakers were constantly dirty with food stuck on them. The staff were just not very helpful at all and seemed to be wandering around not really knowing what they were meant to be doing.

At the beach there was only one attendant despite the fact that the hotel and beach were extremely busy. It was very difficult to firstly find the attendant and then to get his attention to actually get you some towels - expect it to take around 5 minutes. The beach menu was not very extensive and the only things on the menu worth eating were the fries and chocolate ice cream. 

In all honesty I really would have overlooked all the above and not bothered writing a review on tripadvisor had I not encountered the absolutely worst service of my life at the Spa. We visited the Spa on the day at the start of our stay and it was fine - nothing to rave about but it was a normal massage. However, on the day of our departure we decided to try another massage. The therapist I was given took me the changing room, showed me a locker and gave me a towel to wrap around myself (when we had the first massage I was given a robe, slippers and disposable pants), I was not provided with anything more than a towel. When I asked her she told me to take my pants off which I was not comfortable with so I told her I would keep my own on. The massage, which was meant to be a full body massage including the head was terrible - the word massage can't even be used. She simply rubbed oil on my body in repetitive long motions on my arms legs stomach and back and painfully scrubbed oil in my hair and then gave me my towel again and that was the end! When I reached the changing rooms I saw that my underpants had oil all over them. As they were very expensive I asked the masseuse how I should remove the oil and she simply laughed and said 'I don't know'. When I reached the reception of the Spa they asked me how my massage was, to which I replied 'terrible' and again their response was to laugh. I proceeded to explain everything and they simply handed me the bill the sign and said maybe it would come out with water. There was no apology at all. When I asked to speak to the manager they called the sitting Doctor who was also in the Spa who also had no apology to offer but simply said he would speak to the girl, and then proceeded to bumble back into his surgery! I have never in my life seen such terrible service, and it seemed to epitomise the general unprofessional nature of most of the staff at hotel. Upon our departure I briefly explained this to the hotel manager who did seem concerned but that won't change our trip!

We stopped at the Park Hyatt on our way to the hotel and we were truly impressed. The hotel is beautiful and the food and service at the coffee shop was impeccable. We will definitely be staying there on our next visit to Goa!

We read such good reviews of the Leela and were excited to stay there. We aren't usually the kind of people who care a huge amount about customer service but we were immediately taken aback when we arrived when, en route to our room, we asked the concierge if there were any romantic activities we could do at the Leela as we were on our honeymoon and she simply said 'no'. We were further perplexed when that evening we saw a couple having dinner at a private candlelit table on the beach! When we enquired the next day as to whether there were any activities we could do in the area or trips we could take, the concierge again simply said 'no - there's nothing to do'. I said that I had read about all sorts of boat trips in our travel guide, could they help us organize one? "There are boat guys on the beach if you want to ask them'. The concierge told me. When I did ask them they had astronomical prices for short boat trips. There are several restaurants scattered around the hotel but they don't give you menus for them in your room, so you have no idea which you would want to go to. When we called the concierge to ask for menus; it took them over 2 hours to bring them - and when they did they brought us only one! It was quite astonishing. Finally after desperation was beginning to sink in, one concierge told us that if we took a cab to nearby hotel 'mike's place' in cavelossim; they would help us organize some activities. This they did - and helped us arrange a boat trip and a tour of the area. It's a traveller hotel, and frankly should not be so superior to the Leela in its standards of service - but it was. At the Leela restaurants, the waiters studiously practiced the 'upsell' ('would you like desert?' 'no', 'are you sure, maybe just some ice cream?' 'no thank you', 'what about some creme caramel?' 'no!!!') to the point where you felt like you were being harassed! When we finally checked out of the leela and told the manager what happened, she did apologize profusely and arrange for us to get a 'really nice room' at the Leela in Mumbai; however when we checked in at the Leela Mumbai they showed us to what can only have been one of their worst rooms with absolutely no view except a neighbouring car park. We had to complain again! Finally when we checked out of that hotel and asked to join the Leela Kempinski rewards programme and get points for the nights we'd stayed in Goa and Mumbai; they said we could not reclaim those nights past - which seemed ridiculous. Altogether, even though the Leelas are very attractive hotels - they need to work hard on their customer service! The only high point in service at the Leela Goa was the head barman at the beach bar, who was extremely friendly, not at all pushy, helpful and made a terrific cocktail. He had apparently been sent for training in Orlando - something which the Leela might consider sending other staff to do also. Maybe they don't want you to leave the property so you spend more money there - I assume that's the idea. They do have a very pretty beach area, but while the hotel calls it a 'private beach', it is filled with hawkers who accost you whenever you go into the ocean. The room is also lovely and we had no complaints about that at all. It's just a shame we had so much trouble doing anything outside of it!

its was a pleasant start to a desasterous end.. roms had shower problems , airconditioning did not work to the fullest. staff was helpfull but i had to move twice in my 3 day stay which did not appeal to me.

The first Night we couldn't sleep a wink, because of insects making noise outside our door..... We changed our room the next day, only to find a lizard between the sheets in our bed.... TOTALLY OUTRAGEOUS... very poor housekeeping...

Though the spa is excellent and the property offers load of great things to keep you busy... excellent location and beach too....

Breakfast was very ordinary, not 5 star standards. Their RIVERSIDE restaurant was awesome with live music and gourmet cuisine...

The CASINO was pathetic. !!! 

would not recommend if you are looking for luxury. Else this hotel kept us busy with tone of stuff...

Liked  The Beach
Disliked  The lizard between my bedsheets

I never thought Id find myself saying this upon returning from the Leela Goa but Im glad to have left and wont be staying here ever again. Its not too much to say I wouldnt stay here again for free. This is a reasonably nice hotel with OK facilities but worrying management. I booked a long weekend with my wife, arriving on a Thursday and departing on a Sunday.

We booked a Lagoon Suite which was two rooms, one living room and one bedroom overlooking a man made lagoon. The room was nice but a little dated. The two TVs were ancient and as is becoming more and more prevalent in top end hotels the TV reception was rubbish.

Aside from the Caf there were 3 other restaurants. One served Indian food, one served Italian/seafood and the other down on the beach served seafood/burgers etc. We ate at the Indian restaurant and the seafood restaurant and found both to be reasonable. Neither will serve the best food you have ever eaten, both are unlikely to make you ill.

Down the beach from the hotel (30 meters) there are three beach restaurants serving food at far more reasonable prices. We would have tried them had we not been on an all inclusive deal. Given the emptiness of the restaurants in the hotel each evening this must have been where people went to eat.

My major issue with the hotel came towards the end of my stay. I appreciate times are tight for the hotel industry but my stay was ruined by the arrival of 30 men from a large telecommunications company holding some kind of conference. This resulted in this group lying around on the grass drinking, monopolistic the pool, shouting, drinking and generally making a nuisance of themselves. Complaints to the management elicited responses such as its hard to control a large group of men or ..but they are all from a top company. The hotel was clearly far more interested in making sure that these 30 men had the run of the hotel causing whatever havoc they chose at the expense of the other guests.

This has left a very bad taste in my mouth. I spent a significant amount of money for the three nights I was there and came second in terms of priority to the drunken idiots in the eyes of the management. Its a shame. Having stayed at other Leela hotels in the world the management at this one really let the side down.
It was good value for money. Nice amenities, good food and suitable location. Easy access to important tourist places.

Were disappointed from GHM Hotels after we had an amazing stay at the Legian in Bali
Service:
Part of the staff was on strike and therefore quality of service suffered and negative atmosphere. Room wasn't cleaned on some days. No turn down service. Had the feeling that the personnel in lower positions were not treated well.

Rooms:
Small. More like a 4 Star hotel. Parts were dated. Bathroom: average

Breakfast:
food was good. Staff friendly and helpful

Lobster Shack:
Great staff and food.

Concierge/Beauty Salon/Reception:
useless, lazy, slow, incompetent

Pool/Beach:
slow service. Beach was on particular days dirty.

General : Very inconsistent. Not a 5 star hotel! but probably still better than the Taj. You will be very disappointed if you have stayed at another GHM hotel or at an Oberoi in India before.

Sent a letter to the General Manager but never received a response.

We stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Having spent the previous 3 days in Dubai at Jumeriah Beach we were expecting a similar experience- wrong I`m afraid.
Firstly there was significant building work- the pool cafe was closed for 2 days, ugly green partitions were dotted everywhere and many of the villas looked like a building site (with sawing and banging to match). We did complain to our rep and were moved to a quieter villa.
Although the hotel staff were nice and accommodating i just didn`t get the same feeling as I did in Dubai. 
Also the prices at the resort are astoundingly expensive, certainly not value for money- if you plan to eat in and also have a few cokes / water during the day then at least 200 a day for a couple!
On the plus side, was very quiet and beach wonderful.

Liked  beach
Disliked  value for money

It is reckoned to be the best hotel in Goa. Well god help Goa. My wife and I had a great holiday and the hotel is pleasant enough. The beach is outstanding and the crowd we met there was charming. However I had to major issues with my stay that for me remain the salient memory of the hotel (though fortunately not the holiday). Bear in mind this is a professional business run by those concerned by market forces. It attests to being 5 star. First there is the service. Everything they (the grunt staff) did, they did with a smile. Everything they did they gushed with helpfulness. Everything gratitude we expressed they beamed with satisfaction. Everything they did was wrong. I don't think I ordered a single item that didn't in some way come with something lacking. Perhaps this is an Indian phenomenan. I had the same experience in Bombay at the Taj Palace. If you want something done then ask three people and hope that one of them does it. Ok, no big deal, and it wouldn't have been had it not been for point 2. 

Management were forever hosting evenings that 'starred' various singers or bands. Now its not as if Goa is short of talent. Just outside the hotel was a restaurant called 'Betty's Place'. They had a fantastic band and I mean 'good' by London standards. The food at Betty's was remarkable and the price likewise. I think we ate the River Sal's supply of crab for the season and it cost the same as a pack of fags. However at the Leela it cost (for India) the equivalent of a year's salary. Now I have no problem paying high prices, even over the top prices. But I do have a problem with being 'sold' a grand night out and finding out that the 'grand' refers to the bill. I complained about one particular evening where we served ourselves at the buffet only to find that as we sat down the most terrifying shrieks that only someone undergoing unanaethetised surgery on their groin could possibly make. Either that or a band at the Leela hotel. 

The fact is that I came away feeling I'd been sold to the whole time. Always being pitched at for one event or another. each of which was just plain amateurish, albeit it that it was accompanied by the most professional of prices. And when I complained they did nothing! They may respond and say they knocked a breakfast off my bill. That was because when I ordered egg, toast and tea for breakfast only the eggs arrived. 

Conclusion. The hotel is atrociously managed and avaricious. It lets Goa, the beach and its staff down. Go there by all means but eat out as much as you can and avoid anything the hotel offers.

Liked  The beach, thye sea, the dolphins
Disliked  Always trying to figure out how to squeeze you for another rupee
Tips/Secrets  Eat at Betty's place and Martin's Corner

The Leela gardens and beach are still as beautiful as ever. The staff pleasant and attentive. The food in the restaurants good. However since the advent of GHM as management the decor in public areas and bedrooms in the main hotel is drab and dull and maintenance ignored.
The Club may be new and glitzy but the hotel accommodation although "top dollar" prices is now old, leaking, and shabby. Water ingress in Lagoon Suite Rooms ($485 per night) leads to paint staining and damp smell. Roof tiles are perished and a quick splash of paint simply won't do.
The Spa building leaks and there is damp plaster and staining on walls and ceilings. The ladies' changing room toilets smell of urine.
The gym may sport 2 new treadmills but the air con is ineffective and the window frames show bubbling plaster and staining.
It is sad to see what was once an immaculate hotel when Four Seasons and Kempinski managed now so run down.

Liked  The size and layout of the Lagoon Suite
Disliked  the poor maintenance, water ingress, noisy air con, dull furnishings, poorly maintained window frames and dated tile floor
Tips/Secrets  It is not up to scratch for the prices charged.

I was looking forward to the Leela. I was dissapointed. The Hotel is tired and worn out. On arrival, the reception is impressive but the feeling soon fades away. We have two young children and had booked adjoining rooms. The management decided that our 8 and 12 year old daughters could be placed several buildings away. After much debate we settled for an alternative building for a few nights, and then one room upstairs, and another downstairs for the remainder. We were told the Leela did not have adjoining rooms (they do!). We were told that there was a 12 hole golf course complete with caddiesand buggies (its a pitch and put). We were told there was a private beach - it is for about 30 yards, but the beach is traded by hawkers who can be very persistent. Get the message - lots of false promises and accentuating the positive to the point of disbelief.

I was ill for about 3 days with food poisoning, and my wife for about 7 days. The riverside reasaurant was probably the culprit. The Indian resturant had a very limited menu but the quality was good. Drinks are 5 times the price of outside the hotel (thats what the * in 5* means - multiply!) The onsite cafe was good. The pool was relatively small. The Spa was quite good. Its a shame.

I am fortunate to be an `old Leela hand', having stayed there for the past four or five years; which makes its current state even more painful. First, let me say that the Leela physcially remains one of the most beautiful beach resorts not only in India, but in the world. Its layout and landscaping are breathtaking. But today it is tired...it lacks its past spirit; the staff is disenchanted; the food is mediocre (even in its vast, apparently sumptuous-looking, buffets). Nobody, from the manager down, seems to care. If celebrities continue to come, i.e. Bill Clinton, etc., it is because there simply is no other hotel of this category in Goa. Some years ago, they added a `super deluxe Club' within the resort; and for astronomical rates, you get a huge air-conditioned villa whose permanently closed windows face a greenway; a vast bed overlooking a huge plasma TV and amenities that they have notably taken away from the rest of the hotel. The main hotel's pool is gorgeous, with a lovely waterfall: but, as was evident from guests' vigorous complaints, there is a woeful...and potentially hazardous...lack of chlorine. by the afternoon, when most of the guests were there. When guests complained...and this was at a holiday time when the pool was full of children...management simply shrugged its shoulders and declared that `this is not a high priority'! It is a special pity because the Leela in its better days was virtually unmatched anywhere in India. I eagerly await its return to glory!

I was trying to book our annual family(of 5) holiday to Goa. We stayed at Taj Exotica last year and wanted to try The Leela this year. I called them to find out more and unbelievably they do not provide their guests with free internet. Based on all the reviews it seems like a very nice hotel but unfortunately we will not get to try it first hand. In this day and age when even the smallest of guest houses have free internet - it is inexcusable to have your guests pay for internet. 'It is the hotel policy' is the terse reply I got when I called the reservation department.

Worst experience ever . Will never ever stay here again even if offered free room . It was pure torture . Have been staying in Taj exotica for last 5 years , Leela is not even 10% of what Taj is . There were snakes in the pond / lagoon right next to the room and one they even caught in front of our room . Food and room was pretty good though . They have so many restrictions regarding every thing , its like staying in a jail not resort . They have 6 people staying right next to the pool just to implement the rules and not even one life guard for either of the pools . Ridiculously small swimming pool . Very unfriendly staff , no body greets you when even if they pass by you . No place for any games and badly maintained lawns . Taj exotica beats this property any given day and after experiencing Tajs hospitality , this under par experience is just not acceptable . Have pics of snake if any body wants to see :) . Lizard in bathroom .

Nothing spells summer more profoundly than the beaches of Goa. And then you look for unmatched hospitality and are willing to pay the price. But what happens when a cheeky attitude gets the better of hospitality. Complete put off. Have been staying so regularly at the Leela's since 2002 and have never faced such bad service. I think after Capt Krishnan Nair they haven't been able to live up to its standard and they badly need to introspect. 
Where in the world do they charge you for wifi. They don't even have free wifi in the lobby. I guess they don't realise it's time to change and match up to international standards and not every time will they be able to getaway by landscaping. 
The guest services don't answer their phones. When they finally do it takes a very long time for them to attend to the issues. 
To begin with the bathroom was stinking. So much for being a Leela legacy where they charge you even for sneezing. They are running their hotel in a bookish military rule fashion where their only concern is to bring their failing legacy out of the immense loses and couldn't be bothered about the guests feelings.
I must mention at this point that their competitors Grand Hyatt in this way were superbly hospitable. They went all out to provide us with the minutest request and never wrongly charged us a dime.
Completely disappointed. Will never come back. They need to be more transparent by putting all extra charges openly online so the customer knows what they are paying for.

From Check in to dining this was a complete disaster, I have stayed here before 2 years ago and it was fabulous with excellent attention to detail, this time it lacked it all, lots of staff but keep missing basics, for example rang reception for a plaster for my son ( who had cut himself ) and it wasn't delivered until I chased it up 45 minutes later. Check in was slow and the rooms were not organised, not something you expect from a hotel of this calibre. Location is excellent, however it seems like the basics are now missing. I have heard the Hotel has changed hands recently and this could be the reason why service levels have dropped so dramatically, however the price has increased with inflation.

First visit to the leela was amazing so we went back only to be sorely disappointed. The whole welcoming vibe and warmth of the resort has gone and everything from the front desk service to the quality of food has dropped. I'd go as far in saying that the front desk manager (Ashley) and his team could benefit from a few weeks of hospitality training as they really are clueless on how to manage guests. 
The Leela is also the only 5 star hotel in India that charges for coconut water as part of the breakfast buffet. How they can justify this, I'm not sure. 

If you want true luxury and great service, avoid this hotel and try the Taj instead.

For the week we spent in the South for New years we stayed at the Raddison Blu. In the North we visited the Taj Hotel for a day and loved it, so we decided to do the same at the Leela, as my brother and father wanted to use the golf course that wasn't available at our hotel (to which it cost them 50).On the phone beforehand we were told that we could use the beach facilities for 50 for four people. Thinking it was ridiculous to pay for beach chairs given that we were going to spend a lot of money later we settled for two chairs thinking they would charge us 25. As soon as we arrived on the beach they radioed all security, they said we were to pay 50 for two people despite making a deal over the phone. 

We couldn't relax on the beach as all eyes were on us and it made us feel like we were criminals because we were not residents at the hotel. On top of that there was a man serving watermelon to guests on the chairs, when he passed us he he blatantly avoided giving us some, though we were paying for it. I understand the Leela prides itself with high profile guests, but does it really have to be that high profile to treat normal visitors inhumanely? When my brother and father finished the game of golf security were waiting for them. In the end they kept to their deal and charged us 25 for the chairs. After they realised we were paying customers they changed their tune and treated us like royalty when we were dining at the beach restaurant- Little too late if you ask me. We ended up paying around 250 for dinner! The total for one day wasted of our holiday was over 300.

I understand the experience for residents of this hotel may be different. The grounds of the Leela is beautiful and no doubt the rooms must be exquisite, however the atmosphere was so quiet, dry and isolated. I reckon the Lalit and Taj would be equally as beautiful and the experience a whole lot better. Looking back we regret not staying at the Lalit, as it is very close to Palolem beach (The best in Goa). Also the Fisherman's Warf (A restaurant) in the same vicinity of the Leela was fantastic, half the price, better views and fun atmosphere.

In sum, my suggestion having visited Goa would be, if you want complete isolation and a pretentious atmosphere stay at the Leela. If you want fun and luxury go to the Lalit/ Taj. If you want a nice friendly place that isn't so expensive and family friendly go to the Holiday Inn/ Radisson Blu.

The Leela Goa prides itself as being one the best hotels in Goa, which may be true for guests staying at the hotel. Clearly they don't give a damn about non residents wishing to dine in the restaurant. We made a reservation for the night of 1st January in the Riverside restaurant, the last night in Goa for 3 of our party. So sad to turn up to find no record of the reservation. It was suggested we wait in the bar until a table became available (a likely long wait). Other than that there was nothing else offered to help us although they did suggest dining in another restaurant.

Security at the hotel is robust. When making the reservation, in person, at the hotel reception, we were greeted at the gate by officers who ID. We were then greeted by more security at reception. Told to ensure we were wearing the proper attire on the night we felt assured all was in order and that all was being professionally run. It just goes to show that you are only as good as the staff you employ and the two individuals who made our reservation have let the hotel down.

We finally dined in the beach restaurant which was fine. The food was good and the staff great. The 20% discount was a nice gesture but the damage had been done. On a previous evening we had dined at the adjacent Fisherman Wharf restaurant, same setting, great food and atmosphere and much cheaper. If we come back to Goa, which is an almost certainty, the Leela will not be on the agenda.

This place is absolutely hyped with zero deliverance ..The property is supposed to be sold out , but terribly managed . I really wonder 

Robin who is supposed to be a duty in charge for night shift is absolutely an arrogant and shameless guy ..found him quarreling with few guests .. Heights of unprofessionalism .

This hotel promises so much but does not deliver.
There is nothing positive I can say about our stay at The Leela, except we were delighted to leave early!
We were dissatisfied with the 'pool suite', restaurants, level of service and cleanliness and truly disappointed by the attitude of the so called management.
DO NOT VISIT...EVER!

awful experience = they used my credit card without my permission and now I am going to the police station to put a complain.Don't give them the details of your credit card or you will have some problems! Evening buffet was awful= Most of the time empty! I was waiting more than 30 mn under the sun with my baby of 2 months old outside the Italian restaurant opposite the complex because the buggy never came! They said 5 mn, it came after 30mn when I decided to go by walk= No management. Shame on a palace hotel. If you have a baby, don't select this hotel. They don't care of their customers.

Food is terrible for all three meals, the service is worse, the staff isn't helpful or even bothered to know what the guest has to say. It is a better decision to stay at another hotel like taj exotica or Hyatt

First trip to India and the last.
The Leela was sold to us as an amazing place.
This hotel is aimed at the Indian market, is not western at all, which i found out.
The staff have not been trained very well if at all, as even when asked to get a plate of french fries was too difficult for them as did not understand english, something which happened for the whole of the week we were there.
The management where just the same, a simple order of chicken and chips was a major thing to order, was upsetting as all food was paid for and all we ate was chips chips chips, even asked for a chicken korma which arrived uncooked. Not impressed.
Came back home 2 stone lighter which was the only plus about this holiday.
If you hate mosies do not go there, we were feasted on every night to and from the restaurant, and we were covered/drowned in spray, and will have the scars to remind us of a nightmare holiday.

I was staying close by the Leela and wanted to meet with friends staying at this resort. She put my name on a list at the reception and then called to tell me they wanted IR5000 for me to come inside and meet with them. I refused to pay as I pay that much for my beautiful apartment on the same beach, just 15 km away for a week!. My friend was on her honeymoon and begged me to come saying her new husband would pay for me to come in and greet them. I was allowed to stay on a sunbed for this price. I paid IR1000 for a small salad and a soda. I asked for a taxi to go back to my own lovely apartment and I said sorry and walked outside the resort and paid IR10 for a bus ride home...sorry this is overrated and the service sucked! I love my sweet apartment in Benaulim...same beach..same Sea.

Stayed here from 25th April to 6th March.

Pros:-
Nice enough rooms
The beach is nice

Cons:-
Rooms more expensive than London for similar quality

Hotel takes a cut from anyone trading in the vicinity including shacks, watersports, taxis. This means all services around the hotel are 2x or more the price of elsewhere in Goa.

Staff service is the most terrible I have ever experienced, even a UK Travel Lodge is far superior. As an example and there are many, at breakfast it took 30 minutes for anyone to ask if we wanted tea or coffee, and even then took another 15+ minutes to arrive by which point my partner and I had all but finished breakfast; this happened every day we were there. On several occasions I had to remind staff to bring the tea/coffee and remind them we were there at all.

I also noticed several other guests becoming very annoyed at this lack of service.

Secondly at breakfast the hotel serves various branded yoghurts as part of the buffet. I approached the counter to pickup what were the last two yoghurts of the day and as I was no more than 2 meters away two hotel staff members snatched the yoghurts from infront of me and made haste in case their boss saw.

Thirdly the cocktails are awful. On three separate occasions I had to complain about Mojitos being mixed incorrectly, not enough mint or rum - there must be a mint and rum shortage in Goa right now. My partner noticed this lack of quality stems from the fact that most bar staff are not really bar staff and seemingly alternate between being barman and towel attendants. We noticed only two bar staff capable enough to taste the cocktails before serving to customers.

Fourthly, the general quality of food is terrible. This starts right from breakfast with supposed indian tea actually being Twinings tea bags that I could buy back home from Asda. Do not bother asking for Masala tea since they just use a black tea bag and shove milk and masala powder in the pot...yuck. Do not bother with room service of restaurants either as you will pay well over a 3 Michelin Star London restaurant prices for food that is worse than Nandos.


On one occasion my partner and I were going out and on a strict time table for the days activities, we only had time to have cereal for breakfast and asked the waiter to box up some pastries for us to take with us. This request was refused, I have never stayed in a hotel where this would ever be refused before, especially not a supposed 5* hotel. Their reason for this is because people would not buy the lunch buffet. Again another example of how they treat paying customers.


If you didn't get the drift now... basically do not stay here and if you do, do not eat here. Spend no money at this hotel, everything is an extra. If you stay here go and eat at Blue Whale Shack further south down the beach where you will find much better food at a fraction of the cost and will not have to deal with the snarling attitude of the Leela staff.

To top it all off on our checkout not one staff member asked us how our stay was and after paying the bill in cash the cashier pocketed the change as a tip and ran off.

From the moment we checked in, the experience was downhill.The service is mediocre at best,the food almost tasteless, you can't change the temperature of the air conditioning in your room below 21 as it's centrally controlled...I could go on and on and it's only my first day here!Frankly can't wait to go home!

We stayed in leela hotel goa - staff is not cooperative at all , we have to wait for fooding items , water, Even the spoons and forks are not there, tables r not clean after first attended guest it takes about 2 hrs to complete our fooding as might be hotel having less staff or might be they should be hired nicely , also statf is having attitude problems , cant even give cart lift for walking ladies & childerens when the cart is fully empty . There was DND Sign on door and the house keeping guy opened the door and entered , the intensions of hoteliers are malafied ,Also we have to wait for almost 20 min everytime after calling for pickup. We did not feel comfortable over there, and checked out 2 days earlier ..we complained to president of leela group after that whole hotel staff seemed to argue us and each and everyone is tried to prove us wrong at every point even after molesting our ladies intentionaly and giving us lame exuse of saying its our hotel policy that any body can enter in our room with masterkey even when our ladies are in bathroom and they are shouting pls wait pls wait but they will enter in your bathroom and on the top of that your general manager is arguing us this is our hotel policy . 
Your hotel policy is that if no body complains for anything than also your staff will enter in the room forcefully and your G. M will say its our policy that we can go to any room anytime for having fun with ladies guest .

I was staying at The Leela during the last week of May and what a stay....my wallet goes missing from my room...is stolen and the attitude of the GM was utterly disappointing.....not even once did Mr.Nair meet me or speak to me or even write across....the wallet is still missing and the culprit is still hanging out there at the hotel....but the Hotel Management does not have the courage to admit that the culprit is one of their own employees.very disappointed not because my wallet was stolen.....but disappointed to see the ATTITUDE of the Management and this is is the Service Industry...the kind of stress I am going through.

Stayed May 2014, travelled on business

It's a nice large campus. Clearly big and tiring to walk around. But for peak season - $450 a night + $250 a head forced dinners. It is way way overpriced for completely 3 star service. 


Clearly value equals a three star Taj hotel but priced like a Four Seasons, Which it is NOT.

Not a classy hotel: 


Eg 1 :
Xmas night - forced a $250 buffet dinner per head, With strangers. 
$250 per head excludes alcohol, clearly poor choice.

Check- in took over 30 minutes . 

They did give me coconut water while i soaked my irritation. 


The staff never explained anything about anything. For a giant property where walking to the buffet is a 1 km walk. I think it's a resort for teenagers. 


Eg3:
duty managers are clueless. Which clearly is the case with most of the staff at Leela 

Leela has nice properties in general but consistently mediocre service. 

It's over priced for what it delivers. A lot more staff training and finishing needed.

unfinished folks - if you want a four seasons service and great Indian hospitality , This Leela isn't it.

not classy for what You will pay at all

Pool is very small & shallow, lot of mosquitos & bugs in the property, beware of bicycle which the property offer complementary for 30 mins they are not in good conditions, my wife injured her knee while riding one of this bicycle. 

When we check in the hotel we were asked to pay additional charges for one kids as the hotel policy didn't allow more than one child in the room, the villa balcony is converted in to child room therefore we lost the opportunity of enjoying siting in the balcony despite paying the additional charges the children has to suffer entire night as their room temperature was not ambient.

Shaving kit they offered in the washroom was of very cheap quality I had too many cuts after using their complementary shaving cut.

Hotel Staff is very unfriendly and seems this property is totally commercial.

Leela Goa is not value for the money you pay; I would strongly recommend Taj Exotica or Park Hyatt in Goa if you are planning a vacation with your family. 

Overall experience was Terrible !!!!!!!!!!

The Property is too old The Staff too tired to help or smile..Don't go relying on the great pics...this property feels like a 30 year old property..only the landscaping gardens are well maintained..and the rooms..I beleive the ones renovated..otherwise the property cries out loud for renovation...Lobby is so dull and depressing...the much Hyped about "RiverSide" restaurant feels like you're in 70's..creeking chairs..somber mood...pathetic condition..I am surprised that this is the Famed Leela..! We had a 3 Year Old kid with us..and they have just a small room full with toys to play...its so small..?? Few Slides are there but out in the sun ?? The Spa is also as Terrible as other parts of the property..you donot feel rejuvenated at all. The In Room Dining lacks the Style and detailing you expect from a 5* or 7*...We reached our Villa around 3:40 PM and when I tried to order Pizza..they refused...saying Lunch hours close at 3:30...Terrible Start...Only Staff that are willing and smiling are the buggy drivers....I URGE ALL TRAVELLERS TO NOT TO GET LURED BY THE PICS OF THE PROPERTY ..or the Name ...

It took them 2 hours for check in of the room after we reached. We came at 3 pm and there check in time is 2 pm and none of them replied our question. Every time I asked they are like give us 5 minutes and we will revert back. Even the manager on duty called back when we requested the front desk. Really worst experience from such a hotel.

Room was full of mosquitoes. There were at least 50 mosquitoes in room at any time. The moment you open the door, the next batch of mosquitoes was ready to enter room!

We felt sick due to continuous "Hit" spray. 
Horrible experience!!!!

We stayed in a Royal Villa for four nights. Very fancy and not a cheap option for a family of 2 adults and 3 small children under 5. The room was fantastic. The butler was truly great at his job and we lacked for nothing. Our little private pool kept the children happy for hours. The whole hotel looks special and is a grand place to holiday.

This was spoiled by a feeling of being gouged. Everything cost extra. A bottle of water with breakfast. 1900 rupees for 3 disappointing sandwiches for the children on departure. Internet connectivity. The bad taste started at the beach restaurant where the fish we were served tasted 'mothy' at best. We were asked by a number of the staff whether we were enjoying our food. "No" was the measured answer. Nothing happened. Even after speaking to the baby-faced manager. The simple beach bar next door served perfect fresh fish for a fraction of the price.

I won't remember this holiday with especially fond memories.

Had grouped to celebrate my sisters and brother-in-laws 10th anniversary, and everything went wrong. Food was disgraceful (burnt rice was served, bland soup, melted ice-cream served). Even after speaking to the manager on duty couple of time and having 3 times listen to meaningless apologies and promises there was not an iota of improvement rather as the evening progressed it rather deteriorated. 
I even left my e-mail and mobile number for the senior management to reach me, but till date the have disappointed me. For the management not to have an excuse how to reach me, please find my e-mail address to you can discuss this further.

ss.kainda@yahoo.co.uk

This hotel is not 5 * and it certainly is not a Kempinski. I have stayed at other Leela hotels and other Kempinski brands, and this by far is the worse. 
Food quality was poor, service was over the top, staff were arrogant and not very helpful. Hotel is very far from the main the capital city of Goa. Spa is very small, the treatment rooms are cramped. Considering the hotel is on 75 acres, the pool is so small, i've seen bigger pools in peoples back yards.Room service food was always cold. You know something is wrong when you have asked for tea three times, and each time it arrives it is stone cold! Had diahorrea after eating in their indian restaurant. Waited 15 to 20 minutes on most mornings for a table at breakfast as breakfast area is small and congested. There is no adult bar area to relax in the evenings,
GO STAY AT THE TAJ EXOTICA INSTEAD...!!!

Thisn hotel is completely over hyped. We stayed there for a long and were completely underwhelmed.


Check in- We were checked into a room beside building work. I asked to move rooms and was treated as if I was asking for something ridiculous. One hour later we got a new room

- The room was in need of decoration, but was a good size and had a nice setting - no complaints there

Food- over priced and not good. Went to the Italian restaurant 
(several power cuts during meal) The cheapest bottle of imported wine
was over $200. The food - straight out of a Pizza Hut buffet.

Pool side bar- ordered drinks and had the usual appalling level of service that is so usual in India. I am not exaggerating, it took 45 minujtes to get the correct bill for the drinks.

Room service- dont bother - a few limp chips and an overcooked burger
$30.

$1200 for a three night stay- money down the drain. Definitely not worth the one hour drive from the airport

Liked  The room was pleasant
Disliked  Very poor service- more training needed

the worst thing that happened in this 5 star hotel, Is that someone stole in our room. the staff didn't excuse with us nor felt ashamed for what happened. the only thing they did was make us belive it was a mistery! incredibile!
the worst treatment ever recieved in a hotel that wants to be a luxiours hotel but isn't. rooms nice but dirty, a lot of dust . bas experience.


Liked  nothing
Disliked  how the staff behaved with us

Went to Goa for the first time & heard great reviews about the The Leela. Booked 2 rooms. As a property the Leela is amazing. Now thats the only good thing I can say about this hotel. The service, is terrible & the all inclusive meal is below standard.

Went to the private beach as they term it left my sandals under my parasol. Was away for 1/2 hr & on my return found my sandals were missing. The strange thing is that there is a security person overlooking the beach area. When I questioned him about the loss he was cluless. I reported my loss to the Hotel management who frankly didnt care a damn. 

The next evening went to the coffe shop at 11pm & asked to be served an ice cream & was told by the staff to go to the competitors hotel across the street. Very strange!

They operate a buggy system around the hotel suggest you dont call them becuase they never turn up. Its easier to walk.

Strongly suggest not to visit this hotel stay anywhere in Goa but the Leela

I booked a sea facing view room for my family this Valentine's Day and it was worth every penny..The property offers a breathtaking view of the pristine blue beaches of Goa..The rooms and the services are top notch and the personalized care is par excellence..A must for a Goan trip..

One of the Best Property, well maintained.. Great ambience, food, amenities and specially the services. It was not our first trip to Goa but this one is the most amazing. The difference is our stay at Taj fort Aguada.. Staff is friendly and helpful. Superb hospitality... Beautiful ground floor sea view room with sit out.. Breakfast is fantastic, such choice and the smiling, pleasant staff are only too happy to get you anything you need, rare to see in other hotels, The spa is serene and simply delightful.
Was thinking for any faults or anything less at Hotel, but could not find any..

stayed there in villa with private sit-out, situated over the small hill...excellent view from room and ample space in garden for kids to play...beach is just near to the property where all water sport activities are available..during weekend specially on Sunday restaurant is crowdy and you have to wait for table so you can better start early for breakfast...food quality is good but they have less options as compared to Taj exotica...as property is spread over the hill , you have less activities like cycling etc for kids.. even they dont have separate pool for kids..so if you are staying with kids may be Taj exotica is better option...overall great stay..

We went to this place to celebrate my Wife's birthday. It was a great time with the family at Aguada. Great food and sea facing bar is the highlight. We were spending most of the time looking at the sea and chilling out. We were planning to roam around Goa, but finally ended up spending three full days in the hotel and the surrounding places :-)

I had stayed there only for a day but had an amazing experience. The staff was very friendly and courteous and they made our stay memorable. We would surely visit again and stay for a longer duration.

I was there last year during July last week to celebrate our anniversary. The place is simply awesome, and they took extra care to prepare food for our 1.5 year kid. Although rain spoiled our stay (we could not go out much), the resource was awesome. would like to visit second time in a better season.

We went with our 6 month old kid and it was a complete joy ride...did not even once felt like moving out of the property.
Very very relaxing and homely experience ...villas are a great stay !!!! Highly recommended!!

It was a special trip for my husband and me and we were unsure how it would turn out. Taj properties are usually pretty, well maintained and staff is hospitable however, in this trip the staff did everything possible to delight us every single day. It was my birthday and surprises were planned with my husband throughout! The food is fantastic especially the Goan Thali (Chef Pandey). I would highly recommend this place and specially thank Jessly who went out of her way to make the stay memorable. Thank you.

Went on trip with family and friends, after staying in holiday village a year before i was missing the quiet of Taj-Fort Aguada (was there in 2011). This place is one of the best property of Taj and view from cottages is mesmerizing. SFX lounge was the best part in last visit as we happened to spend a considerable amount of time lazying and drunk on awesome cocktails they come up with. Very friendly staff and great place to bring kids along.

Taj Hospitality does not leave a chance for complaint.! Absolute cozy. Food, stay and service too good. My daughter, wife and I enjoyed it a lot. I took a Villa facing the sea face. The view was not that great, enjoyed the privacy. Great Stay.

very comfortable stay. away from the touristy crowd. We spent most of our time by the pool drinking and chilling and head out to the beach during the day. This hotel is a good for couples and families who want to relax and be away from the crowded.

We had a wonderful stay at Vivanta by Taj Fort Aguada. It is a fantastic location to stay in North Goa. View from lobby was awesome. The best part about my stay was the service. They were friendly and efficient. Pool was good, however I found Pool at Holiday Village better. But best part is one can use both properties irrespective of stay hotel. Sinquerim Beach was serene.

Really a very memorable stay at the Taj and would like to visit again

We visited Goa in December, this is a fantastic location for anyone who really wants to relax and have fun. The hotel is amazing, the restaurants in the Vivanta are incredible with an Italian food offering which is simply delicious. Vincent is the manager and he is truly a brilliant host as well as someone who genuinely cares about the experience. We met the chefs and the kindness shown by the team who work in the hotel is beyond gracious- they want you to have a great holiday and will try to make this happen. 
The restaurants-Latitude, the Banyan Tree- yes Thai in Goa and brilliant! and my favorite Il Camino. The bar in the hotel is also worth several trips when you go enjoy the sunset with my friend Ravi- the manager and Akshay who work there- they are so friendly and simply great at making you feel at home

If you like seafood visit Morisco- they have the best range and their Chefs are fabulous as well as hospitable

Taj like always made us feel very special. The accommodation was excellent.The first thing that struck me was the refreshing ,restful perfume in the room. I wanted to ask them what it was but forgot.One felt refreshed straight away.The location is excellent...the spa was wonderful and I enjoyed the yoga .The instructor was very patient and gentle.The food was excellent. Will return definitely.

I am so glad we picked the Taj for our stay in Goa. The fact that there were so many other families with young children was a good sign. That said there's a nice mix of guests from honeymooners to retired Europeans on vacation. 
Pros: you don't have to leave the property if you really don't want to. There is a great selection in their breakfast buffet. Right after breakfast my kids would head over to the activity center or pool that's adjacent to the restaurant and spend the whole morning there. The hotel provides pool toys and sand buckets for kids. The children's activity center is clean and you have to take off your shoes to enter. It has board games, puzzles, toys, stuffed animals, carom board, pool table and air hockey table. They offer hair braiding, henna and temporary tattoos as well as book mark decorating etc. I was excited to see that they had a small library with adult and children's books but found that the library was mainly filled with non-English European books. Probably filled with books left by previous guests. 
The access to the beach is guarded and you can grab some hotel towels at the entrance and leave your shoes up there before going down. It's a very clean beach and they make an effort to sweep up any trash first thing in the morning that got swept up with the high tide. There are 2 restaurants on the beach and I highly recommend the Fish Shack, especially the Goan fried masala fish and spicy garlic prawns. The daal tarka was also a hit. They offer pasta and fries for kids too. One bonus about this place: its floor is basically the sand on the beach so the kids can play with buckets provided by the restaurant and stay busy right next to your table while you eat, in the shade. We loved the food so much that we went there for lunch and dinner on the same day. 
Water activities can also be scheduled at the beach itself. 
There are benches and day beds on the hotel property overlooking the beach. Go there in the evenings and take in the sunset while enjoying the cool breeze. I'd order tea and relax out there. 
The hotel grounds are well kept and it was nice being able to let the kids run around freely around the coconut trees to burn off some energy. Staff are all helpful and friendly with kids.
On one of the days I took my mother in law and mom and headed to the 7sea's spa across the Taj entrance and we enjoyed massages there. 
There are some souvenir shops and restaurants along the street. We ran out of diapers and I was able to buy some at a chemist about a 5 minute walk away. The souvenir shops were ok, but if you need extra t shorts or flip flops/ swim
suits then they are available. 
Con: don't stay in the block of the hotel with room 1017. It's next to a private residence with multiple dogs and I was woken up by incessant barking in the morning. Not good when you're trying to sleep in on your vacation. They didn't have any coils or plug-ins for mosquitoes in the rooms so make sure you carry repellent as there are mosquitos. My in laws had a cottage and the rest of the party stayed in rooms on the 2nd floor. I recommend the cottages because of the verandah and garden space you have. The gardens also have hammocks. 
Wi-fi sucks and would get disconnected constantly but if you're on vacation maybe you should be off-line anyways. Just made it hard to stream videos for the kids on the phone when we needed to keep them busy. 
We stayed for 3 nights and then took the free shuttle provided by the hotel back to the airport. Very convenient.

Loved our holiday here, beautiful hotel and rooms (lots of rooms don't have a balcony) and the best view in the area. All rooms have a beautiful sea view and the hotel is right on the beach. Great service and lovely breakfast with a good selection of Indian and European food. At the quiet end of the beach, which means you have a short walk to bars and restaurants but plenty of taxis outside the hotel. Would love to return!

Great views near sea I had a great time this place is totally amazing and the weather was killing I just loved the place and people of goa I will defiantly cone again and again whenever I'll be free my wife will be very happy to explore goa

Our first stay, and just wished we had stayed before,lives up to its 5 star rating, sea view room , very good , garden and pool areas, excellent, well kept, very high standards, some good touches,fruit in the rooms, flowers, and provided cold bottles water,by the pool,breakfast superb buffet style, all the staff from cleaners,pool lads,reception, very efficient, only negative was our room had an adjoining door ,which you could hear everything going on ,to the next room, not happy about that otherwise fantastic stay

Our first visit to Goa and to the Vivanta by Taj hotel. We arrived before 8am after a long flight, on my birthday. We received a very friendly welcome at reception. Our room was ready, and held a huge surprise of balloons, cake, fruit and wine. Our room was on the ground floor with a fabulous sea view. We were rather disappointed that our picture window didn't open but considering the mosquito situation, maybe not a bad thing. The air con is very efficient, sometimes too cold, but easily adjusted. The bed was huge with two types of pillows and a light weight quilt. The room held two easy chairs, great for enjoying the view, cool tiled floors, a generous sized fridge, and excellent easy to use safe. The bathroom was quite dated, but had a great over the bath shower, which seemed quite new, but maybe some upgrading in the bathrooms is needed. Plenty of toiletries available and lots of good towels, robes and slippers. The hotel has a fabulous reception area with elegant sofas and chairs and large open aspect for admiring the scenery. Our room was kept immaculately by our room boy and our bed turned down in the evening. The dining room is spacious with lots of comfortable seating, also outdoor seating which is rather limited, but not a hardship to eat inside. The breakfasts were incredible with an amazing choice of delicious foods. We only dined in on one occasion in the evening as there are so many amazing restaurants outside of the hotel, but the hotel stage dining experience evenings a couple of times a week which look quite spectacular but are quite expensive. The pool and surrounding areas are very good, maybe the crazy paving could be tidied up, as the sun loungers stir up the soil underneath which is not so good when emerging from the pool with wet feet. Plenty of sun loungers and also large canopy beds are available. The beach is accessible down a few steps, but due to tight security you will have to be let in and out of a locked gate. The pool guys are so friendly and obliging, and will always make your favourite beds available when possible. Christmas decorations here weren't rolled out until about 10 days before Christmas, and even then it gradually appeared and was tasteful, and elegant. Perhaps the Christmas music was rather too loud at times but so much nicer than the UK ear bashing from Sept thro to Dec 25th!! We were invited to the Christmas Eve gala at the venue above the hotel, which was a fabulous and indulgent evening involving the most delicious food, wine, music and company. The venue was decorated so dramatically it really took your breath away, from the table decor to the stunning draped swags to the fantastic stage. The food choice was endless, and the serving dishes (manned by numerous chefs) held all manor of world cuisine. The desserts were out of this world and a feast for the eyes. The head chef has an amazing team, who obviously excel at a very high level of catering. We spent the the best evening anywhere we've had in a long time. The dining room waiters were on hand for your every whim and they all work (and worked on the evening) so hard. Most of these guys would've been on shift from 6am until well after midnight and up again for breakfast the next morning, still with their warm smiles and friendly persona. I really can't speak highly enough about them. I could enthuse about this hotel for ever and a day, it really is a marvellous place for a holiday. A note to Ravi (general manager), to extend an enormous thankyou for our fabulous stay during and over the Christmas period. My husband and I can't applaud you enough for the way your hotel is operated. Your whole team, extending down from, managerial to waiting staff, to, catering to pool staff to cleaners, gardeners, maintenance are all outstanding, you should be extremely proud. Our two breakfast waiters, Jiben and Rajender were so very professional and nothing was ever too much trouble, please extend our sincere thanks. Our first trip to the Vivanta Fort Aguada but it won't be out last.

This place is magic.
Great Ambiance.
Decent Meal. Did not burn a hole in our pocket(we were cautious of what we ordered as we don't waste food)
Highlight: the lounge has a beautiful view of the sea. i would just not feel like getting away.
The washroom at the restaurant has a shower to wash off sand if you directly come from the beach.
The service was TAJ standard. Live music was in English. Goan or Hindi would have felt better.
Do visit once for the experience of it. 
We tried: mushroon xacuti. Soup and roti. 5/5
we got papad complimentary. I like free stuff, so enjoyed it :)

We had amazing experience with ambiance, food, amenities and specially the services. We went with our baby, and we're very impressed with hospitality of Miss Minky Sherpa, who gave us one of the amazing stay time in the hotel.
Definitely recommended.

I visited this place with my husband and a couple of friends and I must say that it was a lovely experience. First of all, the location of the hotel is just ideal. The first two evenings we thought of going out to check out popular places around town to see the sundown, but we realised that this very hotel has one of the best sundown lounges in the city. The evening we spent at SFX lounge and bar will go down in memory as one of the best evenings we spent on the vacation. 

Another amazing thing about the hotel is its food. Whether it was indian or continental, the food can be described in one word - phenomenal. At the Italian restaurant at the hotel, the moment you bite into a pizza, you will be transported to a piazza in Rome or Florence. 

And last but not the least, the service and the staff of the hotel! They were not only responsive and co-operative but also proactive. Special mention to Minky who went the extra mile to make our baby moon all the more special. 

All in all, thank you Taj Vivanta for making our vacation unforgettable! We look forward to coming back soon. 

- Urvi and Malav Desai

It was not m first trip to Goa but this one is the most amazing. The diiference is my stay at Taj fort Aguada. Simply stunning location and view. Rooms are not that great as its an old property but yes well maintained. Staff is friendly and helpful and this you expects from Taj. Wonderful hospitality. Front office manager Dirgha is really helpful lady. I was provided an upgared as requested. Although I too has upgared voucher with me. Food is delicious. Huge property hence deserves a day to be spent in the resort itself.

Words can't describe the experience.Surprisingly everything you need or wished on a holiday is available.Absolutely zero faults.

1.Hospitality - You can never see the whole staff in any hotel consistently reaching the high level of customer satisfaction as you do in Taj Aguada.It's because they have a great leader and example in Mr Ravi,General Manager

2.Breathtaking location and views


3.Fab food in the latitude restaurant

4.Plenty of great shacks on the beach to spend time with your loved ones

5.Very clean and spacious luxurious cottages with home theatre speakers in the room and DVD collections

6.Wi-Fi is an issue for people who do not have data in mobiles.But as Mr Obama said,wifi is even very bad in the White House.

After a stressful journey (thanks Thomas Cook!!) we arrived to the stunning setting and delightful service provided by the Taj. The hotel was better than we had anticipated or than the photos show.

Beautiful ground floor sea view room with sit out, only minor comment would be the bathroom was a little 'tired' but I believe these are in the process of being refurbished. The hotel was truly delightful and the perfect oasis from the hubbub of the local surroundings. 

Breakfast is fantastic, such choice and the smiling, pleasant staff are only too happy to get you anything you need.

In fact all of the staff were delightful but special mentions for Jessyl who made us feel like we were the most important guests in the hotel, and who helped my birthday particularly special and Sanjeev at the pool.

I took advantage of a couple of treatments at the spa - a scrub and wrap to start the holiday and a facial at the end to relax me for the trip home. The spa is serene and simply delightful.

Couldn't fault the Taj, this was our first time but we will certainly be returning.

Visited the Taj Aguada property on Jan 21st 2017 and was staying in room number 222. 

Typically Taj, the rooms were spotless and clean. Gorgeous view from the window of the rear side of the property and the beach. A sure place to visit for those who want a quick recharge from the chaotic city life. 

Room service is a bit slow. But the food is super. Worth the wait! 

I'd happy recommend this property to friends and loved ones to visit.

"Thank you for such Tranquility and Rejuvenation! What a Vibe and Time we had. The moment we landed Goa, you made sure the Chauffeur was waiting for us. A lovely time spent here. Kudos to the entire Team.??

A well maintained property by Taj offering amazing sea view rooms and beautifully landscaped gardens. The rooms are spacious plus you get a small private patio with sea view rooms. A rampart from the hotel runs straight into the sea and one can spend evenings soaking up the sun and the sea. Food and service are equally good with big buffet spread. A costly but romantic place for couples.The only problem was the terrible wifi connectivity.

Just go sit back relax..enjoy..after all it's Taj hospitality..way to go guys..amazing property..amazing location..just the best you can say..we truly loved the view from the top..the food is amazing..and the four nights..that we spent are unforgettable..thanks again..keep going guys..!!

Great hotel on the fantastic Candolim Beach - the ramparts form part of the hotel. The Sea view rooms have a small patio which lead into the hotel's gardens - the rooms are very well appointed with a very large bed, 2 armchairs, desk etc. The bathrooms are a bit tired but...!! The wifi can be a little tricky as well - keeps knocking you off the signal, so you have to re-log in.

Its a great place and I would definitely stay here again - expensive but worth it

pros

excellent food
housekeeping
room service
clean
more for office conference
nothing much to walk around
nothing much kids can do except pool


cons 

no beach a bummer!
expensive spa next door. 
nothing much to complain its Goa you just relax and sip a chilled beer !!!!

Staff at this hotel made the stay even more enjoyable with there efficient polite friendly service . Even assisted us with taking our little 9 month old baby boy to the main Children's hospital a hour away for a check up . The location is wonderful with a fantastic sunset and the local village a short walking distance away. 
The facilitts at the hotel very well worth booking. Mainly only eat breakfast at the hotel which was 5 star and dinned out on a evening . Well done to the whole team at the hotel great place .

Visited this hotel in 2011. The service is exeptional. And the view of the ramparts of the old fort from the rooms are fascinating.
