Buffets are sumptuous and the staff will go out of their way to be helpful. Although you have beach access, the beach is not a private beach. The speciality restaurant Morisco serves fantastic sea food. Good value for money

Great experience with family
Great view and delicious food
One of the best hotels in north goa
Next to beach and in fort aguada
Its rooms were very spacious and luxury cottages were the best
Overall an awesome experience

I stayed in dis hotel with my wife... Amazing hotel.. Amazing view.. Great view from the hotel.. One of the best place to stay in candolim.. Best part of the hotel is courtesy of their staff.. Always wearing a smile.. Make u feel special all d tym.. Hope to visit d place sooner

I stayed in Dec 2016 for one night, property is vey big and nicely built. Rooms are big with all facilities and comfort. Food is excellent as in all taj properties. Don't have private beach but one can go to beach of adjacent another taj property.

I'm a big fan of Taj service, and I've become a bigger fan after staying at this place. They are best in the class and you almost feel pampered after staying at Taj. 

It's a beautiful property, with all the rooms facing the sea. They have old and the new rooms, however I would suggest that you stay at the old wing as its closer to the sea so offers better view. I need not mention that the amenities are best in class and smallest of the things are taken care of in the room and hotel. 

I also loved the coffee shop as it overlooks the sea - so enjoy your breakfast or lunch with a nice sea view. 

All in all a must stay if you are looking for a luxurious stay in Goa.

One of the best properties. Very beautiful very clean. On the beach. Immaculate views. Nothing that I can say was not up to the mark. You can just say wowwwww.
Customer service awesome...
Shuttle Awesome 
Food Awesome.
Updated rooms
Go for it....

Stayed for 2 days at this amazingly beautiful property of the Taj Group.The location is just next to the beach with very spacious rooms,the food at the hotel is top class and so is the service.Would like to make a special mention of Ms Minky at the front desk who was ever so helpful with a beautiful smile that made us feel at home all the time.For a relaxed holiday in Goa this a place to be in.

The Taj is perfectly located with beautiful panoramic views over Sinquerim beach.

The food was tasty & flavourful. Staff were attentive but not overbearing. Price reasonable in relation to the whole 'experience'.

Highly recommended

What a lovely hotel with fabulous service. The pool men are friendly and helpful. There is always a sunbed available but it is a stones throw from the beach. Breakfasts are huge and have everything on offer. Food is divine but some is expensive compared to eating out.
The staff go out their way to help you in every way which is great.

I stayed in the month of December. The initial view when you come in is absolutely stunning. From the service to the pool area, to the bar facing the sea this is a place worth paying for. The beach is easily accessible and the hotel is centrally located. The breakfast buffet is really good with a lot of selections. A lot of good restaurants near by also like fishermans wharf.

We arrived earlier and were able to accommodate two hours earlier than the official checkin time.

The staff was always responsive and pleasant.

We had breakfast included and it was awesome, both vegetarian and non-vegeterian foods, fresh juices, authentic Indian food (yet it is often very spicy but we get apt to it and then loved it more than non-spicy).

We had a room with sea view and were delighted every morning when we watched out of the window.

We absolutely love this property and have made a habit of visiting them during the Christmas break each year. As it is a pet friendly resort we brought our Labrador along with us. We also participated in the rock climbing organised by the hotel and loved it. We will be back for sure.

One of the best hotels in North Goa. The Taj hospitality is always excellent. Good beach attached to it - although it was crowded this time of the year. The location of the hotel is next to the good restaurants of North Goa. Everything is in 30 minutes radius. The traffic in north Goa was quite a bit due to the holiday season.

the property is amazingly located on the beach and just in front of the fort. You have a direct access to the beach as well as the fort. ample greenery fantastic rooms and awesome food.
a big thumbs up !!!!
highly recommended

This was long overdue. I had a pleasure of staying at Taj Aquaford in Month of Oct with family. From the moment we walked through the doors we were charmed and thrilled! The Hotel location is outstanding and could not be beaten. Our first room wasn't best suited for our needs. Management was notified and Mr Nischal and His colleague Dirgha immediately fixed the problem. We were moved to another room and in fact upgraded with no expense to us. This immediately made our trip a pleasant one. Driver Mohan, was excellent in helping with directions and even took time to find schedules for us and have them ready for the next day. He took additional pain of cleaning our car each day and did not accept tips even when we offered. We returned as a Huge Fan of Mr Nischal and Team's Hospitality and Aquaford is definitely our default destination now whenever we return to Goa next. We will highly recommend Taj Aquaford to any of our friends and family who wish to travel to Goa.

Have stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate my marriage anniversary and it turned out to be a great experience. Every thing is so perfect about this property- location, rooms, food , staff, services, hospitality... everything is TOP CLASS! Would highly recommend travellers visiting Goa to try this property! This place is perfect for for any occasion! I will definitely come back soon ... Keep up the good work team Taj - Fort Aguada. Cheers!!

I would like to thank the general manager Mr. Nischal and Mandira for the amazing hospitality provided to us during our stay. Everything was looked after and surely made the holiday a memory to live for. The cottages were brilliant, excellent breakfast and the other food we had. Strongly recommend this property to anyone who plans to visit goa. Dont think twice and just go for it. The best in goa for sure

Taj resort at Fort Aguada are true to its brand with 5 star guest care and attention to minutest details. I had requested room decoration & cake for anniversary celebrations which was done perfectly. Although, location is excellent, the rooms are bit dated here. You can also visit Taj Holiday village for breakfast and pool.
Lighting in room is really low.
Only thing which I disliked was they have airport transfers by bus. No transfers for railway station.
Enjoyed variety at breakfast buffet, evening folk dance, live music
Ambience- great
Food- great
Rooms-OK
Location - excellent

The check in was quick, staff were polite. The hotels location is the best part, its just besides Fort Aguada and beautiful. one can walk down to the beach from there private gate. Room was spacious enough, and well decorated with attractive paintings. We had buffet lunch in one of there restaurants, with was really good.

This was my 3rd stay at this property in the last two years. And as always it was a fantastic one.

We stayed in their villa rooms which were spacious, cosy and with an elegant old world charm.

We tried all their restaurants and food was delicious.

Kids were taken care and given extra attention by all the staff.

Hat's off to the Taj Way of Hospitality..!

I stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights at the end of June. 

It's a great place to be during the monsoon. Wild torrential rain and great views over the ocean. 

I stayed in a cheaper room - about $250/night plus taxes. The rooms and facilities are ok. But the staff are excellent and go out of their way to offer great friendly service. I hope they get good bonuses. 

Goa itself has a mystique in the West it probably doesn't deserve any more. I feel sorry for the people - it looks like their politicians and developers are failing them badly. 

Lots of bad cheap development along the coast and inland and environmental destruction is becoming total. Garbage everywhere. I wouldn't swim in the water at the beaches. It all looked very polluted. 

In this mess the hotel offers a clean and comfortable oasis. I'd recommend it.

Comfortable stay with some amazing views. The best feature of the hotel are the views & the Spa. Jiva has some of the best spa treatments and masseuse . Open only to the I house guests ( I believe) , it's the perfect way to begin a day or end a day! 
Recommended .

We booked sea facing room which they upgraded to sea facing with sit out which we really liked it. Although room size was very compact but the best part was sit out area from where we can direct access to lawn and can enjoy the sea view. 
Check-in & Check-out was very smooth and the staff was very courteous and always welcomed us. 
We were very much satisfied with room dining services, very tasty food. Even the breakfast spread in Latitude restaurant was very nice. 
They have free shuttle to airport at different times during day which is very good and one can opt the services according to their flight time. 
Hotel is having various location where one can enjoy beautiful view of Sinquerium beach also having direct access to Fort Aguada.
The thing which I don,t like so much was room size. 
If you are looking for relaxing holiday and want to spend time in lap of nature then this is ideal place as sound of waves, greenery and cool wind can catch anyone attention.
Really want to go in near future.

This hotel is the best place in Goa to stay and unwind yourselves, the hammocks just outside the rooms have great view of the sea & with light breeze is the best place in the whole property to spend time with your better half. 

Pros:
a) The location of the hotel is awesome.
b) The rooms have the best view of the ocean (Rooms in above floors have better view of ocean than the one`s I stayed in (see photos), but the ground floor rooms have direct access to the hammocks anytime, without having to go too much far from your rooms)
c) The pool though small is good.
d) You are greeted with warm smiles from the staff all the time.

Cons:
a) The bath tub is very small and easily overflows when u just want to soak in warm water with your better half.
b) The hair dryer was overheating and wasn`t working properly (so pls carry your hair dryers)
c) They generally prepare very bland food, so if you want anything spicy, please please inform them in advance.

e did an extended family vist this time - parents, brother's family and us. It is a great property right on the sea. It was monsoon time, so the sight and sound of waves lashing on the walls of Fort Aguada was truly mesmerising. There were 3 children, and our elderly parents, in the group and the staff made sure that everyone felt comfy. The property is in North Goa, where all the action is, so one has the option of staying put in the property or venturing to some great eateries nearby. The only letdown was misleading package - we had booked 2 rooms with sit-outs and one without, hoping to enjoy the monsoons from the comfort of the room. However, the sit-outs dont have a roof, so that was quite a waste - unlike Taj Exotica. What was worse, the room without sit-out had the best view since that was on first-floor. We felt cheated since we had paid extra for rooms that were actually worse. We gave this feedback to the staff but have not seen any corrective action till date.

This a beautiful property with sprawling area. The hotel is beautifully located on the beach front with access to the beach. Environmentally it is beautiful. Lots of greenery and well landscaped. They have a variety of rooms from independent villas to normal rooms. The independent villas are a treat and you can spoil yourself by staying in one such villa. The hotel service is good and the staff is very friendly, courteous and very helpful. They would go out of their way to help and assist. The hotel has a beautiful Spa and the restaurants are good. The food served is nice and tasteful. You can enjoy a good breakfast in the coffee shop. Wifi is free and you can enjoy the internet without having to pay anything. There is nice swimming pool and bar. Overall we had a very good experience and we really enjoyed ourselves. It is up to you how you look at it. Go and stay there and try it for yourself.

Our choice of this property was based on a recommendation from friends. We traveled with 2 kids and chose an option that provided 3 meals during the day. The location was fabulous as was the view from a seaside-view room. The lawns were manicured and the greenery was spectacular during the rains. The food was excellent, including the places that served buffets. We had two-way airport drop. Although we traveled in a shared shuttle, the ride was smooth and comfortable. The hotel also provides a very efficient shuttle service to and from the Taj Holiday Village. Otherwise, it is a 15-minute walk from one hotel to the other. Thanks to Vincent, Sudipto, Ranjeet, Hemraj, staff at the Banyan Tree, El Camino, Beach House, staff at Giggles who made the experience special through their kind gestures. However the service at Caravela was a bit disappointing due to seemingly uncaring attention during breakfast and lunch hours a few times. We had to ask several times to be served the bread (while it had already been prepared and was in waiting near the oven), tea/coffee servings, etc. There were a couple of things that need some improvement. Firstly, the infrastructure seems to be lacking care at a few places. Some parts of the wall in our room showed signs of dampness, there was a faint smell of cigarette smoke in the bathroom during certain times of the day, the bathroom had a slight crack in the sink and a portion of the plaster from the toilet cover was chipped off. Overall, the bathroom seems to be old (perhaps due to the stained fittings) and could do with a face-lift. Given the size of the hotel, the pool is quite small. If 12-15 people get in at the same time, there will be limited space to move about freely. One thing that the hotel can do to improve attractiveness for kids and adults alike is to introduce a "lazy river".

I have visited Vivanta by Taj 2 times.First in June 2015 and 2nd in June 2016.
This place has been improved. Management takes each single complaint seriously and this is the thing which I really appreciate.

No one is perfect but desire to maintain the class is what matters at last.
I really admire their breakfast and service. No need to visit any where . Just book a sea side room and get up early in morning to have a walk near fort .

After 5.30 PM just try to go out gate of Taj at left corner. Sit calmly and enjoy natural music of Sea. This is one of the most beautiful place I keep in my mind.

Ofcourse , will see you soon :)

This resort is indeed the most luxurious in all of Goa. Set on a cliff near Sinquerim Beach, it is everything like the perfect holiday. Book this in advance as the availability might be tight. Full value for money I would say.

I was planning a last minute surprise birthday dinner for my girlfriend in September, and i didn't know where to take her, so I decided to take her to Taj since she's never been there(and also cause she loves Italian and Taj has an Italian restaurant named, "Il Camino" ...Since I've worked there before and been to the property a few times later, it seemed like the ideal place that I could take my girlfriend to.

I called up the hotel, the same evening on her bday, and asked if I needed to reserve a table at Il Camino, but they said that the restaurant was closed for a private dinner. Damn was I disappointed! But, nevertheless, the restaurant staff said that he could reserve a table for me in their other restaurant, "Latitude". So I asked him if they could serve anything Italian and also make some bday arrangements, and he kindly replied that it was too late for any arrangements, but he would do his best to see what he could offer me. 

Later when we reached the hotel, the security staff greeted us warmly and we headed to the restaurant. We reached the restaurant pretty late and all the in-house guests were almost done with their dinner. There was a one-man-band guy singing amazing songs which lifted the ambience. We were offered a table and the menus were given to us(there was no bday arrangements made)...and I couldn't find much choice for Italian either, ... So we ordered what we thought would be nice... When the dishes came and we tasted em, boy were we pleased.... The pasta that my girlfriend ordered was amazingly delicious and she loved it. The restaurant staff were very helpful and kept asking us if they could get us anything else and even agreed to take a few pictures for us. After we were done, they even served us complimentary desserts! (Who doesn't love complimentary stuff ) and then out of nowhere came a small chocolate cake with "happy birthday" written on the plate! That was truly the highlight of the night and it made the dinner so very special for my girlfriend!

I thank the restaurant staff for being so courteous and making last minute arrangements, (even though I would've wished for more Italian and other bday arrangements ) this dinner, truly won't be forgotten by me and especially by my girlfriend.

The service was excellent. Every request was addressed efficiently. We were pleasantly surprised with balloons in the room when we returned from the beach. Rom service was always very prompt and they kept us informed if there was any confusion. Shuttle drivers were very polite and accommodating. The gate security was also very helpful. They cleaned our car without being asked.
Property is very well maintained. I could sense the attention to deal all around. We walked around and could see a number of new villas being added.
There is enough to do in and around the property for a long weekend type of visit. The beach is right outside and you can get to a quiet spot with a short walk. So we didn't try to do any additional beaches. 
There is a nice live music place called cohiba which you can go for using the complementary shuttle. Book in advance to get a good spot.
There is renovation underway in the lobby area. So the construction noise does carry over to the pool area. They did tell us about it before we arrived though i don't remember seeing it on the website at the time of booking. But it was no big deal. It is expected to be over next month November 2016.
Highly recommended getaway!

Many beach resorts in Goa but not all have beach view from the window of your room. Truly amazing experience to wake up to the sound of waves n amazing view of sunset right from your balcony. The property is quite old but still has its charm very much intact and as usual hospitality at its best as usual. Food variety and quality was best. 

I am giving a 4/5 only because I felt the bathrooms were too small(and old) and we were in a allure suite and with 2 kids it wasn't very comfortable.

We stayed in this resort for 3N/4D and had a good experience which would had been a little more pleasant if the hotel staff would had a gone a step ahead.

This is a huge property on Fort Aguada and is sea facing. Mostly the rooms are all sea facing. The beach is easily accessible through a special gate they have put near pool area.

We had booked Superior Charm room with breakfast and the room was on the ground floor with a back door opening to lawn area and facing sea. The pool area as well as beach could be easily seen from the room. 

Superior Charm room was beautifully done with a king size bed, two chairs and a small coffee table. The size of the room is average and not very big. Washroom was clean and nice but didn't had a bath tub.

Room service we experienced was prompt and the staff was also very polite and nice.

They also had DVD player with a list of Hindi and English movies which can be ordered free of cost.

We really liked the service for baby food which was very quick. The food was also as per baby liking. The chef's are very nice and consider the need of guests
Special thanks to Chef Ghanshyam.
They charged us only once for the baby food.

As far as food was concerned we had our dinner at Latitude where the cost was approximately 1800 with taxes and had a reasonable spread
The best part was the live music was there. There were other two restaurants with Goan good speciality and Italian restaurant. 

We liked their facility where in we were allowed to go to Taj holiday village and enjoy our meals. Even that property is one of its kinds. The shuttle facility is available all the time.

We also got many cabs available just outside resort which took us around the beaches.

Overall it's a beautiful resort as the view is breathtaking. The staff is courteous.Check in and check out was smooth.

The only thing we did not like was while we checked in the front desk staff was were cold and since we had a booking from Goibibo, that was something that bothered them.

I have always been a religiously staying at Taj Village everytime i am in Goa. This time, it being a last minute plan, we chose Taj Aguada. I must say the villas are nice and spacious. The bathrooms were clean. Although there was some dust on the antique wall hanging with glass jewels. Post renovation, the place looks really better. Although they can do something about the noise from utility plant right next to Villa 427. We asked them to shift and they promptly did which was helpful.
We ordered Peri peri Fish and Rachedo Fish, lets say they were not the best in Goa, hence they can do better (Fisherman's Cove is better for food). The staff were v helpful. The buffet spread was decent. 
The airport pick and drop is very convenient.

A solid place to stay with very good service and restaurants. The views are spectacular but it's a very busy location with lots of tourists walking around right outside the property. The public beach beside the hotel was extremely congested and dirty. Granted, we did go during a long weekend. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the sea which was really nice but the interior was starting to feel dated.

The staff at the hotel were fantastic and we had a very nice welcome to the hotel. The sea view room that we had was lovely, and the pool area was well laid out. It didn't quite reach the full 5 marks because some elements of the hotel seemed a little worn and in need of an update. I appreciate we visited during the building work so perhaps once it is complete it'll be perfect. 
Well worth a visit if you are in the area for a longer stay.

Lovely view of Fort Aguada remains, can walk straight to the famed structure through a private gate open only for residents. 
Excellent breakfast and also a choice to have breakfast at the nearby Taj Holiday Village. That gives a lot of variety....2 restaurants with totally different themes. Good activities for kids too. 
Was there in July and there isn't much one can do in Goa when it rains. So remain indoors and enjoy what the Taj has to offer!

I checked in to this hotel in the month of January with my friends, I booked three months prior so, I striked a better deal, the hotel is really awesome, it is located near the famous landmark aguda fort, the proximity of the hotel is really good, the rooms are soo large, the beds are soo comfortable, the bathroom fittings are really excellent, the wifi connection is extremely speed..the staffs were soo feiensly overall we had a wonderful stay here...!!!

Great property and amazingly courteous staff. The rooms feel a bit dated, however the scenic view makes up for it. Location is prime - very near to the most happening spots of Goa. Food at the restaurant is exceedingly good. Must stay once if you frequently holiday in Goa

I stayed for three nights in the hotel during my official trip to Goa in Mid November. Booking was through my office international travel desk. 

I had opted for a paid airport pickup by Cab instead of availing the free shuttle. The car reported on time and journey to the hotel was uneventful. Check-in was smooth and I was allotted one of the cottages up the hill overlooking the fort and the beach. Amazing views from the sit out area of the cottage early in the morning while sipping my coffee.

Food was good as usual like in any Taj property and breakfast buffet was pretty good with a nice spread. Folks in all the restaurants were efficient and service was good. 

The room was a cottage which was spacious with all amenities including WiFi, Coffee Tray and Mini Bar provided for. House keeping was efficient. 

I had a bad experience during check out which I have high lighted as part of my feedback to the hotel a week ago. Strange that there has been no follow up from the hotel though I am an Inner Circle member and the feedback was pretty serious. I shall wait for them to respond to my feedback and provide an update on that depending on the follow up. 

Overall a nice getaway and I shall return again with family if my concern highlighted in formal feedback is noted

We stayed here for 5 days and enjoyed it very much.Overlooking the beach and close to it's sister hotel Taj village this was a relaxing break.The rooms were spread out and the entrance had palm trees that were beautifully lit with loads of lights.Not sure if the lights are there all the time or just around Diwali time.You could eat at the Taj village and vice Verda.The pool was big and well maintained.We had an evening meal by the pool area which was a set price buffet serving an assortment of dishes and had wine included.This hotel is on the expensive side but well worth it.

I stayed here a few years ago with my family. The rooms are luxury and it is a nice get a away if you do not want to experience the rest of Goa. Although over-priced, they do offer a nice view of the Fort and sunsets.

We stayed here on our annual summer vacation to Goa. This was our 1st visit to this hotel and we weren't disappointed. 

Being a foodie, we absolutely enjoyed the Goan cuisine served in the room. The checkf delighted us with local cuisine throughout our stay which made our stay quite memorable. The staff was courteous and efficient. However the food served in restaurants is no where close. We visited the restaurant on the last day before leaving for airport and were quite disappointed with the food and service. It was quite chaotic too. 

The USP of this property is its location. We preferred the sea facing room with a balcony a living room and bedroom. In my opinion, the rooms could have been bigger for the price particularly the bathrooms. Amazing view from the bedroom of the sea. It was truly mesmerizing. 

The favorite part of the stay is the access to the Taj Holiday village which is adjacent to this property for no additional cost and availability of internal transport for pickup and drop. Taj Holiday village makes up for access to the beach with larger landscape area which is limited to this property since it is built over a hill slope. 

I strongly recommend this place for food and great location. Must visit once.

We stayed here for two nights. Located in the happening North Goa, just overlooking the sea, the property is a beautiful one. We lived in a Garden view room. The room was good, clean and tidy. However, they only provided one club glass and one pair of slippers, which was odd. The food is good and their servings are enough for two people, which I found good. The breakfast was also amazing. The staff is very courteous and always ready to help. The hotel is next to beach, so if u want to do have a swim or do water sports, everything is available in one go. When we were out for sightseeing for the day, coming back we noticed that our room was not cleaned. That was a slight disappointment. However, the room was cleaned in a jiffy, when informed. I think the hotel is due for renovation. All in all a good property and worth a visit, but I have stayed at vivanta by taj, kovalam and that was a much better experience.

We were here for our anniversary. They made sure it was special. They were allowing us to have meals at their holiday Village hotel as well. So we got to taste food from both the hotels. They have a good spa but it closes at 7pm, which is bad as one would want to access the spa after beach. you get a good view of the Sea from the rooms on 1st floor.

We had stayed for 3 nights and the stay was really good except for some minor stuff


We expect something from a 5 star resort and we get that pretty much without any compromises.

Rooms are in a terrain but no worries you are picked up and dropped from anywhere to anywhere within the hotel premises.

Other advantage is you also have access to the Holiday Village Taj Vivanta which is also close by and you can also have breakfast in that location.You can also use the facilities of The Holiday Village Taj.

I loved the pool of Taj Holiday Village which is bigger and also has a kids pool which we could use.

The breakfast spread was very good. 
As I had been on the Diwali eve there was Pooja and minimal fireworks to entertain the guests.


Overall it was a very good stay.

We had taken a sea view room, it was very good view and very peaceful. Swimming pool water was warm at 27 degrees and we really enjoyed. Access to beach was easy and the beach was clean with decent activities. Food quality was very average and could certainly be improved. We had to get food changed several times but room service guys were happy to change it. Staff was very nice and friendly. Rooms with sit out on ground floor were better than even suites (especially one closer to the lobby as there is no privacy there because garden outside lobby overseas the balcony and we did not enjoy our stay there as much as ground floor). Overall worth it!!

Stayed here with my husband and friend from 10th until 14th October 2016 - a total of 4 nights. Taj Hotels very kindly upgraded us into 2 amazing Villas, because we were moved from the Taj Exotica, where the BRICS Summit was taking place. We were compensated for all the inconvenience by being given Villa 510 and 511 - very recently renovated just one month ago - up the hill from the main part of the hotel. Our accommodation was stunning and exceedingly comfortable, and we were told just to phone for the driver, any time we wanted to be transported down to the hotel.
The hotel is very nice overall - very nice food in all of the restaurants, (we ate breakfast there every day and also ate in the Italian restaurant and the Seafood Restaurant; lovely staff - especially the guys out at the poolside; great access to the beach and also to the Fort; and we were extremely well looked after.
This is a lovely hotel and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Stayed here for 3 night, as we got an amazing all meals deal from the hotel. Though there was initial delay in getting the room, the awesome service by the staff covered it up. The food was excellent with the restaurant staff being prompt and assist us warmth and a smile always, Kudos to Prabhakant ( restaurant manager) and his team. 
The house keeping to an awesome job to keep the hotel and the rooms clean. The only drawback is the hotel doesn't have a elevator as it built on a remain of a fort. Overall an amazing and relaxing stay.

We visited taj fort aguada from 12 to 16 jan 2017. Excellent place to stay
excellent location 
wonderful beach just next 2D Resort food was tasty all staff were helpful and signature taj service....smart but not oversmart. 
Cons.......needs renovation. Though evrrything is preserved well and all irregularities well covered due to good housekeeping still....
Our room the premium indulgence cottage was good but not lavish...at more than 20 k per night...we expect more.... Like more space...betr interiors...i felt at any other property i would have got a betr room....but the location the food the sea outdoors more than made up for the room.

The location of the property is outstanding with access to the beach quite easy and painless. The property is also extremely well maintained even though the villas are quite spread apart. The breakfast spread is really good with service being quite up to the mark. The lunch buffet and banquet food however could have been much better and the only reason not giving it a 5 star.

It was a nice stay. Excellent decor. Good rooms with beautiful view of sea and beach. Excellent private balcony overlooking the beach. Pool is very good. House keeping is efficient. Stay was very comfortable. However staff at reception need to be proactive. I had to wait for three hours before room was allotted. They even forgot to offer welcome drink or even a glass of water which I was not expecting at least here. Activity department the facility of making those key chains and other articles with your photos is very good. Over all it was a comfortable stay. Thank you so much for for making our trip memorable.

A really lovely hotel, hidden away the noise and madness of Candolim, yet a quick walk into town to get into the mix of it! Comfy spacious rooms, nice golf course and swimming pool and The Bayan Tree restaurant on site is absolute perfection!

before i review the hotel i must mention the shortage of money in candolim. we returned on the 8th and at that time the queue at atms where a hour for max of 2000inr per day.N o offical shops where open for exchange and if you can find someone to change your money the rate comes down to 70 to 72 inr to the ...The best we did was find restaurants who would accept english to pay the bill at 80 to the  .It does not make a relaxing holiday looking for money every day
The hotel changed money but it was 5000inr per room per week or 5000inr per person per week depending on who you asked at reception
Despite this the hotel it self is lovely .The staff are helpful and can not do enough to make your stay restful.The view from reception and our room was excellent the down side is that on rooms beginning 2 there is no balcony .free water and fruit inthe room every day .Breakfast was of good quality with nice range of curries
if you get fed up of curries try ruffles for amazing pie
the hotel gave us free transportation to the airport it also offers free shuttle to the taxi rank at the bottom of the road but haggle over the fare

Vivanta by Taj  Fort Aguada, Goa is at its best. Romantic, Charming, Vibrant. It has history woven in its walls. This is where royalty, heads of government agencies and the biggest celebrities are known to frequent. The first luxury hotel in Goa. Get an experience that no other place has been able to recreate.

The property has a scenic view of the beach,well maintained environment and polite staff add to its glory.Staying here I would suggest the beach view rooms either family or business this is the best property to stay.They also allow the guests to visit the nearby Taj Holiday Village and transport for the same is arranged complimentary.

We went to Taj Vivanta - Fort Aguada for our 1st wedding anniversary and needless to say had selected the romantic package to make sure its special. While the hotel is well maintained with decent enough restaurants and pool some things still need improvement - the beach is not private and we didn't know that so had to adjust to a beach that is left to general public but this was not as big a spoiler as the fact that we had to literally ask the hotel staff to give us what we were entitled for in the package such as complimentary anniversary dinner, breakfast-in-bed etc. This was not a very pleasant feeling coz it them lost its meaning and the special moments we were looking forward for it being creating - imagine you going and asking that this is what we are supposed to get so pls give it to us..........this was definitely not very professional. Bu this was balanced by the warm hopitality shoed by some very dedicated hotel staff like Kumar Vaibhav in Latitude and the manager and chef of the Italian restaurant Ilcamino. With a slight improvement in professionalism towards guest management, this place is among the best resorts in North Goa.

Decor not upto the Mark at all
Facilities nice 
Spa nice 
Over priced 
The staff is so good they make up for everything lacking 
Taj hotels really trains their staff like no other Hotel brand 
The foreign brands offer better decoration, perhaps more value for money but could never compete with the homely welcome Taj hotels give their guests 
Taj goes the extra mile to serve their guests 
Other brands go the extra mile to make their guests spend more

Stunning property. The fort is an icing on the cake. Location wise good since its 10 mins drive from a lot of sought after pubs/clubs & eating places as well. Food is excellent, staff very helpful. Loved our 4 day stay !

The best part about my stay was the service. They were friendly, sincere and efficient. I had a deluxe sea view and the room was nice but smaller than I would have expected. Another downside of the room was that it had an adjoining door. Definitely request a room without this. I could hear everything in the other room. I asked to change rooms but they were full the whole time I was there. Also, ask to be away from any stairs. It wasn't as quiet as I would have liked. The bed was a little harder than I would have liked, too. I don't want to give a bad impression. Overall, I was very happy with my stay and would stay again. The breakfast buffet was quite good with many options. I hired a driver, Francis, for a few days to take me sightseeing and I found that price to be reasonable. However, I did find it overpriced to get a quick drop down to the main area of Candolim.

A fabulous property in the heart of GOA. Warm friendly efficient service. Recommend this hotel highly. Staff are friendly and look after all your needs. Understand their customers well and make sure they are comfortable.

Well as the name suggest its a TAJ brand.... right from the pick u service at the airport to the hotel. 

This was second trip to Goa at the starting of 2017 

quick check in process & then you come to the wonderfull villa.

Food is awesome... 


Its worth the money you pay at the end of the day.

We stayed at Taj Aguda in the first week of Feb 2017. 


They have two properties next to each other and guests can use the facilities of both. Both the restaurants at Taj Aguda are good. 


Good location! The have access to Fort Aguda and the beach directly from the property. They have access to Jiva Spa and tennis courts etc. through fort Aguda. 


Try to get the sea facing room on a higher floor. The view is amazing!


The breakfast is average but the spread is good.

You cannot beat the property's location within the Ramparts of the Fort and with immediate beach access. The grounds are fantastic, service was great and the rooms were clean, large and well appointed. We took a garden sit-out room which still had a great sea view and a nice terrace. 

The only problem was food prep. We were in India for a month and avoided any major food problems even though my wife has a severe seafood/fish allergy. In Goa we ate nowhere but the resort. On the evening of the fourth night, we ate in their Italian restaurant (by the way, the cream sauces were far to heavy and cloying to be enjoyed). By 3 am that night we were both violently ill and remained so for at least 36 hours. We are well seasoned travellers and have been ill in the past, but nothing like this. While nothing is certain, we cannot imagine how we could have contracted it any other way. Hotel staff were responsive and helpful but this should not happen in a high level resort. A couple of mornings later, I watched as one of the chefs preparing eggs in the breakfast buffet, dropped his spatula, chased it across the floor, picked it up and immediately stuck it back in the omelet he was preparing. Several other staff witnessed this but no one seemed concerned.

Stayed in the property for 5 days last year around June. Hotel was in very good condition and renovation work was already in progress to make the condition better. However, whatever the condition was,we got the luxury experience we expect from TAJ. Food is good and I would suggest trying all three restaurants. We stayed in the college with a garden view and sea views suite in the main building. Cottage is spacious but no view of sea and MY SUGGESTION goes for only sea view suite. Rooms is small but view is to die for.

Happy to help if people need more information

We decided on Goa last minute for a relaxing break in the sunshine and it's exactly what we got! The location of the Taj is fabulous for the beach and the shops and restaurants, and the villa we had was perfect for a short walk to the restaurant for breakfast,so very happy with that! Breakfast was great, fresh fruit and cereals and chefs to cook anything you wanted. There were three restaurants to choose from and we tried them all, none of them was disappointing, and the food and ambience was very good. The villa was spacious and clean and the bathroom was ticked with plenty of amenities which were restocked daily, as was the water, plenty of bottles which was amazingly good. The manager held an afternoon tea for us on our last day, which was a lovely gesture, all the staff were very happy and helpful the whole time. The only downside was the dogs on the beach, there were so many all the time, sticks were available when we collected towels for the sun beds, to scare them away! The complex was very close to a street full of shops and restaurants so we walked out a few times, but taxis were plentiful and very cheap, we did struggle to get some local money as the ATM s were running out but everywhere took debit cards so no problem. I was pleasantly surprised that there were no mosquitoes or flies which was a bonus, and the sea water was warm although quite rough at times, I would go back again but maybe choose a front line beach villa next time.

The service was excellent. 
We had asked for a deluxe room which was not in the main
building - we needed a pickup & drop from our room which came promptly.
The room was great - large & well furnished.
The location is far from airport & the nearest town & a little inconvenient to walk anywhere as we are elderly. Amenities are all very good. 
The breakfast was great but the other meals rather disappointing. We got a cold noodle dish one night & an overdone hamburger another night. Although we complained we were still charged with no apology.This is the reason i have given 4 stars. Avoid restaurants for dinner.Most nights we ate out. The bar is a great place to hang out & take in the sea view. We walked on the beach every evening - the best part of our 6 night stay.

Rooms and bathrooms are bad .... food is good .... pool is good ..... old rooms .... staff is good .... so better stay at some other hotel as bathroom is really small... housekeeping is bad ... if u ask anything they will say they are trainees. ... go for meals to visit the property and stay anywhr else.... as beach is also dirty with beer bottles any polybags.....

Taj once again did not disappoint.. The rooms food buffet service hospitality were all commendable.. Did not enjoy the spa that much as it was heavily booked and the whole experience felt a little rushed..

You can never go wrong in choosing to stay at Taj Aguada... Everything about the place is a like we rehearsed play. Each and everyone in the property knows how to play their part to perfection in making your stay memorable.

+Well appointed spacious rooms
+Very courteous and helpful staff.
+ All your needs are taken care off.
+Brilliant location.

An amazing property overlooking sea. We were there around new years. they have the best staff, good food. their lounge which is perfect to have a drink and enjoy the beauty. the restaurant by the pool and live music makes it more than perfect.

One of the oldest pioneering five star of Goa. 2 hours from the airport through Calangute one of the finest district of Goa. Taj Aguada is at the tip of the heritage fort bastions from where one can virtually enjoy and experience the vastness of Arabian sea. The sea view rooms are amazing over the villas and cottages. Whoever goes there cannot miss the hilltop yet again encountering the infinity of the water. Lush green but details seems poor against other Taj properties. Adventure activities are interesting. Adjoining Taj Village is worth visiting.

e stayed here for 2 night and loved the place. The place and the food options are really good here, just that the place is not well maintained. There was some renovation going on at the property but was so well taken care of, if not mentioned we would not really notice it as well. I would recommend the stay here, though the ones with kids would love the holiday village property more.

A good place for stay - neat and clean with courteous helpful staff.
I stayed in the place during monsoons - so trip from rooms to Reception / dining/conference area through cab was irksome in the rains - the pathways at night could be better lighted.
Small beach there but was rough so no one ventured.
Good location for view of the sea.
Food is good - the service can be faster though.
The Brinjal sweet sour pickle was delicious and something I tasted first time.
All in all a nice place.

The property is nice and good to go to every time we go to Goa. The cottages are very nice and clean. and are on the top of hills. The rooms are ok ok and have a good lawn in front of the rooms overlooking Arabian sea. The property is huge and has a ferry service to the cottages and the other places in the property. There is only 1 problem that is that this hotel has not elevator to go to upper floors. Which is a big turn off.

Physically impressive hotel in a lovely commanding setting and and fine gardens, with access to adjoining Vivanta village offering more gardens and another impressive pool. Room had magnificent sea view and good air conditioning, reasonable facilities. Beginning to look tired though, with disappointing shower over bath, and very grimy grouting in bathroom. A surprise considering how many staff are employed doing very menial tasks around the grounds.
Adjoining beech is very long, very sandy and is sadly ruined by over development, with endless beach shacks and noisy thrill riders on jet-skis and towed bananas. The local tourists think nothing of throwing their beer and spirit bottles into the sea after a days heavy drinking, especially at weekends, this makes the beach a potential hazard. The sea is likely heavily polluted with sewerage from the over development. Whilst outside the hotel's control all this unfortunately detracts from the lovely hotel and diminishes its appeal. 
Booked via Thomson's in UK with a half board option to avoid having to find potentially risky food outside, this being our first time to India. Staff were very unsure of our status and kept offering a restrictive choice menu and not the a la carte, this confusion continued into second week. Not a fault of the staff but one of communication from above. Unfortunately contaminated food eaten in hotel resulted in severe illness for 10 days, with parasitic stomach infection. Likely cause of contamination was birds and vermin seen in open restaurants, which has access to completely open restaurant and kitchen areas at some of the properties restaurants. Mice and crows seen inside. Birds plague guests outside at pool, they use the pools for bathing and drinking, leaving excrement everywhere, and riffle through unguarded belongings. The hard working staff struggle to keep them at bay, and birds sit on tables laid for evening meals. several members of same party fell ill whilst on full or half board, those who ate in shacks and restaurants outside did not fall ill.
Cost of drinks is prohibitive, over 7 for single G&T, locally acceptable Gin only 1.50 a bottle in supermarket. Result is hotel misses out on massively on sales and the ambience of pre-dinner drinks, which people take elsewhere. Dinner can become a dry affair, if you love wine forget it, you will be made bankrupt.
A holiday thoroughly ruined by avoidable food contamination. Will never return.

I would not stay here again. Some of the staff was excellent, some was fine, some just lied to us.

We chose this property as we have Taj Inner Circle Gold membership. When checking in we handed over a room upgrade certificate and were given a very nice villa on the hills. Unfortunately, the villa we were given was directly next to a villa that was under construction - and there was lots of hammering and disruption. So we asked to switch to a regular room, which was accommodated. Our excitement at the upgrade was now a bit diminished, but we still had very high hopes for the property.

On our day of check out, we asked for a 2 pm check out (Taj Inner Circle Gold offers a 4 pm check out). We had also mentioned this at check in and had been told it shouldn't be an issue. But on the day of check out we were told that, as check in time was also 2 pm and they were sold out that night, it was impossible to also have a 2 pm check out. This defies logic, so we pushed back. The desk agent then said fine, we could have the 2 pm check out, but if anyone was trying to check into that room before then and couldn't because we were in the room they would just be told it was our fault so the incoming guest could complain to us. I have not been treated so rudely by even a 1 star hotel, let alone a Taj property.

Mentioned above that the agent also told us they were sold out that night. We asked some other staff at the hotel. I forget the exact numbers, but the hotel has around 140 rooms. That day 90 rooms were checking out and 40 were checking in. This means that even if the hotel had been sold out the night before (irrelevant for our 2 pm check out) there were at least 50 vacant rooms that day, so this was easy to accommodate. Instead the staff is trained to say no at first and hope the "guests" just go away. This is not the type of management that I would want to reward with future revenue. There are plenty of other nice properties in Goa that are far more worthy of your money. True lack of caring here.

I expect someone at the property to respond in the name of the GM and say how the hotel did nothing wrong, since they're unable to face criticism.

Beautifully located by the coast but sadly the food was very lacking. Too much salt in many of the dishes and they even served up unripe avocados. Extremely expensive for what we got. Only came for lunch so can't comment on anything else.

All the positives are already highlighted by other posts. 

This is an old hotel which is more like a 3 Star with aging facilities and arrogant management.

It's suitable only for business meetings because that is their priority and holiday guests are unwanted. Not suitable for families with small children.

This can qualify as the worst hotel in goa. Please book in hyatt or marriot for 5 Star service.

I am afraid to say is it Taj !!!?

Coffee shop cutlery and cup saucers and teapots need to be cleaned properly! !

Front desk staff and duty manager are more interested in swiping cards for bills. Not bothering for customer satisfaction !
We will not come again and will not recommend anybody.
We had stayed here 1995 june 22 to 27th june. And cone again this time 1st to 6th November.

My room was room number 203 The rooms on the second level are old , grimy and are in need for an instant update for the amount of money taj is charging for it.. The restaurants are dated the rooms are disgusting to say the least ..I then got my booking changed to the taj holiday village which too seems dated now. My advice is stay at the newer hotels in north goa because Taj is just not worth it...

I stayed at Fort Aguada in the month of June, I expected the hotel to be clean and luxurious but it turned out to be just the opposite. I spent four nights and had to change the room every single night because of several problems firstly, with their cottages and then with their Junior suites as well. I have stayed in properties all across the globe but never has my dissatisfaction level been higher, the hotel rooms at Fort Aguada are very old and not well maintained as the property must looks very old. For this price, i feel there can be so many better options for the guests.
The swimming pool is very small and the hotel has very poor spa facility for a property that is spread across 45 acres of land.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and we thought the hotel was pretty poor. There were a small handful of positives - there were a couple of examples of excellent service and there is a Thai restaurant (albeit at the sister hotel next-door) which is first rate. But overall, the quality of the experience falls far below what would you should expect for the price.

As others have noted, the rooms are very tired and desperately in need of renovation. I see from the hotel's responses to other reviews that modernisation work will happen but that's of no use if you're staying in a shabby room. It's not as though it's any cheaper to account for the poor state of the rooms.

Another issue we had was the level of service which was generally poor. There were countless examples every day but to pick out a handful... On a few occasions, we ordered things at breakfast which didn't arrive. We booked a double room with a king bed (we are married after all) but we were given twin beds - they put the beds together but then we had no lamps by the bed. After we complained, they moved us but only the following day. We called reception at 1 a.m. on the first night to ask when the thumping music outside would finish - we were promised a call back which never materialised. We received a welcome pack for a wedding that was nothing to do with us, we were charged for wi-fi (in a 5 star hotel, in 2016!), there were mix ups over taxi payments, I could list loads.

And finally, this is a very noisy resort hotel - it's very difficult to properly relax. In addition, to the late night music, you'll get noise from the rooms above and each side. Breakfast is like eating in a school canteen. On the first day, we managed to get one of the few tables to eat breakfast outside but one of the staff was using a noisy machine to blow up a zorb water ball. And the pool activities go on through the day so forget about a peaceful time sun bathing and reading by the swimming pool.

I've stayed previously at the Taj Exotica in South Goa and that was a wonderful experience - a much better prospect for your holiday!

Not impressed with Taj , experience not so good

Staff more worried on ur check out ; they give u multiple reminders 3 years before ur check out ;

We went to Goa for the Republic Day long weekend and booked this basis what several people we know had told us. First the good things - staff were very courteous and responsive, the lobby and common areas are nice, breakfast pretty comprehensive and the overall look of the gardens very nice. And the not so nice - the room quality was shabby and there were places which were a little dirty ( we were told the hotel is going to get renovated but these rooms were clearly not upto the mark) , and on the first day we had to remind housekeeping to clean our room . When they cleaned they did not replenish the coffee and creamer and again we had to remind them. once we reminded the staff were very prompt but the fact we had to remind at all put us off. 
Most importantly, this resort is just not worth the price paid - there is no private beach ( and the approach to the beach is narrow and one gets accosted by private operators trying to sell water sports ), and for hanging out in shacks or by the beach there are far better options at far lower prices. The kids play area was so tiny it was laughable.even if the service had been what we would have expected from the Taj I would not recommend this hotel at all. Far better options to enjoy the beaches, shacks and roam around on a motorbike

After paying peak season prices for our rooms, we felt being cheated. Once we checked-in, we found the rooms and the bathrooms to be old and worn out...this property requires serious renovation...honestly we spent more time at the sister property (Holiday village) because of the common access.

After staying at the Leela Palace in Udaipur and the Taj Mahal in Mumbai, we thought that this Taj hotel was a 5 star, but unfortunately it is NOT. The room we had was very average and the bathroom size is barely big for one person. I believe that we have been fooled and we are very disappointed

Rooms are average but overpriced. Even the staff is not very well trained and slow, had to remind them several times go get things done. Food at the restaurant was terribly slow. Was very disappointed with everything.

During our stay overall experience was not very pleasent only plus i would give them 
for cleanliness. Restaurant dining is not at all a good experince food was very average

avearage with slow replenishment and staff would have to be reminded thrice for any

We stayed for a day in this superbly located Taj property on our anniversary. Sad to say for the amount they charge the rooms were miniscule in size as compared to their other cheaper properties elsewhere in Goa.Breakfast wasn't complimentary nor were there any welcome drinks or fruits or cookies placed in our room. More than half the hotel was under renovation which made for a depressing ambience, they could have slashed their rates, at least to make up for that.
I feel the staff could have done something to make our visit special especially for the kids since on arrival they made us fill out a detailed questionnaire about our kids' likes and dislikes as regards food and activities. Sadly it was a very average stay in an average hotel with exceptionally high room tariff!

I have stayed here for three days, Bad service no telephone working, no body replies no shower working . I have applied for taj epicure plan membership plan, but cant use any services .No bath robe in bathroom. Didnt wxpected from five star hotel like taj will never come again

HI Inspite complaining nothing was been done i was not been given also another room , food was very okay , i had stayed 3 days , some to the items very repeated every alternate days how can rooms have lizards roaming in the room , also flying cockroaches , it was a very sad stay and spoilt my families holiday , as we were terrified creatures poping up from walls and ceiling

A 5 star property with an absolutely stunning view of the sea but then something is amiss here; specially, with the staff being too busy to even talk properly or for that matter greet the guests at the time of check-out or ask for feedback. Rooms are small in size and washrooms even smaller but food options are in plenty.

But yes, a 3 star experience nonetheless for nothing can beat the seamless swimming pool and the sea view.

The only good thing about here was to food, which was why we went however I think some of the staff think they are more upmarket that the clientele. We had dinner at the Seafood restaurant which was lovely but there was no water on the tables and no finger bowls after eating king prawn and our waiter had a bad case BO We also had a cat hanging around the actual table all the time, it was shooed off but just came back. There was a lovely singer on for the evening but we could not hear anything due to the very very loud Christmas music from the shack right next to us on the beach. After dinner we were unable to move to anywhere else, as the seats near the stage were taken by other diners, so we decided to leave. We told reception we were not happy and were leaving, they didn't ask why.
We had ordered a taxi and asked if we could leave a note at the gate house to let the driver know we had left and that we would still pay him when we saw him the next day. The hotel staff were dumfounded that we cared about the cab driver and said it was not necessary to leave a note as they will tell him we had left. They didn't ask our names so I don't know how they would do that. We waited outside for a cab for a few minutes and then someone came and said we had to order one at the desk.. The desk said taxi would be 6.50 to go less than a mile?? I told them never mind we will walk, the taxi there cost 2. As it happened we got a taxi as soon as we set off and paid 2.50.
I would not return to this hotel even if I won the lottery, some of the staff especially the males think they are something special. The idea that they think they can rip people off on the taxi drivers behalf is incredible ow do they explain that? . They need to remember their customers pay their wages and stop being so smug.

I was there for for nights in October with my parents, and we stayed in a one-bedroom sea view villa in the Ermitage part of the resort. I've spent many cherished summer vacations here in my childhood, but we switched over to the Exotica about ten years ago, and this was our first time back since then-- and my, how the mighty have fallen! It rained heavily throughout our vacation (since it was the monsoon season), and a lot of water managed to seep in through the full length windows in the bedroom of the villa on our first evening itself-- after a few repeated calls, they sent one person with a tiny cloth who cleaned it, and never sent anyone to fix the problem till we created a ruckus the next morning. We ordered a huge meal from room service, but most of the food tasted a little stale, the prawns in our prawn dish were straight-up straight and smelly-- imagine this, STALE seafood in GOA! That too, at a five-star, where you're paying like 800 bucks for the dish! Then the next morning, it turned out that there was no hot water in the master bathroom, and while the third person was having their bath in the smaller bathroom, the hot water stopped running there too. There were people in our villa fixing it all day-- it felt like we were sitting at our home while there was renovation work going on, and it was just not done, because you should check and make sure everything in a room/villa is working the way it should be before you check guests into it. In addition, the bathrooms were mouldy and old-feeling, and the villa felt a little rundown in general-- this is something I read in a LOT of reviews before coming here, but I kept thinking, how bad could it be? It's the Taj, after all! To be fair, they are renovating different parts of the hotel in phases, but they should probably shut the whole place down and do it in one go, rather than jipping off guests who are assigned the non-renovated accommodations. The general manager was away during our stay, so we dealt mostly with the desk manager, and I suspect it was because my dad is a Chambers member (and made his anger and displeasure very clear), but that night, they moved us into the neighbouring villa, which was a renovated sea view two-bedroom, and gave us a free meal at the Banyan Tree (in Taj Holiday Village), and thankfully everything worked just fine there. However, the overall experience left a bad taste in our mouths, and we are unlikely to ever return here-- which is a pity, because although Exotica is a far superior hotel, the Aguada property is definitely more interesting and beautiful.

Aright...so my review of this place might read differently from the others'. 

Maybe it was just the time of the year that we decided to be at Vivanta Aguada ...for the New Years. Maybe it was too many guests...or maybe it's just as I experienced it. Not much, however, could be reasoned given that it's hospitality from start to end. 

Front office -- below average responsiveness. Unable to address the most basic demands...leave alone those that needed exceptions to be made. Despite repeated requests for as little as an hour's extension to the checkout time (after staying for 4 days)...we were, literally and figuratively, thrown out. Haven't had to experience that at a Taj property before. But then...

Room service -- possibly too many guests overloaded them, but it was sluggish and quality was far below the average Taj standards. 

Rooms/ Suites -- we used both owing to the size of our family. We were almost 25 of us. View from most of the rooms was exceptional. I give that to the property, where it's located. Interiors were dated...looked and felt poorly kept...and restrooms really did let one down. 

Overall -- the experience ranged between poor and average, as you can tell. But there's a silver lining - the property is beautiful...the view...the clean swimming pool...and the beach right in front. Fort Aguada is very beautiful. Maybe at another time of the year, Vivanta Aguada might deserve a chance. For me, I will take some time to get over this trip and reclaim it when I do. 
Have a good one!

I have been going to this hotel for ages.
The property is now in a terrible state of disrepair.I was in one of the cottages and they really should not have been using the room.The shower door was practically falling off and after shower I had to mop the whole room.Sockets were not working, speakers in the ceiling seemed like they were about to fall down.
There did not seem to be any concern about the room even though I was moved. Looking out of the room I could see other cottages literally falling apart.
No free wifi, in this age there are not many hotel chains that do not offer this service.( i was told by some of the staff this is a big complaint).
On the plus side a receptionist was great, a waiter in Latitude restaurant went over and above what was expected. 
Time to spend some money on the property!!
The staff are great but what a shame no managers and even the general manager don't care!

While the Vivanta by Taj, Fort Aguada property is fantastic, I found the service to be below standard for such a high priced property. 
I was disappointed as I had gone to celebrate my wedding anniversary. While the check in staff noted the occasion, not even a courtesy wish from the staff.

We went as a couple to Goa and stayed at the Taj for 4 nights.

We used the shuttle service at the airport to get to the hotel. The Taj staff at the airport were very courteous and helpful. The drive to the hotel takes about an hour and a half and usually the shuttle drops passengers off first the the holiday Village and then at Fort Aguada.

The location of the Fort Aguada hotel turned out to be very inconvenient. It is at an isolated corner of the North Goa beaches and is far from convenience stores, restaurants and the main beach areas of the Calangute, Anjuna and Baga.

It takes 15 minutes to walk down to the Holiday Village and the way is not very nice either. Taj do provide a free cab service between the two properties. This is particularly important because the taxi stand is located outside the main gate of the Holiday Village.

The taxis provided by Taj are very convenient and a safe option. But the prices are exorbitant to say the least. On one evening we used the taj taxi to go to a nearby restaurant called Earthen Oven, since it was raining. We were charged Rs. 650 for this ride, when a regular taxi would probably drop you off at Baga for 400-500.

Bear in mind that due to the location of the hotel you will end up spending a fair amount in taxis.
One word of advice; if you travel to a place and intend on traveling back to the hotel in a couple of hours then retain the taxi, since it usually works out cheaper.
Petrol is the cheapest in Goa compared to the rest of India, so taxi operators look to profit heavily from tourists.

We had a sea view room with a sit out. While the view was very good the room was not.
The entire property has tired feel to it and does not seem to be in very good repair.

There is a gate besides the pool which provides you access to the beach and one of the Fort Aguada ramparts.

We checked in around 3:30 PM and were asked to wait, although the rooms should have been ready by then. When we went to the room the floor was still damp. There wasn't any coffee in the room.
We had been provided 2 towels and both seemed different. On inquiring we were told that one was an old towel and the other a new towel.
These were promptly addressed when pointed out.

One very poor observation which I have made is that the Taj do not provide spoons to stir tea/coffee. rather they provide alcohol stirrers. I have stayed in a few hotels around the world, but have never been provided stirrers for coffee. I think this speaks a great deal about the Management of this hotel.

What happened on the third day was quite sad. We waited in the sit out area while one of the staff made up the room. After he left we were surprised to find that he had not replaced any coffee and the towels were not right again.
What was shocking was the fact that he had replace the bedsheet with a new one which was completely torn off at the edge and there is no way he could have missed it.
The linen at the Taj is not very clean at all, but using torn bedsheets is simply not acceptable.

The pool at the hotel was fine, although we spotted a few crows drinking from the pool.

The property has a lot of crows and they can become unnerving when you use the sit out in the morning. Clearly the Management have not bothered with doing anything about this menace.

The breakfast was good but not exceptional in any way. We noticed a lot of families lifting food from the breakfast area, probably for the rest of the day, and no one seem too concerned about this behaviour.

Overall, the entire experience was quite disappointing and not what we paid for. This is my second stay at a Taj, the first being at Taj Samudra in Colombo. I think it is safe to say that the Taj will be my last option in the future.

Taxi fares for Baga will be around 400 for non-A/C and 500 for A/C if you use private cabs.

Make it a point to visit Souza Lobo's and Brittos if you visit North Goa.

Where do I start from....
The excitement of staying at Taj evaporated at the check in itself. We had booked a king bed, but at the check in the receptionist tells me that we are booked for twins beds (first shocker). I showed her the print of my reservation which clearly said King Bed. She took the print of my reservation and went inside and returned after few minutes while we waited, she came back and informed us that we are all set (we assumed that we are all set for king bed room). We went inside the room to find out two twin beds joined together to create A PSEDUO KING BED (second shocker). We were shocked beyond limits. I spoke to the duty manager and our room was changed,obviously my question to him was why were we CHEATED AND FOOLED. He "instructed" me that I should first have my room changed and then discuss thw matter, he went on to tell me that the receptionist had informed us that twin beds would be joined to make a kind bed (third shocker), this conversation had never taken place. 
In a state of shock I requested to meet the GM who apologisied but did nothing beyond that till my knowledge. We received a sorry card in room which was nice and kind gesture. 

Location of the hotel is the only saviour of the hotel which is breath taking.

Service (minus the receptionist) was excellent.

Food lacks taste and variety. 

Overall mixed review, recommended only for location nothing else AT ALL.

The letters missing from the security sign on the gate is the first clue to a distinct lack of management at this property. This is reinforced by the lukewarm welcome from front desk staff who go through the motions but clearly have been given no inspiration as to what service is all about. The property is getting a little worn but that would not be a problem if the staff were managed as opposed to being on unaware autopilot. Note to the Taj Brand CEO. You might want to retrain the GM urgently. Too late for this customer. It will be the Hyatt for me next time.

Not worth for money. No cleanliness. No amenities. Staff is not good . Better to go Raddisson or Hayatt in this price. It's not a five star property at all. Staff of hotel not cooperative. Small rooms. Not the same as shown in pictures. So I advise not to do any mistakes. Don't book this hotel.

I would like to have a sincere word with the GM of the hotel of Goa property. I would like to report many things right from from the watchmen's promptness to the arrogance reply of the Latitude restaurant captains . Sincerely not recommended to stay at this hotel . Goa being a major sea food destintion which has a peculiar goan taste was not at all catered . The following points were observed and detailed.


1)we reached the hotel at around 3 pm on 25th September , no one was bothered to receive us at the reception . No welcome drink was offered at the facility. We had to wait for our chance to talk to the reception person for around 15 mins. No briefing about the property was done after we checked in. P.S . We drove from Pune to Goa with our own vehicle. (Not expected from TAJ hospitality)

2) next day 26th Sept at breakfast we ordered a glass of watermelon juice we were denied arrogantly by the captain at hotel Latitude . Finally requesting after 2-3 times to the lady who welcomes at the reception desk of latitude restaurant she told the same captain who was arrogant to us to serve us the juice. While giving the juice the captain said that he thought we were "outsiders" and not the guest staying at the hotel. Is this how you really treat the customers whether outsiders or the ones staying in the property? 

While having food in the afternoon there were a group of people hooting and howling and shouting slang words which the faculty could handled , being with family this is not at all accepted .

3) Same day we visited to the "seafood" special restaurant Morisco there. We ordered for the Goan seafood special thali, it was really a disgrace to the Goan cuisine. Being fisheaters ourselves to the bone, taste of the typical Goan curry was totally bad. King fish fry served was dehydrated and not fresh. Rice served was dry and undercooked. Our expection of the taste and what we got was did not match. Roti/ naan served was chewy and lacked of taste. We called upon the chef and reported the problem. Ghanshyam Rege took care of that night with a much better taste and quality with his personal attention towards the cooking. I wish this would have been the case with the thali.
