4) we checked out of the hotel on 28th September. After the breakfast we requested at the reception to make the final bill and formalities ready by 12 o clock. We reached the reception at 12 30 nothing is ready. Finally doing all formalities we got out of the hotel at 1 30 pm. Sluggish way of working. 

Overall I won't recommend or I dont think I will stay myself henceforth with this property. 

Regards
Shantanu Pandit.

We were most disappointed to find ourselves in a cottage with mold in the bathroom and along one wall of the bedroom area...my husband became ill on the first night and I woke up ill the second day. On a tour of southern India, this was supposed to be the one hotel we were not worried about and it turned out to be the worse! We moved to the Taj Exotica and saved what was left of our four days...but we blame our travel agent for not warning us about the condition of the Fort. QuIte apart from the room, if you have any walking problems, you should know that the only way to get to the dining room or pool is to walk down four flights of steps...no elevator or buggy to get you down there. True, we were able to take a buggy ride to the nearby Taj VIllage and eat and swim, but that was a pain. When you check into a hotel that is supposed to be a luxury resort you do not expect to have to commute to dine or recline by the pool. The management responded by helping us move, but they and Taj need to get their act together. Taj Exotica was excellent!

This hotel is very opulent inside and has a 5 star rating. It's location is spectacular near the point at Sinquerim. The views from this hotel are quite spectacular.
Staff on the gate at the start of the drive are very pleasant and staff inside the reception are pleasant enough - if a little slow to answer questions and lacking in local knowledge. 
However of startling concern is that they employ a man to organise traffic outside the gates of the hotel on the public road. One of those employed in this role exercises quite blatant racism towards white skinned people.
This hotel do not own this road - it is a public highway owned by the Government of Goa. There are no parking restrictions in this road, nor any signs concerning parking. It is an access road to a popular place in Sinquerim for watching the sunset.
Friends and I went to park two small scooters at the side of the road. There were many other vehicles parked along the side of this road including 4 wheelers and 2 wheelers. My friends and I were immediately pounced on by this man who told us we could not park there and harassed us until we got fed up and moved. He would not give us an alternative place to park and told us we could not park anywhere, despite many other vehicles being parked.
We then drove further along the public road to park on the verge - at this the Taj employee started yelling to a taxi driver who had parked and was getting out of his car, to tell us to move. The taxi driver gave us a place to park behind some buildings telling us that the Taj employee could not stop us there.
Having parked my scooter on private land behind a restaurant I saw the same Taj employee wave through a group of Indians on scooters and clearly direct them to the exact two places he had told us we could not park. 
I asked this man why - he laughed. I asked him if it because I am white skinned - he laughed and could give no justifiable reason for the differentiation in his behaviour towards my friends and I compared to the Indian people he had directed to the parking place.
I complained to the duty manager about this man's conduct to which the female duty manager's initial response was to claim this male was not one of their employees, then had to change her mind once I pointed out that he wore a staff identity badge and a Taj uniform! I was then promised a call back within 48 hours.....
...clearly the management of this hotel couldn't care less that they are employing a member of staff who exercises such vile racist behaviour to foreign nationals in Goa as no call back was received and no apology either.
Avoid this place if you have white skin - they exercise extreme and blatant racism.
Sadly this incident let the entire Taj brand down - the result being that I will never frequent any Taj establishment again

Taj Vivanta
After staying in many Taj hotels in India and around the world- and after traveling to Goa from an outrageously grand stay at The Taj Palace in Mumbai this was my ABSOLUTE worst Taj experience and frankly a hotel to skip.Not at all deserving of the esteemed Taj moniker.
We selected the Taj Vivanta in Fort Aguada to visit Northern Goa and originally booked the hotel for 3 nights.
When we arrived we were shown to a cottage on a steep hillside that was dirty and run down and did not pass the cleanliness or smell test.Worse than rooms I stayed in during my budget student days.
The duty manager told us she thought the room was "lovely and charming" but would "upgrade" us to a more modern and seaside room if we took a walk on the beach for a few hours to have lunch.
When we arrived back to our newly assigned rooms a few hours later in the early evening they were much smaller and even dirtier than the first cottage with brown shower water and a host of crawling bugs.The man who assisted us with our luggage recently came from another hotel chain and told us he had received similar complaints from other customers.There were numerous blackouts and our TV and air conditioning were not properly working. In fact the following morning another guest and his wife were also complaining at the desk about the cleanliness of this property and told me that this was the worst hotel stay of their journey in Goa and India.
My wife wanted to immediately leave and the hotel management did absolutely nothing to resolve the issues despite gracious tips.The most unhelpful staff we have encountered after many months traveling in India or anywhere else for that matter over the past few years.
My wife was in tears.
I told them that we wanted to move to the Taj Exotica further south and was told by an assistant manager that it was completely sold out yet I was easily able to find rooms online on my own .
Management of the Taj Vivanta told me that I would have to pay for all of my booked days because they personally were unable to confirm availability at the other Taj (Exotica)which was complete nonsense.
After a sleepless first evening in a threadbare linen bed atop an old,uncomfortable and squeaky mattress - we left first thing in the morning and headed south to the Taj Exotica taking a chance without a reservation and we were welcomed with open arms and upgraded to an amazing suite after hearing our story.
To say that the difference between these two Taj Goa properties is night and day would be a great understatement.
The Taj Exotica in Goa was outrageously great(see my review) and exceeded expectations.I wholeheartedly and emphatically advise one against staying at the Taj Vivanta in Fort Aguada.
I have never been so adamant about my travel advise and have never written such a review.
In Fort Aguada there are much nicer places to stay at a fraction of the cost or just go right to the Taj Exotica which is more than great and take a cab ride to Fort Aguada for a visit.I have slept better in airports and on airplanes and the stress of this brief stay almost ruined an otherwise amazing journey.

The reception was cold and unfriendly... The total lack of organisation and unfriendly approach left us feeling so disappointed that we turned around and went elsewhere - so we can't comment on the rest, but if you want to be treated like you are in prison just go the Taj. UK visitors be warned, there are much better places with friendlier approaches...

I think this is the worst of the services meeted out by taj. Totally disappointed. Landed at the airport greeted by some ordinary person who made me wait for like 15mins to decide where am i going. Then another person comes and doesnt even answer. And then another wait of 30mins before i get boarding on the bus. Vallabh was the person handling the airport arrival. Inspite of charging so much and being on the gold epicure plus this is the treatment meeted out, very very disappointing never again will i visit this hotel

we had a booking at this plcae,their check in time is 1400 hrs and check out time is 1200 noon. we reached their at 1300 hoping that there would be some accommodation. we had four kids with us so ultimately we went for their restaurant we waited till 1500 hrs still our rooms were not ready. somehow we got the room but the room size is extremely small considering their tariff. it felt as if for our every necessity we had to just sit at front desk while the girl at front desk was busy attending several other calls. for example we had already paid the tariff but the front desk girl first made us wait for 15 minutes then told me that room tariff needs to be paid. i had to prove to her that i had indeed paid tariff earlier then she was convinced.
only thing we liked was the swimming coach sandeep.

I am staying in the Superior Charm Sea View right now. We have triple occupancy. 
The rollaway bed caused back ache on first night so on the 2nd night asked them to put mattress on ground. The person who did this, was considerate to bring a thicker mattress.

Tonight (3rd night) again they put a roll away bed. After asking and reminding once to Ekta and waiting for 20 minutes, the housekeeping person comes and puts the mattress of roll away bed on floor.

This mattress is a very poor quality PU mattress of some local company that has long served its life. I have attached photos to show its low thickness (around 1.5 or 2 inches) and density might be 28 or 32. 

My father has served as a technical advisor to Sheela Foam (manufacturers of SleepWell) and I am a Chemical Engineer from IIT Delhi so I know something about PU mattresses and their technical parameters.

So I ask Ekta to replace the mattress. This time it takes 30 minutes and again no action. On asking Ekta, she tells me to speak to housekeeping. Finally at 11.10 after 30 minutes of wait, I ask her to escalate the call to Amrita, duty manager.

The mattress, thicker one this time as I had asked them to bring, finally materializes. There comes a boorish rude guy called Amit who gives me gyaan on how this poor quality, low density mattress that had gone flat and served its useful life, is actually perfect for roll away bed.

I want to ask if Taj is cutting corners this way. After all the third bed is charged. So why are such poor quality mattresses being used. Why is higher density mattress not being used. Why is a mattress that has obviously served its useful life being still used.

In response, I will much appreciate if the management talks ONLY about 3rd mattress because the mattresses in bed were spring mattresses and that is not the issue being discussed here.

We have had a few minor issues which I would have never mentioned otherwise (and not posted this review) but since the poor mattress and rude staff have already spoilt my sleep, I might as well mention here.

The bed sheet on day 2 was torn and had been stitched. I did not click photograph but it is something one does not expect from Taj.

Also, a person Rohit, at pool, forgot our tea order. Like simply forgot. I went to Latitude after 15 minutes wait and Sapna located him. He did apologize and said he would waive the charges and as I said we are here as a family enjoying so did not want to nit pick about minor things.

Most of the junior staff are truely service oriented, the cleanliness level is very high. In general the service orientation is there, all the things that one expects from Taj.

The 3rd mattress issue is something that should be addressed on a policy basis at Taj level because most users of 3rd mattress are children and they can not even highlight this. I have no doubt some accounting guy tried to pinch pennies by using the cheapest possible mattress they could. But when Taj charges an amount equivalent of cost of mattress as a single night supplement, it is criminal to use such 3rd class mattresses.

If you are planning to travel with an infant this property is definitely not for you. To begin with rooms are very small and suffocating. There is no way to open the window either. More over due to 'condensation' one needs to keep the AC on at 21 degrees 24*7 else the floor, the walls and everything around starts getting wet. You cant leave your baby on the floor to crawl and play because of this. There is no option of a lift so you need to manage the stroller on your own. You can't trust the food served for babies as twice stale khichdi was served for my baby. In terms of food Taj Holiday Village seems far better with a wider spread and tastier food. Services are poor with a basic thing like tissue paper taking ages to be delivered to your table. If you have stayed in Exotica and Holiday Village, don't carry high hopes for this property. The only plus point is its location but then there is no beach. So every time you need to go to the beach you need to either access it through Taj Holiday Village or walk down to any other beach. Disappointed with the overall performance of this hotel.

We have booked two indulgence cottages for 2 adults and 2 children with all meals included under monsoon package. To our surprise, there were lizards and flying cockroaches inside the cottages and after sanitizing and cleaning the rooms again, we had one more flying cockroach in the night n after complaining we were shifted to main building with very small rooms and floor was always wet due to some a/c issues.
The buffet food was not at all to the standard and me and my wife had severe food poisoning !! Being in Goa, you expect to see some Goan seafood delicacies but none were found in Lattitude restaurant and Morisco the seafood restaurant was also so so. We skipped out paid food packages and had food at Fat Fish and Souza Lobo outside which was much bettering authentic Goan food.

Checked out one day before than the paid package and decided never to check in Vivanta by Taj Ford Aguada again.

There are better International chain hotels like Novotel, Radisson etc which should be preferred over this hotel.

Moved again and again and again everyday I was packing and unpacking. 
Finally had last two days in a good room... Then had other issues, room which was supposedly allocated for us was occupied by someone else, we got the keys and opened the doors to find someone else's bags. Night before the departure we decided to clear all our bills, so the bills were all incorrect. Finally got the right bills paid them and then followed by emails after emails to say they again made a mistake and we paid less, checked the bills they were incorrect again and again and again.... We have been given a recipt of full payment received but still being told it was incorrect!!!!. Very upset and disappointed and found the whole experience disappointing and embarrassing. We paid one Lakhs rupees six months in advance and more on top for the extras and trust me I wish I never paid them or we should have just moved the next morning to some other hotel... Travelling from uk with two kids and all this hassle and not once the is any recognition of what we had gone through... We Will never recommend or go back . We want our refund or attest some of our money back but once again we have not got anywhere due to complete arrogance of the front desk manager . Stayed in taj hotels all my life never exproeneced anything like it.... 
One of the front desk manager Amd many other managers used excuses like its a old hotel, it's due rennovation, sorry the room are outdated, sorry about the noise, we understand the pictures are not what you get but that the same when we take our pictures we want to look pretty .... Just outrageous kids were so unhappy and unsettled, they gave us one meal free on our first night which the front desk manager made such a song and dance about, whereas this was due to the fact that the room that we got was so bad and due to all the hassle and after 30 hours of our journey we could not go out to eat... Plus this was what I insisted not what was offered as a good will gesture or out of respect to us !!!! So angry and frustrated.....

My friends and I had high hopes for the Vivanta by Taj hotel, we'd specifically booked this hotel hoping for a great 5 star experience. 

Our Taj adventure kicked off well, we got picked up from the airport without any issues and the check in procedure was smooth. Initial impressions of the hotel were good. 

However, the following morning, once we had recovered from the jet lag (we flew in from London), I discovered that the room wasn't as clean as we would like and indeed would expect. We found mushrooms growing in our bathroom door. We reported the issue and although the staff came in good time and sorted out the problem, the whole situation did leave us a little concerned about the cleaning standards of the hotel, especially as the friend I was sharing the room with suffers from various allergies and is asthmatic. 

Overall the staff at the hotel were lovely and very friendly and helpful, the only bad experience was with the manager right at the end who we felt brushed the whole mushroom and cleanliness issue under the carpet. 

Such a shame.

Extremely disappointed to know that this is a marriot chain of hotels. Disappointing rooms with loads of mosquitoes in it and arrogant staff. Even after being an silver elite member u r treated like this. Surprising and extremely disappointing. And my stay has just begun. The worst of the marriot properties i have ever stayed at. Please dont visit this if u want to take back a good experiencen of goa

Stayed here for a week to ring in the New Year. On arrival our room was upgraded to a beautiful sea facing room with Sea view and balcony. Appreciate the gesture. Thank you. Unfortunately all the good things for us ended there. 

We're frequent visitors to this resort over the past decade, yet little has changed over time. The most disappointing is the in-room dining menu. We usually prefer personal touch to our food hence refrain from buffet. However visit to the Waterfront was quite appalling. Dirty cutleries. Ordinary ambience. Again nothing has changed over the decade. Service was however alright. 

New Years Eve.
Biggest disappointment. We've decided never to celebrate New Years eve at the Goa Marriott ever again. We booked at the last minute. The allocated table was not available. We waited for 30 mins for a table to be arranged. Finally we were allocated a so called premium arrangement to be shared with another quest after we decided to cancel the booking. The overall experience was quite disappointing. 

Food served in-room dining is extremely average. No taste. Worst we've tasted in any of the Goan resorts. Expensive and bad taste. 

On day of checkout the afternoon flight was cancelled and rescheduled late night. We were allocated an alternate room at no extra cost for late checkout. Great gesture. Thank you. However the room smelled puke. Horrible experience. Felt sorry to put my family through it just to avoid paying an additional day charge for a couple of hours stay. 

For sure we've decided never to visit the Goa Marriott ever again.

We are all so horrified at the standards of this Marriott that we are going to contact the directors of Head Office. The place is falling apart. The rooms are shabby. Maintenance does not appear to be a thing. We paid extra for an ocean view room and could see a big palm tree. This is a 3 star masquerading as a 5 star. 
We checked in New Years Eve and were told there was a party until 1.30am RIGHT UNDER our room. We were annoyed. I'd also asked for one king bed room one twin next to each other. We got 2 twin. They'd got no room. Ok. They could move us the next day. Ok. We got to the room. It's falling apart. Mouldy shower, paper coming off walls, dirty warm furniture even etc etc
The pictures show it way better than I could. We wanted to check out. The assistant manager said we could check out but would be charged for one night. I was furious. After some debate (there should have been none) they offered a free night and an upgrade next day. We said ok. The night was the worst night We've had EVER in a hotel, let alone a 5 star. 
The NYE party was supposed to finish at 1.30. It finished nearer to 3. The room was vibrating til then. Literally the bed was vibrating. The hotel should know how to manage for functions. 
This morning, exhausted, we went for breakfast prepared to get the upgrade and make the most of it. 
Breakfast was just crap. 
We were queuing outside the breakfast room with other guests as we'd been asked to do. 
One guest and his family walked straight in, past staff, straight to a table. No-one stopped them. The staff member managing the line said she could not do anything. Another staff member said sometimes there's nothing they can do. They didn't even say anything to the guest. 
We were sent to a table. They said they'd clean it while we selected food. 
The selection not great. 
When we got back to the table they had laid it, it was "ready" for us. 
It has food all around it on the floor - see the pics. We were expected to sit and eat breakfast with our feet in other people's food. 
My husband nearly lost it!!
We saw the assistant manager and said we're booking out. There is nothing you can offer that will make this place ok. We had already gone online and booked The Leela. 
The assistant manager (Sanket) agreed to a full refund and organised a hotel driver to take us to the Leela at their cost. That was the best he could do in the circumstances and we appreciate that. 
We are in Goa from 31/12 and leave 05/01. 2 days have been ruined. 
We're knackered!
We're at the Leela now. Much, much better. 
My advice. If you want a real 5 star you cannot go to the Marriott. 
Like I said, we'll be contacting the Marriott Head Office.

Recently I visited Marriott to check rooms for my international guests. As i asked the staff to show me certain rooms I was shocked to see staff mopping the floor on their knees. This is never in my wildest dream i expected to see at a hotel chain like Marriott. On inquiry i was told that there are no moppers or mops in the hotel. Does the management know this scandolous situation? Or do they pretend not to know and waited till some guests exposed this. Firstly, this is inhumanitarian, secondly even the cheapest road side guest houses have mops for their housekeeping staff, so for a price charged I am sure Marriott Goa can provide mops to its staff.

we have stayed there for 4 nights in November.....we have booked 5 rooms .....accept food everywhere you are in queue , even making reservation it took us 10 days to confirm ...........no reply of emails & no authorized person to talk with ........ every day diff person with diff stories

We had a very unpleasant 3 day stay at this hotel last month.
We arrived to scenes of chaos in reception with people all crowded around the reception desks. 
We were allocated a comfortable well appointed standard size room, more like a decent 3 or 4 star standard room.
The first night we were awoken at 4am by shouting guests in the corridors. 
The next morning when staff asked how we were enjoying our stay we happened to politley mention this. We were advised there was a wedding and these things happen.
Breakfast was an absolute disaster each morning. You must stand around for 10 minutes before being allocated a table. Only for said table to be taken by other guests as soon as we got up to get food. No fresh juices were available, and a very poor and confused set up.The biggest problem was the queue's for each and every breakfast station. I waited 10 minutes to use the toaster. When we again politely mentioned this we were told that the hotel is full & nothing was to be done.
When we arrived a wedding was in progress. During the rest of our stay the hotel was preparing for their next weddding.
The preparations began as soon as one wedding finished with builders wandering around the hotel painting the common areas. While laying by the pool a painter came and painted the man hole covers with a green toxic paint at peak time at the pool. The smell was atrocious and many guests complained but the work continued. We had no option but to move away from the pool side as did many other guests.
The stay was not relaxing, and we did not enjoy our time there and would not recommend this hotel.
Panjim is quiet with not a lot to do after dark. We picked this hotel as we wanted to relax and be taken care of by Marriott. After all we this is what we paid for.
In reality breakfast was stressful. We continually kept bumping into work men in the hotel and could not avoid the noise from the function room.
We were very disappointed and felt our feedback was not listened to when we provided it.

I stayed at the Goa Marriott hotel from November 18th to the 20st and came away from my stay vowing to never stay at this hotel every again. Not only because of my experience, but because of how I was treated by this hotel and the Marriott brand.

On the 20th, I was approached by an elderly gentleman in the lobby of the Marriott hotel (UK nationality) stating that he had been mugged the night prior, was beaten, and that his passport, wallet, and telephone were all stolen. I immediately let my guard down since I was in the confines of the hotel  what is supposed to be a safe place. The man was well educated, elderly, agitated and seemed to be in very rough shape. Long story short, I helped the individual for over 8 hours in trying to secure him money and a passport (calling supposed relatives overseas; speaking with the UK consulate, etc.) Ultimately, I had a choice. Leave the man with nothing (I had a flight out that day) or try and help him secure a car ride to Delhi  the location of the nearest consulate. I was given details for a money transfer and gave him close to $250. Long story short, no money transfer existed. I was scammed robbed. One could easily say why would you do such a thing? But as a traveler to some very rough places in the world, this was easily the most comprehensive/elaborate ruse I had ever seen. 

Please see details for other individuals conned by the same exact person. This has been going on since 2013 in both Mumbai and Goa. Traditionally it has taken place at the airport or at railway stations. This started in the Marriott hotel -https://www.tripadvisor.in/ShowTopic-g304554-i4228-k6752815-Tourist_scam_warning_James_Watson_near_Marine_Drive-Mumbai_Bombay_Maharashtra.html 

Ultimately, this was a crime that originated on the Marriott property in the confines of what is supposed to be a safe place - and note, a 5 star hotel with a $300+ price tag. Ultimately, I requested that Marriott compensate me for the exact amount lost, whether in the form of credit or even a reimbursement for a single night (compared to how much I spend at Marriott/Starwood ever year, this is pennies). This was the least that could be done, as I not only lost a large sum of money but was emotionally shaken by the events. I was given 2,500 points. Anyone who knows Marriott knows that 2,500 couldn't get you a broom closet at the lowest tier hotel.

First, the hotel handled it poorly. They mentioned time and time again that they would call me, to no avail (even after they mentioned theyd file a police report and immediately get back to me, I again received no call). I was eventually told by the hotel, this is a public place, people are free to come and go as they please, we would like to inform you that the hotel will not take any responsibility as the guest was not the resident of the hotel. First, the hotel should be responsible for providing their guest with a safe environment  that is the bottom line. Otherwise what is the difference between this hotel and a hotel in a war zone? And second, Im not sure how guest vs. non guest changes the equation. In fact, I then called Marriott customer service and asked them how I would be treated by Marriott if I were stabbed (no joke, because I was furious at this point and clearly agitated) and the woman told me the outcome would be the exact same. You would have to contact local authorities. 

Im glad the Marriott cares about providing their guests with a safe environment. Please note the heavy sarcasm. This is a company that clearly operates only for financial gain and has no concern for the safety of their guests. Im appalled and frankly saddened that a company would treat a customer this way. There is no sense or morals here. 

I stay at Marriott/Starwood hotels a minimum of 50-60 days a year. And on top of that, my company uses Marriott/Starwood for their bookings. After this, I will make it a point to ensure that is not the case.

KT

Overall a very bad experience. I was staying for 2 days. The staff is rude and unhelpful. The whole place was managed really terribly during the IFFI event and the manager wasnt even bothered to check the situation. Not sure if i would want to stay here again.

We chose Goa Marriott over Taj or Hyatt (Where we are regulars). This hotel does not qualify the 5 stars rating. We were 3 adults and stayed for 3 nights and 4 days at Marriott on Half Board. While it was a mixed feeling of our overall experience, what I would like to bring to Marriot and customers notice is couple of instances at the hotel, which is not what I expected from a 5 star hotel. 

I received a mail just before one day prior to my arrival (less than 24 hours) stating that the Hotel will cancel my reservation if I do not pay within 24 hours since my card declined due to non-availability of enough credit. To remind them, I would state that the Hotel was supposed to charge me a week prior to my arrival. The Hotel didnt charge me so I used that particular card for shopping. I wrote a complaint mail and called the Hotel personally, after that the duty manager bothered to call me for an apology. 

The rooms are not very accommodating for a family with 3 adults, and the property is also not a big one for the price they charge. The lifts are located at quite a distance from the rooms, so one needs to walk a bit. 

In spite of my booking the room more than a month in advance, clearly stating that I will be accompanied by my senior citizen parents, no one bothered to accommodate us with an accessible room. The AC did not work for all the 3 nights and we were perspiring late at night even after maintaining a temperature of 18 degrees. The balcony door never got locked from outside. We called twice for the housekeeping staff to fix it. The guy came and fixed it but the next time, again it never got locked from outside. The hot and cold mixers are terrible in rooms. No one bothered to replenish fruits in the room after turn down service. It is definitely a very worn out property.


I was not comfortable staying in the same room as my senior citizen parents so I went up to reception desk personally twice to request them for another room. I was very coldly told that there is 100% occupancy and I have to pay and make reservation for a separate room. I challenge the Hotel, at any day between my stay, the Hotel was never 100% occupied. I checked it myself on various sites and there were several rooms available. The front staff was least bothered about the problem I was facing staying in 1 room with my senior citizen parents. 

I paid another 36 grand for a separate bay view room for 2 nights. The horror started just after I made a fresh booking. I was informed I will be given a room by 1 pm and I agreed. I personally went to front desk at 2.30 pm. I was made to wait for 10 minutes and then handed over the keys for room no 338, which was an adjoining room with a barely a bay view. In addition to that, there was a dumping place right in front of my room for house keeping staff so there was a continuous disturbance and high volume conversations of the House keeping boys. 

Why there is no one to check the disturbances from all such instances. This is nuisance for the guests who look for noise free and quiet surroundings. 

After spending 2 hours, I called AYS and spoke to Susheel, duty officer requesting him to accommodate me in another room informing about the problems being faced. The duty officer was very rude in his approach and went to the extent of saying it wont be possible. 

I simply lost my temper and reminded him that we are not talking about Hotel giving me a complimentary room. It is about 36 grand which the Hotel charged me for 2 nights. He just kept the phone down saying that he will get back to me. 

Susheel never bothered to call me back so at 6 pm I called back again and reminded AYS of a room change. With reluctance, I was given room no. 244 on 2nd floor. That is the last room on that wing and right in front of the room you can see boarding point for people going on Mandovi cruise. There was disturbance-starting morning till 6 in the evening. I was so tired that day and gave up entirely and settled for whatever I had.


I had paid for a round trip Airport transfer with the package and I was again asked at check out that how would I be making the payment of the vehicle.

Overall Marriott Goa is super sad in terms of service and you have to pay for everything in this hotel. Some instances are as stated.

Reception staff forgot to serve water or welcome drink. Reservations team is very unprofessional & nobody responds on boardline numbers frequently.

I specifically asked for Times of India newspaper while checking in. I believe no one paid attention to what I wrote in the form while checking in.
Service at Waterfront Caf is even more horrible. The major chaos is breakfast time, which on all 3 days was a big let down. During our stay the food was not refilled and only when we questioned, they were sorry about it. The boys at Waterfront caf are more interested in chit chatting than customer service.
The food is not refilled very often and customers are kept waiting. The taste and options are not great and are repetitive. The coffee/tea came only after reminders and was never hot. Egg section is absolutely a mess and so is tea/coffee. No butter or ketchup on tables.
I was charged for a simple Fresh lime soda while having dinner. The beverages are not included in dinner is what was informed. Awful. 
Fruits not replenished in the rooms.
Housekeeping not attentive.
Beach is not clean or well maintained.
Below average SPA and sheer waste of money.
Casino is chargeable, it came as a surprise to me. Paid 1 grand for each person.
No farewell cake or pastry on the last day.


Overall not at all recommended, super bad experience with such a high cost. Least expected from Marriott.

This was the worst experience of mine with Goa Marriott.

Torn table mats laid for guests, bisleri cartoons scattered all over the coffeeshop, my jeans which went for dry cleaning on my check in came damaged and accepted by the management, elevators from the lobby to the coffeeshop not functional for past 20 days and Hindus please be carefully as they tag their buffet wrong most often and that happened to me again this visit. They tagged pork sausages as chicken sausages. I as a HINDU BRAHMIN am not allowed or ever touched pork n beef in the past 40 years. Pl make sure what you are eating. Look at the pictures for you reference.

Thanks

Reservations team is very unprofessional & lazy...... nobody respond on boardline numbers frequently.
I'll definitely recommend travellers to call & experience the lack of knowledge of reservations staff.

We were in Goa for the weekend and decided to have lunch at the Marriott. After travelling all the way from North Goa where we were staying, we arrived at the restaurant which was a mess (not even half full). Nobody to acknowledge or assist, we walked around looking for a table. We had to literally attract the attention of colleagues to confirm whether we could sit in a particular section. When we requested for the A la carte menu, as we had a late breakfast, we were told that we have to go for the Brunch only and a la carte won't be served. It was a rude shock as not everyone would like the Brunch spread or have the appetite to eat that much. The response was mechanical, the staff looked confused and in rush. A simple apology with a smile would have been sufficient.

Worst experience ever..
The staff here is pathetic..
In the restaurant , we ordered for a chicken burger which was just horrible and left it as it is , later we ordered for a cold coffee ..in the name of cold coffee we were served a better drink which was horrible..
The staff were not at all attentive 
To place one order I had to search for a boy for like 15min..
On complaining the restaurant manager Mr.Brinston had no manners at all to speak to a lady..
Instead of asking us about our issue ,he was fighting with us ..
This is so disappointing..
Finally when we asked for bill, we were charged double..
Marriott Resort has such good reputation worldwide but this one proved to be really miserable..
I am never ever gonna book with this property again..
I was recommended this hotel but I will make sure people know the fact about this property..
Please respect woman !

The rooms have a good view of the bay but it is always occupied with local cheap tourist boats that play loud music. And we found cockroaches crawling freely on the buffet table everyday for three days and once in the salad in room service. A international cricket team was staying along side and we bit our tongues..plus the managers hovered over us to not make a ruckus but seriously kitchen is swarming with the roaches....STAY AWAY

Stayed October 2015, travelled with family

Rude staff especially front desk, resturant, except a few in the conference room.

Food is average, very expensive overall, won't recommend. Roach, insects, spiders, un-cleaned rooms, terrible experience with shower, got burnt due to shower water interruptions.

There are many better hotels at half the price with multi fold better staff for a really nice experience.

I had booked the hotel on 27th Dec 2015 and received a confirmation too from the hotel with my booking confirmation number, I travelled all the way from Jaipur to Goa and on reaching the hotel they tell my they cancelled my booking, I was totally shocked and upset for no reason they cancelled my booking, thy told me on 18th Jan 2016 they mailed my regarding my cancellation, once you receive a booking confirmation and plan your trip who will ever think that in the end moment the hotel will cancel your stay just because they had a system error and thy couldn't use my card.

If this was the problem that same day you should have mailed me when I booked or the same week. How can u cancel my booking just 4 days before my arrival, that too with just a mail. Goa has net issues I couldn't even read my mail on the 18th I was in Goa then for a wedding. #marriott this is not expected from a 5 star property like you. You should have either informed me well in advance so that I could look for a diff hotel, you take the customers phone number, why didn't I receive a call bout my cancellation or the card not working.

Me being a female I had to roam all night alone to look for a hotel and that was a peak time in Goa all decent hotel properties were sold out and all that was available was oyo rooms. 

#marriott you just spoiled my trip.

They person sitting on the front desk did not help and just said we are sold out. Pathetic. And on top this you have no direct number to your hotel. Whenever I called it wouldn't connect to some other country and they wouldn't understand my English language accent. Do something about your services. And atleast with a female you cannot be so non cooperative. 
BAD EXPERIENCE in terms of your staff, booking process. #marriottgoaresort

I have never been to a hotel that is rated a 5* to have had experienced such bad kept rooms. The bathroom had mould around the sides...the glass window between the bedroom and bathroom had hand marks on them....there was mould around the sink....the shower head broke off as soon as I went to lift it to shower...the view from the room was of broken slates...the fruit left as complimentary was old as if it was left there for a few days....the iron did not work and having complained about this it was still not replaced....the wifi went down for a long period of time that I had to go to another hotel to use their wifi and decided to have dinner there aswell....i found the buffet selection boring too....after experiencing what me and my partner experienced having checked in for our honeymoon we asked for a refund....we are still waiting for this and I do hope I get this soon....I do not recommend this hotel its not worth the money...

I have booked a 2 night stay at Marriott resort and Spa Goa viz 29 Jun and 30 Jun. The experience of booking so far has been a traumatic experience wasting almost 6 hours of my time speaking to various executives and getting contradicting statements and rates from 5 executives i am dreading what they are going to finally charge me and what kind of experience i will finally have.
The first day i spoke to Vivek at Goa marriot who gave me a deal of Rs13200 incl taxes per night for 2 adults and 2 kids with breakfast and dinner. This whole coversation almost took about 40 minutes because of the long wait and being put on hold many times after getting the marriott number with great difficulty.
Since it was so difficult to contact Goa Marriott I called at the centralised Marriott number given by Vivek and was put through to Mr ISAAC who gave me a rate of Rs 12250 for the same . When I told him to cross check as the rate quoted by Vivek was higher and kids were accompanying me he said that this was the present rate hence i gave him my credit card details and he sent me a confirmation mail with the booking number as 90380143 in the name of Amar
As i noticed in the confirmation mail that the breakfast and dinner for kids had not been mentioned I called centralised reservation again and spoke to Mr ISAAC again who flatly denied that the rate included my kids whereas i had specially asked him the first time. He then recalculated the rate and told me the rate including kids breakfast and dinner would be Rs 13000. I then requested him to send a confirmation mail and I got 3 copies of the original mail quoting Rs 12250 for 2 adults b'fast and dinner. 
The next day feeling harrassed I made another call and spoke to Ms Shruti and told her that i was totally confused and upset and told her to check the recored message of my conversations.
She was very helpful but quoted a rate of Rs13357 for the same. While I was speaking to Shruti i got a mail from Ms Evanessa Lyngdoh asking me for my credit card detaiuls and surprisingly also asking me as to which marriott hotel i wanted to stay in. Expressing my surprise to Shruti I told her the same and she apologized and said she would send me a confirmation mail about the rate she had just quoted.
Still being naive I thought the matter had finally settled but to my surprise I recieved another mail from Ms Evanessa Lyngdoh who quoted me a rate of Rs 13577 for the same deal.
Disgusted I called Marriott Goa and completed the circle by speaking to Abhishek who said that i would finally be charged Rs 13400.

I must say this has been a very harrowing experience for me so far from Marriott Goa which is rated Number 2 of Goa resorts on your site which is one of the main reasons I booked here but I feel you need to really look into their booking system, and it gives such a POOR impression of the hotel even before check in. Now i am actually wary of what deal Im going to get at check in and am giving second thoughts to weather I should stay in a property which claims to be a 5 star resort but with extremely poor operations

This is not a 5 star property! I normally dont write reviews but this place was just too terrible! 
-The pool and lounge area are dirty and everywhere smells like fungus. 
-We found a huge cockroach in our bathroom (picture available!) and hotel staff thought its not a big deal!
- We had to wait for a table for breakfast for around 15 minutes. Ordered eggs and had to wait another 30 minutes and thsn just when we finished they asked us to leave the restaurant cause they needed to get ready for brunch! 
Overall the only nice thing about this hotel is its lobby! Nothing else is appealing.

We have just spent two weeks at The Marriott,Goa and apart from the staff being wonderful I can't think of another good thing to say! It has very small grounds so the pool, pool bar and restaurant area are squashed up together. They have wedding after wedding and conference people in between so in the 14 days we can't remember a quiet day. Added to this a fleet of up to 12 small people carrying boats continually stop as close to the shore as possible playing very loud music, the crew and passengers shout and the boat engine are revved up constantly. They bring passengers from the town across to the beach at the front of the hotel and seem to delight in annoying the guests. The shore is only a few feet away from the pool area so there is no escaping them! If you have your balcony door open the fumes from the boat engines even come into the room. My husband joked that the only quiet place was in the lift on our own with the door closed! I can only assume that the rave reviews on this website are either written by people who are not used to peace and tranquility or are relations of the owners! Their website promises relaxation and rejuvenation, all we got was constant noise and aggravation! Why are hotels in Goa allowed to get away with this sort of advertisement without saying that they host lots of weddings and conferences which dominate everything?

One should never arrange any conference in this hotel your business will suffer they serve stale food and have absolute amateur staff to manage your important event. On top of this they have courage to ask why we did not complain on time. Non cooperation at its best

Hotel rooms are not very spacious nd even pool is too small.
Even i lost my phone charger nd power bank from the room itself nd thr was no response from hotel staff.food qualityvwas good ..................................................

This is the first time I came to Marriott Goa. I came for a conference here and was excited to stay at their property. Excitement turned to disappointment the moment I reached. I left the bag at the conceirge to register for the conference and get my room key. When I come back, my bag is nowhere to be seen. The guys at the conceirge are looking dumbstruck and questioning each other. I was told by one of them to give them my room number and theyd deliver it there. I went back the room, waited for 30 min, nothing came. Then I went back to the reception / conceirge, and my bag was lying there and no one was bothered. So then I asked one of the guys to deliver it to the room and finally it was there. 
Another instance of disappointment: id set up a wake up call at 7. And this wwad perfectly executed by the staff, only to make me irritated. I received 3 calls 1 minute apart asking me to wake up. I couldnt resist, and I had to snap at the lady calling me. No apologies done!
Another small instance, I wake up at every hotel expectinf the days newspaper to be kept out. Here I found none.
To top up all the disappointment (as if there was less earlier), I was seated for breakfast just about to start my meal. And this person comes and tells me, sit somewhere else... dude! You never ask someone to get up while their eating.. table manners 101!!
The only silver lining at a really horrible service, was the lady at breakfast who apologized and was very pleasant. Also the AC in the room stopped working the previous night and so the repair guys did a fantastic job. The only people whom I really felt nice speaking to was them. Rest all are fakely nice.. just on the outside, they dont reallly care.
I was planning on extending my stay, but clearly that wont happen ever at the Marriott Goa!!
I think just because I was a conference guest I was treated this way.

We found out after we checked in that this hotel is by a river. The Mondovi River to be exact. No where close to the ocean. Felt ripped off. The person who checked us in had the nerve to ask us if we wanted to pay 8000 rupees per day and update to a oceanfront room. My husband said " what oceanfront". Resturant staff are super slow. I had ordered coffee well i got that half hr later but no teaspoon. I had to ask 3 different people until i got one. Very disappointed at this place. Never staying here again

As a Marriott timeshare owner we are able to exchange points to stay at other Marriott resorts, having heard great things about Goa we booked. This hotel drops way below the standards we'd come to expect so much so that we spent the first day researching and visiting alternatives. The staff are very pleasant and eager to help but the food is poor quality. The carpets and wall covering in the walkways are filthy. The shopping complex only has a few occupants the rest are bare shells littered with mess and plate glass windows allow you to see all. The thumping sond track in the well equipped gym may not be to all tastes but certainly destroys any attempt at ambience in the spa directly below. This hotel is not up to Marriott standards, for your piece of mind please explore alternatives. We left after the first day

The food & ambience is good , but we had a horrible experience when we caught the barmen serving some "Ketel One Vodka" when we had ordered & paid for absoulte.. When the barman realized that i was checking the same , he refilled it back in the bottle & bought absoulte from other outlet... well there was no absolute in the waterfront cafe itself. When the issue was bought to managers notice, they created a story of Ketel One vodka being ordered from & then getting cancelled & refilling it in the bottle again. ..

Please check & verify what you are ordering for & what you are getting served in the glass.

My friend and I decided to spend the night as I had a voucher (Marriott preferred) and it was woman's day. Moreover , my friend was visiting me from the US after 4 yrs.

Service has exponentially decreased .....that is the tip of the iceberg!! Last night, there was a puddle of water from the ac (our good luck ..that nobody slipped!) and the ac went off!!! and Goa was indeed v hot yesterday. The only compensation that they can think of...is a complimentary dinner!!!

Our room was dusty when we checked in and the dust was obvious on the dark wooded furniture. The corridor smelt nicer than the room which was so musty.......would not recommend this place unless as a last resort (pun intened).

The quality as well as spread of food at waterfront has been slowly but surely declining.....perhaps comments may be encouraging from first timers or unexposed clentele...but the experienced traveller too should be considered.Service too is on the decline except for the restaurant manager who seemed professional and just a couple of service guys were up to the mark. We are also Marriott rewards members....one being silver!

Stay there ONLY if you must.....but dine in the neighbourhood...Goa has excellent food in it's moderate and smaller joints!

We have been staying at this hotel for last more than 2 years and have stayed for more than 20 times atleast!!! However this time (in December, 2012) the experience was rather terrible :-( the management was pathetic under the manager-ship of Sanket, who didn't have the courtesy of attending their regular customers if they had some trouble with the services of the hotel staff! The baggage management was pathetic and needs improvement... The earlier management was fantastic though!!! They really need to take care of their services else they will loose their customers. The location of course is fantastic especially their bay view patio rooms!!!

The Marriot is a lovely hotel, no doubt about it. The interior restaurants do good food and the buffet deal is very reasonable. However, last night I visited the 'seafood festival' for dinner. It was a horrible experience in all. Put at a table which was in total darkness 'the other tables with lights are booked'. Had to repeatedly ask for a menu and they brought a torch for us to read it. Kept pushing the wine menu at us. Waiters seemed harassed although gathered together in a group for most of the time. The food was truely awful, wrong sauces, wrong orders, wrong quantities and a superior, weary attitude. I don't believe that these staff have ever seen the inside of a training school. The staff inside are quite the opposite. The Mai Tai I ordered was a joke, something my child might make when playing pretend. Whoever runs this festival, management need to be aware how dire it is. I will certainly not return. However the malaysian festivel will start soon and as it is inside, I look forward to it.

Just spent 1 night in august 2012, instead of 3 initially booked: we left immediately after 1st horrible night, and hopefully saved our holidays.

Negative points:
Room is not corresponding to Booking description and our request of a quiet non smelling room with sea view. Management instead of respecting it, tried to sell us an upgrade. Strong smelling fungus in all the bedrooms, of cigarette smokes in bed sheets. 
Window joints missing, glass door of the shower cab collapsed in the hands of our child hurting her. Safety box was blocked after we put our stuff. Extra bed was only a thin layered mattress uncomfortable.
The breakfast buffet included in tariff is a shame in term of quality and variety, not better than in a factory canteen, salad bar is a ridiculous pitiable choice of green peas and corn to assemble, no seafood while just in front of ocean.

Positive point:
We see only one good point; a nice location along miramar beach, at junction between river and sea, in Panaji, the main city of Goa, 45 min from airport. 

Globally this Mariott hotel is a scam for the price we paid of 13,000 INR for one night, Management was only able to ask is if we enjoyed without even inderstanding their errors, or offering us a price reduction.
We switched immediately to Taj Vivanta with a formula including dinner to spend our 2 last nights and saved 150 USD.

The food is terrible and the service is worse. Having stayed at other hotels in India, we were used to good food and service. This hotel was shocking. They couldn't care less. The beaches are dirty and smelly. I think its best you avoid Goa altogether. I think there are much better beaches and hotels in the East than here. Trust me- I have been around if you must know

Before I start the review proper, I want to state that I did not actually stay at the hotel, but was eagerly planning my wedding reception there - for all the same reasons people choose to stay there; renowned Marriott brand, 5 star atmosphere that will impress guests...location in Panjim...etc

I met up personally with the events management personnel of Marriott Goa, to discuss the reception, well in advance (1 yr in advance to be exact). So time constraints, surely was not an issue. These people, on behalf of Marriott Goa, promised to send us details including quotations, menu options etc and very eagerly took down our correspondence details. My family waited patiently for 2 months before flying down to Goa again to check on the progress Marriott events team had made. Another personal visit and we were told that an email had been sent and had probably gotten lost in the world wide web (outright lies obviously). We would like to remind the Marriott staff that they couldve looked at the business card provided to them and perhaps tried confirming via phone - something that better trained staff in other organizations would have done. 

To pacify us, an email was sent on the day of the second visit to explain that the said personnel's 'system was down' (whatever that was supposed to mean..since an email did come out of it) and she would get back to us ASAP....and then......silence for a couple of months more...I sent another email requesting for an update, not to one but to two members of the Marriott Goa team...and still, no reply!

What is the reason for this ridiculous behavior? Granted the hotels core business in not hosting receptions but we did want to put up our guests in the rooms. Perhaps we did not have the right approach? Honestly, short of signing a blank check, I was willing to compromise on a lot of the requirementsbut heck, at least let me know what I am buying..and how long does it take for any professional body to churn out a quotation?!?! Bah..forget a quotation, just a matter of setting up proper communications for an event..Humbug!

Well thankfully I have found a venue and management staff that actually seem interested in running a business and while they do not profess to be 5 Star, their service has proven to be far better than the internationally renowned..My only grouse now is that Marriott shouldnt have wasted my time....If you do not want to do it and/or do not have the capacity to do it, just say that you are fully booked.

If you want to have a good night sleep this is not the place for you! The walls are very thin, so you can hear people walking and talking in the corridors at night and in the early morning. 
The bathroom is disgusting.. And the whole room and the corridors have a bad smell! 

Stay away from the food in the buffet! The food is cold and old. 

Every night you can hear nois from partyboats.. :/ 
I recommend staying at Leela Kempinski! You get sooo much for the money! And you get a nice beach as well.

We stayed here for Christmas 08- it was one of the worst experiences i have ever had at a hotel (i forgot to write a review at the time but was reminded to because thinking of going away this Christmas and agent recommended a Marriot hotel in Eygpt). We booked in on Christmas Eve (stupidly having moved from the Leela to be close to my wife's relatives at Christmas) and the room we were given was appalling- beside some sort of ventilator system for hotel (outside of the window) and the room was dusty and mildewed. At the time our son was 4 months old and was with us and asked to be moved room and for the inconvenience we obviously caused them they gave us the privilege of waiting for close to 8 hours for our 'new' room, which with a 4 month chid is not ideal as you can imagine. When they placed us in a room it that was only very marginally better- i managed to get a chest infection from the air conditioning in the dark dank room they placed me in which took me two weeks to recover from . Essentially they ruined Christmas Eve for us (because we did not get into our room until after 10 pm and restaurants were closing at that time) and my Christmas because i got a chest infection from the horrible room they placed us in. The hotel given the time of year was very busy, understaffed but with a staff that generally could not have given a monkeys about the guests (well us anyway). I would avoid like the plague- the facilities were very average, there is not much in Panji (for tourists anyway) and it is very overpriced for what it proclaims to be. Go to the Leela or one of the Taj's for a 5 star hotel.

It was better when Rajiv Seth was GM, i had parties and well organized.

Then on my 40th birthday i had a dinner party in Chinese restaurant on 7th July 2007, inspite setting menus one week ahead for 40 pax, with the chef and inspite of reminders 1 day ahead. They couldnt manage it.

They messed up my party that you can ever imagine, service was too slow, and can you imagine they made a small 2 kg cake for 40 pax ...A real laughing stock, they gave me discount of the mess they created plus a free lunch or dinner at Marriots Goa, but after this incident i have never again stepped in Marriots.

rude arrogant and very helpless staff, need serious training to get to the standard of Marriot. Had to wait 20 mins to get a drink. Staff was lost, got us cold food and the whole experince was a serious let down. F&B needs serious reviewing. Not the same hotel i stayed at a year ago. Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

What you see is what you believe. The website of this hotel builds of the stay superbly well, but once you reach the property do you realise how hollow the promises are. First of all, this hotel does NOT have a private beach. It overlooks the river and to get a taste of the goan sea, you will have to walk down 5-7 minutes to a near public beach. The check in process took us more than a hour. No not because there was a long que or somethin, just that they did not have the rooms ready. We were asked to use the casino in the mean time to while away our time, but the gentleman in the casino would no allow us as we had technically not checked in as yet. He failed to understand that there was a delay from the management's end in checking us in. We were not even allowed inside the casino. After waiting for an hour, when we finally got our room, the room itself was a disappointment. All in all, it was not way close to what you expect of a Mariott property. HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED!

This was our second stay at this hotel and we must say this hotel has gone from ok (that it was 2 years back) to bad (now). We hear that the last time rooms in this hotel underwent any makeover was more than 6 years back. So, your chances of finding anything new or clean is pretty low. We would rate the hotel to be not even worth a two-star. Given its location and the size, the hotel could have been the top in its class but the poor maintenance has brought it down to pits.

Pick-up from the airport was flawless. It was a shared shuttle and there was some wait involved at the airport but overall it was handled smoothly

Check-in at the hotel is extremely slow. It took forever to have someone attend to us after we arrived. And, even after it was initiated, it seemed like the person had to do a lot of paperwork behind the counter. I couldn't see what he was doing but he seemed to be updating lots of records.

The first room we were given was extremely dirty with rusted shower panels, greasy look on the floor. This, after we had an explicit mail exchange with the reservation staff a priory that we were fussy about the cleanliness because of our child who tends to run around the floor without his slippers. When we complained, we were promptly offered to have a look at the other rooms. We were shown two rooms - none of which were up to our expectations. We offered to come down from bay view room to a garden view room if there were cleaner room available on that side and were asked to wait until they checked it out. It was a long wait and we decided to take our dinner first even before getting a moments rest after we arrived. Post dinner we were shown a garden view room which was even worse - it had seepage on the wall facing the bathroom. What was even more annoying was that the lady at the front desk had the guts to pass the blame for the poor maintenance on the "mositure in the Goa air". We had no more patience to fight and compromised on a room that was far below our expectations. See the attached pictures of this room with grasy floor, cracked walls etc. To make matters worse, we noticed that the mini bar had an open Pepsi can with tissues pumped in. Not sure if it was a ploy to overcharge us or just pure carelessness at ensuring a clean mini-bar after the previous guests left.

When we woke up the other day, we traced out the house keeping in-
charge and requested him to point us to a decent room. He indeed turned out to be a person who knew his job. He took us to one of the cleanest rooms in the hotel and we at last shifted to a room worth staying.

Buffet at the hotel was ok with ample choice of Continental and Indian food but the menu was almost the same every day. As a free gift from the chef, you are likely to find hair in the food. We saw other guests complaining about this too. Speaks a lot for the cleanliness standards at the hotel!

The Glimpses of Goa tour that the hotel offers is avoidable. The guide who took us around was good and knew his job. However, it is too short a tour with only 2 places covered in the whole tour. You would be better off spending this time at a beach or lazing around in the pool.

Overall the only things worth some praise at the hotel are a) the staff - they are courteous and prompt and b) the bar at the pool-side.

Beware of the attempts to overcharge you when you check out. Invariably, you will find that you are being charged for something you never availed of. It happened to us during our last trip and it happened again this time. Seems too much to be a coincidence! Each time however they reversed it promptly without any argument, claiming that it was a mistake.

In summary, avoid this hotel. There are many more properties in Goa that would be worth your hard earned money.

I stayed at the hotel for four nights in the last week of October 2008 i.e. at the start of the 2008-09 season. The property is in a great location for a business traveller but sadly it is not a five star hotel. It needs a major upgrade and lacks consistent standards on food, food delivery, service delivery and customer service. The spa is very old and shabby with dust accumulating on the walls. The steam room has the words in an "in an emergency -pull stop" painted by hand directly on to the wall in a similar fashion to signs painted in Indian Railway compartments. The bathrooms in the rooms themselves are old, have plastic toilet seats, sharp edges and pinch risks and generally need an upgrade. 
Cutlery used is variable in that one will find a fork of one design and a knife of another and a spoon of a third. Room service trays will vary from one day to the next in terms of condiments and tray settings. I ordered a club sandwich and I was asked, would I like the bread "roasted" or plain? I said, toasted would be fine. I get a call a few minutes later from a very enthusiastic person "Sir, I would like to grill the bread for you, you would like it, let me grill it just a little." I said go ahead and grill it. Well it arrived with the bread "grilled a little". It was soft with just the grill marks to show and came with undercooked fries. I had no idea that a club sandwich could be the subject of such mystery and confusion. 
Buffet breakfast is offered with a large variety but sadly a lack of standards pervails. The sambhar in the Indian section was over salted, the egg counter chef needed three goes to get fried eggs "over easy" done. The mixed cutlery pervades the restaurants as well. 
The executive lounge has families with young kids using it as well. So having a business meeting there may not have the hushed atmosphere you might like. 
The hotel does not have a concierge, it has a "taxi counter" whose function is not to get you a taxi but to offer a hotel car at exhorbitant rates. When I asked for local taxi rates I was told that they had no idea. You get the drift, "rip off" the tourist.
All in all, disappointing for a Marriott and not value for the exhorbitant 200 dollars per night for what is essentially a 4 star locally run hotel.

Liked  Good business location and nice property
Disliked  Lack of standards Needs uplift

Pretty OK hotel. The serivce should be worked upon. Calls to room service or requests to the reception sometimes had to be made twice/thrice or were answered really late.

The hotels tennis court is/was in terribly state. 
The hotel has everything in it except a beach, but the everything that it seems to have, looks like it has been stuffed in. The Small Pool, The Pool Bar (In a Small Pool), Just One Major Restaurant, Really Small Casino (Please dont enter with women, this place is strictly for guys).
We went to other hotels for dinner etc and found out some better hotels had the SAME prices, so i would suggest you people to take a good long look at the options.
I would suggest this hotel only and only if you have a really good deal, cause there is no beach the hotel offers, IN GOA. 
I am surely not staying at this hotel, more cause there are better hotels offering better/same deals with good beaches. And thats what we want in Goa.

This was our third visit to the Goa Marriott and will probably be our last. Our first visit was in 2005 when it was amazing and it seems now that the hotel needs a bit of a "tidy up" and some areas are looking distinctly tired. Room was very clean as always but the bathroom, specifically the bath and tiling were in need of updating. Paintwork on the outside of the hotel in some areas was very poor. Our room was on the top floor, sea facing (amazing view) next to the tennis courts. This part of the hotel is looking very untidy and I discarded the photographs I took of the room from the gardens, I was too embarrassed to show them to friends. I was extremely sad to see the "net" over the outside dining area. I know it was there to keep the birds away from the food but it looked like it was just cobbled together, really spoilt the look of the hotel. 

On the plus side, staff were, as ever, very helpful and all my moaning aside, we had a relaxing vacation. 

As our last visits have always been over the Christmas/New Year period we had not experienced the hotel when full of business people. This time we visited in February and really did not enjoy being oggled by business people (mostly men) when relaxing on the sunbeds. I would advise to definately check to see if there are conventions on when visiting the hotel.

Must mention the Cake Shop - it is absolutely brilliant. The cakes are amazing.

Starting from the best aspects of the hotel and working down: the hotel itself has great service, good food, nice gym, decent spa, older style rooms that are clean, but the hotel is in a TERRIBLE location. The hotel is essentially in the middle of nowhere and you need a taxi or motorbike to get anywhere off the property - 20 miles to anything fun. Sadly the beaches around this hotel are some of the dirtiest I have ever seen (see pictures 50 yards from hotel). They make an effort to keep things somewhat clean directly around the hotel but beyond 50 yards itts horrible. In addition there is nothing to do/eat or see within walking distance of the hotel. I was a bit confused why Frommers touts this as a great location when it is in the "middle of nowhere" I took a taxi and drove all around and for my money the Fort Aguada Beach Resort would have been the best location. Although I did not go inside it clearly had a better/cleaner beach and within a short way from an actual village with restaurants/shopping, attractions and night life. I am American and I travel a lot for business in Asia, and should have folowed by normal instincts and not stay at an American Chain while in Asia/India (Four Seasons does not count since its Canadian and they do have wonderful properties in Asia) Fort Aguada Beach is run by Taj Group which is an Indian company managing high end properties.

I booked this because of the previous reviews - but we were really disappointed. Of course, it's about what you expect - so the Marriott may be suitable for some - not for us.
Overall, this is a rather noisy conference and package tourist hotel with ok service in a remote location.

Let's start with the good things:
Service is very friendly. People are nice. It's located directly at the channel (not the sea!) so you always have a nice breeze. Breakfast ist really stunning. A huge variety and high quality - throughout. The spa is nice as well. The hotel has a good standard (somewhere around 4 Star with some 5 star features). 

Here is what we did not like:
The hotel campus is rather small with just a 6-10 meter stretch of grass/pool between the wall at beach and the hotel itself. Within this rather small campus, all guests, the pool as well as restaurants try to find space - so it has a rather crowded feel. About half of the guests are UK package tourists and teh remainder 1-2 day conference guests, meaning there is lots of checking in and out all day. The hotel put's itself into the entertainment category. During dinner, there is always rather loud live music (african, 60's or a mix of both) playing. Given the small campus, it's hard to escape. In addition, we had large garden parties for the conference guests in the remainder of the garden for 4 out of 7 nights with own live music and buffet. So conversation during dinner is a real challenge. Luckily, our room was in the wing without garden so we could at least sleep - but our friends had the "party garden side" and were less lucky. To make things worse, the large discotheque on reception level operates twice a week. The lack of sound insulation means you get full sound from two sides during some dinners. Again, some may like this - for us it was hell. The building is the typical Marriott with US-style hallways and the normal amenities (could be anywhere in the world - few Indian touches). As to the service, it was ok but far from consistent. The mini-bar refill happened only twice in a week. Some appliances were broken and took days to get fixed. The room service did refill shampoo one day - not the other day, etc. Nothing major and well made up for by the friendly staff.

If it would have been less noisy and intimidating, we would have forgiven the details - but this was one week of unwanted "party" and not relaxing at all.

So if you enjoy entertainment and fun and do not normally spend time in 5* hotels, you will like this place. If you prefer intimacy or romance or local touches, stay away.

Liked  friendly staff
Disliked  noise, loud music, conference guests

This hotel does not meet the standards of brand Marriott at all, some team members of the hotel lack very simple hospitality ethics, they just don't smile and service at dinner was extremely bad, shame that we coudn't enjoy their good food.
