We just stayed for 3 nights in February 2013. We were two couples essentially with our rooms being as far as almost 1.2 a km from each other :( distributed over two wings and one needs to take different lifts for different levels and a little walk to reach each other. Rooms are nice but balconies crammed up for space. One of the queen beds of the two in each room had a broken mattress that can cause one immense back ache by the time one wakes up early in the morning. Service is average with beverages (aerated drinks/sodas) being not only very expressive but ridiculouslycharged differently when taken from minibar or ordered from different sections of hotel. Complimentary Breakfast was nice and sumptuous but there seem to be lot of confusion among the zealous waiters. Swimming Pool although "infinity" do not necessarily give you that feeling and perhaps should have been raised a bit. Jacuzzi at the pool was non functional. There is no beach where one can take a walk and dip in the waters, apparently its on riverfront and not sea front. Our room was on the right wing facing the river with adjoining lawn hosting wedding parties and receptions causing avoidable disturbance and noise through out the day thereby encroaching upon the privacy so desired in a 5 star property. Normally most 5 star hotels have the party-area away from the main rooms. Located far away from the happening area of Calangute-Bagha-Anjua and Morjim, one would certainly need a car to be able to move around Goa from here. Just because our rooms were sponsored and hence free for us, we did not mind staying here but i wont like to pay and stay here.

we had to wait a long time at the recepction during check-in and were initially not willing to give us the room we had requested and after arguments they allotted us the room of our choice. House keeping is very poor. we found a dead cockroch in the bathroom.

Goa Marriott is always my second home. Been visiting the place for almost 6 years now. Used to love the way you are treated there. But recently i heard that the things are not great there. Until i landed there myself to get a first hand experience...

plus points - great place to relax, awesome view for the river, nicely renovated rooms, 

minus points - customer care is bad, no proper person to guide you, the telephone operator messes up your calls big time, staff at the restaurant are rude, breakfast menu is complete cut down version( far far below standard) .. all these experience put you off big time. It actually can ruin your great holiday. 

Looks the staff is new and inexperienced. 

So if you are to going to take room service or eat at the resort , and just want to stay there... then go ahead. 

But i need to mention a few people who really tried to go out of their way to sort things out..
1. The GM of Marriotts who upgraded my room after a week of haggling to confrm my booking with the privilage members section
2. Delilah of front office who called to find if everything was okay.
3. Ashwani Kumar , Assistant manager -concierge, who actually reimbursed my breakfast bill for a lousy rude attitude of the staff.

There are some good people at the resort who can go out of their way to help your stay a pleasent on, but the majority are just rude.

I booked a 5 night stay here over park Hyatt as this got slightly better reviews (only marginally).

However, this is NOT a 5 star property, at best it is an average 4 star property. The word "resort" is also slightly misleading as the property is quite small with what can only be described as a decent size childrens pool.

So the positives, airport transfers were on time and communications were good prior to booking. The check in was smooth too and the cleaners do a good job on a daily basis. The gym was pretty good too.

The negatives:

Breakfast and dinner - we booked half board (which I wouldn't recommend). Breakfast was ok but the food for dinner was very poor. I would've expected that the Indian section would at least be decent but it wasn't, it was mostly bland with hardly any flavour. 

The "waterfront restaurant" is more like a cafeteria with very poor ambience. Service was hit and miss too, ordering eggs and tea for breakfast took over half an hour on the 2 mornings they actually got it right. The other 2 mornings, what we ordered never arrived after waiting for 40 mins so we just left.

Although we had half board, we had dinner at local restaurants on most nights which was 10 x better.

Staff - on the whole were pleasant to deal with. Urmilla our cleaner did a great job with our room every day.

One thing I didn't appreciate is the kickbacks the hotel receives from the cab companies. The 2 occasions we asked the hotel to call us cabs, the prices were hugely inflated and they insisted we pay the hotel staff the fare instead of the driver. 

We took a cab to one of the markets by hailing it ourselves, cost - 150 INR. Asked the hotel the following day at roughly the same time, cost - 300 INR. Appreciate there may be an admin fee for picking up the phone but double the fare ??

Same with airport transfers upon departure, asked for a Normal cab, cost - 1500 INR. Asked the drivers how much they usually charge, they said 800 to 1000 INR max. Again had to pay the staff directly rather than cab driver. 

I am a Marriott reward member and thought these types of practices were above Marriott but this "resort" showed a real lack of class. Definitely not what I expect considering I paid circa 250 per night.

In conclusion, the resort kind of reminded me of the places I used to stay when I would go on cheap holidays in my teens with friends! Definitely not 5 star and I'm really surprised by the amount of positive reviews.

If you want 5 star/luxury, this is definitely not the place!!

I was expecting a relaxed holiday at the Marriott Goa Panjim, so have made some the reservation given my requirements. I had email and even had a call to confirm that the room should near the elevator as I am traveling with a Sr.citizen who can walk much, It was confirmed that We would get a room as per my requirements. However when i reach the hotel, I got a room away from the elevator. We asked them that we had requested for room near the elevator, however the front desk informed that it was a the closest room to the elevator that was available, after confronting with the front desk that our prerequisite was for the room near the elevator which I was assured by the hotel, we were given a rooms near the elevator the next day. 
The house keeping staff was prompt to our request and theydo a good job to keep the hotel clean. However the bathroom tiles had mold and that was the case in both the room. the bath tub hand shower were leaking which spilled the water out of the tub. In the elevator there is a wooden handle missing and the screw/nails jutting out of the wood, luckily one us escaped with a minor scratch, however these thing should taken care of. You don't expect such thing for in 5 star room where you are paying around $1000 for 3 nights. I have stayed at the other Marriotts before and even their Marriott courtyard are better maintained.
Now for the food, 1st day we have in room lunch( and at night we had a-la-carte at the waterfront; both meals were good. The breakfast for all the three times looked the same. the cakes and juices were the same for the 3 days. On Sunday the breakfast kheema (minced meat ); to our surprise the same kheema(minced meat ) was served as " Today's special" in the Dinner! The Buffet dinner was average where you had to ask the staff to warm up the gravies. 
We tried the Simply Grills restaurant for dinner one night the food was great, However they charged us higher that the prices mentioned on the menu. Which we had to point out to get it rectified.
So overall the hotel didn't meet our expectations. We have stayed at the other 5 star hotels like Taj (Augada and Exotica), Grand Hyatt and Holiday inn in Goa, and their level of service in all aspects are far superior than Marriott Goa.

This is one place that should be avoided if you don't want to ruin your Goa experience . 

Never ever we had experience such terrible hospitality at any Marriott property across the world 

We had booked 3 rooms for our group of 6 in this so called luxury resort but that was a very big mistake 

We arrived at the hotel around 2 pm and during check in we were informed that rooms are not ready and will take some time . Miss Arantxa checked us in and gave us an upgrade on all three rooms from garden view to bay room for late check in . We signed all the forms and room nos were alloted. We proceeded for lunch on assurance from her that rooms will be ready by the time we have our lunch and luggage will be shifted in them 

When we arrived after lunch , our room nos have changed and we had been downgraded and were asked to wait as rooms were not ready . On asking why rooms have changed when we had been alloted rooms she said I can't help you on that . So much for hospitality 

When we finally got the rooms , one room was stinking badly . On requesting the house keeping they sprayed a room freshener . But the smell did no go and had to call the house keeping again after 2 hrs . 
We told them that we are going out please sort out the smell issue by the time we come back .On returning at 1:00 am they smell was unbearable . On contacting the housekeeping they again sprayed some room freshener and asked us to stay 
But the smell was too much to tolerate and when we blasted the duty manager that they got down to change the filter of Ac . Even after changing the filter when the smell did not go , we were asked to shift to different wing of the hotel with a 3 yr old daughter half sleeps somebody's room . 

It was decided that the hotel can't do anything so we opened the windows and sprayed our perfumes on the blankets and went to sleep .

The next morning on meeting the resident manager Mr Randal that the problem was sorted when he gave us a new room . 

The attitude of the staff can be gauged from the fact that when we ordered coffee at poolside it was refused saying that it is not served there. But we could see that it being served to other guests . Again on talking to duty manager mr Vinay did we got coffee served 

On check out mr Sushil the person at the billing said there was no smell in the room and we had created unnecessary fuss . Then he said that he will wave of 500/- the internet usage charges for our discomfort . 

Luckily Mr rudolf was passing by and he refunded us one night stay . Though the resident manager had the courtesy to refund one night charges still there is lot to be down by this property to come to Marriott standards . 

Thank you Marriott Goa for spiking our holiday

Old run down property. Not renovated at all.
Maintenance is clearly an issue as is housekeeping - the windows and glass was dirty and no one has bothered cleaning it.
The service was very good but that was it.
There are far better places to stay in Goa. I would skip this place.

I am a Starwood Ambassador Guest for many years (over 100 nights a year). With the merger I was given Platinum Status with Marriott Hotels. I reserved a water view room in Marriott GOA. 4 Days out before my arrival the price of the suite on the internet was cheaper than my water view reservation. I phoned Marriott and they told it was to late (within 7 days of arriving). The morning before I arrived the web site still showed a suite available for the entire stay cheaper than reservation. When I arrived the hotel told me all suites are sold out. This scares me with the merger. Starwood would always match the hotel rates no matter what the situation. 

The hotel is a 3 floor hotel. Unless you smoke you will not be on the top floor. The hotel has not been sound proofed and I was able to hear my neighbours kids cry in morning very clearly. The rooms are not what I would consider close to a 5 star hotel. The resort is small and seems old but the location is good. It is not good value for the money with rooms. 

The restaurants and Lounge were very good. The staff was also very friendly

Just checked into this hotel yesterday for 5 relaxing nights after a hectic 10 days travelling around India and nobody mentioned the building work going on around the pool from early morning to evening. The banging and drilling is very off putting when around the pool area. The work is in front of the " Oceanside" buffet restaurant which now has no Oceanside views because of the large tarpaulin put up as barriers. No mention on their website about this work either. The Internet by the pool area is also very intermittent and cuts out regularly. For a 5 star hotel, charging these prices one would expect a lot more.

I live in India I don't get a lot of breaks or vacations. So when I do I want a good experience. We this was not a good one. We picked Marriott because I am a member and I always love them. When we arrived the hotel was old and they said it was 17 years old in fact. I still thought ok well it's a Marriott so they will make it better. But I was very very wrong. Yes it was raining and that it didn't help. Because we had to stay inside the hotel most of the time. 

1. The food was just ok nothing like other Marriotts and it was really over priced. 
2. We asked for a room with a balcony so we could at least sit outside. I said cost was no problem. They said next day we could move to a better room. After I called all morning to move they called at 2 and said we could move. I had booked a massage at 2 so I would have to miss it. But we really wanted a better room. They moved us to the same room just on bottom floor. I said to them I wanted a better room this is the same room. They said they didn't have any other rooms I said why move me then? They said the next day they could move me again. I said no I will leave if you can't move my room. I asked them to please call me back. They never did so I changed my holiday to leave early. When I went to check out they then said they are sorry we are leaving and gave me my bill. I said wait you're charging me for today I'm leaving today because you said you don't have the room you said we could have. They said sorry you didn't tell us 7 days before. I said I didn't know 7 days before you wouldn't have the room we asked for. So I said call the manager please. Then they said he was not there they are the managers. I said call him now please. They said he wasn't in the hotel. I said call him then they said oh he's here. He was standing 5 feet away!! So then I told him my story and he then went and asked his staff if this was true. They all told him yes. So they didn't make me pay for the room. 

This was the worst experience I have even had at a Marriott and to be treated like this was crazy. 

Make sure you book the room you want and make sure you get it day one. Don't put up with talking to anyone but the manager the staff will just lie to you. 

The best food we had was the bar free happy hour. 

The massages we finally got booked was very good and we got treated well. Ps you should have a bathing suit for the spa. 

Good luck on your trip

Had a feeling am going to the best Resort in Goa as I visited Marriott for the first time in 2014. But over the last 2 years, feel the customer service, especially at the front desk has really come down. Two instances which would make it clear. Being a member of their dining program, I went in an off-season to avail my free night. But much to my dismay, the room i was given was the corner mnost dingiest room anyone could get. And indeed miles away from the main restaurant with absolutely zero-views!! Secondly, next day when I seriously thought of staying till around 3 PM as my flight from the airport was at 6PM, they turned down my request stating that at best i can stay till 1PM. Well, both these instances made me slightly un-welcome and even though their breakfast was a Silver lining and absolutely fantastic, but apart from it I feel this property cares zero for its own members.

We stayed for 3 nights with two of our children aged 1 and 6, at Marriot. While it was a mixed feeling of our overall experience, what i would like to bring to Marriot and customers notice, is couple of instances at the hotel, which is not what i expected from a star hotel. 
1. Check in at Marriot is at 4 p.m. and check out is at 12 noon. So based on that you will need to make your flight/travel arrangements. Their lunch timings is 12.30 p.m. to 3 p.m., so if you are making a full board booking (including all meals), be assured to miss the lunch
2. On our first day, we went to the beach and were surprised that it was not kept clean. There were hundreds of dead fish, bottles & plastic at the shore and it was unsafe and unhealthy to take the kids for a fun time. Would have expected Marriot to have kept their side of the beach neat, which they did eventually after two days of customers complaining.
3. On the second day of our stay, of course in a holiday mood, we slowly reached the restaurant at 2.45 p.m., but were surprised that none of the staff cared to attend to us. Rather they were closing the buffet services and we and kids were given the last morsels left. The food was being scraped from their vessel to serve it to us. The starters were not refilled and only when we questioned, they were sorry about it and tried to make something from the kitchen. It would have saved us the trouble, if customer service was their utmost priority and they did not want us to let them know of it.
4. The buffet food is not refilled very often and customers are kept waiting. The taste and options are not great and can be improved. Bakery items are good though
5. The rooms are not very spacious for a family with kids, and the property is also not a big one for the price they charge. The lifts are located at quite a distance rooms, since the property is long, so there is a need to walk a bit.
6. On the day we left, they gave us a bag of goodies for kids, and it was nothing but chocos dipped in chocolate sauce and it was really sad. Would have been better they did not give it.

I would appreciate the hotel for things they did, like ones below:
1. Really appreciate Elizabeth from front office and Joseph from restaurant services, who were really sweet and did their best to make us feel comfortable.
2. While the swimming pool has the beach view and is beautiful, it is small in width and quite long. The guards at the pool ensured the kids were safe inside the pool, and they took turns to keep a watch on the kids, without any neglect.
3. Children's play room is good and has a variety of things for kids to play. From books to read, puzzles, toys, Foosball and painting, it is a joy for kids.
4. The property has a beautiful beach view, and room service is good. Not sure if they surprised us with cleaning the room, when we came back from the beach.

Overall, Marriot at Cochin, can surely pass a skill or two on customer service to Goa Marriot. Food-Taste, Quality and options, Hotel Service and Hospitality at its best in Cochin Marriot.

Property: Is not very huge for 5 star resort, but of a decent size. Adjacent to beach(River) but didn't seems to be a private beach.

Pool: is very small. but timings are awesome. open till 11pm.

Parking: Every time Valet use to give my car keys to my hand instead of getting my car, and that so sad for Marriott.

Restaurants: Chinese Restaurant(Wan Hao) is sad not worth the money, Main Restaurant's service is awful.

Service: Marriott Goa is super sad in terms of service, 
- Reception staff forgot to serve a water or welcome drink, 
- Service at main Restaurant is even more horrible: There were no napkins or cutlery at table and we got those even after two reminders, we ordered for simple masala dosa and we got that after 40 mins(almost after we finish our breakfast)
- Mr Manu Nair(F & B Manager) sent a sorry cake at our room but again without any spoon, what is Marriott upto???
- Lift stuck almost every time at ground floor, no maintenance at all and the excuse by bellboy was "Sir its a 16 year old property"...so what? Please repair guys, its not a small town single star hotel.
- When we came back from pool, one of our room was open and no one was around. when we tried to search, suddenly a guy came from far lobby and told us that they are cleaning the room, you guys can clean the rooms but someone has to be thr always, normally we just kept out valuables on table or desk.


Overall: Not at all recommended by me and my family, super bad experience with such a high cost. Not expected from Marriott :(

PS: I know the General Manager will share his same old apology jargon(Copy paste sorry words... Thank you for taking the time to pen...)

The property looks awesome in pics on the Internet. It is very highly rated on a few websites

These things got us fooled.

We chose Goa Marriott over Taj Village and Grand Hyatt (Where we regularly go).

Reception Staff was very very courteous and nice. That was the only bright spot.

But overall I thought that the hotel was hugely overpriced.

Breakfast was very crowded and nearly fixed menu on all 3 days.

Rooms were smaller and conjusted as compared to other hotels worth the same price.

Room Service and food was good at times and very bad at timorth

Pool is very small and just of 4ft depth.

Overall - my worst stay at Goa.

Costa del sol, in India. No charm, tacky, expensive, terrible food and cheesy happy hours. We arrived and they didn't have the room we booked so we had to pay a lot for an upgrade, which should have been given free of charge as the fault was theirs. The hotel is totally dated, no beach. Breakfast was not good. Not worth the money. Stay somewhere with spirit!!

The cold cut selection had anaemic chicken salamis and nothing else. Possibly the worst I have seen in any hotel of this category.The egg benedict arrived cold. The ham on it was pale and limp , the bread dead. The potato wedges were soggy and cold . Egg benedict is meant to be a sinful indulgence .This one looked like I was in a remote Russian motel in the late 90s . In winter .The executive chef would do well to try the dish in Zoe's in Mumbai or even Saltwater in Bandra. And i will never understand why Marriott cant have some decent Goan bread - Unde , pao and poyee .
Now you would say most of the guests in this hotel are Indians and dont really want an eggs ben or a fresh sausage.
So lets talk about their South Indian breakfast -
Dumpy , hard ,cold solid idlis sat in the warmer heavy with yeast.The chutneys - if a Cafe Madras or MTR cook served them he would be executed not sacked. The sambar was watery and lukewarm . The "ghee" for the gunpowder was in the process of solidifying . The upma in the buffet was cold and dry totally devoid of the moist flavour that it meant to have .In his effort to make me a crisp Dosa the chef burnt it bitter ! Knowing food in big branded hard marketed chain hotels I had gone in with modest expectations primarily because the hotel has a good waterside location.But Marriott Panjim was worse than those modest expectations .The coffee came repeatedly not so hot . The staff are extremely charming , courteous, helpful and friendly.They were nice shirts with stylish red buttons and cool M ! They do structured well coached PR with guests. But they cant compensate for the terrible food that would put a roadside place in Queensway or an Udipi out of business in 7 days if not 3 !

Location of the Marriott Panjim property is wonderful - views stretching from Cabo Raj to Aguada - nice boat marinas , right in Panjim city, just on the rivermouth, the riverfront promenade well laid - out, the lounge at the lobby is excellent .. guys at the security pretty decent and helpful .. that's the good part.

The F & B team at the restaurants ... attitude resembling ex - bureacrats after early retirement .. Was there 28th - 30th March ' 15 ; Simply Grills the riverfront seafood area was proud to declare that no seafood available after 7 PM ... great tearing hurry to shoo guests away. The display counter was kept deliberately empty.
Went on to the Coffee Shop; Marriott stewards/stewardress would not allow us to sit outside in the open area late in the evening as it was "too humid for them to serve there".. never mind that the guest is ok to sit in humid conditions. We dutifully agreed not to sit outside as we thought that the stewards / stewardress might be worried about their own make-up & hair being spoilt in the heat !! So we no options left within Marriott Panjim Goa ; we walked down to the excellent Mum's Kitchen ( 5 minutes away) for a delicious meal of .. think what "seafood"
Not much imagination in the Coffee Shop buffets .. just the same oily stuff rotating. There is a Chinese section tucked away on the right which is somewhat better.

So location great , service " a huge no comments".

Lest anyone reading this feel that this review is from a one-time visitor ; I have lived in Panjim for 6+ years and been seeing how this property has been trending in terms of service.So this review comes after probably 60 + visits incuding weekend room stays , restaurant visits etc. You can really feel the difference when you experience the warmth at the other 5 star property located in Panjim.

We are goans and have been coming to this hotel for years.... But never experienced such embarrassment. We came to eat at the waterfront and requested the staff to serves us by the pool at the grill restaurant. My ceaser salad and wine was served but when my guests joined us they said they couldn't. We requested them to make an exception but Akash at the grill restaurant was soo rude and strict with policies. If we wanted we could have made few calls and being hotelier ourselves making an exception to delight the guest is taught and followed. Shame to see such an amazing hotel with amazing food is getting worst because if such staff. But an exception was the waterfront staff who were amazing and wanted to help us but got manipulated by Akash and other grill staff ( as they were ganging up behind the bar and discussing what to say) exception for Chagan for his extra services and good communication skill.

The property is located centrally and quite convenient. It is clean and well kept. But this is all there is to recommend it. Their hospitality is wanting. 

I am currently attending a conference at this hotel, and was shocked to find the mini-bar locked (it was previously open) when I returned to my room. On enquiring, I was informed that the hotel co-ordinator asked the doors to be locked for all guests attending the conference. I cannot help but wonder at how arbitrarily it has been done. I know that the mini-bar services need to be paid for, and it is obvious that the bill can be settled while checking out. Somehow, this is something that is obviously beyond the hotel management to understand.

It is surprising that a purportedly 5 star property not only contradicts all tenets of hospitality, but it also violates guest privacy, with hotel staff entering at will, at odd times and making any changes they want in the guest's absence, on orders of some vague people. It was obvious that the staff did not come to make the beds or for any other purpose, as the room is otherwise in exactly the same state as it was before I left for dinner. I find this absurd and absolutely disgusting. If it were not for the conference that I am attending here, and the people who I know staying here as well, I would have checked out immediately.

Me and my family had gone to get in my brothers b day the food on the buffet is mostly veg 1 mutton 1 chicken 1 mix sea food curry 1 beef in sauce n the rest of the buffet was veg the service was ok the waiter lacked of wine n food knowledge NEeds training

We booked for a second floor room, and front desk give us a first floor room humid , the walls has holes the room number was 176 and price cuality Not good... I still smell humid a lot and the floor have some ceramic broken... It look old

Disappointing all round. The rooms were very varied despite same fee. The pool is small and not separate from families. Breakfast was horrible. Staff are friendly. Loud and obnoxious family groups in which the staff members did nothing to quieten them down, especially by the pool. For the cost of this hotel and the facilities I would not recommend it. Much more value at the Park Hyatt. Disappointing and well over priced.

This hotel does not qualify the 5 stars ratings, after reviewing comments reported in here I truly wonder whether I stayed in the same Mariott hotel in Goa! First of all this hotel is need a major housekeeping "clean up" and upgrade/refurbishment; 
Walking the guests corridors you will get a preview of what guests rooms might look like..dirty/stained carpets, torn wall papers.in my room(211) I requested the broken lamp shade to be replaced, one of the mounted wall reading lamps remained loose the entire stay, dark stained bathroom edges, shower out of order even It was mentioned to guests services for repair,no follow up on the matter, I finally gave up all bed pillows could do with replacement etcSo much for housekeeping services!
Occasionally I returned to my room when Attendant were servicing and cleaning, at no time I was asked for my identity, I was allowed to walk in freely. Else where normally he/she would let you in only once the key card would have been validated and verified.So much for preventive security!
The breakfast service was simply pathetic as after a week long stay you don't get to see any food variation, it takes ages to get the first coffee serving, well very much "canteen style" set up!
Last don't come up with too complicated services requests that are out of the limited routine, staff is not well trained to respond rapidly and creatively, everything out of line seem to be much efforts askingoften frustrating!
Staff is generally working hard, attitude is somewhat robotic often avoiding guests contact and greetings, a pity as from experience in other Hotels in India, people can truly be friendly and attentive.
This is not a cheap hotel to stay and except for its location I certainly would not choose to return!

We had an enjoyable stay at the Goa Marriott end of January.
The staff were nice and friendly. Special thanks go to Delila Almeida at the front desk for making our stay a memorable one.
The pool and facilities were good. It is unfortunate that one could not swim in the river/sea because of undercurrents and pollution.
Overall, a pleasant place to stay in Goa !

We stayed in " Bay view-Patio" room. Location of these type of rooms is adjacent to beach yet it's very peaceful. Staff is extremely courteous. Good breakfast spread, lovely ambience. V good spa. Nice pool with bar. If you are looking at having a peaceful break, this is the place for you. Since it is v close to Panjim city, you can go around the happening places as well.

It is an excellent place to stay at this resort. Rooms are very very tidy and very much spacious. The staff here are very much cordial. The bay view rooms are simply superb as u can just have a view of the sea from your bed itself.We can spend our complete day here enjoying at the beach as they have a private beach access. They even provide with cycles if you want to go for a cycle ride near the beach.They even have the sitting chairs just to sit and have the view of beach.They have spa services which are free for the guests. They have kids room where from a toddler to teens can enjoy and the staff over there are so helpful that u need not worry the child's security even if you are not available for 10 mins around. They have a private swimming pool area which is very well maintained and very decent. They even have casino over there. Related to food, the breakfast is the one you can vouch for. Very delicious, u have so many varieties ranging from south Indian, continental, north Indian,veg, non veg everything. We being vegetarian had so many options to taste l really felt cherished to see so many options like idli,dosa,vada and the list continues. The fruits and sprouts were also there along with juices. A special mention has to be done for parathas as they prepare simply superb ones giving us a feel of a true north Indian one. A special mention for Mr. Sahil who was there at the front desk who provided us with the bay and double bed accommodation.He was so helpful and so genuine and told us also the options which are available for the guests during our stay.There is nothing to complain or find discomfort in the services provided. The only suggestion I felt was if they have some rooms in cottages style or say villa style which will be like feather on a cap.

I went with my wife for short 3 day trip to Goa and stayed in Marriott. Stay was really comfortable. Excellent breakfast and great dinner in hotel outlet 'Simply Grills ". This outlet is open air next to the pool facing the beach with great view. Staff in the hotel is very friendly and helpful. Wish to make special mention of Sanket Athavale-Asst. Front office Manager. Guy like him is an asset for any good hotel. He was extremely helpful and took care of us. Overall had a good 3 days stay in the property.

I stayed in the Goa Marriott towards the end of my holiday in India as we'd be staying in some basic accommodation and needed a little bit of luxury before flying home. The welcome at the hotel was fantastic - fresh juice and a complimentary upgrade to a sea view room. We decided to pay 2000 rupees per day to have access to the exec lounge (free soft drinks all day, 5-7pm free alcoholic drinks and buffet and breakfast) which was well worth it. The pool area is nice, the hotel in good condition and staff fantastic. We tended to walk into the main town and went out to a few fun karaoke bars on Thurs night. All food was lovely, the breakfast is superb and I'd recommend staying here.

We recently enjoyed a short break at the Goa Marriott after a hectic week touring Rajasthan. The hotel is in a great location overlooking a bay and other parts of Goa though far enough from the inlet where the casino ships are located. We found the staff so friendly and helpful and our room (we treated ourselves to a suite) was recently refurbished and very nicely fitted out with a spa like bathroom and balconies overlooking the water. We did very little during our stay though we found all the facilities we used very good and well maintained. The only gripe if any was the local call charges which are expensive. The hotel is located near Panajim which we walked round and were underwhelmed so you are better off exploring the Candolim area which is very geared to looking after tourists. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

We arrived for 1 week break from Dubai journey took 3 hrs approx, we managed to get taxi to hotel ( beware as they drive very fast ). Our hotel was awaiting our arrival so our check in was easy and out efficient. The room was very lovely dressed up with lots of red petals and towels made into animals, The view from our balcony was a sea view it was nice to watch the sunset in the evening !! Always lots of bottled water available !!
Our food was very good from pizza to goan curry all lovely, but cold sadly I asked a few times for it to be reheated...we liked to taste some of the curriy dishes and naan bread was delicious...some of the staff were rude when they marched in front of you and got there food first,it's just not nice, and when I asked one chef Khim for pizza he replied you don't get it it's not included in the full board, but we were quite happy to pay , its my choice !! the chef Gopi made us feel welcome let us try some amazing dishes we even had fish and chips one evening , salmon another !! Jason stood out for us in the dining lounge to he was very helpful and did things quickly when we asked ( some took ages for a pot of hot water ) he spoke great English too !! 
Happy hour was free from 5-7 pm all drinks were good and wine Jacobs Creek , we even took our wine with us for dinner !! Excellent staff very attentive !!
We went to the spa had a massage it was lovely not to expensive either , used the sauna and jacuzzi we felt very relaxed !! 
Its a busy hotel most days fully booked, we always seemed to get a sun lounger most days and nice fresh towels.. pool very cold but nicely situated and it gets hot hot hot !!
Room attention was wonderful nothing to much trouble for them, very clean sheets towels everyday and lovely products shower gel etc available !! I even received a flower arrangement too of lilies !! Hairdryer in room was a little small so glad I took my own one !! Aircon had no noise at all, but got woke up by noisy plumbing on a few occasions. ( banging noise) annoying !!
The only negative things we felt was lots and lots of rubbish lying out with the hotel made Goa not nice for tourists,felt a little invaded when dining as staff was sometimes to attentive we just wanted some quiet time !! Mosquitoes were everywhere my husband got a few bites when in Azure Lounge Bar , Waterfront Restaurant, bedroom,lobbies,we had 3 plug ins in our bedroom and wrist bands but still got bites !! 
All in all we had a good time and everything went as planned the hotel is a lovely place and staff attentive, wish we could remember all staff names but we can't but thank you to them and for there help !!

Stayed here for three nights over the Holidays and found it to be in a great location to explore North and South Goa and the beaches as day trips. It is well located for restaurants and nightlife as well. We even took the bus into Panjim a few times and that was not a problem at all. The hotel was very accommodating in arranging transportation for us for our excursions in the area, and when one of the days we had a car that was not to the quality expected and driver had an attitude, the hotel staff were quick to address the issue. Had breakfast at the hotel and enjoyed the variety of local cuisine. Chef even made me a banana lassi, even though it was not on the standard buffet! The beach and pool area are pleasant and nice to relax at. It was a bit sad to see the garbage on the beach (not necessarily by the hotel, but on the stretch of beach we walked) and generally felt like no one cared to clean up after themselves. Would be great if the hotel organized beach cleanups or such events where the hotel guests can feel like they are helping with the local environment and perhaps even get the opportunity to interact with the locals some. Overall, good experience.

Very peaceful place despite being middle of residential area. Access to the night life in Panjim is very easy from here. 

Breakfast is always excellent here. Many options to choose from. Staff is very helpful.

The spot is idyllic with beautiful views all around over the river and out into the Arabian Sea, the entry hall  which is open to the air  is spectacular, and the grounds lush and well looked after. The staff were helpfulness itself, friendly without being too in your face, and some of the food was outstanding. We spent a couple of evenings eating by the pool and the selection of sea food, think fresh lobsters, crabs, sea bass, was excellent and the cooking first rate. The skill and thoughtfulness of one of the more senior of staff, Mandeep I think was his name, would not have disgraced a maitre d' in a major city. Some of the facilities such as the gym room were better than the health club I belong to back home.

OK, a lovely place. So why not an excellent rating? First were the prices. A bottle of average French wine, say $10 in a supermarket was about $80 at the bar. Likewise the prices for the meals were comparable with international prices which isn't quite fair given we were in India. The hotel taxi service though efficient was about 50% over local limousine prices. Second, although the hotel tried to clean the beach in front of the hotel  even having a permanent person making sure that people walking along it didn't peep in  the river itself wasn't swimmable in and wild dogs wandered on it too. The dogs couldn't have got in but that wasn't pleasant.

This property has tremendous staff and service - the Bay view rooms afford great views - especially the sunset. 
Shubert, Vinod, Harris and Saraansh and Gopal deserve a special mention.
It is a property with nice views but the place needs urgent upgrade and modernisation.

Dear Manager & Staff

I am writing to express my appreciation for the quality of service you offered my family & I during our stay at the hotel.

We could see from day one that the hotel has a great quality, both because of its comfortable and appropriate facilities, as well as service and constant concern for our comfort. Thank you especially for being aware of our requirements.

I will definitely recommend your hotel to friends and family, and Im sure Ill be back again and hope to receive the same quality of service when I return. 

Names of staff particularly I remembered who went the extra mile for us are : Akash, Rutesh, Sarvesh, Rohidas, Damson, Jason, Leny, Philip, Raymond, Antony, Durgesh, & Rohit.
everyone at the Water Front Team really was outstandingly helpful and I can't praise everyone enough.

Raj & Simran from the Water Front Team - both of you bring a very special atmosphere and my words arent enough to say thank you to both of you. My kids can't stop talking about you and Raj - Ashley is missing you

Also all the staff at Az.U.r Lobby Lounge were fantastic. Thanks for making my stay excellent.

To finish off, the view, the cleanliness, the complimentary items and the comfort was exceptional. There is no way on earth that we could ever fault the service or standards, amazing experience and one we won't forget in a hurry.

Thanks to everyone at the Marriott Goa

Amit (Ricky) Nisha Aryan Ashley

Very good location and good service. Special thanks to front desk guy Ashley. He is Very helpful, polite and guest friendly. Food is also good. We enjoyed our stay at this Goa Marriot property. This property also provides airport pick up and drop, complimentary. Ashley arrange all our sight seen tour at very good price. This hotel also drop guests at local market as complementary.

Me and my wife stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon and we had the most incredible stay! The staff were most attentive and nothing was ever too much to ask! The hotel is great and we shall most definitely be staying here in the future.

The hotel is in a quiet part of North Goa, with all lovely areas easily accessible. There is plenty to do if you wish or it is very easy to relax and unwind at the poolside.

A special thank you must go out to our driver who picked us up from the airport and took us on two day trips, Leeladhar Gawas. A huge thank you to Shilpa who worked part of the kitchen and welcomed us to the hotel. A special thank you to both Chefs Gopi and Murgesh who made a special meal for when we were poorly, and even offered to make us snacks for our onward journey and flight. Shanu, a waiter at the simply grill was great, and made our valentines meal most memorable. Kashinath, our room attendant had the most creative towel art, and the pool attendant, who's name I have misplaced, but my gratitude is still great towards.

Thank you for a great stay Marriott!

Nisha and Tim, previous residents of room 205.

I arranged to take my wife to the Sunday brunch on her 50th birthday we also used the pool facilities.All I can say is what a fantastic day it was nothing was to much trouble all the staff very attentive, my wife had a fantastic time Joseph and his staff really looked after her on her special day . They even supplied a cake without me asking , memories that will always be with us.

We had booked Marriott for 4 days in the last week of January for a much needed break with our 20 month old daughter and boy did the staff ensure we had a nice time! Although the property was full for the long weekend, we were given personal attention starting from the airport pick-up to checking-in to booking a table for dinner and even during the happy hours in the gorgeous lobby of theirs. 
The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was yum. I have to thank Sanket (Asst. front office manager) for his attention & ensuring my daughter gets her 'special meals' and milkshakes throughout the day. The kids play area and the casino are a huge advantage over other properties in Goa.
Being in the city center, almost everything is approachable which is an advantage when you travel with family. The only drawback I can think of is the beach - where a lot of boats come to pick-up and drop tourists, taking away the 'secluded feel'. The pool and the bar at the pool is nice, and over all - we were very happy with our stay and the friendly staff ensured we were at ease always.
Definitely worth another visit

Excellent facility. Spacious rooms. Wifi is free but just for mails. Higher speed at a reasonable rate of 250 plus taxes.
Sea facing rooms are expensive to Garden facing rooms.
Nice swimming pool facing Sea/ Madovi river is very good.
Garden is very green and they have an excellent SPA.
Breakfast spread is very good and quality of food they serve is excellent.
Nice cosy bar and the two restaurants are very good.
Hospitality is top of the world 
Would like to come again here

From using the pick up service from the airport the stay was excellent. The staff are so attentive and polite and the facilities are immaculate. The last night we dined at simply grille and the food was great I opted for the tenderloin steak. The pool bar was really nice with great service and just what was needed after a day in the conference suite. Next time I hope to come for a holiday and spend a bit longer exploring what Goa has to offer.

Great trip

I am a Marriott Platinum Premium Elite Member for over 10 years and try to stay at Marriott properties most of the time. We had 5 ocean front rooms. The setting was beautiful but the personal attention of the staff was exceptional, especially Sanket Athavale, Asst. Front Office Manager, and Delilah Almeida, Guest Relations Manager. They took care of all our needs and made extra effort to make our experience very memorable.
We were treated like royalty.

Excellent resort with excellent staff u will not like to go back ... So much warmly attention and very friendly and helpful..... Keep it up... 
I stayed here from 9feb to 15 feb and on leaving day i was in tears to leave them so much love they all gave and very nice resort with the staff in Restaurant very helpful they packed me lunch also on the day of leaving.... Loved the stay very well done...

We went to Goa and stayed for 3 days before moving on .The service ,food and rooms were all excellent.Most of the staff couldn't do enough to help and the location was very good. There was also breakfast and a happy hour[2 hours] where the food was and drink was included with the breakfast which was extremely good value.

Superb hotel , great team,i really enjoyed my stay, food was great. Breakfast experience and spread was amazing. Housekeeping was quick to all the request. I will surely recommend goa marriott to my friend.

We visited the hotel for Sunday buffet lunch The choice of food was amazing From hot Indian food to salads bread and fruit Drinks are included in the price The range of puddings and pastries was also incredible From Indian puddings to delicious bite size cakes

The marriott in panjim is very well located. In the heart of the city but still tucked in. The hotel was packed and lobby was buzzing with activity. The rooms attached to the lawns are very nice. The service is excellent. Wide variety of cuisines. Sea food, Chinese and the coffee shop. Touching the mandovi river gives the property lovely views.

Myself and my husband were recommended to eat here on Christmas Day, during our recent trip to Goa. We were highly impressed with the enormous variety of food on offer, but were particularly struck by how tasty and homemade everything was. I loved the soup and salads so much that I emailed the hotel in the hope of getting some recipes. Imagine my delight when I got a quick response from the head chef, who was delighted to share with me. I would recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a tasty meal.

A fab place to stay in... try the patio bay view or bay view rooms...Service is pretty much above average. Check in and check outs are very quick. Overly Courteous staff all around. they catches your eye and runs into you if you want anything. Breakfast excellent...there are beautiful restaurant & bars inside the Hotels. Best was the swim up Pool Bar.... just a bit improvement at the pool bar is a good quality music is missing out. Place for Kids toddlers, relaxing experience i had with SPA. And has a amazing private beach. Special arrangements are upto the marks if you need. In total it was an amazing experience staying in .... DDDD

1. The team at the coffee shop went all out to look at bfast options for my lil daughter. One of the Chef even made a small micky mouse shaped pancake topped with chocolate sauce especially for her. Am sorry dont remember the name (Was it Chef Gomez?). Thanks Chef.
2. The housekeeping person who would clean the room daily, made a towel animal everyday for my daughter to play with. She loved it. Thanks Surag.

Overall a lovely experience.
Thanks

I think this hotel is excellent in every way and the staff are both helpful and approachable. From check in where Absil helped me with the new app to register online, to Kuber at the pool who always has a smile and cannot do enough for you, to the bar and restaurant staff who were also first class. I would not hesitate to recommend a stay here

We saw the online Facebook page of Alila Diwa giving details of Sunday brunch and the phone no.It read as

Alila Diwa Goa
July 8, 2012  
Sunday brunch Diwa Style
Make your lazy Sunday a little more exotic with our indulgent brunch. Wide variety of food and beverages at INR 950++ | Live music by Emmanuel. Call 9049997537 for more information.
1 We called the said no -NO RESPONSE
2 We got the phone no of FnB manager 9049997530 from a friend-NO RESPONSE
3 We got a no from the online Alila site-NO RESPONSE
4 We called their duty manger who finally booked our table
5 The AC was not effective in indoor seating so we had to move out
6 Food -below average,Service-rude specially a waiter called Abhay,Jayesh incharge of buffet charged us 1500/- per head for non -alcoholic package for 4 people whereas the advertised rate is 950/- plus taxes-will the taxes be more than 50%!!!
I had great memories of the Sunday brunch as well as other occasions I dined their for parties.But very disappointed with their standard and service .Not to mention a total rip off with absolutely no value for money.

We are here for 4 nights. The buffet menu seldom changes. They keep repeating the salads, desserts and ice creams. The staff does not seem bothered. The food is over but until you ask them to refill they dont seem to realise. The staff passing by doesnt greet you or even smile. Rooms are very dimly lit. Its actually very depressing to sit in the rooms. There is no recreational activities for adults.

Poor hotel management. We booked this hotel through an agent for 4 days. We called hotel 2 days prior our arrival and confirmed if hotel received full payment and they confirmed the same with us. Even during check in at reception I asked if they received payment they again confirmed and on last day they told us that they have not received payment and we were asked to pay in full immediately. We wasted the entire day to sought out the mess and hotel didn't care and finally they accepted that they have received the payment.

We are currently residing at Alila Diwa;but we are thoroughly disappointed with the food.we have always stayed in 5star and above properties in Goa but have never had such a bad experience when it comes to food....when u pay such an heavy amount for your holiday there are basic expectations for food...it is bland as if made for the non Indians palate..we had unfortunately taken a three meal plan..will never recommend this hotel. As much I loved the property we hated the food

wful experience! If you want a quite relaxing tranquil holiday as described please make sure you check there are no indian weddings taking place or conferences.During our ten night stay we had two weddings each lasting 2/3 days.The infinity pool was taken over for a private pool party twice lasting all day,extremely loud music all day with heavy drinking in the pool,drones flying everywhere (no privacy) ,On the wedding day we were woken at 5am with heavy base music ,this continued till the ceremony which started at 5pm the disco not finishing until 5.30 am.It was more like the clubbing holidays my children go on ,not the relaxing break we expected.I understand the weddings generate a lot of money, however i do expect to get what was advertised,i do not feel we should be pushed out and unable to use the facilities we paid for.This is the third time we have been to this hotel ,we returned because it is a beautiful hotel in a fabulous setting with amazing staff,last time we went there was a conference where the pool was also out of bounds but we thought that this was a one off.I think if the functions were kept to one area and the other guests were not compromised most people would not have an issue however there were 3 couples to our knowledge who had also been several times before but will also not be returning.VERY DISAPPOINTING FOR SUCH A LOVELY HOTEL!

While the first impression the property and staff gives you is exceptional and it kind of takes away the struggle of reaching to the property, the hard reality bites soon enough. 

As there were 2 rooms booked by us, I called early morning from the airport to ensure rooms are together. upon arrival we were told that only 1 rooms available. took them over 2 hours to get the other room allotted (mind you we reached post their check-in time). 

rooms had several issues and most of the 1st day of check-in went getting the room facilities fixed. bathroom flush, ACON fan, bathroom door, basin flooding, bathtub jammed take the top position that I cant forget even if I want to.

staff showed their concern by apologizing but hardly took any action to confirm their concern for guests. in room dining staff should maybe shifted to other department as they cant differentiate a pasta sauce to khichadi (steamed rice mixed with Indian dal).

it was only on the end of the stay when I had had enough I tried escalating the issue and the duty manager, but by then it was way to late to patch things up. 

she did her best by booking us a shuttle and taking care of the incidentals on our check-out. but really if I was too much concerned on saving a 1000 - 2000 INR, I would not have booked an expensive property such as Alila in a town like Goa which is filled with options. 

Throughout the stay our floor was getting painted and walls were being patched that gave an impression of staying in a make shift arrangement kinda place. November and December are the peek months and any hotel with a 5 star tag should appreciate this much in advance. 

a completely dissatisfied experience and a total NO for future!

Kunal Taneja

Hotel employs thief's !! Personal belonging stolen from car during my stay this watch out !! Never give your car to the chauffeur at this hotel .Food sucks especially breakfast ...repeat the same menu daily !! Will never visit this hotel again !!

In September15 I decided to undergo a 21-day detox program at Spa Alila after talking to its young and passionate head of department - Dr Arjita Kumari. Her confidence was infectious and even though the cost of the program is pretty hefty I signed up within hours of meeting her : as you can imagine she is a sales-person par excellence.

Unfortunately, sales person is all that she is! I have been doing detox programs every year for the last two decades but never before have I ever been in a situation where my health was compromised. Within days of starting the program, my blood pressure fell to unprecedented levels. By day 13 my metabolism was shot to a point where I had a gastro attack of such severity that I could neither breathe or speak. Each time I brought my condition up to the Dr, I was categorically told that it was normal.

It is not normal but I do understand that sometimes when we do a program like this, things can go wrong. But what I don't understand is the casual outlook and complete lack of corrective measures on the part of Dr. Instead of using her skills as a medical doctor the only thing she could offer was some sort of alternate healing mumbo-jumbo. So visualise this - you are so sick that you cannot breathe, the left side of your body is in tremendous pain, you are wondering if you are getting a cardiac arrest and the medical Dr whose supervision you are under does not take your blood pressure, or pulse, doesnt give you any medication instead picks up a crystal and starts to chant hoping that your condition will pass! Un-freakin believable, but true.

When I decided to bring it up to the General Manager, he point-blank told me that their spa programs are casual / recreational even though the printed brochure for the said program suggests otherwise. What I found even more horrifying is that despite putting this in the knowledge of the General Manager not one person (yes, thats right, not even one person) from the management called to ask after my health or well-being even though I was in the hotel for another four days recuperating. (I quit the program as soon as I was well enough to do so i.e. on 17th day)

Alila is an international brand with 5-star properties across Asia and I am simply appalled that not only are they running such a third-class program under their banner but also their management doesn't give a fig for someone who may fall seriously sick during their stint at the property.

Other observations included ants in my bed and on the WC, clogged shower drains, expired products placed for usage in the shower area etc etc.. the list is endless! But not everything is bad with the property. The design aesthetic of the hotel is fantastic. The yoga teacher and male therapist Ajay is beyond fabulous. I appreciated GMs offer to return the balance from the advance money I had paid for the program in vouchers once he acknowledged my lack of faith in the program.

To sum it up, Alila Diwa Goa is like The Lady in Red  she will totally seduce you with her beauty and her charms but scratch the surface and you are in for a ride to hell and back i.e. if you are lucky!

We rented three rooms in Alila from 30may - 2nd june.. the experience was terrible and i am not ever going back to this crap place ..
pros - our rooms were upgraded to diwa wedding because the hotel was booked for a wedding and they did not want to disturb our peace.. the only highlight of the trip .. the worse then stared..

cons - they took around 2 hrs for us to checkin.. one room was provided in 30mins and rest were to take another 30mins more .. got them after almost 1hr 25mins!! no apologies from the team ... 
2) the room service is sub-standard.. we had baby bottles to sterilize .. they take around 30mins to send some one with numerous reminders .. this happened consistently across all three days and for all the rooms we booked.. on one occasion they did not return the bottle and i called up the reception on numerous times.. it was 11:30pm and i told them also to not ring the bell since our baby was sleeping.. and guess what they ring the bell and then also call on the phone!!
3) breakfast was useless.. the juices were plain water and sour.. and even the wedding party folks were complaining
4) this is the worst that happened.. there is restn called Martins corner which is about 600mts (5mins walk and 2mins by car) .. we were returning from the restn around 8:30pm.. we had five kids who were tired.. we tried to ask local cabs and they responded they had tied up with hotel and will only come if they ask them to.. we called the hotel and they said 800rs for the 2mins ride from martins to hotel .. it was a loot.. we were not even given the bill... next day i complained and somebody in reception confirmed we were overcharged but nothing happened.. these guys are working hand in glove with local cabs to find ways to loot hotel guests.. 
5) lots of other incidents wrt to service.. room cleaning doesnt come when asked to for instance..ordered pizza, the guy says sir the pizza will come from a vivo restn located in another wing and pizza will get soggy and will take 45mins!!! really who are u kidding here..

never coming back here.. totally ruined it for us..

Good hotel overall but grossly mismanaged. You have a feeling that at every stage of your stay they try to extract as much money from you as possible and you are only there for that purpose. A couple of examples:
- We had a private yoga class and it is 1500 Rps per hour. When we got a bill we were billed for 2 persons, i.e. 3000 Rps and the manager told us that if it would be 4 people it would be 6000 Rps for the same hour of yoga. Keep in mind that they pay 10000 Rps to the yoga instructor per month! The rest goes to the hotel. The same is with the massage as it costs from 3500 Rps (this is before taxes which add another 30%) and they pay just 10000 Rps per month to people doing massage. 
- We asked for the bicycle and were told that it is 350 Rps per 2 hours. Keep in mind that in Goa one day of renting a scooter is 300 Rps and 1 day of renting a car is 1200 Rps and compare it with the hotel price for the bicycles. In most hotels bicycles are complimentary but not in this one. They are there to extract the money from you.
- The taxi to the airport costs 1300 Rps and what they do is just ask the taxi standing in front of the hotel, which is priced at 900-1000 Rps. The rest goes to the hotel for nothing. 
- The food is also grossly overpriced. The bottle of Old Monk Rum is 160 Rps just outside the hotel and they sell it at 125 Rps per shot. The same is with everything in the menu. Although the food is of good quality you cannot ask 250 Rps for steamed rice in India. 

So in total we spent as much in the hotel as for the rooms, i.e. $5000 USD for one week. If you think that this money goes to the nearby community you are completely wrong. The road to the beach is approximately 500 meters and is full of litter. Only $100 USD would be enough to pay for the local people to clean it but obviously the hotel does not care about it. They are there to extract the money. This is the shame and very disappointing that a good hotel is managed in this barbaric way which is obvious to travelers and to local people. 

For that price they even cannot provide the clean towels to the beach as all towels we were given had stains and were covered with sand (unlike clean towels to the swimming pool). The WiFi speed in the hotel is also almost absent. You would expect decent WiFi in a 5-star hotel and for that price.

This review has taken a long while to write, but nonetheless, here it is! We stayed May 2014 and had booked for a 5 night stay based on the good reviews we saw on tripadvisor and also through personal recommendation. HOWEVER, the minute we arrived in Goa was when the poor experience of Alila Diwa started. We were greeted (If you could call a grunt a greet) with our name card outside the airport. The man that grunted at us was on his phone and basically hand signalled to us and pointed to the direction in which we should be going to collect our airport transfer. We were told this would be a car transfer upon booking. We were surprised that a 50 seater coach, instead, came to pick us up. We were the only ones sat on a 50 seater coach travelling on our very bumpy journey to the hotel. We arrived to no greeting at all this time and loitered around in the hotel until somebody came to us. We finally checked in and were taken to our room. The surrounding hotel looked lovely and we decided to dismiss our bumpy journey and proceed to enjoying our holiday. Our room disappointingly was a twin room when we paid for King. We then transferred rooms after 4 hours!! The manager kindly allowed us a meal on the house, however, in what is supposed to be their 'top class restaurant' in Goa, there were bugs embedded within their glass tables. Our meals were, hence, not very appetising. Once we got into a newly transferred room, we discovered the bed sheets were stained, the light switches were not working and the elevator was making a very loud sound. If after reading this review, you still choose to stay at Alila Diwa, DO NOT stay in a room next to the elevator!!! 
Once again (and by this time it was midnight) we transferred rooms again. 3rd time lucky.....NO! The AC unit was not working!!! They did not transfer us again and instead, decided to call upon an electrician at 2am in the morning to fix our AC! The hotel, at first glance, looks lovely but please please think before booking this hotel. The next day we immediately found other hotels (the Taj Goa and The Leela, which were FANTASTIC and what is expected of 5* resorts!!) The manager at Alila Diwa was kind enough to not charge us for our 1 night's hellish stay, but this was after MUCH commotion!! Service poor, cleanliness poor, Alila Diwa ..... POOR!!!!

Hi, 
I visited the resort with my friends and I was robbed of my Samsung phone worth 10k and cash of 1000rs My friend with whom I shared the same room also lost 2000rs.
Also there were 4 other friends robbed of cash while we all were away to the beach which is close by (only 10 mins away). I waited for 1month but there was not even 1 mail/call from the resort informing me about the investigation. This sort of behaviour is not at all expected of a 5 star resort they should take some serious measures and rectify things. Totally spoilt my holiday :(

I am very surprised by how bad Alila Goa was, considering that they are a 5 star hotel and supposedly reputable. Firstly the good part...the room is spacious and bathroom is big with a wardrobe. However the bathroom opens up totally into the room, which is fine for honeymooning couples. However, if you are planning a corporate trip or friends trip.....hmmmmm. luckily there are 4 sliding doors to close.
Now the downside.........the front office staff is not trained to handle big groups...even on the day i departed there was another big group coming in and there was chaos. I had asked for specific rooms to be given but the front office just messed up
Secondly, the management is not flexible in assisting guest. I made several request but was told it cannot be accommodated
Thirdly, the food was bad......even my local Indian colleagues complained that the food was not up to mark
Fourthly the restaurant staff were not efficient. my colleagues requested for water, coffee etc and the staff either forgot or was not interested to serve. Each meal we had at the restaurants, they were dropping utensils, plates regularly.
this hotel may be good for couples but definitely not able to handle big groups...and i would return again. There are better choices in Goa for less than the price my company paid for it.

I visited Alila Diwa first in November, 2013. I had gone to see the hotel as a suitable venue for hosting a wedding, and while we came back very impressed with the rooms, we could not nail down a deal for hosting the wedding. Never the less, I was told that I should come back to the hotel, to stay right after the wedding, so as to unwind and relax, and was promised excellent hospitality. My wife and I went to Alila Diwa right after the wedding, and I have to admit, I was extremely disappointed with the hotel and the hotel staff. Ive highlighted pros and cons from my stay at the hotel: 

Pros:
1. The rooms were absolutely excellent. The size of the rooms was very good, as were the services within the room. Thumbs up to the house-keeping for organizing it so well. 
2. The property itself is quite nice to walk around, and to just sit back and relax. Definitely a very home like experience with 5* feel to it. 
3. We forgot a few items at the hotel. And the house keeping staff were friendly enough to find it and have it sent back to our address. 


Cons: 
1. Checking in to the hotel was a very painful experience. The reception desk staff took well over 20 minutes to check us in on a not so busy Saturday. Never the less, I requested her for the best room in the hotel as it was a special occasion, yet she kept saying that the hotel is full and all she can give us is a regular room on the first floor. I cant complain about the room (as I liked it), but I did not like the attitude of the staff as they made no efforts to make our experience a pleasant one. 
2. The food definitely did not live up to 5* standards and was definitely over priced. We ordered food to our room  and were not impressed with the quantity of food delivered  as it was barely enough for one person to eat, and wasnt cooked well enough. The spread at breakfast was excellent, but the quality of food disappointed me. 
3. We requested for a late check-out but the reception staff wasnt receptive to that. She kept insisting the hotel is fully booked (which it wasnt by any stretch of imagination) and thus they needed us to vacate our room, they kept insisting that we leave the property early. 
4. What is with the hotel and taxi nexus! They over charge us for every possible trip (Although I am sure this is a problem not specific to Alila Diwa).

Alila Diwa is a great property, but they showed no initiative towards making it a special stay for me and my wife, despite repeated phone calls and requests in person. I definitely do not recommend staying at this property if youre looking to go there for a special occasion. Its got good rooms but lack respect for its guests and have a very stiff approach to doing things.

I stayed in this property for 3 days in diva suites. Room is clean and good. You can hear loads of noise in morning time, it has two outside houses in the property. If you request any room service please expect unlimited delays. Cleaning staff will keep ringing the bell until you open the door in frustration. Hotel management is very rude and all good point of property goes in vain due to such experience.

once u pay money online you have no choice but to accept the room they give normally it is the worst room of the hotel room no 147 n 153 family terrace room what terrace? i pad for one day online n wanted to check out n the manager had the courage to ask the amount for the balance two days i.e for sun n mon nite 13 n 14th july. pity untrained people manning this good property

While they have made decent property, but nowhere close to Lila or Tajs of the world. Prices are no cheaper. 
I guess they have forgotten that they operate in hospitality industry. They are RUDE to the core. You can feel it right when you enter the check in. House keeping doesn't respond. So unless you have spare money and time to spend on them, dont even think about it. Services are pathetic.

INTRODUCTION
My family and I ( 7 of us including a baby) checked into the hotel on the 16th hoping that we would have a relaxed and chilled out annual family vacation. Little did we know that the staff of the hotel was about to entirely ruin our plan of a relaxed holiday.

ROOM
We had booked the terrace rooms almost a month and half in advance and had been promised excellent service by Asmita who is employed in the bombay office of Alila Diwa Goa. We were taken to the rooms which to our dismay were not even adjoining despite booking well in advance. The rooms are really nice and spacious and this was one out of the three positives that we witnessed in our stay. 

PROPERTY IN GENERAL
Another positive of the trip was the Property as a whole, which is stunningly beautiful. a Specific mention must be made for the Infinity Pool which is really nice.(SECOND POSITIVE) 

FOOD
All our meals were at the Vivo restaurant since we had booked the all meals plan. As we ate dinner we realised that the staff at the restaurant are more interested in clearing crockery instead of providing us with water, finger bowls, etc. on asking them 3-4 times we got water. on our last day we literally had to go and take it ourselves. The food was decent but became really repetitive and so we got bored of it after a point.

EDGE BAR
We went to the bar one night and were given really good service and were very happy with the staff who were polite and courteous. (THIRD POSITIVE)

HOUSEKEEPING
By far the worst experience we've had in terms of housekeeping and staff. We settled down into the room only to find out that one of the rooms had a lizard. On calling the housekeeping they said that there is no lizard and unfortunately it had disappeared by then. on the second day of our stay we found out that the staff just barge into the room and start cleaning it without any instructions. On telling a member of the staff not to do so, he backanswered us and said that it is our duty to inform the hotel that we do not want our room to be cleaned. In one of the rooms the air conditioning also wasnt working and in spite of telling the housekeeping/maintenance to do something about it, nothing was done. The most disturbing part of the stay was that on multiple occasions the housekeeping people just entered the room without ringing the bell in spite of the privacy setting being active, which reflects really badly on the training that the staff has been given. 

SERVICE IN GENERAL
The staff was really laid back and dint serve us promptly at all. We had to call people 3-4 times to clean the room and on the last two days our room keys just stopped working and it took the reception nearly twenty minutes to send replacements to us. The rooms were cleaned only when they felt like cleaning them. Lastly, as the icing on the cake, the day we checked out a wedding group was arriving and hence there was no staff on the reception to even bother seeing us off despite them knowing that we had been treated badly. Hats off to the shamelessness displayed by the Staff of the FIVE STAR PROPERTY Alila Diwa Goa. 
On the whole if you want to stay in a beautiful property with third rate service this is the perfect fit, though I would strongly recommend the Taj properties in the north ( Village and Aguada) or the south (Exotica) as they charge nearly the same amount but offer much better service. 

CONCLUSION
We will never ever go back here to stay and dissuade all those who we know from staying here. 
To those at The Alila reading this review if you'll even do, Thank you so much for destroying our holiday. I sincerely hope you dont do to any other guests what you'll did to us.

Its been a nightmare trying to book this hotel lets see if and how quick it ges turned around. My view may change into a positive one but so far its been disapointing. Not a great start to our honeymoon experience

Had to wait for almost an hour to check in finally we got one room by 4 pm although we booked for 2 . The other room we had to wait for another hour finally when we got the rooms the bathrooms were not cleaned towels not replaced after the previous guest has left absolutely lethargic house keeping department 
The pool when you see in the website is heavenly but is absolute waste and not maintained hygienically 
For sight seeing we were asked to approach the travel desk which was blissfully empty and finally the reception arranged a taxi 
The so called library has less than 10 books 
Absolutely lethargic service in the restaurants 
Absolute waste of time and money anybody who has value for thier money or time should never visit this place

It was a destination wedding 200 rooms booked and service and promises were all broken .
Never ever visit such a place where the new rooms are the only attraction. 
No one seems to be charge ,all requests were met with a firm not possible ,early check in no ,late check out no .pool dip 20 minutes past time ,no .car availability no .
Some one in Delhi sitting there calls the shots ,still have not managed to find out who actually runs this place

Sub standard food and service. Had all meals inclusive but poor quality of food. 
The bread counter was closed in lunch hours and took more than half an hour to bring Indian breads when we were done with our meal. 
They made egg pancakes along with vegetarian dosa saying both are same
Never to go again
Written customer feedback form in room but did not get any response

Checked into the hotel, yesterday, and realised this morning that we were burgled from our rooms.

The thief has walked into my room and stolen my bag from inside the room, emptied the contents outside in the lawn and taken 20,000 INR (approx). we also lost 10,000 INR (approx) from inside the room which were placed at the head side table. 

We complained to the staff at 10:30 AM (approx) and they are still 'investigating'. 2 more rooms were burgled last night. 

The police was called after 5 hours, and they refuse to show us the camera footage. 

The junior staff takes the call, because they have NO Manager Incharge. The Duty Manager is on Vacation. (HOW CONVINIENT?!?) 

It took the staff over 2 hours to hand is our room keys when we checked in, to share feedback about small things.

We were planning to stay for 2 nights but instead we are checking out NOW.

An AVOIDABLE place for a holiday.

If you are into Russians, deck chairs reserved throughout the day by towels, cantina style food and seating this is your place. While the staff is generally helpful and friendly and the rooms are noisy but sort of okay, the Alila Diwa Goa experience leaves me with one wish: beam we home.

after getting a good review from a friend. i decided to book this place for our 1st marriage anniversary. in our online booking form i had mentioned that this will be our first anniversary stay and request if they can book a cake for us (at extra cost thats fine) and since we are checking out on our anniversary day, request if we can get a late check out by 4 hrs. I must have mentioned this line several times in the communication with the hote "THIS IS A SURPRISE for my husband"

after landing at the hotel, property is beautiful no doubt about it. the first thing that the front desk staff is asking my husband "sir when would you like to have the cake". We land at the hotel on 19th May and our anniversary was on 21st May......even a kid can guess when we would like to have the cake. a night prior to our anniversary i take my husband out and requested the hotel staff to keep the cake in the room so that still i can keep up to my plan of surprise. The front desk lady calls my husband and asks " SIR we have not arranged your cake can we get that tomorrow morning".

what level of service is this???????

last point on our request for late check out? after informing the front desk staff atleast 10 times....they pretend that they were not aware of any such request made by us where i have a written proof of this request being made.

are you kidding me that this is a 5 star property. no wonder you are not able to retain your customers.

well you can visit this place as the properly is awesome. but dont expect a 5 star level staff service.

To say this is a 5 star Hotel should not only depend on the hotel and facilities but should also focus on service, to which there is none.
