If you are considering traveling to this hotel you should make sure that you do not stay over the holiday periods as they also use the hotel as a wedding venue for very large weddings and therefore any holiday guests that are staying are in the minority. During our 8 day stay the hotel was taken over by 3-400 wedding guests for six different weddings. On each occasion parts of the hotel are shut off to holiday guests such as one of the pools and one or two of the restaurant's depending on what time of the day it is.  We had to move rooms on four occasions depending on what part of the Hotel had been hired out for the wedding as this changed from the bar to the main pool then to the lawn area or maybe all three areas at different times of the day. 
I have been travelling to many different countries over the years and I have never experienced such a terrible mistreatment of hotel guests I think I can speak on behalf of the very few guests that were staying there at the same time as us by saying we all felt that we were treated like 2nd class citizens and that the wedding guests were the most important people to the Hotel. Do not spend your hard earned money staying here find somewhere that is actually a 5 star as this resort is not!

I would give Alila Goa the hotel and it's staff five stars but.....an otherwise amazing hotel experience has been marred by hordes of extremely loud Indian wedding celebrations. I have never been to a "beach" holiday that was as "untranquil" as this one. My first impression was "wow" and Until our last day I thought that the management sort of tried to keep the full paying hotel guests a little shielded, but on our last day at breakfast it was like a fish market with incredibly loud drums and shouting all over the place. In front of our amazing room were Indian guests shouting from one end of the corridor to the other. This hotel is truly paradise if not for the management allowing such behavior and noise.
Thank you though to the exceptional restaurant and pool staff.

Had booked a 2 bedrooms suite (which is a scam!). First, we got the room at 4:30pm! We literally had to go in the room and pressurise them to hurry with the cleaning. Room interiors looked old, floor had stains and it pretty much looked like 2 interconnecting rooms (1 suite and 1 deluxe room). While we were waiting for the room in the reception we were asked to go for our meal. With only 2 tables occupied, it took an HOUR to serve our meal (im guessing this was done to buy time). 
When we did go to our room, there was just ONE person cleaning the entire suite. We wanted to talk to the hotel manager, but never got him. First the on duty manager was sent (who could hardly speak english), then the housekeeping manager (who was speechless) and finally the Director of rooms (couldnt do much). Even tho she said she would personally take care of us, we didnt see her for the remaining part of our stay.
even in the restaurants we had few issues over the period or our stay. 
Overall it was a horrendous experience that we have ever faced.

I've staying here before and first time was very nice as a lot of nice places in Goa. This trip I arrived at 11:30am only to have to wait till 3:30 for my room. No apologizes and I went to the front desk three times only to be told "it's not ready". My main beef was when I required to rent a car with driver for a work meeting and asked 3 times to have an all day car driver, that way I could come out of my meeting and the car would be there. I believe they had no drivers or needed more as I was told they could drop me off and I could get a cab at meeting. I said a few times, so I can get a cab there and was told yes, yes again and yes again. AND, I came out of my meeting and NO cabs and had my meeting colleagues call and could only get Ailia Diwi to come back to pick me up, which is exactly as I did not want. I waiting in there office for over 45 minutes, wasting my time and was not happy. I was lied to as I think they had a low number of drivers and missed the sunset and beers at the shack on the beach and singlehandedly put the front desk person for my missed opportunity of a fun evening. Not the hotels fault but I was awoken at 2:30am from a loud group drinking and listening to music as my room was right over the pool. Had to call staff to assist and they did. So, I feel bratty for writing the above but I just have a bad taste in my mouth from the trip......

Visited with family..we had 4 rooms.
The quality of the food at the Alila Diwa is horrible. I have never had such bad food at the resort. I tried all the 3 restaurants- Vivo, Spice & Bistro and it was appaling that the food can be this bad. After that we ended up eating outside the resort where the food was much better.
Also the staff at the resort is completely untrained. If you need anything in the room you wont get it unless you call 5 times & yell at them. One day i had to wait 30min at the pool for towels. The staff was completely clueless about where the towels will come from. There is absolutely no coordination & communication between the staff. Also the towels & sheets in the rooms are dirty & you need to tell them for clean linen. The pool area is nice but the food and service is so poor that its better to avoid this property. There are much better properties in Goa & elsewhere!!

My wife and I stayed for 3 Nights at the Alila Diwa. Had previously stayed here in 2014 and loved the place, so choosing this hotel irrespective of the reviews was a no-brainer for us. Unfortunately, this time around we were rudely shocked. Property is beautiful, but one can see the 'newness' wearing out. Wooden flooring was creaky at many places and multiple stones on their long corridors looked cracked. Sad sight but not a deal breaker. Reason we would choose Alila over a Taj / Hyatt was their impeccable hospitality. Unfortunately, not so anymore. The staff has changed. Staff still has their heart at the right place but are just not trained properly or in some cases simply incompetent. Being an Indian, on many occasions, I was finding it difficult to communicate with the staff. 

On arrival, we were welcomed warmly by Nigel, who very nicely showed us all the available options. Thorough-bred gentleman. 

But post that experience, it went downhill. After a arduous drive from Pune, we wanted to relax but were disturbed by 4 phone calls for 4 different reasons. 
Anyway, everything can be forgiven, but in a few moments after the barrage of phone calls, a gentleman from housekeeping walks straight into our room whilst the privacy sign was On. Sorry guys, but something like this simply unpardonable!! 

On complaining about this incident, a Jr Asst Manager threw us a bone in the form of a free dinner 'but please pay for your beverages.' Anyway, I am sure this was the best he was authorised to do. 

The breakfast buffet was below par, practically the same for all 3 days except for a few twists in the potato / grilled fish. 

All in all failed to impress. I think Alila is now interested in catering to corporate affairs / weddings etc. Why else would your mini bar snacks include a Good-day biscuit and Haldiram?? Very sad to see such a beautiful property deteriorating so rapidly. 

Word of caution: Please make sure to ask whether there are any corporate events / weddings before checking in. If yes, choose another hotel as the facilities such as pool / bar are taken over and you end up in the midst of a unpleasant noisy environment!

Will I stay again? I might because I still can't get the fond memories of 2014 out of my head.

Yes it boasts of good rooms and a pretty swimming pool. But 15k for a night! Tht too in off season. Just not happening guys.

The spa is 5000 for a 1 hour massage. Even hotels like taj and hyatt are cheaper than this. I would definitely recommend to avoid this place. 

But for guys with lots of cash. Huh! Hv a blast.

Stayed March 2016, travelled as a couple

I have just returned home having spent 2 weeks at Alila Diwa. I have to say I have struggled writing this review. The hotel has quite a few good points, conversely however it has quite a few bad points.
First and foremost, the thing that really makes this hotel is the staff. Every single member of staff from the driver who picked me up at the airport through the gardeners, the cleaners, the bar staff, reception staff, restaurant staff, were, without exception friendly, helpful, cheerful and a real credit to the hotel.

Now, allow me to quote a couple of adjectives used on the hotel website 'serenity', 'tranquil courtyards'. In addition this hotel features as a Thomson A La Carte hotel. I have to say my expectations were high.

I was sorely disappointed. 

It appears to me that Alila Diwa caters for the Tourist market as a sideline. What this hotel is, is a conference and events destination. There is something quite disconcerting about being surrounded by 100 plus conference delegates (a recent review quotes 220 delegates, this happened the day before I left), in the dining room and then having the tranquil mood around the pool invaded by a large group of them playing games in the pool screaming and shouting at each other. 
In addition to the large number of people attending conferences at the hotel during my stay the Sunday lunch is apparently open to paying visitors should they wish to come along. A large group of English visitors paid their money and invaded the serenity of the pool area on my second Sunday. Without a word of exaggeration all that was needed was Madge in a gold motability scooter to appear and it really would have been like being on the set of Benidorm.

Don't get me wrong, when the hotel is being used by paying holiday guests only it really is a haven of tranquillity. When the restaurant is not full of conference delegates the atmosphere is exceptional. 

I know the tourist market is tough at the moment but the hotel really need to address how they cater for paying holiday guests and how they can be kept apart from conference and events guests.

The rooms at the hotel are really rather comfortable. I loved the open plan design. They are kept spotless by the efficient cleaning staff and their managers. I have never seen three people cleaning one room. Magnificent!!

The Vivo restaurant serves a mix of different foods from around the world. Indian, Chinese, Italian. Somewhat rather unusual for a buffet restaurant all the food was piping hot. A special thanks must go to Subrata one of the waiters in the restaurant and also to the manager Shubhay. Both of these guys really are exceptional at what they do. Always a friendly greeting using my name, always happy to offer something that is not on the menu (loved the cheese and onion naan). Thanks guys.

I paid one visit to the Spice Studio but had an unfortunate experience there that I won't dwell on.

The best place to eat at the hotel has got to be The Bistro. The food there was beyond anything I had expected to experience in India. It really is a 'fine dining' experience.

The Edge bar offers a great place to have a relaxed pre-dinner drink (when the pool is not being invaded by conference delegates). I've become a fan of the Indian Merlot they serve and the Mojitos are just mind blowing. 

If you're thinking of booking Alila Diwa or have already booked be prepared to share you holiday experience with conference delegates and people attending sundry other events at the hotel. 

I wouldn't book again, but that's my personal choice. As I said previously when the hotel is being used by paying holiday guests only it really is a haven of tranquillity. Unfortunately the hotels main business interfered with and spoilt my holiday. To their credit the management at the hotel did address my concerns whilst I was there and they are to be applauded for this, especially Chadwick. It just seemed that as they addressed one issue another one arose or another large group arrived for a conference.

This is our third time staying at this hotel. 
The staff are attentive, pool boys, waiters and housekeeping. Breakfasts are good with variety of dishes. Rooms are well arranged and air-con quiet. Infinity pool is great, cart to beach usually efficient.
During our stay at this hotel there were two weddings which lasted three days each, one was massive, also two conferences. During these times there were changes of restaurants, unable to use the infinity pool for three days.(you could use club pool, but it is not what we were expecting). Times you were using the pool there would be a construction of an area ready for the next part of the celebration. Not very peaceful.
When the celebration started it would have loud music playing.
Also the taxi drivers we encountered acted like thugs! We use a local guy for taxis, one day we returned in a taxi, decided to have a drink at bar across the road as we were crossing the hotel drivers were hassling our driver. My husband asked what the problem was and at this the hotel driver verbally attacked him, then went to physically attack him, at this point the security guards stepped in to protect him! We reported this to the hotel , they investigated this incident but were told he denied it, although four of us were present plus hotel security. Would never use these taxis in any circumstances.
Also we did feel the constant weddings were intrusive but as management pointed out they need the different functions to survive in business because of the falling number of foreign tourists
We have been visiting Goa for nearly twenty years but the charm of the area has diminished to such an extent we probably will not visit again.

I first went to Alila Diwa in August as part of a conference group on a full meal plan. The experience and property was lovely, so we decided to do a family holiday during the Diwali week on a continental plan. The experience was just not up to the mark
1. The front desk is not geared up. Check out took a long time and the staff was struggling with the credit card machine
2. The restaurant for a la carte. Dinner time with a la carte was a mess. They were short-staffed, the orders took a lot of time, the billing was off, the soup came after the main course, etc. 
3. Breakfast buffet. When items would get over, it would take a long time for them to be replaced. 
4. Buggy to the beach. There is at least a 9-12 gap between the floor of the buggy and the ground. My mom who is 76 and has trouble climbing just could not climb in or out without two people holding and supporting her. We asked for a small stool or platform multiple times, but no escalation and no one was bothered. 
5. We had booked two taxis to take us to the airport. I had reconfirmed multiple times, but there was utter confusion at the time we were supposed to get the taxis. 
6. Though subtle there was a bias towards non-Indians, who formed the large majority of guests. 
On the plus side, the staff is ever-smiling, and when not stressed, helpful and supportive

Great hotel, but poor experience with Thompson holidays 

We travel a lot and can compare from experience. We usually pay more so we can relax and unwind in the best there is. Never having been to Goa before, we liked the marketing from Tompson on this 5 star resort. 

Flight:

This is a trip on the 787 Dreamliner where two passengers behind us nearly got to fighting over luggage space, where those in ear shot would have heard the man and woman telling other to 'F off'. No further issues from them but then I encountered what has to have been the rudest member of cabin crew in 40 years of long haul. 

My wife and I were in Premium on Tom124 at the very front. The issue was with a female member of the crew (I didn't get her name) but she wasn't permanently stationed there. She kept nipping down for a chat to her colleagues in the front galley - no issues with that.

Instead of asking if we could use the left side to access the toilets (I was in 1F and it meant walking over bags or all way round) she twice failed to utter a single word and instead, actually outstared me when I asked very politely to get past. On the second time when walking through and back to my seat, she did not move, leaving it difficult to squeeze past and then once I got through, she 'gestured' her disgust by 'slamming' shut the curtain. I'm not being funny but without a sign saying "crew only", if someone doesn't simply ask you, then the money-paying customer should not be left feeling chastised and embarrassed.

Hotel:

At first, very happy. The room is large and well laid out with the usual 5 star touches like a choice of nice shampoos etc, robes, slippers etc. Some bulbs were out and as always, there were not enough coat hangers or hanging space (we ended up leaving the cases out with clothes in (there really is little hanging space). The safe is also very awkward to get to in the clothes cupboard and fitted the wrong way around meaning you actually have to get in to the wardrobe and sit on the shelf to put the code in. So, five stars, I'm not sure based on the detail (yes, the problem if you've done 5 star in places like Dubai). Maybe we're spoilt but stars are stars and the same build detail should apply worldwide. 

The staff we met were really very nice and attentive. Their English was excellent and seriously nothing was too much trouble. Now, this did not apply everywhere. In the high quality Bistro pool bar, the staff fail every time to actually see you walking to a table and sitting waiting for a drink - ten minutes it takes on average and in the main, there were only two other couples there. There are around six members of staff on duty plus a Manager and they all seem to be doing something other than serving the customer. It happened every day without fail - in fact it's as if they are not part of the main hotel and almost like it's been franchised off to a cheapskate company. 

Weddings

I don't recall Tompson warning us that this was a hotspot Indian wedding venue. Had I had known, we would NOT have booked. The guests who were in the next room to us had come down for one of the weddings and like any self-respecting party reveller, they gave the ball a kick. Until 4:00am on Sunday they really were at full volume, ringing who ever they could at the top of their voice, with the TV blaring out, walking out on to the veranda every ten minutes to actually spit over on to the gardens. Not something you want to hear at the best of times and certainly not while trying get to sleep. We reported this next morning and the Duty Manager was very sympathetic and apologised. We said we never want that again and he said he would ensure our new neighbours would be quieter. They were, but alas the wedding they were attending was not!

All day from lunchtime today, the sedate venue of this beautiful location with lush surroundings, amazing affinity pools, Palm trees and paddy fields has been converted in to Ibiza, with music so loud, you could not shout to be heard. The sub bass levels like I had never heard before certainly started to make me feel sick. No matter where you went in the extensive grounds, you could not escape the 120 BPM for over five hours. I love loud music but this WAS TOO LOUD - to the point of it being treated as sound pollution.

By 6:00pm and the music has stopped. I chose not complain again, as it was getting boring for everyone. 

When it came to check out, because the flight was early morning, the contract for each of the several Brits on this package was to receive an 11:00pm check out. When we were asked to meet the day before to do the briefing, the local Thomson Rep said this was not true and it was a "misprint". We all showed proof and said, this was not possible and had to vacate our rooms by lunchtime. We complained and Tweeted but Thomson were useless. That said, the hotel Manager was fantastic and came to everyone's rescue to allow us to have use of a spare room each. Although it was inconvenient, it prevented us all from sitting fully clothed with no private facilities. Well done Alila Daiwa, rubbish service Thomson. 

Nothing came of this, except after three months when Thomson rang me to see if I was happy that my complaint was sorted. I explained we at the time was never compensated for the breach of contract, or the loss of a day in the hotel. The Customer Services call was quite literally a waste of time and would have been better not having been made at all. Useless!

Sorry to bang on about this, but seriously, this has put us off returning to the same hotel and we both vowed never to use Thomson Holidays again.

Me and my husband usually travel to Goa for short breaks. We have stayed more or less try different hotels. This time we went for 3 days stay so first day we stayed at Deltin suites ( however there was lot of crowd) and we wanted peaceful holiday so we decided to move out.My friends suggested to go to Alila Goa for remaining stay . It was a weekend and I contacted someone who could book us in. Gentleman called me and advised they that the reservation is confirmed for 2 nights. First night on All meal plan and second on Half board plan ( Breakfast plus one major meal). When reached the hotel reception I was surprised that the lady ( Front office Manager) offered us to stay at the Diwa Club section instead of the regular room (superior /exceutive ) we booked for. I assumed it was due to the good relation I shared with the Gentleman that we got upgraded. However Front office Lady subtly put across that there is a wedding group in house and for next three days it is going to be buzz and hence they want us to stay at the Diwa end ( so that we don't get disturbed). I was happy that at least they considered our privacy and didn't spoil our peace. She briefed us about breakfast at the Diwa club , but for lunch and Dinner ( we had to visit their restaurant which was common for wedding crowd). To my surprise the buffet on 1st day had only one non veg dish. I called the chef to know why they didn't have much choice and he answered abruptly the day India has higher Non vegetarian preference we will have much choice. It sounded Kidish . The entire restaurant staff was busy serving the wedding group that we waited for 15 minutes and 3 reminders to get a glass of water ....I thought we made a wrong choice staying at this property.
We were briefed about the mini theatre and movie at 9pm. So we decided not to move out of the hotel ( just relax) and watch a movie at the mini theatre. To my surprise again , I found the Wedding group sitting in the mini theatre and getting their Mehendi done. They told us you may watch the movie ( but how can you watch with all lights ON). We immediately went to the reception and confronted the Duty manager ( asking him that he could have informed us about this mehendi arrangement in advance so that we wouldn't have wasted our evening waiting , instead would have moved out in the evening.
However he apologised and advised the following night he will take care. It wouldn't happen.
So the second day saga - We have a good late breakfast at the Diwa side. 
We roamed around and slept and skipped (paid ) lunch. We stepped out late evening for dinner . Again the restaurant was crowded with wedding grip tables weren't set and we had to look around again for a glass of water . Since my husband was hungry, we didn't bother to wait we went to the buffet .... again sad non veg dish .....as soon as my hubby had his first bite ....surprise surprise ..he found a plastic strap in his food ( one that are tied to chicken legs). He was furious and we called for the F &B Manager. He apologised and advised that Chef will see us. We actually felt this is a disaster and things are going worst for us. We then met the chef and a dedicated restaurant guy was allotted to take care of us. All of them consoled us about our bitter experience at the property .
They also asked why didn't the Duty manager offer a DVD player last night instead of asking you to wait until next day. I didn't have any answer.
it took two days for the team to realise that our holiday was getting spoiled , ( Unfortunately due to non availability of return tickets we were forced to extend our stay by a night) I was very skeptical , but my hubby didn't want to move out as we had a next day early morning 5:45 am flight) we didn't bother to ask anything any further. Staff was good. 
I felt things could have been managed well. If one is going to relax and spend a peaceful holiday , first enquire there are no groups also as customers we expect HOTEL to be more equipped to manage such situations.
But I wonder why didn't GM bother to meet us . In spite of several critical incidents happening with the guest GM didn't bother. I wonder what was he busy with ?

My husband and I were there in February, in the brochure it stated there was entertainment every night but in fact there was the same CD playing every night for 2 weeks apart from 1 night when they showed The Sound Of Music!!!!!! It also stated that snacks would be served by the pool until midnight but that was not the case either, there was the occasional bowl of nuts. we certainly loved the hotel but wouldn't say its ideal for all inclusive. The staff were all very friendly and the hotel was lovely but sad to say we will not be returning to this one very expensive and not a la carte.

About 6 couples decide to go for the weekend here....The food standard was not as expected....when we ordered Burger and fries...the fries didn't come...reason as the waiter had told us "The gas got over,so couldn't make fries"
When we complained about the other food,waiters tell us that our taste buds are wrong and everyone else appreciate it.
Never coming again to this hotel for food,
Only worth thing at this hotel is the pool.

We stayed at Alila Diwa Goa for 2 nights at a Family Suite. Both Agoda and Alila's websites say "lush paddy views" but our room overlooks a rooftop with no field - lush or not lush - in sight. When I brought the matter to the site manager Mr. Chanwick, he said view is subjective. We could not agree with him as looking out to an ugly rooftop is obviously inferior to what was promised. He then argued that the better rooms are reserved for long-stay customers. If that is the case then it should be specified that view is subject to availability. When we asked what he could do to help Mr. Chanwick said the hotel was full (which didn't seem so) and he only has one room with view. The choice he gave us was either to squeeze the 3 of us from a Family suite into a standard room, or, we have to take a second room with extra charges. We found both choices unacceptable and after much time wasted, Mr. Chanwick said the best he could do was to offer us sunset drinks. We refused to accept that as it didn't even seem like a sincere offer to rectify the situation. 

I think the biggest problem here is not just the misleading room description on Alila website, but a stubborness to deny an error and unwillingness to help.

This was the place in India that I was most looking forward to staying, but it left a bad taste in my mouth. 

Firstly, our room was fantastic, but there was no hot water in the bath after the first night. I contacted reception on several occasions, but it was never looked at. 

Secondly, many of the staff seemed to be handing around for tips, not something you would expect when staying in a resort costing the amount it did. 

However, I do need to give credit where it is due. Movil who cleaned our room was different, he was efficient and did his job well. He was very hard working.

Thirdly, if we wanted an extra bed in the room four our children it was going to cost and extra 2500 rupees per night, around $50 AUD. When paying over $200 AUD per night, this is not acceptable. They did provide the linen, at no extra cost, for one child to sleep on the couch. 

Fourthly, the laundry costs were more than double the cost of what other hotels we stayed at charged. The staff had difficult in costing the children's clothing right. When I pressed this issue, it was corrected with and overall discount. 

Finally, staying at the Alila Diwa isolates you to using the taxi service engaged by Alila Diwa. The service is a huge rip off. When I asked for a car that was not going to rip me off, they produced a price list. I was told the vehicles are cleaner and larger. To have a car take me to Margoa was going to cost me 1000 rupees one way. Yet another vehicle the same model and size, not linked with the resort, would do a return trip and wait for me for two hours in Margoa for 600 rupees. The hotel vehicle would only wait 1 hour. There were other destinations that we were quoted by the hotel 800 rupees that an alternative taxi (same size and model) would charge 300 rupees for. The drivers associated with the Alila Diwa still expected a tip. Due to the location of the resort you cannot just walk out onto the street and get an alternative taxi. You need to walk up to the main road, which takes 15-30 minutes. We found a regular driver while in Goa, but he could not pick us up from the resort, we had to meet him elsewhere. In the end, he had to drop us off nearby as he was given a hard time by the resort staff. This treatment of our chosen driver really upset me. 

Our room was comfortable, the resort was clean, the gardens beautiful, the pool was fantastic, there was a free courtesy vehicle to the beach and the breakfast food was fantastic. It was the other things that left me feeling I was constantly being ripped off that made the Alila Diwa the worst place we stayed while in India.

location of the hotel is fine, rooms are good, food is also fine, but the staff at the reception is lacks courtesy of a 5 star. We booked 2 rooms by make my trip.com. At the time of check in on monday we reached hotel at 1.30 pm had to wait as the check in time was 3.00 pm. We requested them if they could give even one room as my parents and kids were along they kept us waiting saying rooms not yet ready. At 3.00 pm finally we were provided only one room. Finally got the other rooms only by around 3.30pm. As my flight was at 4 pm tuesday i requested check out at 2.00 pm instead of 12.00, they kept saying we will try, we will try and at 11.45 they said sorry no rooms available. At that point i had to raise my voice and threaten them about the late check out complaint, at that time i had to force them to provide at least 1 room for stay upto 2.00 pm. then we 5 people spent 2 hrs in one room. overall dealing with reception staff was not a easy task. Looked like bargaining in flea market.

V went in a big group here on the 15th August weekend..the hotel is a small property with average rooms..they conned us with the name of family terrace rooms being bigger and better than the terrace rooms..we payed the extra amount and then saw they were same kind of rooms more or less..the buffet food was pathetic every time..only the ice creams were good in the whole spread of buffet..for the tariffs that we payed here..I think we could hv got better properties..

The property is very nice and the interiors are great, but there is nothing else which is good about the hotel. Though the interiors were good, but everything is designed in a very complicated manner, specially light switches. You will have to spend some time to understand how they fucntion.
We had gone there, on the long weekend of 15th August 2014 and the hotel was fully occupied, but they did not have sufficient staff to cater to all the guest. Service was very slow and the quality of food was pathetic.
During buffet, one had to stand in long queues at live counters to get the food made of their choice. The Buffet spread was very bad and there were hardly any dishes which were good in taste.
I would suggest other places in goa over Alila Diwa, as they do not have, what a lot of other hotels in goa would offer. The beach was not walkable, one had to take a shuttle from the hotel, everytime one wants to go to the beach. They did not have any tie ups with any car hire places, i. e. if you want to hire a self driven car, you dont have any option. There is no such option available nearby also, if you want to explore such options on your own. We had a drop facility to the airport as a part of our package, but they delayed that also because they were so disorganized. Some of the positive points about the hotel would be that they gave quite good discount vouchers as a part of our deal. But I would not reccomend this place to anyone visiting goa...

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my husband for a business-cum-family trip during monsoon. We had booked Alila Diwa room, however the hotel upgraded us to Diwa Club (Nice). The hotel is competitively priced compared to other 5 star properties in Goa. The welcome process is quick and refreshing. The property looks amazing until you cross the Alila Diwa gardens and get to know that the Diwa Club is surrounded with so many residential houses. They have two residential houses within the property (and we found residential people driving bikes randomly). The rooms are quite nice and big, with a modern style bathroom, however the view from room is busy residential houses and not a Goa'n view. They have quite a few restaurants; with just like any another hotel food options. If you are in Goa for beach or beach view you need to walk for 10 mins to reach there from this hotel. They claim to have frequent shuttle services, that is not so frequent. We woke up in the morning with a lot of residential house noise, and found their restaurant super busy to get some breakfast to make up the morning. To avoid hassle, we tried ordering food in the room other day, for which room service never cleared the plate (even after requesting them over a call). The check out process is very painful too! We requested them for half an hour extension to check out, because of obvious odd flight times and they were very strict about not extending it (as the hotel was busy). When we arrived at the reception, it was very sad to know, that they were happy to give exception to many other guest for an hour and two. My only bit is, you can get better hotels at this rate; like Taj Exotica, Hyatt and Lalit, which can offer you great service and experience. It's all about service and experience when you prefer south Goa to spend your holidays.

We stayed in Alila Diwa from 15th March to 18th March (Me, My Wife, 2 Kids - 5 yr / 6 months old)

Good: The property is nice, rooms are of good size. Pool is very nice. Best part is Kids area - lot of activities for the kids. My daughter loved it.
The hotel is about 1km away from sea, but they've regular shuttle going to the sea. 

Bad: But our stay was spoilt by two aspects : terrible service, and issue with lift. On the service front, we faced challenge at cafeteria. Long lines at each counter, and hotel frequently ran out of stuff. Curd was finished on Day1, and ran out of paranthas on Day2.

Ugly: Biggest issue we faced was lift. We were given room on 2nd floor. On 15th evening itself, lift stopped working, while we were inside lift. Had to wait for 15 minutes, for someone to come, open the lift manually, and rescue us out. After this incident, they installed a notice in front of lift that lift not working. From Day1 evening to Day3 morning, lift was not working, and we had to climb up and down manually (with 6 months kid, and a pram in tow - very challenging). I informed this to management team, but no action. On Day3, lift started working. We used it once, and again we all got stuck. Someone had to come and rescue us manually after 10 minutes!! We again raise issue to management, but no action, other than apology! Ofcourse, after this experience, we didn't use the lift at all, and checked out the next morning.
In service industry, problem can come in any area. Running hotel is a complex challenge. But how a good hotel differentiate itself is putting customer first, and prompt response/action on issues. Not only there were recurrent issues faced, but we didn't see any tangible action happening from management. Very disappointing stay.

Our experience with the hotel was bad from the check in, we had to wait endlessly as there was check out of wedding guests. We were booked in the club Diwa where we paid 16k per nite. The only good hing was we were apart from the main wing, had our own pool. The food is average but service pathetic. No waiters would even look at you to offer to serve you. The cleanliness of the rooms were below avg. At bistro we asked for apple juice and were never served , ultimately we left bistro and were still charged for it. The check out was pathetic again , car not on time inspire of promising us that coach would be available at the agreed hour. Wrongly charged mini bar bill was another woe. The receptionist , Shaheen was laid back in her approach, (not even a smile on her face from day one)and took ages to waive off the said amount until we intervened and told her we were late for our flight. All in all just not worth 16 k a nite.its more of a wedding destination, they host weddings at least once a week. This kinda service, cleanliness and attitude is not expected from a five star hotel. We had just spent 4 nights prior to here at grand Hyatt and the difference was clearly visible.

The Hotel is beautifull, but its beauty is chipped away as your holiday goes on. They mainly cater for the Indian weddings in this hotel and you are pushed to one side, The pool will be out of bounds the resturants closed and even if you can go in the pool you will be over run by small children that are allowed to run riot. Peace is shattered.The weddings held here go on for 2-3 days so its not just a one off, People got so fed up of being turned away that they ate out (the shacks outside are lovely!) so when the wedding finished there wasnt any one in the resturant. They then closed the resturant , not funny when your full board!!
If you were Indian the service in this hotel was fantastic.

Seriously. A mess. A beautiful property nearly ruined by some truly inexplicable service and business decisions.

Unfortunately, our very first impressions set the tone for what would turn out to be a very strange resort experience.

Upon arrival in Goa, we had arranged to be met by a car and driver from the hotel. We exit the terminal, and survey the sea of drivers holding signs  but no sign with our name, no sign with the Alila Diwa logo. My husband walks around a bit trying to find someone. No luck. He heads back into the terminal to try to find help, where he finds a very nice guy who manages to track down a rep from the hotel. He searches for our name on the list of the days expected arrivals. Nothing. He pulls out a cell phone and calls the hotel, and has a long conversation with someone else who had never heard of us either, despite the fact that I had booked this stay months in advance and was holding in my hand a hard copy of our reservation complete with confirmation number. Nope. No idea who we are. At this point my husband and I were both fuming. (As it happens, I had also come down with a sinus infection and was feeling awful, so this was not helping.) He hands the cell phone to my husband, who gets nowhere, but they do finally agree to pay for a cab to take us to the hotel  still no promise of a room, but at least we will be able to negotiate with someone face-to-face.

We arrive at the hotel, and naturally we are loaded for bear  but as soon as we get out of the car a manager comes over saying everything was figured out and they have our room and here's some juice! All is well! OK! Great....except...What is that crazy LOUD music? "Oh! That's a wedding! he explains. They're having a pool party so it will be like this for the next few hours...You won't hear it by your room though!"

Ummmm...Not exactly the peace and quiet we had been looking for, but if we can't hear it near our room in the Diwa Wing....

We arrive at our room. It is a beautiful suite  large, comfortable, tastefully decorated. Its in the Diwa Wing, which is about a five minute walk from the main part of the hotel, but we can still hear the music! We are lucky enough to have stayed in many resorts around the world, of many different levels of service and price range. If you travel enough, it is inevitable that occasionally you will stay at a resort that has a wedding or other event taking place. Were pretty easy going people  really! We are! We can make allowances! But we have never, ever, experienced this level of noise and disruption. We would later learn after talking to several members of the staff that this hotel is a HUGE wedding destination. Which is fine, but NOT at the expense of the
enjoyment of other guests  especially when you market yourself as a serene resort where you can enjoy an intimate couples retreat where relaxation reigns. We couldn't even sit and read at the Diwa Wing pool. It was that loud. Not cool, Alila Diwa. (And, it could have been much worse. As it turned out, this was just a party - the actual wedding ceremonies and banquet were taking place somewhere else.)

Now, as to the service Perhaps the kindest way to describe nearly every interaction with a staff member would be Well meaning, but awkward. After we checked in, we were puzzled to find that the room had almost none of the amenities you would expect. No shower gel, no body cream, no hand soap for the sink by the toilet - you know, the standard stuff you find in hotel rooms marketing themselves in the luxury category! We asked for some extra soap 3 times before any were delivered. To their credit, they did finally apologize, and from then on the housekeeper made a point of creating some genuinely cute towel animals each night, which was nice.

In the restaurants, the servers all seemed very nervous and unsure of the fundamentals of their jobs. If you asked for coffee when sitting down for breakfast, it wouldn't come until the end of the meal. If you wanted to find a waiter, even though the restaurant was nearly empty, it would feel like a real-life game of Wheres Waldo?

Breakfast in the Diwa Wing's Bistro could be OK, but our advice: Stick to eggs. Pancakes were like glue and, when my husband made the mistake of ordering the crepes, they arrived raw  perhaps no one had ever actually ordered them before, and the cook was unaware that they were supposed to be cooked? Who knows, but Yuck! On the other hand, the one night we had dinner in the Bistro, the food was quite nice and the friendly executive chef a joy to chat with. 

Dinner in the Spice Studio was also very good and the lovely manager was helpful with giving advice on unusual menu choices and such. We also enjoyed the house made pickles (the garlic!!) and mini lesson on Indian spices!

On the other hand, the resorts approach to room service was beyond peculiar. We wanted to order some of that tasty Indian food to our room for dinner one night, but there was no menu in the room. So we asked for menus at the front desk  and it was like pulling teeth. After several attempts, miscommunications, and negotiations, we finally figured out that since we were staying in the Diwa Wing part of the hotel, we could only have food from the Bistro menu delivered to our room. Huh? At times, it felt like the Diwa Wing was being operated as a separate property from the rest of the resort.

Although the resort itself is well taken care of, and the grounds are lovely, we found the decor of the room a bit sterile. The vast white walls screamed out for some art; the illuminated nooks were obviously meant to hold flowers or sculptures or something  but were empty. Both pools are beautiful, but the annoying pop music coming from the bar made it nearly impossible to truly relax or read when using the pool by the main part of the hotel. Why spoil this gorgeous view of rice patties and water buffalo and palm trees by blasting "Man In The Mirror" 3 times in the span of an hour? (And no, that is not a joke: we counted.)

We enjoyed the walk to the beach, past lovely homes, small farms, and friendly stray dogs. (Watch for the cow patties!) The beach is spectacular. The shack on the left once you get past the entrance to the beach has comfy loungers, cold beer, and the owners are very friendly and fun to chat with. The water was calm and warm during our visit. Perfect for swimming.

But, back to the resort and its unrelenting oddness: We arranged for a car to the airport days in advance of our checkout, and reconfirmed it numerous times with numerous people (hey, we were a little paranoid after the arrival debacle!). Upon checkout, while waiting an alarmingly long time for the car to arrive, we were handed a blank piece of paper and asked to "Write about all the things we liked about the resort - and mention names. The staff wanted us to review them while waiting for our car to the airport, and WHILE THEY WATCHED! We were dumbstruck. We would understand if they encouraged guests to put reviews here on Tripadvisor, or give us a survey to fill out later. But don't put people on the spot like that!!!! It was incredibly uncomfortable and awkward  but in some strange way, perhaps it was the most fitting end to a very peculiar 5 days.

The Alila Diwa really needs to decide if it's a wedding/banquet facility with rooms on premise, or a hotel that markets itself to independent travelers. It doesn't seem able to do both. My husband put it this way: "This hotel is like a Stradivarius violin in the hands of a very untalented 6 year old". Beautifully designed, but played terribly. What a missed opportunity.

Very disappointed with my stay. On arrival, guests are served with glasses of kokum juice. As I was thirsty, I had two glasses. I am always very careful about what I eat and drink in India, but don't drink the hotel's kokum juice because I ended up with diarrhea for two days! They hotel claims to be 5 stars, which is a joke. The signs around the place are falling apart (missing letters etc) and are generally unhelpful (took us 20 mins to find the kids activity area) while in our room heavy water stains were coming through the marbling. I also had to call reception four times to get the wireless connection sorted, and when it was working it was very very slow and next to useless. The staff are generally young and inexperienced, and have trouble dealing with anything but simple requests. Do yourself a favour and go somewhere else.

I stayed here for 2 weeks and can promise why one should not stay in this hotel?

1. Staff with a lot of attitude. From front desk to bar....everyone.
2. 1.5 Km away from beach...the shuttle they claim to be provided is only available from 10 AM to 5 PM
3. They will never change the bedsheet or towels....will just fold the used ones till you notice
4. Used crockery will never be removed till alila host is informed
5. Spice Studio is always closed for private parties. The only other option Vivo is pathetic.
6. Gym doesn't have access to Steam room. The sweaty treadmill will always be sweaty.
7. Charged my Credit Card for the whole stay 100% advance even with asking me.

The only thing the hotel is good at is replying back on public platforms with false information. The guy who is replying back will never see you in person. He is probably sitting in marketing office.

The alila diwa goa is a good and new property spread over a good space with good pools and good pool facing rooms,
The rooms are very spacious and the amenities are new with all latest gadgets and all new bathroom fittings,the bathrooms also spread over a 150sqft space

The sad part is the management and the staff who could not serve the guest with smile,the management is good professional and not upto the mark,the food is pathetic and no variety is being served,as the property is located very in isolated place that it becomes difficult to go out

If you are looking to pamper yourself with good food and enjoyment then don't opt for this property

Stayed August 2012, travelled with family

Nice ambiance .... nice rooms with amenities but the service quality is pathetic. Not suitable for any group movement. 
Resort is away from the beach ... n they claimed to have shuttle service between hotel n the beach. During our stay I have to utilise the services of my vehicle to ferry my group members to beach as vehicles were not there and hotel refused to use there other vehicles stating they are used only for airport transfers. 
Service is below par ... if you ask something u get after 2 hrs that too with reminders. The team has no authority to take any decision and for any request you get the reply NO. 
Such a bad experience we had during our stay at the hotel ... definitely not going to visit again. 
I must say hotel is great with amenities and ambiance where they lack is the service quality. Big NO for any one looking this one for group movement.

This was our fifth visit tot the hotel in the last three years. This time we planned may as the kids school holiday's were coming to an end. We have always loved this hotel and preferred it to the other five stars in South Goa due to it's location, ambience and the serenity it's offers which is really required when one is taking a break from the faced paced life in Mumbai. Have always given this place a lot of reccomendations but unfortunately this time we had a very disappointing experience because of the detroiating service standards in the hotel !!! am a very Selective traveler and attention to detail is important to me and due to work pressure we land up taking 2 holidays only every year!! we arrived into the hotel during lunch time , we went to Vivo the coffee shop as We we horrified with our first meal at the start of vacation which gave us th taste of being at a wedding where the caterer cooks for the masses and doesnt care about presentation or quality. And it's sad that after calling the GM of the hotel and speaking to the head of F & B 
services about my disappointment in the food quality were we promised attention to food. All I can is that besides one night of having a good meal from spice studio the other meals were below average!!! Forget expectations on local goan food , the other fare wouldn't excite your pallet at all !! I did get an opportunity to meet with the Head Chef who was pretty outright in telling me that the choice of food was to cater the large groups !! We had a fantastic experience eating out at Nostalgia and even at Martin's but all select foodie's would not recommend the food at the hotel at all!! They have a gorgeous infinity pool and also a new wing which houses another pool which we enjoyed !!! Our SPA exereince was also good!! 
To summarise all I can say is that it's a great place to stay with courteous staff but definately not a good place to eat in!!! A Beautiful Hotel which has miles to go where food quality and service standards are concerned!! We are definitely not coming back to this hotel !!

We stayed here during the good friday long weekend and the resort was packed. Seems to have become extremely popular and talked about in the past year or do. I really don't know why?

The goods things first: The property is well laid out, not too big not to small. Its got a shuttle access to the beach which is convenient. Its close to the airport, about 20 mins. We had a really good time with the kids. The kiddy pool is nice and so is the children's center. The activities organised for the kids on Easter Sunday was fun. The staff at the childrens center was helpful. The pool looked nice and comfortable lazy benches in the pool to lie inside. 

Now for the real deal: Honestly for a 5 star property with a 5 star price its nowhere close. 
The rooms though spacious are not squeeky clean. We had a garden room the flooring tiles seemed to have some portion chipped off and the table in the room was not fully polished. The big bathtub in the bathroom (with the sliding door) seemed more like a hindrance rather than a comfort. 
The pool corners had dirt and goo accumulated. Saw that when my sister pointed it out, not a very pleasant sight. 
The worst part was the service and food. We had taken an all meals including package and maybe that was a big mistake as the food spread though large was poor in taste. Only saving grace was the dosa during breakfast which was exceptionally good. 
The service was appalling at the dining area. Seems like no one cares, everyone is running around like chickens with their heads cut off. When asked to do anything it takes forever and umpteen reminders. Really poor. Also the room service ordered for kids food takes forever to deliver and when asked to make it less spicy, it doesnt' happen that way. I cant understand how can they mess it up. 
The staff at the reception also painfully slow. Despite informing them well in advance they couldn't organise an airport drop off in time at 3 pm. It took forever to get a few cars in place. I find it hard to believe how difficult can that be. 
Our family was big with many children and we had fun, but I would not recommend this place to anyone with 5 star expectation. I have stayed at the Taj Village in Goa (see my other review) and believe me this is nowhere close. Service in a 5 star is top notch and sorry to say but Alila Diwa Goa has a long way to go. Glad that i will never be back here again.

in this beatifull resort, the management locked the nice central pool for a wedding parry, not allowing any other of the guests to swim . it seems that a weddingparty is more important to te manager than his guests. after complaining , nothing changed , and the normal guests were not taken seriously. i have never seen something happening like this in a 5 star resort.

I am writing with feedback about the dinner my family of eight and I had at Spice Studio, Alila Diwa last night, i.e. Wednesday, 4th January 2012.

From loud music, loud fights in the kitchen, dirty plates and snail pace service, one could describe it as a most unpleasant experience, definitely not one that would draw a customer for a second time around.

We were awed by the property itself and the elegance. However, once seated at the table, it was really something we never expected. 

Firstly, the waiters got the order all wrong. I don't know why more than one had to take the order to begin with.

The drinks came in one at a time, the last one, a humble orange juice arriving 45 minutes later midway during dinner. Cashew feni came instead of the Palm feni and when exchanged the waiter tried to light up the drink unsuccessfully with a cigarette gas lighter. Is this actually permissible? After all the effort the drink only ended up with an unpleasant smell! It took ages to even get two bottles of drinking water.

The appetisers arrived well after the drinks were had and then the dinner, one dish at a time, with the accompaniments rice/rotis coming in when the food was cold. No one thought of serving us and the heavy crockery was just placed on the table (you could really switch to something lighter for self service). And the climax was that half the order did not arrive - two dishes of mutton pepper fry, rice and a seafood salad. After some waiting we called the waiter who was absolutely clueless about the rest of the order and so were the other two who had pitched in to take the same.

We were told after consultation with the chef, that the salad would take at least 20 minutes to prepare, the mutton fry another 20 minutes and well, there were no suggestions of any quicker option. As a result 3 of us had no food to eat. We just about split what was left of the other dishes. We were even denied a naan to go along as it would take 15 minutes and then the two rotis which they condescended to bring arrived after we finished eating, all burnt around the edges. Most probably the dough was hurriedly prepared as it was raw in the centre. It seems they were in a hurry to close down the kitchen which we realised when leaving.

I would understand if something like this happened in an overcrowded restaurant and not one that had hardly five guest covers last evening. The way the staff was operating serving all five at one time, with one dish here and one there, gave the impression that these were either untrained hands or that the hotel just lacked the capacity to run a restaurant. We had to keep asking for the music volume to be lowered and another guest and I had to request that the shouting in the kitchen be moved elsewhere. It was really difficult to have a relaxed evening and conversation across the table.

I really do hope the hotel takes this feedback seriously as this is NOT an experience one takes back from a hotel of supposedly of this standard. I would not rate it as the Best Hotel in India after yesterday. I surely hope the rest of the services are better. For us it was just a waste of money and we could have got a better deal in the restaurant across the road.

The only staff member who can be recommended was the Security Guard at the entrance of the hotel, who was very helpful with my disabled mother, getting her in a wheelchair and taking her into the hotel and out of it. He really stood out for his good and polite behaviour and willingness to help. This was a small consolation for my 84 year old mother, who does not go out any more, but did so specially yesterday just for us. She didn't even get her small salad!

The hotel is supposed to be a five star property but it does not match to any of the other places i have stayed in Goa in my earlier visits. 

The staff is not only ignorant but very callous towards the needs of the guests.( if I tell them that there is no salt in the sambar and he reverts that salt is there on the table u can understand what I am saying!)

They take too long to do the check in and one person does not know what the other is doing so there is total chaos.

There were no napkins in the rest rooms!

The gala dinner for the new year eve was at a steep price of Rs 6000 per head ( compulsory ) and what they offered us was street food of Mumbai ! i could see all the foreigners just having fruit for dinner. There was no show and at midnight there were barely a one minute firework which ended before it began.Total shoddy show. We were made to pay for the gala dinner along with our booking but on 31 afternoon we realise that we have to book our table, which was too late so we got a very corner table. they did not have to courtesy to tell us also that we have to get our table alloted or anything.

Great place for a quiet break in Goa. If you want to stay away from North Goa tourism, this is just the place to be.

Rooms were very good. Food was very good. Service was selectively very good and at times not so good.

Stayed in alila for 2 nights with kids it was amazing atmosphere massive lung space and Waterbodies. Check Inn was not fast they took there time for the formalities but till I waited they served kokum juice and wet towels which was nice.room was nice with all Morden amenities and the bathroom was also of the same size with a sliding door which did not have lock which was disappointing with kids in the same room . swimming pool was lovely clean overlooking the paddy fields. My kids enjoyed kids club and the mini theatre. They have shuttle to the beach which is 500m from the property but the beach does not have any beach activities. Spa had complimentary suna but steam was charged which was disappointing. Breakfast at vivo was very good special there masala chai. During checkout luggage took 20 minutes to come to lobby. Had lunch in martins which was 400m from the property but could go for dinner as the stretch was dark so had dinner in fishka which is right opposite the hotel which was also good . Hotel does not provide complimentary airport transfers which is disappointing. And the taxi system in goa is very pathetic they charge 500rs if u have to go nearby I don't know when app based taxis would be launched in goa it would be boon for travellers like us.over all very good property .

Very good property and its feel amazing when your are enjoying its infinity pool with rain pouring from sky.
Luxury on its best..!
Lovely feeling to be here and a strongly recommend to come with your family

I was at Alila diwa recently with my family. It was a great stay overall. Rooms were comfortable and had a great decor. Breakfast at the Vivo was very nice. There is 1 thing which needs to improve ( as such the 4 star rating): The staff at the reception can be a bit more helpful. I wanted a self driving car and I was told they have taxis near the hotel and I should use those. When I asked for some contacts for self driven cars, the lady at the reception showed a cold face and said she does not have any contact. Really?? Someone beside her told me to check in google. Oh...I forgot google, thanks for reminding me. Why don't you replace the reception staff with the google search engine and "OK google" ??? That would be so much better. That was disappointing. Rest of our stay was great.

Lovely place with beautiful rooms. Nice food and the staff is highly courteous and excellent. Choice of cuisines is nice. Loved walking around the resort. So much greenery and it's kept very clean. Definitely recommendable

Definitely counts among the beautiful properties in Goa. Some reasons why you should and may not choose to stay here.

Why you should stay here:
1. Beautiful property, peaceful surroundings
2. Large rooms, clean huge bathrooms
3. Hospitable, prompt, courteous and cheerful staff
4. Good food
5. The resort is around 20mins away from Margao (Madgaon) by taxi and around 45mins from the airport
6. Offers ample space for kids to play and run around. They also have dedicated play areas for kids.

Why you may not stay here:
1. This resort is not on the beach and the nearest beach(Gonsua beach) is around 1.5kms away (15min walk)
2. If you are looking for shopping and other commercial stuff, the nearest beach is Kolva beach which is around 7kms away.
3. There are similar beautiful properties offering similar facilities which have their own private beaches.

This resort should be definitely considered if you are just wanting to be in peace with nature or with kids.

We were here (our group of 10 people) in the long Independence day weekend. The hotel is good, food is excellent and service is also very good. Liked the pool also. As its a low rise had a chance to walk around. Beach is a five minute walk away though.

Great experience in a very well located resort. The rooms are very good and it is a good opinion for a family holidays. Despite the fact thatt the beach is 1km aways, the hotel provides a shuttle. The food is good.

This resort is set amidst greenery and huge banyan trees which gives you a feeling of being not in one of the regular resorts. Being a part of a group of nearly sixty people our rooms were given to us as and when they were ready and the last room was given at 3 pm. The rooms are very spacious, the bath room and walk in ward robes are a delight for the guests. The room had a huge balcony and sit out. Being on the ground floor, there was a small garden like area extending from the balcony which lent natural charm just outside the room. The Edge Pool is a great pool to spend some hours swimming at the resort. The restaurant is very spacious enough to accomadate more than one group of guests, if required. 
The food served was good, but could have been better for a resort of this high rating. The quality of fish items that were on offer for buffet lunch/dinner was not good. Some items were too spicy. A few of the items were very good and the desserts spread was excellent. A mention has to be made of the flies inside the restaurant. They were on the food items, at the dining table and sometimes even on our face as we were dining. This is a matter of serious concern.
The resort staff was very helpful and courteous. The WiFi connectivity was very good at all places in the resort. There was some problem with the television connection in the room. The connection would come on and off and sometimes at the dead of night the TV would come on and spring a surprise to us.
A very good resort to enjoy a holiday and I hope that the management will attend to the suggestions I have made.

Hotel is about 45 mins drive from the airport in Majorda. It is quite close to the beach. It has two swimming pools, gardens, well stocked bar, restaurant and banquet halls. Hotel is done up in traditional Goan style especially the lobby.

When we arrived at the resort we were not ready for what lay behind the subtle facade.The personalized warm welcome & the serene surroundings relaxed and calmed us down immediately.The walk till the rooms is a delight. The rooms are awesome and very comfortable.The luxurious bathroom needs a special mention.
The infinity pool had the kids hooked. Food is scrumptious and lavish spread at the breakfast spoils us for the choice.The resort was full but devoid of any cacophony that usually accompanies a big crowd. Walk to the beach is just 10 min. The beach is neat clean and very thinly crowded as only the guests come there.The best part is the very courteous staff. Always smiling and eager to make the stay comfortable. All in all an amazing place to stay. I would strongly recommend.

an excellent excellent resort spread over vast land,it is very well maintained ,the amenities ,the pool beautiful,the services good, the staff very cooperative and courteous, the food also good, the beach is close by

We stayed at All Diwa over Christmas 2016 and had the most amazing time. The staff and hotel were fantastic. However what really made our trip to Goa was the beach shack at the bottom of the road by the hotel called Mashas. The hotel provide transport to the beach all day until 7pm and you must visit Mashas at least once while staying at Alila Diwa. Do it early in your trip and you will go there again and again. We spent most days on the quiet beach in front of Mashas. There are only two shacks there and never more than around 100 people on the beach - and nothing for around 1 kilometre in either direction. 

However, what really makes Mashas special is Masha herself and the amazing team of guys she has working for her. The food is amazing and really well priced. We were able to eat 2 meals of fresh fish cooked to order a day, beer and drinks all day and all for around 30-40. The staff are incredibly friendly and will make you feel at home from the minute you arrive. You can select the fish, lobster or giant prawns you want to eat (if you're there at the right time) from the catch they buy each day which is brought out for customers see and pick out what they want. From the sea to your plate in a few hours. Simply amazing. Masha is wonderful and an amazing host. If you want to laze on the beach and eat delicious fresh cooked food, this is the place to do it.

Have just returned from this stunning resort where our pictures don't do it justice. 
My best friend took me for my 40th birthday which was supposed to be a week of peace and relaxation without our children and we got exactly that!!! Everything within the resort was perfect, and the team of staff were superb even down to the smallest detail. Special thanks to John and Zoheb at The Edge bar who looked after us everyday, their service was exceptional! It's a shame we don't get service like theirs in London. 
Cannot recommend the resort highly enough, we loved every minute of every day. Thank you Alila Diwa for the most memorable birthday!! Hope to see you again one day.

We have just got back from a week in Goa, staying at this lovely hotel. From our arrival, early in the morning, we were met with a friendly, warm reception. The quiet room we had requested, was perfectly provided; quite large with a generous living area, bathroom and balcony, overlooking a nice garden. Having picked up a chest infection en route, the Reception staff quickly arranged for a doctor to visit and prescrbe antibiotics, which they arranged to be delivered by a nearby chemist.
The hotel has a gorgeous infinity pool and plenty of sunbeds and seats. There is also a free shuttle bus to the fantastic beach.
But most of all, we were delighted by the friendly, attentive and kind service by the staff. We chose the all-inclusive option, on arrival, and were very glad we did, because the food was superb, especially when choosing from the optional a la carte menu! In the restaurant, the staff were quite the best we have experienced in hotels around the world, attentive and keen to ensure you had everything you needed. Amongst the staff, we would especially commend, Alastair, Delmore, Bitu and Tukaram, who were ably guided by Andrea, the maitr d'. We would definitely recommend this hotel, and fully intend to visit it again next year.

I was here for 3 days and overall experience was great, Rooms are great along with other amenities. Great place to relax and rejuvenate your spirits. Buffet is great however being an north Indian would have loved more of north Indian cuisine.

My wife and I stayed at Alila Diwa for 5 days in early January. From the moment we arrived we were bowled over by the welcome from staff and the magnificent Christmas tree. We didn't expect that! 

We stayed in the Diwa resort within the hotel. The room had everything we needed, and then some. It also looked out over the private pool which is just what I wanted.

However, the main stand out was the bistro in the Diwa resort, and, in particular, the new Chef Pradip and Ricky the waiter. Pradip cooked wonderful breakfasts and snacks for us, and really made us feel welcome in India. Likewise Ricky was super attentive and seemed genuinely happy that we were visiting his homeland. Both were fantastic ambassadors for the hotel.

In case it wasn't clear, the food was great with the breakfasts a real stand out. 

There were no issues at all with our stay and we got to laugh at Russian fashion sense - which is always a bonus!

Super is the word for the property like this , simply too good . Luxury at its best . Enjoy u r drinks in infinity pool . Bar rates are also too reasonable . So ahead & enjoy the most . Breakfast spread is awesome . Not to miss ice creams in breakfast . Kids play & activities area is also very interactive . .
Super recommend this property .

We had a wonderfull stay at this hotell. The standard was very high and the hotell overall was quit and calm. Although the hotell was full it didn't feel crowded as other hotells usally do. The staff was very friendly and hellpfull. My wife and me was a litte worried about the food as she is alergic to nuts. But thanks to the great staff everyting went well. The food was great and much to choose from. We would like to send a special thanks to two of the waiters, Tukaram Channementri and Shaan Usman which went the extra mile in excellent servie. We really recommend this hotell!

Wonderful hotel!! Very Good location!! Great stay!! Spacious rooms and excellent food. Awesome spa!! Above all an exceptional team!!Would love to go back soon!!Thank you team Alila Diwa for making our stay in Goa memorable!!

We have visited this hotel almost every year since it opened in 2009. That in itself should tell you that we are more than satisfied.
Of course, there have been hiccups in service, which may be down to the language barrier of more junior staff but once this is brought to the attention of the Management they are straight on it 
The staff in the restaurant for breakfast are always extremely willing and once you take the trouble to explain what is required - voila - its there
Everyone is friendly and helpful and I must mention Ramashan in the Pool area who is absolutely first rate. A real credit to them.
Already looking to book again.

Alila Diwa was really good with very friendly staff. The rooms were excellent and very spacious. Breakfast buffet was amazing with large variety of items and staff very friendly always willing to help with a smile. We will definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Alila Diwa for two weeks in January in a standard Club room. I have difficulty walking and am on crutches so it was very much appreciated that the staff offered help wherever I went.

The room was very spacious and the bed and pillows were very comfortable (I am not easy to please when it comes to beds and pillows) but this bed was exceptionally comfortable. There are two wardrobes, a dressing table, a roll top bath, a walk-in shower and separate wc and a his and hers sink unit in the bathroom! The lighting has been thought about before installation and there are lots of options at the touch of a button. I particularly liked the night light option which provided subtle low lighting so you don't bang your toe on your way to the loo during the night! The air conditioning is great and there's even a ceiling fan! All rooms have patio doors onto a balcony which overlooks the pool. We didn't hear any noise while we were there which is just as we like it.

When I booked the Club side of the hotel, I wasn't very clear about how this worked but having stayed there I am so pleased I paid the extra to stay in the Club section. Although it meant you did have to walk to get to the main hotel area with the Vivo restaurant and the Edge Bar and infinity pool, it was so much quieter and more relaxed in the Club section which is just what we were looking for. Don't get me wrong, none of the hotel was noisy at any time while we were there but we liked the fact that there were lots of empty loungers throughout the day where we were and some days there wasn't anyone in the pool at all. Like others, I too find the people who reserve loungers all day by placing their towels on them, annoying and although this seemed to happen a lot over the main hotel pool, we didn't encounter it at all during our stay at the Club. Ilando, one of the waiters at the Diwa Club deserves an extra special mention for his big smile, helpful manner and attention to detail. He has a way of making you feel important without being too over the top. Thank you Ilando. Pradip who is one of the chefs at the Diwa Club restaurant is another member of staff worthy of mention. Pradip went out of his way to ensure we were happy with our meal and always offered to prepare something other than what was on the menu if preferred. A very small crticism of the Club restaurant is that when you stay for two weeks the menu gets a little restrictive so it was nice to have the offer of extra choice. Thank you Pradip for going the extra mile! I do hope management will pass on our gratitude. We did dine at Vivo fairly regularly also and I can honestly say, with hand on heart, it's the best food we've ever had on an all inclusive holiday. We always went for the Indian food choices and they were lovely.

The front desk at the Club side was very welcoming and a special thank you to Pervani who remembered our names and greeted us with a big smile whenever we passed by.

Having read the review which claimed the shuttle to the beach took a long time, I cannot understand it. The shuttle passed regularly when we were there and whenever someone turned up for a lift the shuttle bus took them so I wouldn't take too much notice of that complaint.

As we were All Inclusive I was a bit disappointed to find that the Spice Studio restaurant was not part of the all inclusive package. They did however reduce our bill by 50% and as the food was very nice it's not really a complaint. I would suggest to management however that the restaurant would be a lot busier if they reduced their prices a bit.

There are areas of the hotel which need a bit of upgrading but overall this is a lovely place to stay with staff who want nothing more than to make your holiday the best it can be. Thank you Alila Diwa for the memories and just keep on doing what you do .

A spacious and contemporary hotel 20 minutes from airport. The staff were very attentive with in-house dining options. Most rooms have a balcony or terrace with luxury bed linen, towels and silks. A free shuttle service to the beach is well worth it for those who have difficulty in walking for 10 minutes or so. Good value for money.

I have stayed in many hotels across the world and on first glimpses this is a beautiful one. Very carma. Lovely rooms. I came for an experience as you would with so called 5 star.
Breakfast is one of the most stressful experiences. Buffet I except, but no guest should have to hunt for plates, cutlery or napkins. Asking for a special order of eggs was like I had 2 heads and when it arrived it was shoved on the table. Where is the maitradee. No where to be found.
Sun beds next. Why do management allow customers to put down towels in the morning only to find that these beds are not used all day leaving customers who do want beds scratching there heads.
Bus shuttle next. My partner waited over 25 mins not once but twice to get to the beach. I who enjoy a walk came up the road twice in the time it took for my partner to get to the beach.
The staff are friendly and will do anything for you. What they lack is strong management and direction. I will not be using this hotel again

Had a ten day stay at the Alila Diwa Hotel in Goa , in early Jan. We were in the Diwa section of the hotel giving us access to the 
Bistro Baron a daily basis and a separate pool which was for my wife and I , a little exclusive and certainly added to the holiday as we loved the quality of service from all of the staff and the food at breakfast and evening was superb .Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. From the front desk to your room service , everyone was helpful , kind and courteous. The Hotel is immaculate, beautifully manicured gardens, relaxing pools and an all round great atmosphere. It was our first experience in Goa, and any worries relating to the trip we're eased by knowing that all of your home comforts and a lot more were covered back at the hotel . We really enjoyed staying at the Alila Diwa. A top hotel all round.

Just returned from Alila Diwa Goa today. 
Fabulous property with ever smiling staff. We had stayed in Terrace room which was really big with a nice comfy bed and a really huge bathtub. The room setting is really romantic and is best for couples. The service and staff here is one of the best i have seen in 5 star hotels. They always go an extra mile with whatever needs are required by the customer. The Infinity pool overlooking the Paddy fields during sunset is simply breathtaking. The Breakfast spread is really huge and very delicious. Our trip was made more memorable by the Head Chef Aline and Sherwan who gave us a surprise visit to our room with a yummy cake for our anniversary.

very friendly staff .. amazing hotel .. has very good restaurants my favourite is vivo and the sheff is super understanding. The spa experience is outstanding, so relaxing and clean. The pool is nice too.

Excellent service by payas Delicious food Beautiful room Amazing decorating room by Payas Lovely decorate bathtub with cake Service is super Lovely interior Amazing view Valuable trip Enjoying fun and fun trip

Have now stayed here for 3 - 4 weeks for the last 6 years during January.

It is a super hotel with very courteous and friendly staff. Nothing is too much bother and everything asked is performed with pleasure.

Vivo restaurant has a very good buffet every day changing breakfast, lunch and dinner and also an  la carte menu. It is reasonably priced for a hotel of this standard.
