Edge bar serves the usual range of international drinks and cocktails and is situated by the pool with comfortable seating areas both inside and out. Inside is air conditioned.

We stayed in a loft room which is fairly large with a nice balcony. the bed is amazing!

This was our second visit to this amazing hotel. The rooms are huge, comfortable and very clean. We stayed at the Diwa Club which is just that bit special. the staff at this hotel are superb, nothing is to much trouble. A Special thanks to Jaffa, Tukarem, Joyal and Richard and all the Bistro staff. Thank you Illando for looking after us so well, we appreciated it.

This resort gives you a WOW experience. Whole setup of the resort is wonderful. Rooms are superb. Washrooms are huge (in rooms near spa), so are the rooms. Food quality is awesome. Location of pool is breathtaking.

An overall WOW experience at this resort.
The entire staff has a 'yes sir' attitude for any concerns and they fulfil them happily.
The food at spice court was especially good with the authentic flavours. Server Ricki was very knowledgeable and suggested the right type of food we wanted and the right quantities. He was superb at his service.
Vivo cafe too had a delightful spread for breakfast and servers Subrata and Veldone were very kind and good in helping out for whatever we needed.
Front office - check in was very smooth with Leon doing his job very well and front office manager Kasuga was exceptionally kind and helpful in helping out any of our requirements.
The swimming pool area with the the bar was a great area for recreation and for excellent evening cocktails. 
Overall a wonderful stay, not just for me but for my 4 year old son too. 
I would recommend this resort as a true 5 star property as it has a personalised feel to it which one misses at a large resorts.
I look forward to being back at Alila Diwa, Goa very soon.

I attended a training programme here in november, Alila exudes a warm friendly atmosphere alongwith great interiors and spacious rooms, the rooms have a big bath tub where you can relax after a busy day, it also has a mini theatre where hollywood and bollywood films are played, food is great and the variety is enough, thumbs up

Awesome time . Edge bar staff superstars, Diwa club Syl superman , Chef,s will deliver anything at your request. The best food , everyone at your finger tips, security staff all very friendly , swimming pool the view is die for . Xx

This was our very first visit to India and we picked such a fabulous hotel. All the staff were so friendly but especially Tukaram who went out of his way to accommodate my dietary requirements, nothing was too much trouble for him. He is a real star, we will be booking again next January.

Another years visit to now my second home great stay great atmosphere helpful friendly staff wonderful food great location I could go on forever but it would only bore you. In my opinion one of the best hotels in Goa and a great team of people make it a very enjoyable stay.

We have visited this hotel almost every year since it opened in 2009. That in itself should tell you that we are more than satisfied.
Of course, there have been hiccups in service, which may be down to the language barrier of more junior staff but once this is brought to the attention of the Management they are straight on it 
The staff in the restaurant for breakfast are always extremely willing and once you take the trouble to explain what is required - voila - its there
Everyone is friendly and helpful and I must mention Ramashan in the Pool area who is absolutely first rate. A real credit to them.
Already looking to book again.

Alila Diwa was really good with very friendly staff. The rooms were excellent and very spacious. Breakfast buffet was amazing with large variety of items and staff very friendly always willing to help with a smile. We will definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Fab hotel with lovely big rooms and tranquil setting. We were bed and breakfast which was perfect fir us as lots of places to eat within walking distance. Had great breakfast, usually freshly made masala disa (crispy Indian pancake with potato filling accompanied with coriander chutney), couple of hours by pool watching kingfisher, egrets, bison and mich more before heading to beach. Shuttle to beach available at anytime. Shacks supplied beds and plenty of good food and cheap beer, sea like a warm bath with great waves. 
Tip - use jewellers next to main entrance (Zorro's) to change money. Great rates and we had rings made there which we love. We would go to Alila again.

my suitcase was opened and all cash has been stolen from my purse and wallet. It has been two days now, no one has a clue, the security is not strong enough and security head not cooperative atall, the GM is trying to help. lets see what happens. , but this has been my most disappointing trip

4 months after my 7 night stay I am still awaiting a refund for a triple booking on my room promised by Vipul Bhosle the Assistant Manager Front Office. Although I have emails promising the refund it still is outstanding. Because of the lack of professionalism and integrity of the management staff I would never go to this hotel again. In addition, the resort is poorly lit and my friend fell down the stairs as a result. The wait staff and housekeeping were great my issues is with the management. Additionally we got dressed and headed to the seafood restaurant only to find out it was closed.

I was very disappointed with my stay here from the minute we walked in. We had booked the all inclusive dining package and when we checked in we found out it only included the buffet meals and we wanted to try the various restaurants. We asked if we could remove the package and we were told no. They suggested we cancel our reservation and pay the penalty fees and re book without the package. It was one of the dumbest and most annoying suggestions I have ever heard in my life. The service was about the same for the rest of the stay. Terrible and sloooooow. I have been to other park Hyatt hotels and this just didn't feel like a park Hyatt at all. The overall design of the property was not modern and minimalistic like most of their properties. The property itself was massive with a lot of swimming pools, activities, a very nice beach and great landscaping but the room was very outdated. Again it wasn't modern or high end. It just felt old. There were stray cats on the property too which were a nuisance when we were trying to enjoy our dinner outdoors.
Park Hyatt is a great brand with beautiful high end and modern properties but this was definitely not one of them. Not sure if I will trust park Hyatt again.

My husband and I travel around the world all the time and Hyatt brand is always our number one choice when it comes to choosing a hotel. Therefore there was no question where we were going to stay on our trip to Goa. This hotel being Park Hyatt, our expectations were very high as the quality of Hyatt Regency and Grand Hyatt in other parts of the world have always been very high. 
The grounds and setting are beautiful, so is the spa and the staff at the spa. Look for Harendra in the buffet restaurant, as he seemed to be the only one with training and always with a friendly smile. 
Staff is generally poorly trained, even simple tasks like bring you ice bucket with your bottle of wine in 35 degree heat seemed impossible, asking for extra ice was basically a joke! We opted for the full board at the buffet restaurant. Even though the food was nice the first day, we soon found the choices were never changed and exactly the same for lunch and dinner every single day. If you are looking for something other then Indian food for a change, the only option is Caesar salad! The biggest issue however was the absolutely disgusting duvet and pillows we discovered in our room on the second day. We wouldn't have expected this even in a 3 star hotel! Just absolutely gross! We had to ask twice to have it changed and the reaction was very oblivious. They don't seem be using any mattress or pillow protectors either, which I would have expected in a hotel of this calibre without question. This made us question other hygiene practices throughout the resort. There was three day wedding going on with loud music and loud guests. There was also a conference taking place, which on one evening restricted access to the beachfront bar/restaurant, but no warning was given to us on this. We did complain again at checkout, but they didn't seem to know how to deal with the complaint. We received an email from the front desk manager with an apology later in the day, however it was clear this was just a standard template as someone else name was appearing the body of the text! This just confirmed how poorly the staff is trained. We would never go back and we will also think twice before going back to any Hyatt hotel! Just extremely disappointed with the whole experience especially as this was our honeymoon!

Badly maintained room. Two main issues:

1. Roll away bed not there despite requesting it at the time of booking. When I spoke to
Them they said - sorry not available. You didn't request it. Booking was only for 2 - adults not one adult and 2 kids. All false. AMEX had to get involved and after many calls at 10pm they found a bed. No one from management apologies for the mix up.
2. Mosquitoes in bedroom!
First night the kids woke up every few hours complaining. Spoke to resort host next morning to get it taken care of. But the following night it was worse. Spoke to the resort host again she was like whatever - we tried!
Kids love the pool - we go back for that. But the indifferent attitude of management to guest complaints is baffling especially as we are repeat guests!

Well, if you like Wi-Fi... even a little bit... don't stay here. Also, if you like to call the Front Desk and expect someone to pick up within 2-3 calls... don't stay here. Overall, we received better service and more reliable Wi-Fi from the 2- and 3-star hotels that we stayed at in Delhi. Had we not been part of a wedding, we would have left after the first night. 

I should note that the dining and catering staff was excellent and responsive. Also, the grounds and resort are quite beautiful though they are not within walking distance of anything.

I made the mistake of booking Park Hyatt for stay in October. I wanted to change the dates of travel as I could not go on those dates. I spoke to many officials of the hotel including Revenue Manager and brought the matter to the attention of the General Manager. They were disgustingly inflexible and I was told by the Revenue Manager that "even when there are deaths in customers families- they do not accommodate". Is that for real? Incidentally I had booked the Taj Goa also in the same time- who were extremely accommodating and customer friendly. DO NOT BOOK PARK HYATT GOA as their approach is to just take your money and do not care for returning customers. I shall definitely bring this to the attention of anyone I know.

Please don't don't stay in park hyatt if you like luxury..there service is poor room is very unhygienic they charge high just because of there private beach. Pathetic welcome they gave us empty coconut which was already used..please please i want money back somehow.

Had an extremely poor experience at the Hyatt. While the rooms are great and the property is really nice, the help received from the staff was extremely poor. It started while I was checking out. My car was not allowed to come in to pick me up from the hotel lobby. When I asked why so, I was told by the Front Desk and Security that it was because the car did not have the right papers. When I walked all the way out to the main gate from the lobby pulling my luggage, I realized it was because the local taxi union was creating issues with outside cabs. The hotel staff was aware of this and siding with the taxi union outside they stopped all outside cars from coming into the hotel. What was extremely unprofessional was that while I was checking in or checking out, this was not told to me and no one from the hotel was ready to either help me or even open the gates so that the car could come in. I almost missed my flight because of the careless attitude of the hotel management. Left a really bad taste in my mouth.

Millipede crwals to bed at 1am. Rude staff asks what can we do. Take one hour to change room. Wastes night. Worst hotel. Cannot be five star. NEVER STAY UNLESS YOU LOVE WORKS IN BED. Duty manager took one hour to come and were absolutely uncaring attitude. How can this happen to 5 star hotel. How if this was poisonous centipedes? Who is responsible?

we were travelling with a toddler and had booked a sea view roomthe room they allotted us for one to view the sea you needed a binoculars or telescope to view the sea. The room had a sunken bath area and an outdoor shower area both hazard to a toddler. we asked the next day for a change of room but were not so politely refused. The outdoor shower area in rains turn into a massive open drain with water just gushing down from the upper rooms as well creating noise that no one let alone a toddler can sleep through. The rooms were dirty and and no turndown services were given in the evening. we asked the housekeeping staff to place a waste bin outside the room where we could throw the soiled diapers and they asked us to throw it in the pot kept outside for umbrellas. after 2nd day i could still see all the diaper packages still there.Though fully prepaidwe checked out after two nights of not sleeping well due to the amount of noise coming through outdoor rain area. when we were checking out then everyone wanted to help and suddenly in a sold out property a suite also opened up for us. after we checked out i receive an e-mail from the hotel that they have refunded the extras we had paid. the hotel manager called our new hotel and left a message when we reverted the call he was no where to be found. it seemed to us that maybe they were stalking us to find whether we were actually staying at the said hotel or not

Pls think about your decision when u plan your stay in Goa, don't go by the name of the hotel. It's old torn and definitely needs a complete revamp. On my arrival , I thought that I took right decision but later on everything went wrong. There cart service is not available even if you keep on requesting for it. Good items are not available from the menu... Post my dinner I waited for 30 mins to get a cart and it didn't come and on top of it there is no signage to guide to towards various blocks of the building. After this disaster walk , I discovered that AC was not working and technician had no clue. Next day when I came back from my work, I found room was dirty. No wonder excuse was dnd switch. The issues continued and when I wanted to talk to GM, every time duty manager was coming in front. Not worth staying .

Stayed June 2016, travelled on business

I have visited this hotel for 8 consecutive years and I have to say it is one of the most delicious hotels in the world,, the surroundings are wonderful, the staff are the finest on the planet and the hotel amenities and grounds are second to none. Here's the Rub, the Goan tourist board have decided to start Disney like helicopter rides in the south of Goa, and unfortunately have decided to use the grounds of the Park Hyatt hotel. The Helicopter is noisy, smelly and unwanted, the noise disturbed your peace and the smell of aircraft fuel makes you nauseous, the Goan tourist board should hold their heads in shame over ruining the most idyllic part of India that everyone should visit at least once in their life. The staff of this hotel are amongst the best in the world and it is a travesty that they have to work with such a monstrosity in their midst.

This hotel specialises in harassing guests. I've sprained my ankle and have a bandage which effectively makes it impossible to move around without help. I've had to wait for a buggy for 30 minutes each time before I would be served. Eventually someone had to walk to the reception and bring a buggy that was parked there. Apparently no one had bothered to inform the buggy it was needed where I was. This was after a minimum of 10 follow ups. It's just horrendous - I'm so disappointed. No one cares.

Exceedingly exceeding disappointed with this hotel. Currently I am writing this review from the park Hyatt on holiday as we speak 

To begin with I made a booking in October for December in advance as we were traveling with a 5 month old infant. We requested for a room closest to the pool or lobby and a sea view room on the 1st Flr. I reconfirmed the booking 3 times as I knew it was peak season. On arrival we found out a wedding was also taking place. Clearly they were over booked and screwed up the booking. After a long flight we were made to wait and then told we were given a ground floor room despite telling them so much in advance we wanted the 1st floor. Then to make matters worse a gentleman who claimed he's the lobby manager said he was giving us a first floor room .. We were super happy only to be disappointed again that the room was literally at one end of the hotel. For those of you with children/ infants should know that's a logistical nightmare. 

Anyway we were determined to make the most of it thinking at least we can avail of the buggy service which btw was virtually extinct for us hotel guests as they were hoarded by the wedding guests. We were made to wait for a buggy service several times that never showed up and ultimately frustrated we had to make our way on foot with bags, infant, stroller etc. again a logistical nightmare. 
Clearly this hotel is terribly managed and cannot handle the load in season time. 

It's a pity really because the hotel is beautifully located has a lovely beach and pool ...but terribly managed. 

I feel cheated bcus guests like me booked in advance despite that we were given a room which could not be more terribly located, unkempt, dusty and shabby ... In the end as oppose to one leaving a holiday relaxed ... We are exhausted !!!

Reviewed by room#248 Jeanine

The Hyatt is a nicely laid out beach resort, with a large pool, well kept lawns, gardens, palmtrees. The room was nice (but it took some negotiation and a three hour wait to get the type of room that we had booked: groundfloor/seaview suite). The staff is friendly and helpful. A cafe- style restaurant offers good food with Indian, Italian and continental cuisine and a fish restaurant beachside offers fresh catch of the day. Despite some initial hickup, the place seemed to have all the ingredients of a comfortable and relaxing 5-star beach vacation,

if it was not for the noise.
First week was Diwali (India's X-Mas style celebration/vacation) and the place was busy and crowded with families. That was fine with us, but we looked forward to a real quiet second week of our 12 day vacation.
But things got worse. The hotel hosted a number of business events for several companies with sales awards celebrations etc: Platforms were constructed on the lawns between hotel and beach with catering facilites and piles of loudspeakers. The partys with techno boom-boom-beat shook the area on Nov. 18th, 19th and 21st from 6pm to 11pm. The worst was still to come. On Nov. 20 a well known Indian software company held a 'NON-STOP BOOMBOOM'-event: From 10am until 16.30pm high-decibel techno sound, zero interruption for six and a half hours. The epicentre of the carnival was about 100yards from the beach, 150yards from our room - no chance to escape or avoid the noise other than leave the hotel. The following day, another huge platform was being constructed on the sand directly on the beach, all around the beach relaX chairs, for a 400 people wedding party the following 2-3 days! 

We could have digested a one-time event, one evening, maybe even two, but four days in a row was an affront. Yes, we did complain, as did several other guests. And we did receive 'heartfelt' apologies from a (poor scapegoat) assistant front desk mngr and a small box of chocolates. But the beat went on, no change in the noise/vibrations level during those 4 days. Whoever manages the hotel obviously does not care about the disturbance and irritation caused to the individual guests. There was not attempt to explain or to inform as to when/how long these disturbances would take place. 

These kind of (sales-) business events in India by definition are extremely noisy and therefore a nuisance for other guests. But the participants of these events fill hotel rooms and the thereby the pockets of Hyatt management and shareholders. For the sake of a high occupancy rate, they sacrifices one of the key qualities that a fivestar beach resort must offer its guests: a peaceful, quiet environment. This is what we were looking for at the Hyatt in Goa at the rate of $ 500 plus p/night. What we got instead, was much Disco carnival. If this is what you are looking for, this is the place to go, else................

We are on the final week of our 3 week tour of India. We arrived in Goa on Saturday afternoon excited at the prospect of staying in the 5* Park Hyatt - particularly after reading the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We could not have been more disappointed or let down had we been shown to the local backpackers hostel!

We checked in at 3pm on Saturday to be told that we have a twin bedded room. Now this holiday is a romantic break for me and my husband to celebrate my 50th birthday and throughout we have been booked in 5* accommodation with double or king size beds. All 5 star accommodation we have stayed at in India has been amazing, just what you would expect. The hotel check in clerk tells us that it is not their fault but our travel agent who booked a twin bedded room. To be told this is somewhat dubious as throughout the trip we have received 5 star king size beds. We tell check in clerk that this is not acceptable so he said he will sort it. 

As you can imagine we were somewhat surprised and perplexed to be shown to our room to discover the single beds had been pushed together. The check in man said there were no double beds available but as soon as one did become available he would definitely let us know. However, the issue of the single beds pale in comparison to everything else that is wrong with this room (No 254). The windows to the balcony and bathroom were filthy, there is a pervasive odour of urine particularly in the bathroom and the toilet is stained with what I can only imagine is urine. The bedroom curtain has become detached from the rail and is hanging loose. There are coffee mug stains on a welcome card. There is a used match on the balcony and the furniture out there is dirty and worn. There has been absolutely no attention to detail paid here to ensure that this room is ready to accept 5 star price paying guests. The fixtures and fittings are more akin to a 2 star hotel and not a 5 star. There are also dirty bicycles out in the corridor which again does not suggest that this is anything but a Centre Parcs by the sea. The whole atmosphere of this room has a depressing, tired and worn feel to it. We contact Trailfinders who have organised this trip and we also attempt to contact the manager but when we do contact reception, when they eventually answer they do not appear to understand what we are saying and cut us off several times! As you can appreciate, we are not happy at this point! We also contact our travel rep in India who have managed to speak to someone and have got our room upgraded. We are told that someone will be along to collect our luggage and take us to our upgraded room in 10 minutes. One hour later, still nobody has arrived (after much ringing reception and unable to speak to someone as phone again is put down when we ring). Somebody eventually knocks on the door but he is not here to take us to our new room but to provide a turndown service! Haahaha! Now that is a joke! He quickly gets the message and contacts somebody who arrives within 15 minutes.

It is now 6pm and we are shown to our new, upgraded room. This is exactly the same room as before only beside the childrens swimming pool and guess what, twin beds and this time, no attempt to push them together!!!! We are now extremely angry as we had been promised and upgrade and a double bed. I do believe the Park Hyatt are deliberately going out of their way to completely send us over the edge of insanity!

We say we are not staying in this room and to find us an alternative room with a double bed. This, magically, they do! Why they could not have given us this room when we first raised the concern regarding single beds I do not know! It did not just magically appear out of the ether! They take us to a room with a double bed. It is marginally better but this is the best they can offer. Again, it is depressing and next to a childrens swimming pool. It is now very late and nothing can be done in terms of relocating hotels but we have spoken to our travel agency and they will find an alternative hotel in the morning.

It is now 9pm and we still have not spoken with the duty manager. No apology, nothing. We are tired, hungry and thirsty as we have not been offered a drink since we arrived as we have been waiting by the phone in each room we have been allocated. 

9.30pm the manager deigns to ring us. He does not apologise but merely blames our travel agent for booking twin rooms and accepts no responsibility. He also talks over my husband as he is trying to explain what has happened. This is just downright rude. As I said, the issue of the twin room is not our only concern. It is the whole condition of the room. This is definitely not 5 star accommodation. It reminds me of a hostel in parts. No luxury. Nothing. 

The manager then offers us to have complimentary dinner which we do and to be very fair, the chef cooked us the best prawns we had ever eaten. The whole ambience of the dining area however is not 5 star. The manager also promises us a complimentary bottle of wine in the room but as you can guess, this does not materialise. On our way to dinner we pass a staff buggy which is driving at speed around a corner and the back door swings open and hits Mark square on the shoulder. They do apologise but we required an ice pack during dinner as his shoulder became very sore and swollen. 

Next morning, our agent allocates us to go to the Leela Hotel some 30 minutes away and I cannot wait to leave. I cannot leave this awful hotel quick enough. It is depressing and I am so upset that I feel as though I want to go home to the UK. The service is dire. In fact, there is no customer service. Even checking out was not a smooth process. 

On the whole, this has been the worst hospitality I have ever experienced. I have travelled extensively throughout the world and this ranks amongst the lowest points ever. I do not understand the positive ratings that I see on TripAdvisor. They do not reflect our experience here (apart from the negative reviews I have seen). Customer service is non existent. We have been lied to by staff and given empty promises. 

Stay here at your peril as it certainly is not a place to go if you want a relaxing break. We are fair people and write fair reviews on Trip Advisor. 

We are now at The Leela and it is paradise and we are having an amazing time. 

I am annoyed though that we wasted 24 hours of our precious holiday in India at The Park Hyatt, Goa.

Do not travel to this hotel if you have an infant son or travelling with elderly people.

We were stuck outside our room for close to 20 minutes, with our 3 month old son (was howling was the entire time), while the hotels sent a key card. This is after placing 5 calls and finally going to the reception to retrieve another key.

After the key was retrieved, my 65 yr old mom was given multiple excuses as to why it was not sent, and answers varied from,we sent two boys, but they got lost, they found a lost kid and got busy in that. Moreso when asked to locate the the boys who were sent, they could not do so for 25 minutes. My mom finally had to give up and come back to the room. 

Mistakes are always made , but taking so long after stressing on the urgency on each phonecall is completely unacceptable.


The next day after the incident, no one comes to apologize - I had to go to the reception and be asked to be taken to the GM. Mr Thomas Abhrahm instead of being apologetic and trying to resolve the issue kept giving an explanation as to why this had occurred = "We have to close to 50 key request everyday and hence they have to treat each situation as the same. On asking if this was a medical emergency would it be any different, the answer was the same"

This not the response you would except from a GM at a 5star. There was not a hint of attempt to make things right. Further keeping with standards offered by other 5 stars, we would have atleast expected someone to be there while leaving and make sure everything was going ok for the checkout. Zilch. Nada. Nothing.

I would highly not recommend anyone use this property till they sort of these issues. Left the property is quite a bad taste.

It's not often that one comes across a beautiful property deserving 5 stars or more coupled with terrible service which keeps one guessing how many stars is the hotel aiming at!

I'm a frequent traveler with 100+ nights a year in hotels and we've been doing this property for few years but this stay is our last.

We've caught the staff lying, they failed to meet promises, consistently delivered inconsistent service, lacked professionalism, some demonstrated such an indifferent attitude, and the list is endless. In short, it was a a wash out, maybe because senior staff were on leave or inadequate resources for the busy weekend but we had several major issues right from preferences they noted to make us feel special but never bothered about, housekeeping forgetting to fumigate in spite of daily reminders to even basic expectations like lack of towels, cutlery, bathrobes, etc which they kept forgetting... shockingly even after things were escalated to the AM, FOM, EM, GM over the 4 days we stayed, service kept falling like a pack of cards until the last hour! 

There are several better properties from the reviews I've seen where we'd head to the next time. 

Hyatt will need to do something really big & special for us to even think about them again...

I had been to this hotel from 8 august to 11 august. We made the mistake of taking an all inclusive food package. In that all our meals -breakfast, lunch and dinner were included. The property on the whole is good. It is a huge property covered with trees and greenery. It has an attached beach that is very clean. We enjoyed a lot in the beach and waves.. The rooms were good with a huge walk in closet and shower area. But my brother's room had a very bad stink in it. After repeatedly complainig to the staff they just came and re cleaned the room and i was shocked to see the amount of dirt in the room. It was lik they push the dust below the bed everytime they clean the room. Still the stink didnt go. Then they just put room freshner in the room and left. Same thing happened the next day. They could not find the source of the stink. They were not ready to change my room as well. On another occasion, my room card key got mixed up with some1 else in the swiming pool area. I had to call the reception 4 times to get a new one.. They made me wait outside my room for 45 mins. The staff who came to give the key said they were not communicated of the same by reception untill now. My friend fell in his room and cut himself.. The staff didnt know how to apply bandage nor did they have a doctor on call. Finally the worst.. The food was pathetic.. Pathetic is a small word for it.. The same food in lunch was re heated and re cooked a lil in a differen way and served in the buffet. The quality was bad and they had just 6-7 options available. I have been to many 5 star properties and they have a minimum of 15 different varieties.. Final verdict is that the 1 star that i m giving this hotel is for the beautifu property and nothing else. Otherwise its worth 0 stars

My recent family getaway with Park Hyatt was HORRIBLE. It was so bad, that i would never ever suggest anyone for Hyatt or its brands. To list a few (1). It started with such a late check-in, was never informed about how long it was going to take - 2 hours late (2). The food was like of 3 star, nothing special - even in a romance package. (3). My nephew was in the bathroom, your staff bumps in and tell him they just want to clean it and would take 5-10 min, and he can continue his chores in rest room. (4). On complaining, you just send me a card of sorry and ready for next mistake (5). No information by the staff anywhere, not even briefed about the package (6). Room service and cleaning is pathetic, a motel would be far better than this service. (7). Air conditions are leaking in the room and you always have to inform them, isn't it supposed to be the housekeeping job?

Paying all this money for a 5 star experience, ended up in a lowest category experience, instead a business hotel like IBIS would have been far better.

I am writing this not to have a refund, but to inform you that your services are moving to be worst hotels of world.

Room Tip: Talk to the hotel staff before 24 hours you arrive, and make sure about everything before you check...
See more room tips
Stayed August 2015, travelled with family

Disappointing experience at the hotel during my recent visit between Aug 6-9

I was staying in the room no 405 n had a early morning wake up call at 5:45 am that the taxi has come. I had not booked any taxi and in the end the caller said it was for Room no 413.
The phone kept on ringing continuously till I woke up. They made sure that our sleep including of my my 4 yr kid was disturbed.

Further at the restaurant it takes proper 40 min for them to get rotis ordered for kids.
Charles, Ashish n Siddharth were responsible for this and they did this in spite of three reminders. In the end I had to blast n then the chef himself had to get rotis for us
Also after getting in touch with Mr Vipul ( was claiming to be the duty manager) regarding these incidents he showed no remorse.
An example of worst hospitality. 
Regret to be here n wasted my lot of money for the poorest of services.
Wish I had got the booking of Taj Exotica which was full for these dates.
So guys beware n still if u want to be there don't expect great services from them. Just enjoy the beautiful property.

We went back to the Park Hyatt, Goa because of our earlier fond memories...this time the food quality, wifi services, amenities...were pathetic. We were also disappointed with the beer/wine selection and the quality of the coffee. The staff were very sincere, but need training

Stayed June 2015, travelled with family

orst ever reception desk. Worst ever booking desk. Never ever go for their prepaid seasonal offers. Because once you have paid you are caught. And they take advantage of the same. Reception desk lies too. We have reached today early in the morning and the booking was made couple of months in advance. They never uttered a word even when we asked for the complimentary early pickup as per our flight timing which was 7.45 AM. And never did they say a word when we called them couple of times before reaching. The lady at the reception says we were sold out last nite.. so they want us to assume they were sold out only for a single night and all the guests had the bookings just for a night. And they will be leaving only after staying for a nite. The lady Frency is really too rude to speak to. If we had intimated couple of times that we are reaching in the morning as the other flights are full still they couldn't keep 2 rooms for us. My mother is a heart patient and we had to start from Bangalore early in the morning at 3AM. The staff is entirely not bothered. I have myself seen atleast 5 people checking out and still the staff is saying that they haven't checked out they have gone for an outing. They are sheer liars. Don't fall prey to their eye catching offers. I always stay at Taj and this was the first time I tried Hyatt but it is really not worth it. They even gave a room to a foreigner just in front of us and were being too rude to us. Don't ever stay here.. you ll regret for sure. I should have really stayed in Taj I am sure now and no second thoughts and no experiments the next time.. any city any place a BIG no to Park Hyatt. The lady was so rude that she didn't even think about apologising even once!!


On top of it a guy named Vivek at the reception desk says that even though we booked it for 24th the system shows it for 25th. GUYS ISNT IT HEIGHT OF BEING RUDE AND TAKING THE CUSTOMER FOR GRANTED JUST BECAUSE WE PREPAID THE BOOKING. How is it possible that an online booking can have a flaw and that too all the confirmations reflect 24th of June. This seems like they have all been trained for being rude. It was my birthday and the worst ever because of PARK HYATT GOA.

Awful service else the property is good, nicely located with a lot of amenities within the complex. BUT it seems that the hotel is NOT CONCERNED about "SERVICE LEVEL" and has hired fresh untrained staff to provide the services..

1. I ordered some plates and cutlery in room.. did get it may be after 1-2 hours..
2. Keep calling the reception, but they may or may not pick up.. same is for room service and Duty Manager.. try 2-3 times I am sure some one will respond.
3. Food was good in the restaurants, but again seems that the stewards have been hired are either fresh out of college or no clue about how to provide service General response time is 5-10 mins, seems as if they know how to ignore even after making an eye contact.
4. There is no option of "Do Not Disturb" at the room door, so anyone can enter for house keeping
5. The water running in the taps is very hard, you need to moisturise as soon as you wash hands. Not sure if it is good for brushing purpose or not.. and on asking no one had the answer, they just sent few water bottles.

All in all, I heard a lot about this resort before finalized on this one, however am not satisfied by the service level. I would say you need to read latest reviews if you are planning to come here, so that you can be sure weather or not the service has improved.

Terrible service, food and rooms again for the second year running. Only went again because I was travelling with friends who had babies and wanted to be on the beach. The property is lovely. But again the service and food was awful. Huge centipedes in my room and in my bed. One pest control guy for 40 acres who didn't answer his phone for 1 hr. Flush tank didn't work, ceiling lights flickered all night despite being off.

It is about 3.15 AM and I am writing this review at this unearthly hour for a particular reason .The thing is for the last two consecutive nights I am being woken up by arthropods called millipede .The property is extremely green with a huge number of trees and plants everywhere but if your room happens to be on the ground floor you had it .This worm like insect actually has been climbing up on to the bed which is supposed to offer five star luxury rest to its guests on this second consecutive night. Tonight I felt something moving on my forehead and believe me it was highly unpleasant .I also shudder to think what if it would find its way into my ear or something.What I fail to understand is that why isn't pest control taken seriously in such a reputed hotel. Although I like being close to nature and stuff but I really hate it when bugs and worms are crawling in the bed where we are supposed to have a good night's rest .Well other than that this property is great and we had a good time here .The staff is very helpful and courteous and they go that extra mile to make you comfortable .I would have written wonderful things about his hotel but this issue has been a huge turn off

This is by far the worst Hyatt hotel I have ever stayed in. 

We are currently in the hotel and will leave on friday; if my flights were changeable we would leave sooner. There is so much wrong I don't know where to start. We are paying almost 500 per night inc tax (85sq M Park Suite king-242). Could have taken 2 smaller rooms (40 sqM) for 120 per night each and for this kind of money i'd say i'd be OK. However, we are paying "Hyatt prices" for one of the better rooms and this represents extremely bad value for money. I can only believe that the good reviews have come from people who have picked up a bargain, anyone I know who pays 500 per night for their hotel knows that they usually get more and for that kind of money they deserve it.

We're here for 10 days with our children so clearly have a lot of clothes. There is very little storage space in these rooms and as I don't intend to live out of my suitcase I have fashioned a space for my clothes on the ironing board and for my children underneath the television. It's nuts.

Slippers: too small even for me. I'm a British size 5.5, American 8). My husband can't get his feet in them and he's only a size 9.
Bathroom: black mould and peeling silicon in the bath. Blinds are dusty and clearly have not been cleaned for a very long time. Windows are filthy.

WIFI: speed is just about OK but I probably have to re-log in about 20 times a day

There is a swamp / bog outside my balcony and generally lots of still pools of water which is great for mosquito breeding.

The hotel allows guests to throw parties in their rooms not just in designated spots and I had to call security long past midnight to ask them to stop the noise two nights ago.

Public toilets in the facility are permanently filthy-they are disgusting. I have now 3 times told staff at the pool bar and near Palms restaurant that toilets are full of excrement and the floors are swamped with water. I don't know whether the water on the floor was urine or pool water but either way it was perilously slippery and I fell and have injured my foot as a result just today. I am clearly very upset and my foot is very bruised. I hope my toes are not broken.

The spa is NOT what seasoned Hyatt customers have come to expect. My last stay was in HuaHin and the Barai spa (amazing). There is ONE -yes that's right only ONE bench in the ladies changing rooms. So you kind of have to hover to get dressed. Not relaxing or private at all.

In every Hyatt I've ever stayed in there have been club lounges and some kind of freebees when you take nicer rooms. NOT HERE. No club lounge, no little quiet breakfast area just the main square where all the restaurants are. Basically you end up in the same location breakfast, lunch and dinner and this hotel is soooooo far from anywhere else that you're a bit trapped. A very kind lady working in reception today suggested that if I wanted something different there was a nice Greek restaurant, 45KM away.

Aside from all of that I am most upset that I don't feel my possessions are safe here. I have never had swimming goggles of toys go walk about in this kind of hotel before but we have lost sunglasses, 3 pairs of goggles, 8 Zoggs diving sticks and flit-flops. All next to or on our sun lounger. So beware because nothing ended up in the lost and found box.

Most of the staff are polite and kind and I couldn't say a bad word about them, a lovely lady called Sweater even called her mum to find out Church times for my family on Easter Sunday. They are clearly trying hard. This is not their fault and I believe this is a training issue. They simply don't appear to understand the quality or service expected in such a hotel which is a shame really. 

All in all a very disappointing holiday. We're on to the Mumbai hyatt next, Let's hope it's better. Can't be worse!

We stayed for 3 nights as part of a large group. The issues first

1. The wifi coverage was pathetic. My iPad and mobile were constantly asking me to login as the network quality was very bad. I just had to live through it.

2. Nobody comes to clean the rooms! We had to call housekeeping everyday to send someone to clean rooms and pickup garbage. Despite that it used to take 30-45 minutes to come. And we all were stuck waiting for them to come

3. Basic items like coffee and milk satchets were not replenished. It was incredible that such basic stuff was not there. Asking for water was a bigger pain.

4. The food was of poor quality. We were a large group and had a separate buffet laid for it. The food was extremely oily and unhealthy. Indian preparations are oily but not so much that a portion of it soils the entire plate with oil. The roti's/ nan's were so hard that adults could not chew, leave along the children. The menu was stale and repeated. 

5. The rooms are by and large fine. The toilet (non bathing) area is so small that it feels like a cage. Very poor design planning and ordinary sanitryware.

6. I got hurt and request a bandage and volini gel. I was charged for it. While the money was small, the thought that a property of this repute will charge for such small things says a thing or two of why they are struggling.

While the staff tried there best to help and were courteous, they seemed massively understaffed.

Overall, I am not returning to this property. Probably deserves to price this property at less than half of where they price it today. Do not deserve a dime more. 

Btw, the group made these complaints to the duty manager through the stay. At a minimum the general manager should have taken effort to personally here out and try and sort out the issues of a large group.

Being a Hyatt Diamond member, we were anticipating warm welcome. However, we entered at 4pm on 23Feb with a negative note that our junior suite was not ready and we will need to wait in the hot lobby. We insisted that we not check in and find a different place around. Mr. Vipul Bhosle was adamant and threatened that we will lose our points for cancellation. We were OK with losing the points. He adamantly wanted us to give him a chance for a good service. We decided to give him a chance, freshened up in a stand by room and we stepped out of the hotel to allow them time to check us in. We returned after few hours to find our luggage in the room. However complimentary amenities provided were not moved to the room. My wife inquired with room service to know that we will be charged for the amenities. We regretted that we had picked this place for our stay and did not just walk out. Next morning we got about 3 calls inquiring about our check out time. International Newspaper selected was not provided. The property was not clean. Rooms had never been white washed. Floor polishing was being done near room 438 not allowing us peaceful stay. 

Room was incorrectly charged for juice consumption from mini bar. 

When we mentioned these challenges at front desk at checkout to Sumit, all that we were asked to do was pay INR 7450 and check out.

This is a cheap grade Hyatt hotel that we have ever stayed in. We feel cheated of points + cash paid for this property and receiving no/minimal customer service.

To begin: My wife, son, and I have stayed at the Park Hyatt in Abu Dhabi twice during the same time of year. That resort is perfect in every way. It lives up to the Park Hyatt brand. We have also stayed at the Park Hyatt in Paris and that was spectacular. Both were lux+. I read the reviews before we booked, and expected some "bumps" for this resort. There were a few more bumps then I hoped for. On the other hand, I understand that this resort is in India and not France or UAE. In saying this, I am not suggesting a "colonial" or privileged bias, I am only trying to contextualize my understanding more broadly. With that said, the area itself is ideal for families (the beach is clean, wide, un-crowded, etc.). The pool is huge and wonderful. The service and state of the resort, on the other hand, need some attending. More details follow:

First, while most of the people working at the resort were pleasant and helpful and the pool and beach was spectacular, we often received very spotty, slow, and sometimes no response to requests when made over the phone or at the restaurant, or front desk, and parts of the resort were un-clean and un-attended. For example, numerous times, we requested services from housekeeping and room service, and I had to call multiple times get a response. There was the poor servicing of our room, as many times we did not have enough shampoo, or bath gel, and once there was not enough toilet paper. In addition, throughout the resort, the bathrooms were often un-clean and understocked. Both in our own room and in the bathrooms by the pool and around the resort, there was often no toilet paper or no towels to dry our hands, One time, my wife found there was not only no toilet paper in the women's bathroom, but someone had defecated in one of the sinks. When she went to tell someone they tried to give her toilet paper. Instead, she wanted to make sure a manager knew. Instead of simply handing my wife a role of toilet paper, perhaps someone should have immediately asked to address the problem themselves. Unclean bathrooms, with no paper or hand towels, and having to call housekeeping to get more toilet paper for our own room is certainly not something one would expect at a luxury resort. 

Second, a more serious problem was with the "mandatory" Christmas dinner. I booked the hotel myself, through Hyatt, and never was told, not once, that there would be a "mandatory" charge for a dinner that we never planned to attend. My wife if vegan for health reasons and I do not eat meat. We saw on the hotel website there was a dinner where we could purchase tickets, but of course never planned on it. There was a similar dinner at the Park Hyatt in Abu Dhabi but we did not purchase the tickets. When we arrived at the resort we were not informed about the dinner at at all. When I asked two days prior to the dinner if restaurants would be open, I was told they would all be open. The day before Christmas eve, I asked again, just to be sure (as we would receive many different answers about different things). I was told the dinner was "mandatory" and it was already charged to us. I immediately asked to speak to a manager. I did. Her name was Deepali. She was surprised I did not know the dinner was "mandatory" and apologized. She promised to remove the charges from our hotel bill. When I checked out of the hotel, I was surprised to see that the charges were still there. It took 30 minutes for me to check-out and have many people intervene to try to figure out what was happening. I feel that this is inexcusable for a 5 star resort. It is not what I expect from a Park Hyatt. The fact that you would even think to charge me for something I never planned on taking part in, without ever informing me is bad enough. But, even after I spent time supposedly working this out with one of your managers, it still appeared on my bill at check-out. 

Third, an additional problem happened on the last night we were there. The electricity went out at least three times. While the generator seemed to kick-in within a minute, it happened again, and again. I understand that the resort itself cannot control these things, but it was certainly disruptive (the sound of the generator was very loud). 

In general, while most people were nice and attending to our needs at the moment (especially by the pool and at the beach), the resort itself was in rather poor shape for a 5 star hotel. There was always construction, things were un-clean and falling apart, and often service was slow when requesting something. I feel that we did not stay a a luxury resort, and having stayed at other Park Hyatt hotels around the world, we were disappointed.

Hyatt Gold Passport member. Prepaid $3,000 for 3 nights. Was asked to pay again on checkin and was put through painful 1 hour checkin. I stood for 25 minutes, at 10:30pm trying to get some kids attention to check me in. They seemed surprised that an American, with suitcases, brought by the Hyatt hotel bus from the airport would be wanting to check into the hotel. US Website said wifi and breakfast was included in price. Was asked for a "screenshot" of login site and charged $15 for breakfast when I didn't have it (I know- petty).
Hotel staff are kids and the "manager" is a kid masquerading as a manager. I couldn't find any experienced person to talk to. I have stayed at Hyatt around the world for 30 years. This was my poorest experience. Professional business travelers used to the normal Hyatt experience should avoid this place. It is very frustrating. They don't have a section for Gold Passport members and kids working here act as if they are doing a favor by talking to you. Just came from Grand Hyatt, Hong Kong, and the difference in service is brutal.

Well where do I start!
This place looks amazing!! Unfortunately that's where the magic ends.

We booked this hotel for a bit of sanctuary after a rapid tour tour of India. 2 weeks travelling and then a week of rest and relaxation.
When we arrived our breath was taken away by the reception area and the sea view across the pools. Its beautiful. The gardens are immaculate and well looked after by caring staff. The room - architecturally - was very nice and well appointed overlooking a large pond with pink lillies.

So why the poor rating you ask?
Well on the evening we arrived - tired and ready for a quiet drink at the pool bar - we were greeted with the thump thump of a huge sub-woofer preparing itself for a wedding. This musical set up was 100m away near the beach but it might as well have been in the bar as it was so loud.
The wedding party didnt stop there - although the music halted late evening the party didnt and the revellers were staying at the hotel and provided hourly wake up calls for the poor residents - as they returned to their own rooms they were in "High spirits" shouting their way to bed.
Now I'm no party pooper and i like a good party myself and this was a friday night - so no issue. This however went on every night except 1 - thursday night during our week's stay.
At the weekend there was at least 3 parties, When i made a very small complaint on sunday about this - I didnt want to make too much fuss - it was the weekend after all and people were celebrating - but I wanted to find out what the rest of the week would be like. I was told that there would be another party only on monday afternoon.
Nope...not true...it happended every night until thursday (our last night!). sometimes the music was blasting twice a day (2 weddings a day!) during the day time and revellers shouting and screaming at 1 oclock, 2 oclock, 3 oclock, etc. Tuesday morning we had the honour of being woken at 6am by our neighbours having an agrgument (after first being woken by maintenance at 2am about an aircon complaint - by someone who didnt know which room they were in!).
So - is any of this the fault of the hotel staff? Well yes and no. The cant control the behaviour of guests. But they can tell you that this will happen before you book at +200 per night. They can also ensure that guests for weddings who stay 1 night are in a different part of the hotel to poor suffering residents who are staying all week.
They could also ensure that revellers keep a little bit more quiet near the rooms as they have staff deployed all night by the rooms.

OK - so no peace and quiet in a supposed sanctuary. Not what we wanted!!

What about the rest of the deal? Food:
Breakfast was a poor experience. It was like a bun fight. When the wedding guests were there - there was simply too many people all going to the buffet at once, what a nightmare. Reminded me of Bultins when I was a kid. Again not a relaxing experience and not something you should have to put up with in a 5 star hotel. Compare with the other hotels we stayed at during our journey this was terrible.
Here's a plus: The food itself was good, a good choice, and lots of it. Plus the staff were very nice and helpful, sometimes you could ask to have eggs brought to the table - but it took too long - more than 15 minutes in some cases. A cup of coffee brought immediately to your table was cold by the time you got back from the buffet.

In the evenings it was pretty desserted in the food court. There was a good choice of different foods, and the times we did eat there the food was good quality. A word of warning though, the menu prices are only 2/3 of what you will pay. Approx 50% tax is added afterwards. And it is already expensive, 3x what you will pay outside. (there are beach huts outside the hotel if you prefer lower cost).
The staff were very good though. And Anand was the assistant manager spoke to us several times to see if he could help. He couldnt - they were over run.

The pool was fantastic - but spoilt most afternoons by the noise of the wedding parties. At one stage i went back to my room at 11am and they were setting up another wedding. The sound of the sub-woofer made the patio doors in the apartment shake so much i couldnt believe that the hotel let this happen!! What is wrong with you guys!

I tried to stay cool when I complained. I didnt want to get angry during my holiday and make it even worse.
The first time - I jokingly asked for a refund - they just told me that the last wedding was monday afternoon. not correct.
The second time I was a little more annoyed and asked them to help with the noise at night. I could cope with the celebrations in the day - live and let live! But being woken up 10 times a night I was not having. They did nothing about this at all, in fact the last night it was worse (wednesday night) luckily i found some ear plugs, but i could still hear the people shouting even through them!

As recompense I was offered a discounted meal - to which i was grateful. I was also offered some points on my Hyatt card.
But to be honest - that's not compensation for no sleep for 5 days. I will subsequently be writing to the director of the Hyatt chain.

It is a lovely place. But dont go if you want peace and quiet. Out of all the hotels that we stayed (7 in total) this was the most expensive and the worst.

but...make your own mind up... seems other people had a different experience.

We stayed 2nights at the Park Hyatt and was very disappointed. Our upgraded sea view room was relatively small with short storage space. The carpet and upholstery were dirty and stained (Smell). Staff smiled and apologized but not very effective. They spot clean the chairs and removed the carpet, which we never saw again! It took more complaints and me showing the staff how to clean the things

The room was also noisy at night when staff were rattling trolley loads of tables back from the functions held in the grounds. The garden with a number of limp and dead plants surrounding a paving slab with a cold shower over - we weren't tempted.

The grounds and pool are very attractive but there is very little shade. We were told that the manager thought that sunshades spoiled the view from the reception area! The sun bed mattresses were not very clean and the man giving out the towels was difficult to find and we invariably sorted ourselves out.

The restaurants are pretty soulless and not particularly attractive. The few meals we had were fine but the the prices are very, very expensive compared to other local hotels. All the waiting staff were very pleasant.

Internet access was charged which will make you disappointed while many hotels providing free.Spa treatments are very expensive but there is a very well equipped free gym.

The hotel taxis were also very expensive but If you walk to the end of the street there are some reasonably priced ones.

All in all the Park Hyatt represents pretty poor value for money.

Not recommended for family stay. Rooms are very lavish and comfortable but food is not so good and service is average. Location wise hotel is quite good, very near to Airport however if you have Airport transfers included please don't expect some luxury cars, they have mini buses for Airport transfers which are not as per 5 star standards.

i yet have to check in to this property but my worries has already started it takes minimum of 15 minutes to speak to a person on phone.there is little bit of reponse which they hardly put any efforts to gt back at you.I hope there is GM who is reading this and does not dissappoint my stay at the resort.

I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world, from the Park Hyatt Sydney to the Pierre in New York passing by some AmanResort, 4 seasons. It is the first time I was glad to leave one of these hotels! I came to celebrate my birthday and it was a DISASTER! I never left a hotel stressed and angry well... there is a first time for everything. But well for this stay lets start with the beginning: Check-in: ID dropped in front of us no real effort to pick it up by the staff that did the mistake Reception staff seeming lost did not get the chance to finish welcome drink as i had to check immediately for luggage (arriving @ 2200 no other arrival so it must be very urgent) During the stay: Housekeeping: Dusting not done in the rooms Bathtub in one of the rooms not cleaned used glasses left by the staff during 3 days in the room When asked for ID of friends who joined felt like a criminal. DM came with 2 security guards to my room talked very rudely addressed me with my first name! For god sake minimum is to remember the family name I am not a friend you are hosting but I am paying for a 5 star service! Ashtrays in the room never cleaned Dustbin never cleaned in 3 days stay! Night tables dirty and sticky turn down service only when it suits Housekeeping Nearly all the staff seems lost except the gentlemen who gave us a hotel tour which was very nice and Professional when asking the In room dinning staff to clean the table after he clears the food i got answered that it was not his job but it was the job of the housekeeping. Only after insisting he accepted to clean a little bit! Drivers are not driving safely (and I am living in Mumbai I know how driving is in India) check out took ages (had the time to smoke a cigarette between the moment i told what i was thinking of this unacceptable service and the moment i got finally presented the bill) Only positive points: Palms restaurant is great seafood is excellent the lobster perfectly cooked, service was efficient and staff was very accommodating and nice Small gesture from the DM on check out (at least that) Overall: hotel is very nicely situated great beach nice pool but staff literally ruined my stay! Maybe the hotel should think of investing in proper training. VERY DISATISFIED WITH THIS PARK HYATT in case you wouldnt have noticed with my different comments.

It was a very bad experience at every stage , checkin , at the breakfast table next day morning and during the checkout process . There was no customer care concept at any stage. I have given the requisite feedback at the checkout desk

Over priced and staff unable to answer simple questions. It was like it was everyone first day on the job! Close to beach and nice pool. food was very good. Rooms need to be renovated and update! would not recommened

In a nutshell, Hyatt has given it's name to this property and that's about it. A Hyatt Place in it's home geography has much better rooms, much more pleasant service, and is run way more efficiently. Check in is chaotic. Transportation to the airport is beyond their capability. Wi Fi is terrible, unusable. Room quality is like a Holiday Inn Express or a Quality Inn. No one around to guide what to visit or see nearby. Transport desk is their travel expert. Stopping so it does not become an essay.

Spent the weekend with friends . Beautiful property , great spa and clean beach and courteous staff. One of the best deep tissue massages I have had . Food ordinary but the worst let down were the beds . They still have these spring supported beds which are a nightmare to sleep on and a health hazard to the spine and hamstrings . Upon complaining (and the staff confirmed this was a common complaint) they put a wooden plank below the mattress on one of the single beds , but that really did not provide a solution. Complained to front desk also. Came back with lower back ache and stiffness. Could not sleep the two nights I was there

After awesome 4 and 5 star hotels in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, The Park Hyatt Goa Resort and Spa is a big disappointment. It seems to claim 5 stars but even 3 stars would be 'ambitious' for international standards. Be prepared for a "tourisme factory" with over-expensive restaurants and bars, poorly trained staff and totally incapable management. 

I suggest you find a smaller scale genuine 5 star hotel if you insist to want to stay in Goa. But think carefully, there is hardly a difference between Benidorm, Bali and Goa. This region seems to have put a lot of effort in becoming a western trash resort. The charm, service and above all enchanting features of India have long gone.

We rented three rooms (a total of 11 nights) at the property to celebrate a birthday in the family. Starting with the delayed check in at 5.30pm, problematic A/C in one of the rooms, indifference from a large number of staff and a hotel operation that suffers from bad personnel management, this was a disappointing visit. Offset by a beautiful property.

Day 1
Just checked into Park Hyatt this afternoon. At the airport coming in, the pleasant surprise at learning of the free airport shuttle soon disappeared when I sat in the coach and had to change two seats; out of control aircon being the culprit. Not a good start...

I must say the resort photos on Tripadvisor looked a lot more exciting than the resort itself. That's true for most photos and most resorts but somehow this gap seemed too stark; monsoon does play havoc with labor intensive operations. 

After a 45 minute wait and two failed rooms later, we finally scored a room overlooking the expansive lawns and beyond that the Arabian Sea. The views are gorgeous. Reminded me of a Langkawi trip 2 years back. Sweet...

I am trying to think of the best way to describe the room. Damp, dingy, musty, frowsty...I don't know...but my nose is keen and always picks these things up before my family does. And the walls, floors, table and even the mirrors are wet; not damp wet. The mattresses have clearly seen better days; the French Windows opening into a verandah are great but one of the Windows was jammed. 

In fact our beach resort in Hoi An in Vietnam was a LOT better than Park Hyatt Goa. And a lot cheaper too! 

I couldn't help noticing hordes of staff all around us; something we didn't see in our recent Vietnam holiday though both countries have similar levels of poverty and under developed infrastructure. 

My wife goes around to check how we can keep our 9 year old busy and active. After all, a key reason to select Park Hyatt was the child friendly reviews on TripAdvisor. She is told most of the activities like dolphin cruises, trekking, lawn football, etc. are closed during the Monsoon. There is a Camp Hyatt where he promptly sat down to watch a movie with some other kids!!! So much for our plan to burn his excess energy in Goa. 

Disappointing that there doesn't seem to be enough planned by the Resort for fun and action during the rains. Plenty can be conceptualized indoors and outdoors. 

So far Hoi An beats Goa hands down. I so desperately want to change the title of my review. Hoi An has an old town that is out of the world. Goa has an Old Goa town as well. Let's find out tomorrow.

Really pathetic service
While the property is good looking the services are so poor i have pledged to never come here again! The keys NEVER work... You have to wait for ages for the support staff to come and help u enter the rooms. Food is pathetic and lacks variety... Overall a very bad experience and wont wish my worst enemies to come here...

All my friends suffered from digestive problems after having our first meal, overpriced when compared to any other hotels like Taj etc. staff needs more customer service training. need communication training too.

I visited Goa from July 5-July 8 and stayed at the Park Hyatt with family. We had booked 3 rooms. I really struggled with the rating. There were some pros; polite staff, a great view, a good breakfast and dinner buffet. Eventually though, the cons outweighed the pros. 

We booked this hotel because it has direct beach access. On reaching the beach we were told we could not go in to the sea, because it was high tide. We asked for safe timings to enter the waters. We were told by the lifeguards, that during rainy season we could not enter the water PERIOD. I wish they would've been upfront about that on the website (post a disclaimer that during rainy season, the beach is closed). 

Indoor areas can get hot and muggy. We went to the recreation area, only to leave within a few minutes. The room was hot and uncomfortable. 

There was a constant urine stink in the room. I had to call and ask for room freshner. There drainage system is terrible. The bath tub would not drain on our very first day. The bathroom fixtures are all dated. The person who checked us in, told us that the hotel is 15 years old. It shows its age in the fixtures. Maintenance is not up to 5 star standards. 

We found bugs in our room; cockroaches and millipeds. The pest control guy told us the cockroaches are garden bugs and come in if you open the patio screendoors. So there's a wonderful patio, but you can't use it.

On our last night, I woke up to the sound of dripping water. I thought my kids left the bathroom water running. Turns out their was a leak in the AC and the water was dripping through the ceiling (and through a light fixture). The manager I spoke with about the issue (Yaarik) was frustrating at first. He offered to recompense us with half the room tariff for one night. I talked to him again during checkout and he was way more polite. They eventually waived 100% of the tariff for that night. 

On the upside, they have a wonderful pool. Also the staff is very polite (Argha in the breakfast section provided great service). The shopping is awesome. They have a wonderful taxi service if you want to venture out.

Overall, they really need to make an effort to raise the hotel to 5 star standards.

I have written this really long review as this was one of my favourite properties in Goa and its very sad to see it losing its place on the list....

This was a repeat stay after a superb stay last time. We had requested for early check in but reached later than regular check in time and yet were kept waiting as they didn't have any ground floor rooms available...we had requested specifically for this as I have a knee issue. They insisted that nothing was available but when we didn't give up they magically found not one but a few rooms which were not yet ready. Again they were not able to tell us when it would be ready and needed 30 minutes to just let us know that!! We surely didn't pay big bucks to sit in their lobby!!
We went out to get a bike and they confirmed our phone number to call if the room was ready before we returned...guess what....they didn't call...reason - we went out!!

Since we liked our last stay so much my husband made it a point to book here for my birthday...they apparently don't decorate the room so he had requested cake and flowers to be delivered at midnight (he is allowed to give me flowers only once a year as I don't like them being plucked)...he did recofirm this at the time of check in. Cake arrives 15 minutes past midnight with the guy wishing my husband a very happy birthday...no sight of flowers! They didn't bother to write what my husband has asked them to on the cake! My husband is a gold member with Hyatt and we have stayed with Hyatt around the world and this is the treatment on a special ocassion!

Housekeeping forgot basic things like shower caps, room slippers, dental kit. Also they forgot to clear used glasses, burnt matchstick from the candle on the cake was lying around for 2 days...chair and lounger were badly stained and pillowcovers were torn!
We ordered breakfast one day and we get a call back saying they didn't have cinnamon powder to sprinkle on the french toast...pancakes and french toast are the basic breakfast items and a hotel like this couldn't serve it! Room service came without a serving table, put the tiffins on the table and left without any offer to serve...and we had egg benedict to scoop from the dabbas...both egg benedict and pancakes were barely warm. 

Multiple feedback were no use and finally I requested to meet with the GM as we do not expect this low service from a brand we are really loyal too. The duty manager informed that the GM was travelling and would be available only on our last day there...She came upto our room and apologised profusely but inspite of this all we did see was deteriorating standard of the hotel. She tried to offer us a free meal and when we refused, transport for our dinner outside but we had our own transport. We only asked them to deliver what we had paid for! 
We asked for a room change after 2 nights and they offered us something near the central area and a pool view both very noisy forgetting our basic request for a quiet room. Attention to detail has surely gone out of the window.

Funnily on our third or fourth day, the housekeeping had placed a bouquet in the room with an apology card...they don't do what is requested and then do what is not needed. The duty manager also offered my husband to arrange some surprise 2 days after my birthday which needless to say was turned down as it was too late.

On our last night we returned to find the bulb of the floor lamp fused...we were so tired of complaining we let it go inspite of it being really dim in an already dimly lit room.

They allowed us late check out and arranged airport drop. Again with an apology card and a request to give them a chance to redeem themselves...they could have done better while we were still there. Also the request to meet the GM was not fulfilled.

We started on a bad note last year at the Grand Hyatt Goa but they finished in Grand style making it a stay to remember for life but Park Hyatt just parked themselves with a ton of apologies...It'll take a lot to spend big bucks to check if they have pulled up their socks or not when there are hotels like Taj, Lalit and even Zuri which will make special occasions a lifetime memory.

It's run by a bunch of hard working but very very junior team. Team leader is missing & what's more important is that the Hyatt service is by far far not seen.
Severe Maintenance issues throughout the property from the Air Conditioning absent in my room throughout my stay w/O any remedy or compensation to various glitches across. The fall backs didn't simply end. 
My booking rates didn't match with the ones the hotel had in record inspite of booking directly with the head of Sales of Hyatt - INDIA.
Mini bar charges were put to my a/c inspite of the drink still lying the minibar.
Mini Theatre movie list kept changing as no one actually had the knowledge of which movie would be on nor was there a notice board to read the same.
Games room was a dis/grace area which simply spoke as to how they expect a guest to be treated with power saving on by reducing illumination & AC kept out of order. Till v brought to the notice of the duty manager & AC was started which means all 3 ACs were deliberately put out of service however the bulbs were not replaced.
Bfast served with SOUR (in CAPITAL) yoghurt/curd & lassi for 3 consecutive days till after severe comments the chef obliged with fresh curd & lassi to the entire guests present. 
The hotel looked decently occupied but looked as though we have come into one of the most lean periods hence it is staffed with a entire team of poorly trained staff.
Giving it 2 stars due to the hard working staff but NEGATIVE RATING is due to the absence of a leader to help out all in place.
This is my second visit to the property but thoroughly disappointed especially becoz I patronage Hyatt with a loyalty membership for over 16 years.

park hyatt is a great property we all know that but what is missing is the heart and soul in this place. staff attitude is very indifferent never willing to help out for anything . would never visit again

Stayed at the Park Hyatt thrice in the last 5 months with my husband.. we have been travelling to Goa on business a lot lately... 
The first time our stay was fantastic.. The property is absolutely stunning.. And the beach is wonderful too.. 

We did have some trouble at check in on our first visit in January but we were upgraded to the suite and so it was all forgotten.. 

The next time we visited in April... The hotel was sold out to a convention.. The hotel was overrun by loud and obnoxious guests.. The service was slow and no one picked up the phones... Most of the items on the menu were not available.. We decide then that we wouldn't stay here again but we booked it again this time around purely due to the location.. 

This time we checked in to find that the hotel was sold out to yet another group.. We were not given a room to check into till 4 pm despite confirmation of an early check in by 12 pm give the by the hotel... Then we were given a noisy room with almost no privacy.. When asked to change the room the staff were not very accommodating as they were sold out again.. 

In conclusion I would say that this hotel is more interested in making a quick buck off its conventions and groups, than take care of its repeat guests.. 
The romantic image of this hotel showing on the website is not the true vibe of this hotel.. Not ideal for couples and moreover they don't care..

Stupid idiots screw ups multiple on transits. First, makes me wait for 45 minutes at the airport saying the car is coming in 5 minutes 10 times. Finally took a pre paid and got in. When informed, no one bothered to check what went wrong. Taxi issues again when we went out at night - funny rules not explained at all. Be careful with transits, bunch of fools especially a guy called Siddhesh, and a bearded guy at taxi desk screwing up otherwise is a great property and experience. Second visit here, not sure if ever again, checking out on Sunday @room no 145.

It's been day 1 and it's clear that the place is amazing. The staff are great in terms of their motivation and willingness to do things but they are extremely lacking training:
- asked if we can get breakfast by the pool. Assured it would not take time to get toast and scrambled eggs. Took over 1 HR and still forgot things despite repeated reminders.
- lunch time was similar experience. They got 7 people working but everyone going like a head less chicken. Kitchen staff let down the staff facing customers.
- dinner was the best where the person serving us was great but was let down by the guys at the kitchen and bar! 30 min to wait for a bottle of wine. 20 min for some butter (despite repeated requests). 
- the day ended well with the room key not working and having to trek not once but 3 times before the person helping me figured out that she got the room number wrong! And after a whole day the trek isn't short. A simple phone at suitable locations to contact front desk would be useful. 
Well wanted to speak to the resort manager....
