Guess what? Resort manager was out of town and the assistant manager had to be hunted down as he was busy at the banquet! 
It took 4 people to figure out where this person was..
In the end what do we get told? Sorry.. Great that's the first step and the least anyone can do but the assistant manager was useless as he didn't as much do anything but nod his head. Nothing more! so not even sure if he got the gist of what was happening! Look out for Alex. Class act!

Now supposed to get a call from the manager... Let's see if that happens.. Watch the space..

The property is great, beach is excellent. People are good people who want to do their best but don't know how.. 
Guess what Mr. manager.. This is a high end hotel so they should have no excuses for this. And you definitely can do better than say sorry. Help your staff!!

I have been staying at Park Hyatt everytime I visit Goa, for the last 3 years. Our first few visits were wonderful and without any complaints...However, this visit was by far the worst in terms of our experience. Check-in preferences were not taken into account, rude behavior by check-in lady, had to wait for a long time before room was allotted, room allotted did not meet our specs, several complaints later, our room got changed, but the luggage was not moved. Our Kids came back from the pool and they had to wait for another 45 minutes in wet clothes before our luggage was moved to the new room. Horrible customer service! You will get better value for money from similarly priced resorts.

A lovely location and wonderful access to the beach is completely let down by sub-par service and clueless servers. Food quality is average. Night turn down service is unheard of. I would definitely look at an alternative five star property which is more child friendly.

The hotel is very good, great rooms, excellent staff, good food. Our stay would have been ideal, if it was not for stray dogs in the premises, very disturbing , the staff was also slow in taking ng any action in about it .

If you want to stay in a very big lavish hotel with a great view , too many restaurant , but very poor customer service right through your stay it's your ur choice ... I understand that we are staying at the busiest time , but hotels that do well are the one which deliver best in class service consistently irrespective of the season... We were celebrating our anniversary and mind u we eat at the coffee shop ,were at the pool / visited the lobby not once did the staff bother to even greet us ... A emotionless hotel thats what I would call it ... I stayed at planet Hollywood just next door for 4 nights I regret not extending my stay there and checking into this hotel and pay 4 times more 

Sorry guys u missed the opportunity ...On the positives rooms are very nice / children's play area is good ...

Apart from the pool and the nature landscape, the rooms, food and customer service was average. Paying over $800 a night I expect exceptional service and better guest rooms. Instead what we received was lackluster customer service except from a couple of front desk managers and average rooms/ food.
The natural beauty of Goa made up for our lackluster experience at the Park Hyatt. 
Personally, I felt most of the staff members were not happy there, so in part it is shown through their customer service.

We recently visited the Park Hyatt over the 2nd October long weekend! We have been visiting this resort many times over the years! We have small kids 6 & 8 yrs so we usually don't venture out much from the resort..so we like to be in a nice resort which is kid friendly!

The positives of the resort is that the CampHyatt is excellent for the kids..the staff is very patient & loving to the kids! They keep the kids well occupied
With lots of arts & craft activities & games!
The pool is also very nice..esp the slide in the pool is a big hit for the kids!! They have a private beach which is also very clean & nice!

As I mentioned before because of the above we have been going back to this resort regularly over the years! But this time we were very dissapointed with our room..!!we had booked a pool facing room..day one all was ok but 2nd day onwards there was a terrible stench coming from our room..it was unbearable!! We complained to the house keeping who came n sprayed some room freshner but that was just temporary respite ..we had to constantly follow up with them to have the ac ducts chcked...finally we called for the duty manager & requested that they either do something about the smell or change our room..! He said that there were no rooms available in our category n we would need to downgrade our room..anyways the jist of it was that the staff was not at all helpful n there only solution was either we stay in a smelly room or downgrade!!!
The only person who was helpful was Mr Arjun who was the duty manger on the 3rd..but unfortunately it was too little too late since we were leaving on the 4th & we'd wasted 2 days of our holiday trying to sort out this mess!! We were very dissapointed since this has been one of our favourite resorts in Goa!

Horrible check in at midnight,looking around my cottage in dark midnight with nobody to help.On reaching the room somehow keys not working so called reception through my mobile,as no other communication possible.Reception politically assured a help but of no help..waisted 1 hour up to 3 Am..Reception fooling around that no rooms available but on asking a cab to get into other hotel finally got a magical room with working keys.

Stay was comfortable but no mobile network working nd reception again failed to communicate important messages sent by my home.

Mailed the issue to the management and they are working on it....Till then ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK.

This is a five star hotel in every sense of the word. The staff are charming and attentive, the facilities are top class and the setting is perfect. The rooms are a good size, and the grounds are vast. This hotel is elegant without being overbearing.

The property is amazing. Although I visited not at the most ideal time (around August), it was mostly raining but still I had a complete blast. My room had all the essential amenities and generally everything that you want in a 5-star property. The Spa was amazing as well. Thanks for the stay. Will hopefully be back soon!

Travelling to Goa India for the first time, my husband and I didn't know where to begin when we starting looking for accommodation. It came down to either the Marriott or Park Hyatt and I have to say thank goodness we chose Park Hyatt! Travelling from Australia, we arrived in the very early hours of the morning. As soon as we entered the gates it felt like we came to a different world. The amazing front office staff welcomed us with beautiful fresh hand towels and a welcome drink and escorted us our beautiful room. We opted for a king room and when we walked in we were greeted by a clean, spacious room, a sucken bathtub and a outdoor rain shower - WOW! We had a beautiful buffet breakfast every morning serving only fresh local produce and omelettes as per your order. We also had dinner every night during our 9 night stay trying the variety of eatery's on site. We were not disappointed! The pool is amazing and the luscious grounds are something to look at!!! The resort is 5 star, absolute luxury however the staff are what makes this place even more special. Everyone, and I mean every staff member always had a smile on their face and was willing to assist with whatever we asked. A special mention to our housekeeper Monika and to the beautiful Fiona D'Costa for making this trip one to last a lifetime. Fiona and her Team organised a beautiful surprise for me as my husband and I celebrated our 20 year anniversary...one evening after dinner we came back to a room filled with red balloons, fresh roses on our bed, a cake and a beautiful bubble bath filled with rose petals. It was something from a fairytale and we will never forget that...thank you so much Fiona and her Team. If you are searching for a resort in Goa like we did for many months, don't go past the PARK HYATT...its truly a magical experience!!!

Fabulous Beach, great pool, many dining options. The beachside seafood restaurant, amazing dinner and perhaps the best Sunday brunch anywhere in the world. Unlimited drinks.....amazing value. Shout out to Olivo Barbosa who took amazing care of us. So many people work so hard here. We will return. Heard a rooms Renovation is coming. Hard to imagine this place any better. The housekeeping department is tops. When my friend had a fever they brought lots of dragon fruit to reduce temperatures and it worked. Only quibble is the spraying for bugs. The workers covered us with bug spray even as we frantically waved them off. Thank goodness no children with us. We told management. We trust they took heed.

I was here with my wife to have the best taste of Christmas and new year and trust me we did get the best experience for life they have the best located property where in we can view the beach and easy accessibility to it you want posh living, you need good food, nice hospitality, romantic stay what not a complete package it was one of the best experience we ever could have

Was put in this hotel as I was working in Goa. Found it to be efficiently run by a wonderful staff crew. Nothing was too much trouble. The weather was impeccable as was the cleanliness. 

Boasts the largest pool in India (perhaps they mean Goa) but none the less, it was refreshing. Some very rude people there clicking their fingers and not saying please and thank you, but I am old school maybe, and just don't like that sort of thing. I suppose it comes with the 5* territory. 

If you are going to Goa, you would be hard pressed to improve on this place although a little pricey

Firstly thank you Park Hyatt for a lovely room, amazing breakfast and great location. Credit to your staff - Fiona, Alex - and all the hard working people at this hotel.

Owing to a double booking at another hotel by Trip Advisor/Tingo/Expedia we were relocated to The Park Hyatt. When we arrived at the Park Hyatt, we were informed that the booking was on a room only basis, but we explained that it was B & B. The hotel looked into this - it took over a day and then gave us bed and breakfast on a complementary basis (what we had originally paid for), The mix up was not the hotels fault and we thank them very much for their kindness. I am currently chasing up this matter with Trip Advisor/Tingo (it is very hard to get in touch with them and make a complaint).

We loved India and will definitely be returning.

I been in this hotel for 4 nights and it was simply awesome, the lobby is stunning with and amazing view the check in was smooth very professional and helpful, the property itself is great and the swimming pool is to die for, the beach was 2min walk from my room and it was great warm waters and plenty of space, only minus was the bed that wasn't the most comfortable but other then that the room was amazing and the staff super friendly and professional

Excellent service (one of the best we've experienced globally and we are extremely well travelled) was the standout experience in this beautifully laid out property on the beach in So Goa. Warm, gracious helpful staff made the stay a pleasure. Went out of their way to even provide a cooking lesson in the native Goan cuisine - that you to the Casa Sarita staff and particularly Chef Tanuja. The concierge service was outstanding in helping find taxis and arranging scooties. Walking distance to the best dining spots in all Goa - particularly Zeebop. Highly recommended :)

Finalising our 5th visit to great India we stayed 4 nights at the Park Hyatt Resort in Goa. Room With balcony and view to the Arabic sea and the beautifol gardens is a good choice. Restaurants offer Goa especialities as well as daily buffet at lunch and dinner at reasonable prices considering a 5 star complex. Swimming pools are attractive and towels are provided both at the beach and pools. There is one pool for adults only so one is never disturbed by children Daily entertainment is available ( yoga lessons, cooking, live music...). A good place to relax after many days of traveling around

We had a family holiday here for a week and had a wonderful time! The hotel was beautiful, clean and the staff were always friendly and happy to help. From Elton & Ishani at reception, to Ananda, Zaki, Mahantesh & Rajit in the restaurant...everyone made the stay amazing. The swimming pool was large and always being cleaned and the beach a step away - secluded from the noisier public beach and clean and calm.
Breakfast had more than enough options and even for dinner there were various menus you could pick from whilst sitting outside listening to live music. You could pick dishes from different menus - from Italian to Indian - therefore never short of choice. There was also an option for dinner buffets which were extremely tasty with many different options. We would definitely return to stay here for another relaxing trip to paradise!

After visiting 7 cities in 9 days, this resort was the perfect final stop to recharge before our 14+ hour flight home. Our room was very generous in size and well appointed. Loved the walk in shower. Wished the outdoor shower had hot water as that would have made the room 10+. Ate dinner @
Palms by the beach which is a great location, food and service very good too. Liked that you can eat outdoors in the Village Square and order from more than 1 restaurant. Had some spa treatments which were very good and reasonably priced for a resort. Found all the staff very helpful and accommodating.

Excellent property but service is very low.Staff not know the Hospitality For Park Hyatt means.Staff not cares .very disappointed.Food is Good .Rooms are clean great atmosphere location is near to airport but hotel management must take strict measures for improving service

Our welcome to Park Hyatt was pleasant and efficient, and our reception manager was very sweet. (Her name was Fiona). As we have stayed several times here, she kindly upgraded us to a Lagoon view Suite, which was both spacious and comfortable, with beautiful views. 
Although we had problems in the past with noise from 'functions' (and last year from helicopter rides!), this wasn't the case this year, except for a 'tune-up' by a DJ for an evening 'do' which disturbed us briefly by the pool at about 4pm.
We also had very helpful service from another reception manager called Vanessa, who helped us with recovering some clothes we had left in the last resort!
I love the grounds here, which are beautifully maintained - the gardens are lush with extensive lily ponds and great vistas, and the housekeeping staff keep the room beautifully clean and well-stocked with water and toiletries - well done guys!
The only reason that this review gets 4* not 5 is that I was not very impressed with the restaurant service, (or the buffet, which looked a bit dull!). Despite there being a large number of staff, and often very few customers, service seemed rather 'random', and though the female staff and manager were friendly and courteous, I was not so impressed with a couple of the young men, one who came across as a little cocky, (and who argued with me about the rice being included with my main course, when it clearly stated on the menu that it was!), and the other who was a bit sullen until the end when he was all smiles, (but again we were charged extra for plain rice when it said that it was 'inclusive' according to the menu). Whilst these are small issues, they need 'ironing out', as they 'colour' one's experience and perception of one's visit. A 5* resort requires attentive, efficient and respectful staff, who understand the menu and each item on it, and who do NOT argue with customers that something is other than it clearly is!
Despite this, we would visit again, as all other aspects of our staff were agreeable and of a high standard.

The hotel and staff are second to none. Apart from being carried to and fro by sedan chair I can't think of a better hotel to relax and unwind. Only downside, slightly noisy neighbours but that's all. The adult only pool is a great feature, the food quality was exceptional, the housekeepers were on hand within seconds. The staff here make the hotel what it is - it's beautiful but so are the staff. Nothing was too much trouble and they seemed very happy and this reflects in the service. I never write reviews - but this time it is a pleasure. We will be returing from London in the next 12 months.

With about 45 acres along the Arabian Sea, Park Hyatt is just a wonderful resort with lawns reaching to the beach, a seafood restaurant on the beach that is open for breakfast, lunch, afternoon snacks and drinks, and dinner. The property has other restaurants that serve Indian, Italian, local Goan food and a Village Cafe that serves Western and Indian food, a huge breakfast buffet and is open 24 hours. We found the quality of food to be very good. Service throughout the resort was excellent.

For swimmers the resort has a huge cascading complex with connected pools on several levels literally flowing from the lobby level to the ocean. The pool area as well as the rest of the resort has nice gardens including a vegetable one.

Park Hyatt Goa also offers kids camp.

Some rooms offer a very nice private outdoor shower, alas the plumbing in outdoor shower has only cold water - not enjoyable in Goa, even in January.

The hotel also makes it very easy to take sightseeing trips in the area by arranging local transportation by nice, clean private taxis - the fare can be paid in cash (local currency) to the driver or charged to the room for a small service fee (5%).

We found The Park Hyett to be a beautiful hotel set in beautiful grounds. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly throughout the hotel. This was our first visit to The Park Hyett after coming to Goa for over 20 years but we will certainly be back!

This property is first class in all respects. The grounds, the pools, the restaurants, the rooms and the spa are all well designed. The beach is wonderful and has all the expected amenities -- lounge chairs, towels, umbrellas, food and beverages. We enjoyed the attentive service of two waiters, Shabham and Rajit and found the front desk staff very helpful with our various needs. Probably the best resort in Goa. Another plus is that it is relatively close to the airport (20minutes).

Awesome services, no disturbance from the staff until you call for them, very good and secured environment.....very peaceful....very clean beach not much crowd...you could walk on the beach in the middle of the night rather whole night ... love to be there again

We booked a special holiday to celebrate our 60th Birthdays! Fabulous resort, amazing staff. ..couldn't do enough for us! Lovely grounds and super food with smashing sandy beaches! Very relaxing and we'll worth a return visit! Well done to you all, especially Elton and Antalya!

Thank you very much for an absolutely incredible stay!
Everything about this hotel is just perfect - from the amenities, to the food and especially the staff. We are already planning our next trip. The Park Hyatt Goa is a true gem.
Special thanks to Evelyn who went above and beyond for us. She checked us in seamlessly on arrival and then provided me with her whatsapp number for anything we may need while there. She responded to my requests immediately and nothing was ever too much for her. She also arranged for a beautiful anniversary surprise, in conjunction with my husband, in the room for me. On check out, after discovering I enjoy reading, she gifted me with a beautiful bookmark. Thank you, Evelyn!!
Also, a special mention to the staff at the beach and at the pool. You guys are incredible!! 
We also really enjoyed breakfast, especially the waffles and pancakes made by the ever smiling Ankush.
Thank you and we look forward to our next visit.

Nice luxury hotel in the south

The hotel has something for everyone including a crche for toddlers! The food is good, their pools are one of the largest and the lawns and private beach is all too good

The property is big so you need a buggy to move around (especially if with senior citizens). Not a big deal though as you just need to call one a few minutes before leaving and it will appear!

Nice overall experience

Another Hyatt beauty! Incredibly maintained property and excellent service and food ! A resort which deserves a compliment. Great view from the room and well designed room. Liked the bathroom , it's like a mini swimming pool!! Totally worth the money and time spend !

Very nice hotel, with the best service ever. We ran into the days with election so the government have made "dry days"without any alcohol served at the hotel. But we enjoyed the restaurant and the facilities without the wine. When we came back to sleep, the room was covered in flower leaves from the red rose at the bed and they have made an excellent bath for us with the leaves spreaded all over the foam in the water. Very nice

Located on to the sea-side, with an almost private beach, this vast property is all one can ask for luxurious papering in Goa. Stuffed with amenities and a nice pool, a great one to hang-out in the tourist city.

We stayed with my daughter's family who had 3 year old twins for four days.It is about half hour drive from the Airport, spread over 45 acres of land along the sea coast, and has 250 rooms with about 250 well trained staff. The staff personnel were always highly courteous and helpful. Lot of different wellness and recreational activities and games are planned everyday. There is a Toddler's section for children below 4 years, Hobby studio, Games room and beach sports during non-monsoon time. They also have Gymnasium, Yoga class, Spa, and nice swimming facility The kids enjoyed swimming and playing in the Toddler's section. The elders could heartily swim in the Arabian Sea during low tide.
There are three main restaurants serving Indian, Goan and Italian food. Everyday there would be breakfast and .Buffet available in the Village square. We could relish the different type of cuisine everyday.
General cleanliness, hygiene standards and courteous service was maintained.

An excellant resort. Beautiful property. Serene, calm and very comforting. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. A must must visit place. You would surely fall in love with this place. Must visit

The resort property is amazing and is so very well kept. The rooms are spacious and very neatly kept. Service throughout the resort is impeccable and staff is extremely friendly & helpful. Would surely recommend staying here.

We stayed at Park hyatt for 3 days and it was so so fun nd relaxing to be there. My 2 years old loved d swimming pool and the beach toys which were given on request. Room was so big with a lagoon view. I especially liked d biggggg bathroom...kids area dts camp hyatt was so lovely wid so many toys nd teddy bears.....rooms were cleaned twice a day....check in nd chk out was so smooth nd so was d pick up frm airport.....one thing that I dnt liked ws the less options for North indian food sumtimes.....English options were more bcz of the foreigners.....but overall it ws an amazing experience.....will definitely visit again....

Stayed here 4 days with my wife and 3 year old son. Check in was professional and was nice to be offered a cool towel and drink after traveling.
The property is very big and beautifully kept, the pools are strikingly pretty and spotlessly clearance. With excellent service and good poolside food and drink it's a lovely place to be.
Our king double room was just big enough and well appointed, my only quibble was that the bed was abit soft but we did sleep well.
Breakfast was excellent and plentiful, in fact all the food we had at the resort was superb.
There were 2 weddings on while we were there and these looked great fun and were a real splash of colour. The noise didn't ruin our sleep at all.
All in all we loved every minute here and will definitely return in future.

Our Honeymoon , Had a Great Time Lovely Place But They Have a Lot of Weddings There 3 When we were There so expect to be Kept Awake as They are very big weddings with live stage music lovely Beach very clean surroundings and very good polite and Helpful Staff But The Waiter Service at Breakfast let's The Hotel Down it's a. Buffet Service which is no Problem but the Basic Service of Tea and Coffee lets Them Down as it takes so long to Arrive at The Table when it should be The First Thing They Bring You as you sit Down but for the first Eight Days it's was coming to the Table halfway Though your Breakfast after many Times of asking. We Complain to our Rep and it got better for about Three Days

Deciding on this resort to choose a family outing with one young kid and one toddler was difficult but sea breach area reviews on Tripadvisor sealed this resort and the point we landed in this resort, this resort didn't disappoint a single moment barring one (details below).
Checkin process was smooth and reception area was beautifully done with front and back open and resort really conveys the feeling of village design with very comfortable and modern interiors. The cleanliness of the room is one big plus as they cleaned up the room multiple times instead of once in the day. 
The room which we choose was on first floor with large sit-out facing pool; comfortable and large bed which easily fit two adults and one kid while they provided separate portable and comfortable bed for toddler. Bathroom was quite open with nice design. 
Almost private and very clean beach and resort large lawns open up to the beach and every day walk to beach itself was refreshing.
This resort has many interconnected pools which combined is the largest resort pool I have seen but not all pools are open to all which is good thing.
This resort has many different restaurants catering to different cuisines and we almost tasted all of them in 4 days stay and none disappointed in terms of flavors or service; breakfast buffet has large variety catering to both Indian and western cuisines.
Special mention to staff who handled our kids: one verbally active one and one physically active one.
Icing on the cake was the kids area in this resort which is very well staffed and maintained and the staff was equally playful and helpful to kids while at same time maintaining distance from kids to let them enjoy.
Its not near to main city market or the public beaches and they do provide efficient and economical cab service from the resort.
Overall a complete resort where doesn't really need to step out of resort and this resort kept my family occupied for fours days.
Now the one incident which felt like hot chilly in almost sweet resort was one when my wife after finishing her breakfast asked the restaurant staff that she plan to carry some breakfast items of the kids back to the room as kids were still a sleep plus we avoided taking them for breakfast in crowded restaurant, staff refused her including senior in-charge and then she has to go all way up to senior management stating that we will pay for this breakfast plate separately. Their policy was clear and understood but at same time we all are humans and not auto-bots and can apply rules to different situations differently. Here this unpleasant experience could have been avoided by senior staff which decided to play auto-bot.
But nonetheless, management did send the proper breakfast for kids to room not just one plate and we got the surprise in the evening when chocolate cake with personalized card for kids was waiting in the room.
I hope staff in this resort realize that everyone carry their dignity over the freebies.

Cleaning my lungs by the beach from Delhi. This is a great resort and wonderful for solo travellers and families too. The adults only pool is great for us children free adults and the service is good and attentive.
The day spa is excellent. This is my second visit to Park Hyatt - previously I stayed twice at Taj Fort Aguada which was also excellent. The Park Hyatt is easier to get from the airport to the resort and doesn't make you feel like you've lost a whole day to travelling to the airport. I'll come back here!

I do not know why some complain about this hotel this is lovely hotel breakfast had everything that we needed the evening meals was expensive compared to the beach shacks and I had to send one meal back because it was cold. The meals on the beach shacks were better and a third of the price our room was 234 with a lovely view of the gardens in a quaint spot but a bit of a walk for breakfast see photo but you can get a buggy to take you there. While I was there I had to get a doctor to my leg the hotel arranged everything for me the doctors fee was 1000 rupees and 1000 rupees for prescription brilliant and after they sent me a get well card and a lovely bunch of flowers. The pool is the best in south goa see photos the pool attendants are brilliant they will have your sunbeds ready for you with two towels on each bed and thay keep cuming round to see if you want to be in the sun or shade the grounds are beautiful with lots of walking to be dune we will definitely be going there again sumtime in the future

My family stayed for 4 days in January and loved it.

The Rooms:

We stayed in a room with a queen size bed with an extra cot. We have 2 girls, ages 11 and 8 and this room was just fine for all of us. The beds are nice and comfy. The bathroom is clean. There is an outside shower as well as a shower inside. The inside shower is a few steps down which could be filled as a bathtub as well. 

The restaurant/buffet:

We had the breakfast buffet and it was excellent! There was wide selection of food, egg stations, dosa stations, lndian and Western foods. The service was excellent. We didn't have meals after the breakfast but it looked busy all day long. 

Pool Area:

There are are at least 4 interconnected pools. There are also slides that connect the pools. These slides are slow but still fun for children and adults as well. There is also a small pool for toddlers. There was full service at the loungers. There is a lunch and drink menu available. The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. 

The beach area. 

The beach is located at the end of the property. There was also a restaurant from the hotel on the beach available and loungers as well. The sea was warm with rolling, gentle, waves. Arossim Beach is large and quiet. 

Overall, this is an excellent hotel, we have visited India several times. This hotel is our favorite hotel by the beach. I highly recommend this hotel!

Recently visited park hyatt for our 10 th anniversary it was a wonderful stay n the hotel made our day even more special by givin us few surprises i can easily say this is one of the best property i ve stayed in goa.

We had been to park Hyatt as part of a wedding party with almost over 80 rooms booked. It was spread over 3 nights. Excellent property, rooms, room service, great breakfast and lunch and dinner at all the wedding functions. Toilets are great with state of the art toiletries. I would have given 5 stars except for the fact that Ms. Frency, front end staff was outright rude and very unprofessional in the way she handled customers from the wedding party. Her lack of professionalism really put us back as it was opposite of our experience during our stay. Please visit the property keeping in mind that one person can ruin your holiday! Well done Ms. Frency.

Everything about the hotel was great, the food was great, it was clean, the room was good, the staff were friendly. The only trouble we had was that there was a wedding on which meant loud music in to the night and some of the restaurants / bars were closed on occasion.

Never thought the Park Hyatt was really up there. But was pleasantly surprised. Performed in its banquets. 

The property is landscaped beautifully and has an absolutely relaxing feel and look to it. You can't help but slip into holiday mode when you walk about. 

Excellent fish curry rice and Goan cuisine available at the main restaurant. Highly recommend it. 

Would love to return and hopefully stay at the resort.

Amazing service.....the Park Hyatt Goa Resort &Spa is a special hotel with exceptional service. We stayed for four nights January 2017 and I have to say it's the best resort hotel where the cleanness is outstanding. Normally in such a climate you would expect a level of insect life within the resort particularly mosquitoes, flies etc but at the Park Hyatt we found none. The rooms were serviced twice a day, the pools were very clean, every restroom within the confines was kept in pristine conditions and smelling very fresh. The staff are outstanding Elton helped us check in early as our flight arrived at 8am and sorted out our rooms in quick time. The restaurant waiting staff in particular Shubham was outstanding helping us with our every need. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to revisiting Goa in the very near future.

Terrible pathetic absurd shame on the staff and GM
The hotel or the staff who changes there behaviour after sales should never be given any business 
It's was 13-16sept2016 
Hospitality doesn't mean only rooms and dine
It means lot beyond it which this hotels fails completely 
Anything which is in itinerary should be provided whole heartily
We given them a business of approximately 18lacs and they didn't respect even over travel arrangements which was part of quotation
When I spoke to general manager about it he said though it was our responsibility but if we fail then "guest take taxi n come to hotel".
Not only this all the 3days it was some how same with travel arrangements
Further "Maya K." was the business executive who lied about conference arrangements and Organised our conference in a very pathetic location and Which was later arranged by myself by going hotel to hotel and checking at country inn by Carlson which should have been paid by hotel and we made payment for that.

Not even taxi payment was remembered 
Whenever I tried reaching maya(the employee) use to avoid my call or disconnect in between.
The worst behaviour I ever seen in this hospitality industry 
So without writing much let me simply conclude it was 230 guest I had in my company
Before business was given to them every one was polite and welcoming and once we checked in their behaviour was so careless and annoying I felt to check out on same point but I was bounded as it was company's trip and I already paid 17lacs to them
Being CEO and managing director 
Let me aware all the travellers this hotel doesn't deserve your stay
They being in hospitality industry and not respecting the whatever they promised in their quotation or business agreement is ridiculous.
And look at the irony they are so rigid that they doesn't even feel sorry even after poor arrangements ,instead start lecturing you regarding managing your own.
They claim that they are 4star hotel but they totally zero in treating a guest.
Finally if they would keep going with same ethics, they themselves will learn lesson with poor business turnovers.
Moral to guest only : visit this property if you want to pay for your own humiliation.

The hotel looks good from outside, but the staffs don't know how to behave with the customers.they need more training on how to satisfy a customer in terms of service. They will never help you in arranging a car for local sight seeing , neither self driven one nor taxis. They will give you suggestions rather to go in a bus and do the local sight seeing. Simply disgusting.room service is also not up to the mark, I went there with my 2 year old baby and in order to get baby's milk I had to follow up so many times, they also sometimes forget to clean the rooms. The duty managers have so much attitude, I don't know they are showing attitude for what.... Overall my experience was poor with this resort, inspite of such high pricing they are not able to provide you service as expected,. With such price range please go for some better hotels which may include the top ones like taj, where you will get the value for money service.

very poor service i had a booking of three days but stayed only for 1 day and shifted to another hotel i stayed in room no 461 and order a bottle of water at 5 in the morning but received the same after three calls at 6 in the morning

Where do we start the girl on reception was dam right rude they didn't give a stuff about other guests only Indian ones food terrible were serving flat beer and tonic we were all inclusive but we ate out this place needs to be taken out of English brochures as they clearly only cater for Indian people

Very poor. Poor service and poor upkeep. Went for buffet on invitation from my co-brother. They were thoroughly disappointed with the service. Then we called the room service guy for bottle opener. He came but was not willing to leave behind the opener. Then came the food. Lesser said better it is. Very very poor. It's place which in a way does not want u to come back.

Four of my friends visited last week and I think I was really carried away with the too much of hype on the reviews. This place doesn't really worth your money, really this is not worth a star hotel. Neither they maintain the standard of star hotel nor their staff are trained to behave with guests. Their food spread is pathetic, they just give some set menu quoting that they don't enough guests and still charge the buffet price. More than the money, it is about the time and effort that you spend with the staff/manager (especially their incharge called Radha is horrible and she spoils your holiday in the first meeting itself) all the time which really spoil your holiday. Their transfers are not on time. I wanted to talk to few of them who were talking big while taking the reservations/booking, no one turned up and/or called me. In total, I wouldn't recommend to anyone. The only matured person who was helping us was Prashant, one of their Manager, poor guy, he is definitely in a wrong place. There was a Big gang on the other day who really made a mess of that place / Swimming pool and some of the couple came as a family talking to us were cursing themselves for choosing this place. Strict NO for family.

me and my 3 children booked in this hotel end of April 2014. One of the worse hotel I came across it can't be 4 star at all. In shower all water goes in to room . no toiletries . and worse it is so unsafe for women to stay here. we had to lock ourself in room, we waited for the morning so we can find another hotel and move out.breakfast was not good either.
at night 2 Russian girls needed to be escorted to their rooms by staff. all because some 150 men were staying in the hotel, and management said they didn't know they were all men . what a joke 
never ever book in this hotel if you are travelling with family. unless you like to go through trauma my daughter had to go through.

i have stayed at this hotel in April..i hired a mahindara thar from outside and hotel staff has torn its seats and scratch the car and i have to pay 6000 inr to the owner of the car.nobody in hotel was able to answer they were just blaming others.

I stayed at this hotel, the food was terrible, evey dish looked the same.
My room was big and fairly clean.
When it came to the last day we were told our occupancy had come to an end, even though we were not due to be picked up to leave the hotel until 6 am.We were not allowed to stay in the lounge and had to book into another hotel until pick up time!!!!!!!

I stayed here in 2012 with my boyfriend for two nights. we saw online and liked the hotel pictures but plsss!!! its nothing like that in real life!!!!! crappy tile floor, dirty bathrooms. Bad service and since this hotel caters to a lot of groups there were hooligans indian families, dont be fooled by bikini clad women in their jacuuzi (like on the website) there are men and the water is infested with insects. Only ok thing was breakfast and location was somewhat convenient to the major destinations nearby

I have been to goa 7 times and stayed in differrent hotels and resort..... But whispering palms was the worst hotel i have stayed in... We took the studio elite rooms which were supposed to be the best rooms in the hotel but the rooms were just like the standard room u get in a cheap hotel.... The food was ok..... The service was disgusting..... No care taken towards the guest... No respone from the staff for any damn thing u req for.... Overall the hotel is just not worth going to...... Also suggest others try for different hotel in this area.... U have better options around... Wld never return and also wld never suggest neone to go to the hotel

Booked flight+ two nights through makemytrip.com. It was a disappointing trip for our family. The hotel was undergoing renovation. Most of the facilities were not available like swimming pool, spa, gym, children play area. Food was mediocre. Firstly on our arrival they were denying us food coupons even though we paid in advance to makemytrip for the same. Room was not up to the mark of a 4 star hotel which they claim it to be. Waste of money as they portray themselves to be a beach resort and having a beach property which is totally untrue. Hot water in washroom is a major issue..its only available for few hrs during morning and evening...they ruined our holiday.

Went in August Mid - No swimming pool, they have built restaurent in the swimming pool area - Not a 5 star property (they claim to be 5 star in some sites) - The nearby beach has no activity whatsoever - All bathroom amenities not replaced daily - Room service slow

We went to this resort in mid July for a couple of days and it was all on work!! No restaurant, no swimming pool and the reception installed on room 205!! They lied to our tour operator and say nothing about the works when he made the booking!! Only a few rooms are in use, lightly refurbished but look old in general (the doors, the bathroom...) and just a plastic swimming pool in a corner of a small garden!!! Be careful!!

Nothing!!! Visited Whispering Palms seven years ago, our first visit to Goa. It was fantastic, we have returned to Goa every year since. Returned to Whispering Palms this year, what a disappointment! We had three rooms, two rooms above the reception, very noisy. Kitchen fans start at 5.00 in the morning, like trying to sleep on a plane. Delivery vans turning up from 6.00. Moved to a room on the right of the pool. It was dirty and gloomy. When we asked staff about the dirty rooms we was told that they where being renovated next year! So we have to live in the dirt until then? The main problem with the Hotel is RATS. Now some one wrote in 2011 about the rats, but I dismissed it. But sat around the pool one evening, I saw the biggest rat I have ever seen. It walked around a ground floor balcony, jumped onto the out door kitchen counter and drop into the kitchen. I went straight over and told the Chef, who laughed! Looking over the counter, I could see a chest freezer with trays of uncovered food on it. The rat jumped back out at me and escaped. 

A few days later we asked to keep our room on for a late departure, and told that they could not tell us until later in the week and would also charge us. I asked the Rep if anything had been done about the rat in the kitchen. The look of surprise on her face! She contacted the House manager and I was asked to explain what I had seen.

I was told straight away that I could keep the room on no charge! They also went and cleaned our room, four people for two hours, they took every thing out of our room and fully cleaned it.

I filled a complaint form in regarding the dirt and the rat. On departure from the hotel, the assistant manger, tried to get me to sign a form, saying I would take no further action.

As far as I could see nothing had been done to stop the rats getting into the kitchen. We never ate at the hotel, for the last week.

On our return I emailed Ryan Bailey from Thomas Cook, all I got was corporate spell, saying I should of reported things earlier in our holiday. The rats had been reported a year earlier!! how long do they need?

I all of the correspondance with Ryan, he never made reference to the RATS.

We will be returning to Goa next year but will not be staying at Whispering Palms.

Not a nice place to stay only ate once in the hotel as food very poor and repetitive. Rooms small and cramped not enough room to put. clothes, they were also in a poor state as was the whole hotel. .Not enough room around the pool only about 30 sunbeds so spent every day on the beach. Would I stay there again no not even if I was paid to, this is not an unfair review just giving an honest picture.

The hotel was decent enough to stay...but it doesn't go well with the pictures updated in their website...the food was really really nice...but the service was pathetic?.very small rooms, no cleanliness...shortage of towels...argumentative staff...it's no for me...though the ko aril is effect to stayin goa...

Very disappointed with this hotel not only is it dirty but it had RATS in the restaurant. Around the tables and on your balcony there were crows/rooks swooping down and pinching food at all mealtimes. Slabs of tile around the swimming pool and hotel grounds were uneven and dangerous (one man actually falling down and splitting his leg open from knee to ankle). Management were very poor, waiters were poor and staff around the hotel was not helpful in any way very dismissive of feedback and comments. Definitely would not return to this hotel. Only positive things would be the house keeping in the bedrooms as these were immaculate and the Thomas Cook rep.

The measure of a successful vacation is based on the feeling that one gets at the end of the trip - i.e., not wanting to return back to work / home. But in this case, we are so happy to return back home and we actually cutt short our vacation. In fact today was our return date, but we cut short our trip, as the entire experience was that of disbelief and dissappointment. Starting from a lie that the hotel is on the beach, dirty linen inside the room, smelly curtains, worn out toilets, partial treatment of staff towards Indians (very obedient to the foriegners though), horrible spa (no privacy, ill equipped, ill trained masseuse, immature behaivour) lack of spread in the buffet (I understand that this is subjective though). The best coffee we had was at the Anujan market and the best lunch we had was at Topnosh restaurant across the main road! The saving grace was two staff - Pratik and Surender, both at the restaurant, who were always smiling and helpful - I wish they get better jobs. And the best of all, on lodging complaints periodically and on check out - the senior staff were not all too apologetic. We were very happy when we finally landed back at our home in Bengaluru. Request people to suggest us any other good resort / hotel in Goa, so that we can shake off this experince, once and for all.

We have just spent 5 days in this hotel and must say that is one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. We were in a group of 13 people and everybody agreed on this point.

To start with, the management refused to honour an upgrade voucher to a single room for one of our group, alleging they had no instructions from the agency in India,(despite the fact that we had a paper voucher with the agency stamp on it) putting her instead in a double with two other people, in a folding bed for small children. So she ended up paying 14,500 Rupees extra to sleep on a camp bed.

The management in general was arrogant and unhelpful, including a head receptionist whose idea of customer service was barking at people and throwing her (considerable) weight around.

Paradoxically, most of the rest of the staff were very friendly including the waiters, although you could tell that most of the waiters were young and inexperienced, probably hired at a minimum wage to save money

As far as the hotel installations were concerned, they are way below what you would expect for the price you pay:

- A small, overcrowded swimming pool with the sun beds right at the edge for lack of space so you are constantly splashed by the kids playing in the pool.

- Run down, tacky rooms with rotting door frames, dirty buckets in the bathroom and threadbare towels (Im talking about the superior rooms we paid an extra 6,000 Rupees for, the normal rooms are even worse).

- No net curtains, so everyone can see into your room if its on the ground floor, meaning you can never have any natural daylight for lack of privacy.

- No hot water in the bathroom for one of the days.

- Dirty, greasy floors and surfaces in the bedroom, despite the daily cleaning service.

The services arent much better the evening entertainment seemed to be a competition to see which band could play worse and sing more out of tune. Also, they played so loud we actually put in a written complaint because it was impossible to have dinner outside, due to the volume.

We asked for a double bed repeatedly, and never got one. We had two single beds (we are a couple).

The list goes on but I think that generally gives an idea of the hotel. The most important thing was the total indifference of the management with reference to our complaints. You basically got the feeling that they didnt care. The managing director was particularly arrogant and unhelpful.

To sum up, this hotel is a rip off and neither I nor any of the other 12 in our group would dream of recommending it to anybody.

property is descent but House Keeping was not good.I asked for fresh towel in the room and was told it will be vaialable only after 8.30 am as their laundry comes during that time.I was surprised that hotel with over 100 rooms,doesnt have 1 extra towel.Infact my husband requested for 1 towel then the person from house keeping just banged down the phone.

We really had multiple reasons to say "Not Recommended" in this hotel. We had booked a deluxe room, on 3N4D +MAP basis. Before finalizing this hotel, I had gone through many reviews for most of the 3 Star hotels in Candolim. As the reviews and pictures were looking great I zeroed on this hotel. But overall experience was totally negative. 

First of all, Pickup. We informed hotel sales manager that we will be delayed by 12 hours reaching Goa since we missed our flights. and what we heard from him was that, "arrange your taxi" to reach hotel. We got there early morning at 6 A.M. For some reasons, they gave us Classical Room instead of Deluxe. But when we got into the room, the bed was not clean. It looked like the room was not cleaned for many days. Looking at the room, it was not even close to the way it looks in the pictures!!! I would say, good photography. Since the condition of Classical room was this, we were left imagining what would be the state of Deluxe and standard rooms??!!

Second thing, next day the hot water was "Muddy". after complaining what we got is only bucket of hot water from outside after around one hour. It took the whole day to get a clean hot water. 

Third thing, the electricity was fluctuating for about 15-20 mins. Fourth thing, when it rained whole room was flooded with water came from balcony coz of lack of proper drainage. Most of the time we spent in hotel, one or the other reason, there was somebody to fix something. 

House keeping staff would come at any time in the day and ring. All the hotel staff/Room service whenever they ring the bell are inpatient. After they ring the bell, they knock the door. all in a space 5-10 seconds.!!! horrible!!

In restaurant we always felt the place was crowded, not spacious enough to accomodate hotel stayers. The swimming pool area was even bad. This time I would say, its not coz of hotel but coz of people. Live entertainment was not that great too. Very average. Internet card was very costly. 

Finally, the location of hotel is really nasty. The beach is close enough, but you can't get into the water coz its unsafe and very dangerous. There is not even a medical store nearby. Whichever is there, is closed all the times. The men who roam around area are kind of scoundrels who always gets close whenever they couples. 

Overall, hotel was bad experience and with the kind of location and people around it even made it worser. Not recommended for honeymoon couple. May be better for family with kids as that was the case with most of families we saw in this hotel.

on arrival at hotel we found that hotel had over booked which meant we had to be put in a upgrade room with the promise of moving the next day but it took the hotel 4 days to move us and when they did they put us in a room which stunk and sewage was coming back through toilet again we had to move and then we had money stolen from our room of which my friends money was in a locked suitcase the thief had removed the padlock from the case and the lock was nowhere to be seen and i had hid my purse under all my clothes we understand the need to use safety deposit boxes but we always had our belongings with us and this particular day we had only left the room for approx half an hour to go and get a drink when we spoke to hotel staff about the theft they were not interested and accused us of misplacing our money we asked for local police to be informed the hotel refused claiming that local police would not be interested we also asked to see the manager of the hotel and staff told us he was ill and visiting the doctors it was not until another guest assisted us that they took us to see the manager who was sitting in his office and was not at the doctors when staff visited our room to look for money they said they would search the staff and they were laughing at us the hotel staff also searched all of our belongings to look for the money as they thought we had mis placed it. when we went to see the manager we explained that we would need a police report in order to claim for our money and he advised us to claim for 600 pound which is a lot more then we lost. at the end another guest contacted the police and they attended the hotel and we had to go along to the police station to get a crime report it was only then that the staff started to take us seriously. the hotel itself is looking very aged and the swimming pool is in desperate need of repair also the food choices were terrible with very little choice.

I would only recommend this hotel if you like a holiday akin to the series Benidorm (Eat, drink and smoke as much as you possibly can). 

Firstly the rooms are substandard - the garden based rooms being marginally better - sheets and towels are dirty and stained. The pillows are lumpy and best not looked at. 
The pool is too small but the beach is closeby. The tanker marooned on the beach is quite impressive and the food is good in the hotel although a better choice of fruit at breakfast would be advantageous. There are not enough tables or sunbeds at the hotel and this was out of season with few guests - well initially anyway.

The hotel thought it was a good idea to have 150 school children at the hotel wiith 4-5 per room whilst we were there. We were well impressed to be woken up at 5.00am to their screams and shouting for 5 days. Management were unable to control the noise. Also there were a number of business conferences held onsite. We found that generally the Indian guests at the hotel were rude and had apalling manners. Men spat in the pool and lacked basic behavioural standards.

A point that amused us was that chairs at the bar were reserved with towels for the day - this was not something we had seen before and it concisely summed up the place.

Limited facilities at hotel. Rooms very poor (2**) unless you are firm and insist on their newer better rooms (3**). No hot water while we were there. Meals very limited menus. Beach is polluted by the rusting shipwreck. Even the slightest breeze kicks up a frothy seaspray which covers you in smelly greasy oil even if you dont go into the filthy sea.

Stay away if you have a family.

Disliked  Location of hotel and poor quality of rooms

silly me locked all my belonings in my suitcase with combination lock instead of putting in safe at reception.240 stolen from wallet all doors locked police involved .loveley hotel but please be carefull with belongings on our first day a littlle girls psp stolen again only people in reception cleaning staff.

On arrival at the Whispering Palms we were greeted by friendly staff and our bags were taken to our room for us. 

The room was clean but terrible and I was particularly concerned about the apparent lack of security. Our balcony overlooked the pool and this meant that the waiters had a clear view into our room. The bathroom was basic but functional, however I had real concerns about the electrical socket in the shower. We could hear people on our balcony and outside the front door at night and this was very concerning.

On our first full day we went to the beach. We suffered continual hassle from men working on the beach and the experience was generally unpleasant. There is a huge tanker rotting away in the sea - this a complete eyesore. 

The food in the restaurant was extremely average but there was plenty of choice. Again, we received far too much attention from the men working in the restaurant and it was difficult to relax.

The evening entertainment was not necessarilly entertaining in the way that had been intended but it was good fun regardless.

The pool area is extremely small and cramped and is not really designed to cope with the number of guests staying in the hotel and the spa treatment areas are truly unpleasant.

Goa is a fascinating place that I would like to return to. However, next time it will be with my husband in South Goa and I will pay for a decent hotel.

Liked  Nothing
Disliked  Everything

We stayed in this Hotel for 3N/4D Package. Trouble started when we arrived at Goa Airport. No body came to pick us up although it was included in our package. We called the hotel they advised us to take a taxi and we are required to pay for the same. Hotel just refused to pay for taxi although it was included in the package blaming the travel agent. 

We have booked room with extra bed (paid extra) as I was traveling with 2 small kids and my wife. However room was not having enough space for extra bed and the bed was just dumped in the room. Room was far from the pool / reception and on the back side and we were told this is the only room available 

On the day of our departure although we have informed them about our flight details (after noon at 3.00 clock check out) Lady suppose to be manager called at 12.30 and asked us to vacate the room immediately as other guest has already arrived to whom they want to allocate the room. We were forced to vacate the room immediately with our kids in an insulting manner although we have paid for 4 Days well in advance.

Fortunately they dropped us at Airport, however the driver was driving car like a jet plane on small roads of Goa as he was suppose to pick up other guest and was getting late.

It was a Horrible experience for us to stay in this hotel.

Liked  Nothing
Disliked  Unfriendly Staff

Saved for ages to treat our daughter & grand daughter. Went all inclusive to save them any expenditure. Absolute waste of money.

Breakfast had little English choices and curry is not appealing in the morning. Every day , no cups (always chipped when they did finally arrive), 10 minute wait, then no teabags, 10 minute wait, no milk, total disaster, walk out & go to Ganesh beach shack for tea and breakfast. Food lunch and dinner was barely warm, repetitive & always covered in flies. Food area was not clean and service slow. The snack menu had a choice but only about 2 items were ever available. The 'a la carte' menu had several itmes which were not available. Many guests complained about stomach upsets and several guests joined together and complained to the manager. 

Few sunbeds and sparse room around pool for number of guests. The pool area was full of tables for people to eat which meant no room for sun bathing and no where nice to eat with out getting splashed from the pool. Bad set up all round.

Balcony could not be used as air conditioning unit flooded balcony. Management did place bucket under leak but room maid did not empty bucket which had overflowed by the time you returned from beach.

Never any clean glasses behind the pool bar. Long wait while staff frantically tried to locate glasses and wash them. Although all inclusive, the bar one early evening had no Vodka.

Staff were pleasant but it appeared that who ever owned the hotel was happy to take the profits and not invest any money back into hotel improvements.

Thank goodness for the Ganesh shack on the beach. Good food unlike the buffet food in the hotel did not upset stomachs. Ganesh, his sister and staff were so helpful, amusing the baby, organising taxis and trips, they compensated for our awful hotel choice. They were even willing to cook the meals of your choice so you could enjoy an evening meal on the beach. If you go to the beach this is the shack to go to for good service and value.

Several guests did state that they had stayed at Whispering Palms 4/5 years ago and could not believe how rapidly it had gone from good to dire. I would not recommend ths hotel to anyone unless they lower their prices to reflect 1* plus prices.

We stayed at this Hotel for Cristmas and new Year it was very dissapointing.The Deluxe room we were allocated was dark and dingy with stained bedspreads. Because of this we paid 20 a night extra to move into new block.
The Hotel facilities are not up to catering for the number of rooms,now over 100 not 66 as advertised. We had to take all-inclusive as there was no alternative but we didnt eat much as the buffet food was hardly warm. I think this prevented us getting ill as many of the guests were suffering from tummy problems.The general cleanliness in the restaurant and bar areas was poor dirty tables etc.So we ate elsewhere a lot of the time,the Ganesh Shack on the beach is very good.
We never used the sunbeds or pool as with 220 guests and 40 sunbeds there was no chance and whole area much too crowded. Except for two nights the evening entertainment was almost non-existant.
In all a very badly Managed Hotel where even the Waiters went on strike after New Year.
I would not return or recommend

2 am arrival in the morning did not help, room sad and not all that clean in need of update safety is not recognised at this hotel as we found out during our stay only 1 bar and restaurant open the whole of the stay but they did have a bbq 1 night a week by the pool, constant working going on for two weeks putting covers over the air conditioning units (screws and nails left lying around) a bit annoying,pool steps broken replaced on our last day had to move our sun bed getting showered with lumps of concrete debris fell into pool and not cleaned away.drinks that had been spilt were never washed away at night sticky in the morning
it was the time of the year when they trimmed the palms it was amazing watching the lad climb the palm tree but not when they just missed a guest with the coconuts dropping as i said safety is not recognised.
on our anniversary prommised surprise on arrival still waiting 
only 1 bar and resturant open the whole of the stay
gym not open
thats the bad bit over
they did have a bbq 1 night a week,
food was good and if you asked the chef he would cook anything you desired within reason as we found out 
the waiters were top class could not do enough for you RAKESH AND ZAVED stood out
entertainment needs improvement
in house tailor ravi (be happy) very good if you want it he can make it reccomend the silk shirts
stayed all inclusive
would possibly go back but not all inclusive and definatley not with hayes and jarvis
eating out very good went to the curry and grills restaurant just outside hotel a few times as we love our sea food had lobster out of this world cooked to perfection it looked too good to eat but we did and half the price of the hotel (book before you go) and please do not do what some people do and not turn up after booking

I booked this hotel and stayed from 8 feb to 11feb 2014. I booked this resort looking at the amazing reviews here but when I finally reached the hotel on 8th of Feb 2014 I was told that there is no room for me & they asked me to stay in a nearby hotel. Since I had booked this hotel on makemytrip.com I spoke to makemytrip.com and finally after a big argument with the resort guys I finally got my room but it was already late in the evening and my entire day was wasted. I was very dissatisfied with this resort. Had high hopes on this resort but not worth of going again. Hotel staff always give priority to foreign guests in my case too they had allotted my room to a foreigner only after I asked for a refund then they gave me a room. Will never return back to this place not worth of.

These were one of the rare vacations, where it was our bad luck to stay in this hotel. The hotel reeks of poor maintenance and care all around. The service was poor. Feedback is not taken in good spirit. The crowd was mostly rowdy group of drunk youngsters who gave a two hoot to peace of other guests and management allowed it. Family travellers please stay away. Still it could have been managed, if food had been good. Breakfast used to be ok, but dinner was unpalatable and undigestable with half cooked chicken, dishes having no salt. On pointing out the chef said "if salt has been left out by mistake, please put it from shaker on your table. Overall bad experience and no value for the money.

We stayed at Whispering for 3 nights /4 days and I have to say we were overall disappointed with the major contributions to our disappointment being :
1. This was the biggest - we were bitten by mosquitoes in this place every where and at all times of the day. The restaurant and the sitting areas around the pool had mosquitoes and other insects all through the day and ate us during breakfast, lunch evening and night hours. 
2. The staff ( besides the manager Subba who tried to help us as much as he can) was very negative and unfriendly and their first response always used to be 'no we can't/we don't ' . This I feel is a big dampner for guests at a place like this. 
3. The place had hot water only between 6-10 am and 6-10 pm. 
4. They had 1 wi-fi per room limit ( does that qualify fr wi-fi?) and that , by the way, barely really worked.
5. The pictures give an impression of a very cool and chic property where as it is a very ordinary property with ordinary rooms , baths being small and ordinary.
6. The good thing is they had some entertainment in the evening and some pool table etc. although it was disappointing that the pool was charged at Rs 150/frame. 

On the good side, the staff at restaurant was helpful and tried their best to help the guests. Jawed was our server most times and he was very sweet. The breakfast spread was great and we enjoyed it every morning. 

Overall, u can choose to stay here but then it being Goa, there are many better places available at this rate is my verdict !

I visited this hotel quiet a while ago back in November 2012 the hotel was going through a renovation just before we went and a friend who I traveled with asked the manager himself if this was still happening as we were worried it would affect out stay as some reviews on here complained about the pool being closed ect. Anyway the manager ensured my friend that the renovation was over and would be by the time we went which was a lie!! When we got there and settled in our room (which we weren't happy with explain later) there was renovation going on outside out room!! It was a terrible view of building and was so unattractive to look at!! Anyway the reason we wasn't happy with our room was because it only had two beds and there was three of us staying!! The room was tiny so they moved us to a bigger room which yet again only had two beds, they told us not to worry and would bring us a bed up, when they did it was basically a scrawny piece of wood and a extremely slim could hardly pass for a mattress. The third person was unhappy with this and would of rather slept on the sofa thing because it was so uncomfortable so we had the extra bed removed. Which is really not the point because for the amount we payed for to stay at this hotel we would expect a room full of three beds, three comfortable bed DECENT BEDS but no we didn't want to complain too much because the staff dosnt seem to understand. Every morning there just didn't seem to be enough sun beds we would have to count on other people to save some for us before they ran out. The pool bar wasn't available when we stayed which it was advertised on the websites. They say on the websites that they have an animation team which they didn't, no activities went on during the day time it was boring!! There was a few entertainment in the night which weren't great. Most of the time it was a "one man band" which couldn't even sing properly and to be honest was rubbish. The food was terrible we ended up going out every night to the cheap resturaunts around the hotel because the food was that bad, they didn't have a range of foods I know it's in India but it was all Indian food nothing else. And just as we were leaving they opened another resturaunt which was chargeable!! In a all inclusive hotel!! We never went because we knew we would of been extremely disappointed as was the stay at the hotel. To sum up unless there has been any changes the hotel was boring although beautiful they didn't know how to entertain their guests in the day time there wasn't much to do apart from sit in the sun or swim in the pool, there was a pool table which is okay but that's it. No other falicities were available at our stay and it just felt like a big waste of money to us. I wouldn't suggest this hotel unless it has changed which I highly doubt that. There was a lot of promises on the websites and none of them were made.

Ignore this at your peril, the evening meal was very poor most of the guests were ill, a lot of Brits stopped going in the restaurant in the evening, and having snacks at 1700hrs, burger n chips or something like that, all the bottles of beer Igot were out of date , I paid a lot of money to go here what a let downi will not return here

firstly let me say that the hotel has been refurbed and to a very good standard, the rooms were clean and had all the facilities we required....HOWEVER our holiday soon became a bit of a nightmare due to being ill...... Now we have been to Goa before so everyone expects ' Delhi Belly' but what we experienced here was much worse. On our first evening there we went into the main restaurant area myself and my husband had a small portion of curry each and my Step son chose not to eat because there was nothing he liked the look of. So the next morning we went to the pool area and several people asked us if we had been ill yet and went on to describe how virtually all the complex had been ill and the doctors had been in giving people injections, people were loosing 3 and 4 days of their holiday and also being hospitalised, however we felt we would be ok as we are fit and healthy and not usually to badly affected.....Oh how wrong we were we spent the next 48 hours in bed being sick and upset stomach ( but our step son was fine) . In the brochure in the room it said reception had a range of medication so eventually my husband phoned for some help as we could not get to the chemist..he was told abruptly 'no we can't help'...So that was our one and only meal and drink at Whispering Palms, the general feel around the hotel was that the kitchens should be closed and completely cleaned down but that was never going to happen..
When we finally surfaced 2 days later we spoke to a lady who was customer services along with several other people and she tried to tell us we had FLU...I can assure you that was not flu.

It took me 7 days of my holiday before I felt well again and able to go anywhere without worrying about the toilet locations.

Other areas that need clarifying with this hotel is what is included in the 'All Inclusive' we asked on our first day about the A La Carte restaurant and were told we didn't get it, then perhaps we would get it but would have to pay 25 or 50% of the cost but they would get back to us needless to say they didn't...Also on the second to last night of our holiday we were sat with a couple who had travelled on exactly the same package as us when the waiter bought her husband an Irish Coffee, my husband said could he have one and was told we would have to pay???? we asked to see the manager to clarify this and he was not on site but I spoke to him myself and he agreed to meet us the next day at 11AM... we waited in reception but he did not keep to the meeting we asked the staff who made some calls and the only person who came to talk to us was the asst kitchen/restaurant manager, who's English was limited and all he kept saying is you can order burgers....so he obviously did not understand our issues.

This hotel is not cheap to go to and if like us you have to eat out everyday it becomes quite a costly holiday luckily we had taken money with us..

Would I book this hotel again I'm afraid not, just to say if you look at my previous reviews I am not a serial complainer so for me to do this review is unusually.

Stayed Whispering Palms 8th to 23rd nov Checked the brochures saw the professional photos and read the reviews i think i went to the wrong hotel.Got are modern medium sized room with its tiny wardrobe.Had breakfast and went to check out the facilities. No whirlpool now tiled over.looked for the pool bar now a mini garden .Looked for the garden full of sunbeds now a two storie building in it was a bar but not open while i was there.There is now a full length walkway along the side of the pool that had numerous sunbeds before.We went to get our sunbeds there were 10 due to numerous complaints it was increased to over 30.Iwent to find the spa none there.I looked for the a la carte it wasn,t built.I looked for thesports bar not there.I think we went at the wrong time it was the indian christmas for two or three nights nowhere to sit or eat the hotel was full.The food was very bland 90 per cent curry but it is india we mostly ate out.A waste going A/I cheap to eat out.Some of the staff were great a lot like new starters.When leaving we asked to pay for a room extension not possible hotel full use the one toilet we were told due to many people complaining they gave us one.On are last day new sunbeds arrived pluss a load of tables and chairs and guess what the a-la-carte was finished.It can only get better.I was told one of the top men had left with a lot of his staff but maybe coming back not like me.Met some great people love to Hilary and Tony and the mad snipper Paul and Hilary.

i had been in whispering palms resort from 14th to 17th nov, 2012 on map packege. The first impression was extremely bad...i had booked the packege of studio suit the highest catagory...after airport pickup , we reached the resort at 3 pm...they kept me waiting till 330 and then gave the terrace room...that was lower catagory...i opposed and shouted and then manager mr kedar came and game the studio suit....however, his behavior was not so good...but, later he realized and apologized.....room condition was not that good...the stuio suit was around 33 sq m in size, but there was 1.5 tonne window ac...the old and very bad working ac....i was exhausted....
food was ok......pool was smaller.....what else i can say....my room no was 421. however, some hotel rooms were refurbished...but, mine was not....i had booked 130 days in advabce...still older rooms were given...this was the height of cheating....

Had planned a stay in the hotel for a week starting 1st of October. We visit Goa almost every year and are quite familiar with the places, Candolim being our favorite destination for food and stay. We picked this hotel for the location and after reading some decent looking reviews. We made the bookings over the phone and spoke to the sales lady about the facilities. Since we knew that during the off season specially the month of August and September a lot of hotels get renovated, I asked her specifically many times if the pool and other facilities would be available. She told me beside the Jacuzzi all the facilities were available. I made the bookings with the booking amount wire transferred. We reached the hotel around 9.30 in the morning, we knew we were early but were willing to wait till the check in time. Upon arrival we could see people coming out of the hotel in their swim wear and headed out of the hotel gate. We just wondered what was happening. Upon arrival we saw that the reception had been set up in a small room and hotel was under big time renovation. We asked them again if all the facilities were available and they told us that they have arranged for a swimming pool in a near by hotel. We took a chance to see where that other pool was and we were taken there in a car. Just imagine the hotel expects you to change into your swim wear, get to the road, hop on into a car and go to a nearby hotel for a swim. We didn't waste much time to ask for a refund of our money cause the holiday mood was already spoilt. We could see the hotel under big time renovation with one side of the hotel broken down and rebuilt, we could imagine the kind of stay and food they would have offered. Upon insisting and after making several call we managed to get the refund for booking amount.
Since we knew Goa and specially Candolim we managed to find another Hotel. But I pity someone who is new to Goa and had to go through such an experience. Just want to caution other travelers to be ready in such situations where the hotel cheats you and expects you to do with one start facilities after selling a four star price. We are not going to choose this place doesn't matter what time of the year we travel. 

PS : Goa is a wonderful place and we have been to some great hotel with great staff. Wish other travelers a great experience too.

I saw the pictures and the reviews and thought this would be best of hotel I can get but when I went my dreams were broken. 
The property is not big at all.its a small place with a tiny un plasenent lobby area.dirty and messy.
Rooms are good size and clean. That's the only positive point.
Swimming pool is like a dirty pond of a village. I have seen both men and women in full cloths in the pool.ladies in suits and men's with shorts and t shirt.never ever I have seen this.if you use the pool you will fall sick so we dint for our stay.
I told the staff but they were not interested. They even suggested to jump in the pool with cloths.shocking.
Food is average and nothing special. They are far from to beach which is also not great.
Overall they spoiled our holiday and I suggest this hotel not worth the money it charge.

Experience was not that great, though food taste/quality was decent. Rooms were pretty untidy and it didn't give the comfort feeling at all. View is not good,it wasn't at least from my room - 107.

In spite of mentioning the flight time, no airport drop was arranged. When we tried confronting, there was a lot of argument.
