Worst, they provide a room service, however, if the food falls on the bedsheet, they charge for it. Well, in that case a table should be provided or else the room service should be withdrawn.

We booked this resort after seeing its pictures on various sites, but it was a big disappointment.

While the property is good and very well located but the kind of people / staying there practically made it a non-family location. We did raised this issue thereand wanted to check out but nothing happened. The food was average, pool was unusable due to the kind of people checked in.

The only good part was the front office, which did a good job. But overall it was a disappointment to us.

location was excellent, however the review is average. there is lots of potential to make this better. we have used this as back up stay for othur goa visit. the service ask okay and enjoyed stay nothing to report about

stayed here January 2015 there is no whirlpool just a few pathetic jets at one end of pool no patisserie shortage of sunbeds the" regulars" get up at 7am to put towels on chairs. The food was average. Rooms very clean .Staff were helpful . Near beach with lots of good shacks and shops .Good standard for Goa

Good location, walking distance from the nice Sinquerim beach.

The 1 room suite to which we were upgraded to was quite unimpressive and stuffy. Hot water in bathroom had to be looked into late at night.

Service too was a let down. Delayed and clueless taxi pickup from airport, incorrect room service after everything was over resulting in no correction despite being told of ill-health of one guest was the last straw.

No value for money. We exited early and changed our hotel.

Good points.... 
1.excellent location very close to shops and beach 
2. Lovely spacious rooms 

Bad points.... 

1. Very very bad wifi almost non existent, left me stuck a couple of times when needed. They tell everyone there is a network problem that will be fixed in the morning. Rubbish 
2. Booked twin room got a double, had to wait until next day for a twin to be available and during that night housekeeping were in corridor working outside the room all night. 
3. New room toilet flush kept breaking, took 3 call outs to solve. 
4. If you are not out of bed with a towel on a sunbed by 7am forget it, good ones gone even earlier. 
5. No where near enough food variation, it was curry for breakfast lunch and dinner so if you prefer English food you are screwed. To be fair the manager did say I could request anything I want if there was nothing I liked but this was only after several nights of going hungry then having to complain. This should have been made more clear. 
6. Broke a wheel on my case dragging it down side street to hotel, staff with trollies not expecting tips would be a huge help. 
7.flies everywhere!! (This is everywhere in India so don't want to be unfair to the hotel, but literally could not eat a single meal or drink a drink without a fly having landed on it the second it was served)
8. Evening entertainment APPALLING! Most nights were the cheap option of karaoke and others were just locals who couldn't sing for toffee wailing into a microphone and then asking if anyone wants to buy a CD. Something tells me the hotel don't even pay for this. It was also directly outside our room and went on until 11pm. 
9.we went to Delhi for a 2 night stay and upon telling the hotel they asked for a 'favour' could we give up our room whilst gone because they were short on rooms. How?? And why should we pack our entire room up when we had already paid for them two nights regardless of wether we were there or not. 
10. We checked out at 12noon and pick up for not until 9.30pm, there was no safety room all cases were just laid in the lobby, not safe! 

Staff are very average at this hotel, I have read reviews saying 5* service, I am not sure where these people have previously stayed but they have clearly never experienced actual 5* service if they think this is it. Staff stood back and watched me struggle to cart my case down loads of steps, we regularly sat at breakfast waiting to be asked if we want tea or coffee for a long time! The one member of staff I would like to commend is a young lad shantanu behind reception very helpful and friendly. 

All in all I loved goa and would return but not to this hotel which is such a pity as it is lovely in other aspects but for me service is everything.

Myself and a friend stayed here for 10 days and from the moment we arrived until the moment we left it was terrible. They put us in a double room not a twin and wouldn't move us until the morning. There were dirty cups with tea in them outside the room and staff were up and down the stairs and in and out of the cupboard next to the room so we barely slept. After moving us the next day the room seemed fine. It was spacious and very clean (very good housekeeping). The toilet however broke three times, twice during the night so they couldn't fix it so we were left with loud trickling water and no flush. The wifi was terrible throughout the whole of our stay. They always said it would be fixed in the morning but it never was. Other guests complained about this too. There isn't much food choice and most of it was indian which became very harsh on the stomach towards the end of the holiday and made me quite ill. What they don't tell you is there is a snack menu where you can order other food. If we had have known this then maybe things would have been better but they do not make it known that it is available. My friend was unable to eat most of the food and got upset as she was hungry and was eating the same thing every day. I am not a fussy person with food at all but even I thought the choice was poor. The milk was also off a lot leaving floaters in our tea so we couldn't drink it. We went to Delhi for two nights and left the key at reception only to be asked a 'favour' to have our room while we were gone as they were short. I found this very unprofessional considering we had paid for the room and they shouldn't be over booking. When we tried to exchange money at reception I was short by 30 rupees and my friend by 300 so please watch out for this and count before you leave reception. We both found the staff quite rude, never smiling and we didn't get one apology when we brought up any problems. At one point there were four members of staff including the manager at reception and not one of them attempted to help us when we were stood waiting patiently. One of the waiters also asked us at night if we wanted to go to the beach which absolutely should not have happened! Our lift to the airport after checkout was at 9:30pm so we checked out only to be told there was no storage room and suitcases were just left in the reception area so we worried all day. We had to shower in the spa which was smelly and dirty. We did use the spa previously for treatments and it seemed fine then but the treatments were no where near as described and they also told us on booking that we would get 20% off but then told us on paying that this was only for a full body massage. Everything is to get money from you. Guests do not come first, their money does. This is fine as it is a business however an honest and higher standard of service would mean we would have considered returning however they have now lost our custom as we will not be returning to this hotel. The beach is a two minute walk...probably one of the only positives.

This resort is not what I would call a resort. Firstly when we arrived at 6pm, we were informed that our room would not be ready till 8:30pm as guest that was checking out was still in the room. Found that weird considering checkout it 12pm but I did figure out why this was the case, You can ask for a late checkout, but after 3pm they charge you for a full day. So they, say yes to the guest, that they can stay in the room, charge them full day rate and then make the checking in guest wait. That way they get double the money for that room for that day, not caring about the person checking in at all. This was very frustrating but not much that we could do. Wifi internet was included but you could only be connected to one device. To get you access code, reception could not help you as they needed to get their manager and he was not at work at the time I called. Had to wait till he returned to work before I was able to get an access code and even then the internet was extremely slow and unreliable as it kept dropping out. This so called resort is not for young people. The crowd at this resort was an older crowd and lots of families with kids. On the first day in our room, the air-conditioning stopped working and had to move room. TV in our first room was old and damaged. It had permanent lines running through the screen. We paid for a Suite Room (their best room) but the bathroom was old and not very nice and needed a major upgrade. We saw the basic room, which looked better than the suite rooms, which makes no sence and requested to move to the basic room. Once we moved to the basic room, we were happier as it was better than the suite. The power at the resort in general kept cutting out. We would be watching tv and then the power would cut out, everything would go off for a few seconds and then it would start again. This happened a lot and was extremely frustrating. The resort would do housekeeping at 12:30am (yes, in the middle of the night), making loud noises, waking guests up. When I asked them to keep the noise down as we were trying to sleep, they didn't care and it just seemed to get worse. Who in their right mind cleans resort rooms and passage ways in the moddle of the night? The only positive thing I can say about this resort is that we took on the all-inclusive package (Full Board). Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner and Snacks throughout the day were all pretty good with only the occassional hit and miss.

I know this is a little late to review, but I had to. This was a family get together with around 30 of us in the month of October 2014 that we visited Whispering Palms. We had around 15 rooms booked and I thought, considering the number of people we were, we would be given rooms which would not only make our vacation of 2 nights and 3 days enjoyable but would also give Whispering Palms a good chance to spread the word and publicize about it.

We had rooms in the main building where the reception area was. The rooms were clean and well kept, but after a day when we saw the rooms which were near the Aahata restaurant, the rooms not only faces a beautiful landscape but were also quiet and nicer, which completely disappointed me. Every night, there used to be some check-in and since my room was located above the reception area, it used to get very noisy and irritable. The second day had no hot water coming in my and my other family members' bathrooms. The worst part was there was a small sitting area with one sofa and 2 chairs near the reception which most of the guests in the hotel used to fight for. Considering the number of rooms they had in the hotel, they should have atleast made some decent arrangement for people who check-in and hang out, when not in their rooms. With food, you are lucky if you are going for a buffet, but not otherwise. On the day we left our flight was at 3pm so we thought we would have lunch and go and it took the waiter almost an hour to get our order. And all that we ordered was rice and fish curry.

The best part about the hotel was the walk to the market, beach and pool, which the kids and others enjoyed.

I don't think I would recommend and go again to Whispering Palms, highly disappoi

the food is cold or warm,especially the chicken.me and the hubby were ill.most couples we spoke to were also ill after eating chicken at mealtimes.there isn't much of a choice at meal times.we were too scared to eat much at mealtimes.the rooms aren't anything special.beds rock hard.pillars are like bricks.very uncomfortable.be very careful when entering the swimming pool.the steps that take you in are very unstable.this Hotel is more like a 2 ** hotel.when you spend so much money to go here.your not really getting much for your money.standards are very poor.be Aware before booking this hotel.would never go back.

the food is cold or warm,especially the chicken.me and the hubby were ill.most couples we spoke to were also ill after eating chicken at mealtimes.there isn't much of a choice at meal times.we were too scared to eat much at mealtimes.the rooms aren't anything special.beds rock hard.pillars are like bricks.very uncomfortable.be very careful when entering the swimming pool.the steps that take you in are very unstable.this Hotel is more like a 2 ** hotel.when you spend so much money to go here.your not really getting much for your money.standards are very poor.be Aware before booking this hotel.would never go back.

We have just returned after 2 weeks yesterday. The hotel is far from the perfect place described when I booked, it is very tired and needs a complete refurb / freshening up.
The rooms were passable but grubby and tired IE grime in corners of the bathroom walls and floor in the tiling joints etc, just seemed like a quick wipe cleaning was carried out. The food was passable but not great. The staff were very pleasant though.
Rated as 4* but more like a decent 2*. Would not go back, right on the beach though.
I suppose it is India though.

Very congested resort, lacks basic policy enforcement for guests at swimming pool on dressing sense, regret going there with my family. Also thrrr was kids recreation centre and no one told us before we accidentally discovered it on my last day. We had a flat tyre at the hotel and the staff there was least interested in our plight when we asked them the nearest repair place, no one seems interested at helping us

Located in a corner, good staffs, but ambiance is worse ,pool is nasty, better to be a holiday home no points to be said a 4star rating, food is average but costlier, but yes room service is much better in compare to 5star properties, so stupid reception people ,need to learn how to behave in hotel industry , even when I ask for a cup of tea at 10.55 they denied thinking that I am asking for complimentary .... thanks to one guest relation lady who could bring the same for me , but yes as I said earlier I had been to so many hotels but the kind of room service they give is amazing , but staying at this place you can't get a four-wheeler to drive self , NO PARKING PLACE, hotel is a average kind , you can better go for nearby hotels with much less price , check in takes a lot of time by the way..... property needs for a complete renovation

Hotel location is good only 200 mtr from beach , the food is average, and house keeping staff is too good , the service is too quick, hotels policy and rules are not clear , the hotel has different rules for Indian and foreigners , If u r Indian u follow many rules and if u foreigner u have no rules. Like we are willing hire a private number car for see sighting for goa because taxi numbers vichle is not available and hotel management refused to give a parking in hotel and we saw foreigners also hire private number Mahindra Thar they will get the parking in hotel we do lots of discussion about this with management but they don't get give the permission of parking, I think if are Indian please skip this hotel, this hotel only service to foreigners only. They also open pub for foreigners at mid late night. But if u r Indian they giving only a book of hotel rules and regulations. They don't give a any kind of service or hospitality.

have heard a great name of the hotel , actually refered by friend from jaipur . Things were spread out but no personallied service and most of the occassion staff were found having no for any question asked or they say...check with so and so person , i do not know thing or can not do this .
were limited food choice but next day it was ok as far as north indian food is concerned . Hotel should not be catering to local only , should be equally be caring to all the guest. would not refer to my family and friends

If you have booked all inclusive, & not spending cash expect poor service. The rooms above the reception area are very noisy . Took 3 days to change rooms, Reception staff say Yes to everything then do nothing, Nice hotel but overpriced !

We ended up at this hotel having booked very last minute due to our original trip arranged to Egypt having been cancelled 

Our room was fine , clean, good shower and air con and these were our main priorities

House keeping wasn't great and on one day - room wasnt cleaned

We didn't use the rest of the hotel very much at all - although we were all inclusive - the hotel really wasnt somewhere we wanted to spend time.

There were a lot of children round the pool which put us off 

So instead went to the beach every day which is 5 min walk. Similarly we went out to eat every evening 
We did have breakfast in the hotel on two mornings and it was adequate as were the all inclusive drinks . Goa is so cheap and lots of choice so you really don't need all inclusive 

There seemed to be plenty of choice at meal times but only from one Buffet - dirty floors and food everywhere splashed around the hot plates - most off putting

Entertainment in the evenings (we only saw on our way in or out) was cheesy and not my thing at all

The staff were all polite, helpful and keen to assist although the cleaning staff were clearly trying to get a tip out of us on the last day and kept coming back to the room and hassling us

I had a watch go missing from the room during the stay and when reported to staff they were totally dismissive - not good at all !

They also insisted on us paying 30 to keep the room from midday (normal check out) to 8pm - a liberty given that we hardly had anything from the hotel over the week. The air conditioning also broke on the last day and wasnt repaired.

Goa was a complete delight and the people were lovely - outside of the hotel - would not return to the hotel

Hotel was ok. Enjoyed the Breakfast. Housekeeping staff were fantastic. Room service food was amazing too.
But Music is too loud. One of the nights there were only 5 people dancing, I don't understand the necessity of the music to be that loud for such small crowd. It wasn't even pleasant music.
Forget about Hotel Wi-fi. they said they're upgrading the service, but said we're able to access slow internet. Rang the reception like 7 times and we were given 5 different passwords, none of them worked. Got sick of them calling them and just had to stick with out mobile phones.
On the day we were checking out, it took 45 mins to complete the checkout process. Their EFTPOS (credit card reader) machine isn't working. we had to go out to 4 different ATM's to withdraw the cash. Even though this is not entirely Hotels fault, i would've expected a simply apology, but got nothing. 
Rs 120 for playing pool ? It's ridiculous. we paid nearly 90k during our stay at the hotel but seriously charging 120Rs for pool is bad.
Walk way to our room stunk like sewage.

I went to Palm beach resort acting on advice of online reviews and friends. But, I am disappointed to say that it does not offer the facilities it boasts. Though the property is quiet decent & located at stone throw distance (literally) from Condolim beam, still it lacks some basic features like poor service level, be it peak breakfast hours, or late lazy afternoons.

Also had encounter with some other nuisance guest, who were totally drunk and were creating trouble both for hotel staff as well as other guests sitting by the pool. In fact hotel staff had to ask 3 - 4 other couples to leave that area to avoid any embarrasing situation to arrive. We were just two girls with few otherfriends, and it was not a pleasant experience.

I think a positive response from the hotel staff would had been to make those people leave the hotel there and than in the middle of the night to create reassurance to other guest that hotel is fully committed to their safety and comfort.

Overall not very happy with the hotel, would not recommend to my other couple friends or gals travelling alone.

Hotel was in a poor state needing to be done up,ie tiles on floor all cracked,only 1 communial toilet ,1 swimming pool .bathrooms floor flooded,and there had been people that had slipped.
The al a'cart was 1 set menue ,and was boring after a while.Eating out was very cheep,so we ate out alot.The beach was not far but your not all inclusive there you pay for your drinks and food,The sea was very dangerus to swimm in big waves and strong current ,so not much swimming in the sea just paddle,which disapointed me.The serving staff waiters very good and worked hard friendly.We injoyed our trips jungle book and castaway,but the jurney to them in the buses was so uncomfortable.

Just come back from this hotel having spent christmas and new year their.
We were very disappointed on arrival, and disgusted with the room, which was so small, and the balcony had a big air/con unit, which made it impossible to go onto the balcony..
The facilities decribed were not available in the room, no mini bar, no air dryer, no electrical adapter, all of which are listed as being in all rooms.

We were moved to another room the next day, which was larger, with a better bathroom, but nothing like the pictures on the internet. We became aware, that others customers were being moved following complaints, and the lucky ones got the luxury rooms.One of the other guests showed us their room, which was much nicer than ours, but they told me they had paid extra for the room when they arrived.

Some of the staff were very helpful, others wanted to be tipped before providing a good service.

The breakfast and snacks were good, but we found the evening food to be poor and we ate out most nights.

The swimming pool was in need of a makeover and a good clean.

Not an hotel i would recommend or return to.

If you are expecting a 4 star hotel you will be sadly disappointed as we were. This is at most a low end 3 star. Inadequate supply of towels, electricity, and hot water. Yes it's a great location and luckily we spent most of our time outdoors. The pictures they provide must have been when it initially opened or they were enhanced. Electricity is turned off when not occupied which causes a musky smell.

Returned for second year ,visit goa every Easter andvthis time v poor superficial service .management false and disinterested ,found Indian men holiday blatantly looking in my room with view to hiring it when we were to depart. How rude and intrusive .shows blatant disregard?! Renovation works ongoing to our surprise / noisy.food poor this time . Shame

I really not enjoyed resort and that too sure its not 4 start. I would say as per my experience it should be by all means more than 2*. Hotel staff needs to be educated. Room service is too poor and you ask for anything delay is expected. Key issues i faced.
1. A/C : not effective and event burnt during night time
2. Food : not available on day1.
3. Room service : too slow and even forget the order. strange
4. Reception - no ideas of how to say yes and no for anything.
5. Rooms were not ready to check in and no room freshners they use by default.

our 9th visit to goa. This is the worst hotel we have stayed in for food quality. meals are served buffet style, and if you like to eat later in the evening, its mush. rooms were ok, be aware not all rooms have a balcony. Location great, just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of calangute. Would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, there are far better ones in the same area.

Having had a few holidays in Goa in the past it was great to return! The whispering Palms is a very good all inclusive resort. The food, drinks, service and entertainment were all excellent. If I had a complaint at all it would be our reluctance to leave the resort and explore Candolim. Rooms are basic but clean and comfortable with noisy but efficient air-con. The location is great only a couple of minutes from the beach and town centre. If you wish to purchase Daily English newspapers, Magazines, books - travel books in particular there is a fab little shop opposite Highland Resort and next to the elephant shop - Hira Shopping Mart, Ramish Govecar the proprietor is an true local and a gentleman, his brother Raj gave us a great day out on one of his tours at a fraction of the cost of some of the hotel prices - he is a quiet and unassuming fellow who allowed us to enjoy freedom on our own without interferance but was always on hand for assistance. The Whispering Palms is a lovely friendly hotel which made us feel very welcome and we would return tomorrow if it wasn't for the desire to try somewhere different each time
food qulaity is Okay not that great mostly people are there with the pacakages which are not that attractive

This hotel is nothing as shown in the photos on the website. The photos make the hotel out to be a lot larger than it really is. The entrance to the hotel is half way down a narrow lane to the beach. Behind metal gates and a high wall.
The room was one of the classic rooms which was nice and also the gardens round the room was kept to a high standard and were very pleasant. The laundry in the room was a bit, hit and a miss. Also told the room was to far from the boiler for hot water. This was put right, sort off; the water was only hot from 8.30- 9.00am and 6.30 - 7.00pm. 
The reception area, dining room, pool area and bar were very small. There was only one toilet and one urinal plus basin in the mens toilet to service all these areas. This is a hotel with 106 rooms, approx. 230 persons when full, as what it was when we were there. 
The pool area did not have enough sun beds and the pool was oily and needed repair.
From the fourth day we didn't use the restaurant other than for breakfast because the food was mostly cold, very poor service and no tablecloths on the tables, except for plastic place mats.
The service at the bar was slow due to bar staff having to duplicate your order onto order pad, which you had to sign for. Also when you ordered from a waiter the order was nearly always wrong. 
The evening entertainment was Third-rate and on a weekly rotation.
The management was also looking for guest to go to South Goa at weekends so they could let out your room to business guests from Mumbai.
No hotel towels are allowed on the beach so you need to take your own towels and the beach is about 4mins walk from the hotel. The beach is sandy but could be cleaner. It also has a cargo ship beached on the beach, which has been there for 10 years.
Plus points for the hotel is that its very central for all amenities, buses and taxis. There is some excellent restaurant around the hotel. At very reasonable prices and catering for all tastes, with all selling excellent seafood.
Also had my teeth and eyes tested at prices much cheaper than the U.K?

Liked  GARDENS
Disliked  POOL AND AREA AROUND THE POOL

Horrible is the word for their breakfast. i have not had worse breakfast anywhere else. Though the rooms are ok for the price and bathroom clean..still nothing extraordinary about the resort..there are many other options in Goa that you can have for this price..

Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is 5 minutes walk away from the Candolim beach and is surrounded by several good cafes. The rooms are well maintained and spacious. Breakfast spread was good and the service was quick. The staff was courteous and helpful. 
Overall, we had an exceptional experience.

Lovely hotel, restaurant staff very attentive, delicious food.
Our room was above the reception area which was very noisy so we asked to be moved which took 2 days to sort out. Our room was spacious & clean. WiFi was a bit 'hit & miss'.
Entertainment in the hotel very good.

Pool area very nice & clean towels available all day by the pool.

Hotel just a 5 minute walk to the beautiful beach.

This is a lovely hotel. The best aspect is the friendliness of the staff. They really try and find things they can do for you, nothing is too much trouble. Don't worry about calling the housekeeping service if you need anything for the room. I had my laundry done twice, and was impressed by the professional service (everything came back wrapped in tissue paper, felt very special). The bed was comfy and the shower powerful. If I am being picky, would say there is a shortage of drawers for the clothes of two people, but when I mentioned this, housekeeping brought us extra hangers. 

We had room 206 by the pool. The view from our balcony wasn't great, there is a new hotel due to be built and the land is fenced of. But it didn't really matter that much.

There is a library, which one of the managers brought me to, as it isn't that easy to find. There is a gym, but unfortunately, the equipment is very out of date and a bit risky health and safety wise.

Meals are great. Not sure what you would do if you don't like curry, but there are alternatives such as fish pie, and stews for those with a dislike for spice.

There is a very short walk to the beach. There are ladies on route who try and tempt you into their shops, but this is part of the fun. We were sold a few dodgy goods, which at home were found to be broken and trousers which leak dye. However, this is a poor country and we didn't mind forking out a few pounds for reminders of our holiday. We had some good banter with the shop keepers!

Should mention that we met many guests who have been going back to Whispering Palms every year for many holidays, that says a lot about the hotel. 

I hated leaving and wished we could have stayed for two weeks rather than ten days. Th

We went on two trips with a local tour guide, Rafi, who loves Goa so much it is infectious. Talking of health matters, we didn't have any stomach upsets at all. I had four mosquito bites in 10 days, so as long as you have spray, seems to be fine as the hotel take precautions to ensure mosquitoes are zapped.

I don't think I have said enough to describe how lovely it is. There are many rooms and some are in gardens, so try and find out what room you will be in before you go. After an 9 hour flight you wouldn't want to argue about accommodation. In short, this hotel suited us and the people we are We felt we were in India, rather than in a 5 star luxury palace. Well done to the managers and staff .

We had a fantastic short holiday in Whispering Palms, can't wait to go back again. Hotel staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The food was great throughout with a lot of variety. The evening entertainment including the Goan cultural evening was very enjoyable. Thank you all the staff, especially Vinda that made our holiday so special. Our room was very clean...

Its a nice place to stay, very near to beach (not rushy beach), food is good but prepared taking international tourists in mind, a bit less on Indian taste, nice swimming pool, tatva spa is also very good and lastly its location is fantastic............ I suggest to have a stay over there.

garden can be more tidy and illuminated at night.mattresses are too loose.must be little hard as they are not comfortable.vegetarian menu for breakfast must have more varieties.Pickup drop from airport should be included in the package.

WPH has always been safe, clean, good food with excellent around staff and managers.
Although the property could do with investment around the pool area the hotel gives you a great base if you want to use the all inc to a maximum or do as we do come and go as we please as their are lots of things to see and do in the area. If you ever have any problems the staff at the reception will do their best to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Even with the ongoing currency issues we struggled for one day but the restaurants and shacks will in most cases take Stirling or let you run a tab. Go to the Whispering Palms and give it a go. We did once and that was 13 times ago. Some of the music entertainment requires updating in my opinion, same songs for a long time.

Everything was great, including the service, just a thing missing was the view from room... But the location is great, three minute walk to peaceful and clean sinquerim beach, and three minute walk to the main candolim street full of great cafes restaurants and shops

Stayed here for a week in mid November. Good location and facilities. Staff friendly and helpful. Beach close by but only spent one afternoon there as the sea was a bit murky and some of the beach huts weren't open for business. There is lots to do in Candolim, great bars and restaurants and very inexpensive. We hired a motorbike for 3 days and visited Baga, Anjuna, dolphin point and Panjim. The traffic is something else but if you keep your wits about you, your eyes wide open and don't go too fast it's safe enough! We had a problem with money as the 100 and 500 rupee notes had just been taken out of circulation and it was difficult to spend the 2000 rupee notes as no one wanted to give change. We got shafted in Anjuna, given change of 3x 500rp and had to go to a bank to change them which was tedious. 
Hotel - very pleasant, spacious ground floor room with a terrace in the beautiful gardens. Food - varied and staff will cook anything for you if you don't like the buffet. Lots of curry (it's India!!) Food could have been hotter. 
Pleasant swimming pool but insufficient sun beds made worse that people were getting up and putting towels on beds before 6am (we're on holiday for goodness sakes!) Staff did seem to be able to conjure up more sun beds when asked.
Entertainment- nothing out of the ordinary but ok.
We had a very late flight home and the hotel let us keep our room until 2pm and then use the spa facilities for showering etc so we didn't need to pay to keep the room on. 
Laborious getting through immigration at the airport to come home - I think it was the first day of work for some of the staff ! We had to show our passports to every tom, dick and harry which became a bit of a joke.
Met some fantastic people at whispering palms, lots of repeaters. All in all, a lovely week in the sun and a great first taste of India.

My best friend and I took on to celebrate our birthday in this beautiful resort. My friend had been here earlier and insisted that I should try it out too. it's a nice place they have so much to offer as far as entertainment is concerned. Yummy dinner was made even more special with live music . Beach is just a walk away. The place is affordable too.I would recommend it to peopen, it's value for money.

Just had 2 weeks here. January/February. Hotel was clean. We did get a bit 'curried out' but the chef would cook something plain if you asked. Our room didn't have a view, but it had a great shower and always kept clean. We didn't see any of the animation team and the regular entertainment wasn't up to much, although the acrobats were fantastic, as was 'Carnival night'. Had a great holiday and would return to Candolim, I wouldn't go all inclusive again as there are plenty of nice, cheap places to eat out.

Just come back from a 2 week stay and I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Didn't expect the hotel to be as nice as it was. Very clean, rooms spacious enough. Staff were lovely. Excellent location for the beach. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great meeting up with old friends , staff as always on the look out for anything they can do to make your holiday the best they can . If you need anything that isn't to your particular taste it is no problem for them to make something that is .

once again we found the staff welcoming and attentive at all times .The hotels location is about perfectly placed between beach and shops-restaurants etc.After 25 years some of the older rooms are getting a little tired and could do with a little work,however this is overshadowed by the quality of the staff we will return again without doubt

Clean tidy and caring environment. Food is alright for all inclusive, breakfast was very good but really could do with two toasters! Lovely pool but not enough room around it for the amount of guests. Access to the near by beach couldn't be better, must nearly be the best in Goa

We spent 4 days in the resort in Feb'17, for celebrating our Fathers 75th birthday. The rooms are adequately spacious and well maintained, the terrace rooms are really good, especially ones facing the swimming pool. The first look at the reception and the corridors do not give a positive feel for the money you spend. But once you experience the ambiance, the food, the Tatwa spa the view changes for good. The staff is really helpful we interacted with Mr.Anurag Nair, who was courteous. They made arrangements for the birthday celebration beside the pool with live music. Food was really wonderful, with a good mix of Indian and continental. A good place to stay if you intent to stay put in a resort, the sea is just a 5min walk from the resort, The beach is clean and neat as well.

I stayed there for 4 nights with my family last week. 
Rooms - were good enough to stay for a couple plus one small kid. Good and comfortable with all the amenities required like safe,mini bar,tea/coffee maker etc. 
wifi connection is good and i didn't get any issue with that. pool was not over crowded and you can enjoy with your kids as well as they have pool for kids too. food was excellent and have many option to try in breakfast and dinner as well. you can enjoy the food sitting in pool area 
enjoying the live performances/event. service was excellent - staff is always prompt and ready to provide good service. location is also good as it is in the main area of north goa and all the beaches are near by the location. candolim beach is just 10 mins walk drive from the resorts.

We stayed for 2 weeks at this really good hotel. A great location in the quieter part of Candolim. The manager was very efficient in sorting us a lovely quiet room in the gardens and all of the staff without exception were friendly and helpful. The food was varied and good and the pool, bar and outdoor seating made for a sociable setting. We didn't make the most of the all inclusive package as we love the beach, lunch at beach shacks and there are some fantastic restaurants in walking distance but its all so cheap it didn't matter - we just dipped in and out where we chose. One or 2 things to mention - you can take the hotels towels to the beach, very few of the standard rooms have much of a view, just ask if you want poached eggs (!), a sunbed or an umbrella on your terrace, sunbeds are all claimed very early morning, the tailor on site is very good. Would happily recommend Whispering Palms.

Sheer delight packed into just one week - our first time at Whispering Palms, Goa....

Our family of three had only one week in mid-February for a break from cold, wintry UK. After searching via the Internet and contact with travel agents, we decided that Goa was the ideal location with direct flights from the UK to match the available dates. Among the options in North Goa (Candolim in particular) we eventually booked the Whispering Palms Beach Resort as it had good reviews and was ideally located.

Our first choice of a room with a balcony accommodating three was unavailable on arrival at 3am, but the staff were very helpful with moving us into our preferred room as soon as it became available.

We found the facilities on offer excellent, the short walk to the beach, the local shops, free WiFi, etc. a bonus. The staff were without exception courteous, friendly and so helpful - no stone left un-turned in making our short stay as enjoyable as possible. 

The breakfast, lunch and dinner cuisine was varied and plentiful with excellent entertainment in the evenings and we had no hesitation with inviting friends and family to join us at a modest additional cost.

Many thanks to all the staff at Whispering Palms for your excellent service. Hoping to see you again next year.

As a frequent traveler the overall trip to Candolim was 'ok' but the hotel staff really made our trip. We came as two big 'loud' families with lots of kids and we felt nothing but welcomed by all the staff.

Although in need of updating or even a little clean, they do have TWO baby high chairs, which as we've learned in Candolim is pretty unheard of as most places have non or at the most just one. 

Pools are very clean with a separate toddler pool. 
Food is good and if there is something you want that isn't on the menu they are more than happy to make it fresh. 

As valentines fell during our trip I asked the staff to make private arrangements for flowers and balloons in the room. They sneaked in whilst we were at breakfast and set it all up beautifully. 

I've had the chance to pop into a couple of other hotels on the top review list that we considered staying during my research as our friends (with no kids) are staying and I am so happy we made the right choice. 

The beach is practically on the doorstep. 
I recommend that once you get to the sand turn right and use Ryan's Shack. Less dogs, free beach beds if drinking/eating and great music with less disturbance from hustlers. 

Overall I can't see that you will find another hotel as good for close to the same price range in Candolim.

I have had a fabulous experience at whispering Palms hotel. Every member of staff has been lovely , professional, anything requested however small was sorted. After travelling the world. I would highly recommend this resort. I have never encountered such happy obliging staff. The all inclusive package was excellent. Great food, drink and entertainment. Every member of staff is a credit to the hotel. I chose to spend several days on the beach with numerous shacks (beach bar/ restaurants) 1 min walk from hotel. The beach also was lovely and spacious. Our girls group had several days at Maya's and Ryans shacks. Maya's was peaceful. Ryans played incredible music from 5-till late, it was brilliant....great DJ 
I will definitely be going back to Goa, and will pre book Whispering Palms again. Sinitta, Vinda and all front of house staff were amazing, as were all of the staff. Thank you. 
whilst Goa is beautiful, there is a lot of poverty there, which is evident everywhere outside the hotel. Cows and dogs along the streets. It all added to the Goan experience. 
One of our group of girls has been going for 18 years, now I know why. I will be back Loved every minute.
We had a great holiday

This is a very good property to stay.very clean and spacious rooms, food quality is excellent, very courteous staff. One of the best thing about this resort is it is located very near to candolim beach.Hotel organises live events in the evening. Has a very good swimming pool.Will definitely recommend everyone to choose this resort for a great experience.

Had 2 weeks at the whispering phams in January, the staff are brilliant and look after your every need.
We have just booked to go back next January this time for 4, weeks and carnt wait.
So look forward to seeing you all and having another great holiday
Derek & Anne

Just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel. I found the rooms clean with a great maid service, tv and air con good. The All Inclusive was very good with all the main Goa beers and spirits available. Food has a very good selection with Indian and western food at every sitting.
Although I went to the beach 13 of my 14 days I noticed that the sunbeds are in short supply around the pool so most are taken by 7am.

As with our first visit to Whispering Palms we stayed for 14 nights, all inclusive (booked through Thomas Cook). Our first stay was in one of the garden suites, and I must admit I was apprehensive about our second visit as we decided to go with the standard twin room - I need not have worried, the room was of an excellent size, the balcony was probably double the size of those of the garden suites, the only thing I would say is that although there is a lot of storage space for clothing there is very little hanging space and ladies, forget about anywhere for hanging dresses, mine had to go on the back of the bathroom door!

The food and entertainment were excellent, I can particularly recommend the vegetarian options, all were very good!

All the staff were as friendly and helpful as ever, we tried the room service this time and it more than lived up to expectations (be aware that room service is chargeable, even with AI). A special mention should go to the housekeeping team, nothing was too much trouble.

The resort is perfectly placed, 2 minutes from the main street in Candolim or 2 minutes from the beautiful beach and the Arabian sea.

During our 2 visits we have looked around other hotels but nothing has compared to Whispering Palms, 

We have fallen in love, both with Goa and Whispering Palms, so much so that we are flying back out on Christmas Day so that we can be there for the New Year celebrations.

Thanks to Jacob John and all his team, keep up the good work and we'll see you at Christmas!

whispering palms great location only a short walk to the beach. hotel food was amazing. the staff and management were first class. room service was prompt.house keeping was very efficient and courteous as were all the staff always smiling. we will deffinatly be returning again to this hotel thank you to everyone at the whispering palms who made our stay fantastic. only one issue the wine was terrible and the management was informed

We stayed for 10 days as did not know what to expect if Goa. Great holiday hotel short walk to beach food good rooms very clean. Great fun looking to book again January 2018 beach great attraction much tie spent jumping the waves. But good selection of buffet food each day.

wonderful location, wonderful property and such courteous staff. Had an amazing time at the resort. Staff is so helpful at all hours.

Housekeeping staff is very courteous and efficient. We have small kids and even an infant with us. But never felt the need to escalate anything, everything was so prompt and accurate.

thank u team. keep up the good work.

Absolute amazing experience of a lifetime . 
Lovely cottages some with lake views (which are on another level experience waking to a amazing natures views green n waters sunshine even a nornSl garden pool cottages are also an Amazing experience with comfort and satisfaction the breathtaking atmosphere with amazing friendly staff and nice food your sure to enjoy and experience another level . You can book a boat trips and speed boats 
Lovely swimming pool and dream surroundings while drinking your fresh coconut .

After bringing up my concerns to the manager on duty , he just apologized and no action was taken. Insensitive i would say. Someone should be taking corrective action but i guess once the guest has checked out, they dont really care.

It was a waste of money ...hyatt as brand was not able to offer as per the brand image.it was expensive and the worst part was the hospitality...the staff at the dining room really sad very disappointed

Checked into the property on 18/12/2016. Room locks were not working. The phone had a message light which kept flashing despite following all instructions to deactivate the same. Response from maintenance was obnoxious. The duty manager and the GM did not bother to call despite escalation. This despite me being a platinum Hyatt member. Have 2 more nights at this property and really do not think i will enjoy the same.

The most disgusting food and service . The Masala Dosa made had the filling of pakoris with chutney flowing into it .also they don't have an option of serving a stronger tea , that's what the guy serving told me when asking for one . The fruits served were absolutely non inviting and the staff is super busy to be disturbed .....

The hotel is very beautiful and has the all comforts that a luxury hotel could have. I was there for my friend 's wedding on 22nd and 23rd of November. Everything was so great until something happened, something that a five star hotel couldn't allow. We went back twice into the room before the housekeeping cleaned the room and we left the second time a watch with a bracelet on the desk. After almost 1 hour we went into the room and we noticed that the bed was done and the room cleaned. Then we started to change because we needed to go to the wedding ceremony and my boyfriend didn't find the watch and the bracelet anymore where he left it. We looked for it everywhere, even in the drawers and my bag. NOTHING. I decided to the report the event to the hotel and they after one day they said they did all the investigations just asking to the housekeeping if she took the watch and obviously she said no. That's what they did! Just this! Unluckily we needed to live early in the morning so we didn't do or say anything more. We just went back home without an important and valuable gift that a five star hotel shouldn't allow to stole.

Staff at the dining room is not fit for service industry, over all property is good but behaviour of staff spoiled my vacation. Total waste of time and money for me. No one was even interested to take feedback.

There is nothing grand in this supposed luxury Hotel- terrible service, bland food, dogs and cats in the resort and beach, a pool that looks more like a fish pond and workers pointing rooms until 10.30 at night with a terrible smell of paint. No taxi available from reception to go into town and no help whatsoever with the recent banned rupees notes- what a disappointment.

The location is terrible. It's quite isolated. If you'd like to visit any places you're forced to take the hotel's transport. The staff is unfriendly. They don't make you feel welcome. There is no beach. The pool isn't cleaned very day!! Towels aren't clean, even the room towels. Breakfast if very average and boring. They were 55 minutes late in allowing us entrance to a function. Frankly speaking, the hotel doesn't have anything to offer. The saddest thing though, is that the concierge recommends an elephant ride. Instead of an elephant haven, a group of men are holding 3 elephants chained with little food just to offer a 10-minute ride to the tourists. This should really be boycotted. What a shame for a 5* hotel to condone and even recommend such a behavior!!

Words are not enough to describe this horrible experience. Rooms are hardly cleaned, the less said better for toilets! I found toiletries probably half used and left by previous user! Handling of luggage was deplorable and one wonders why should one actually even bother to stay in this hotel. I will renounce my Hyatt passport membership!

Hi , I stayed in the hotel from aug 31 - Sep 6th . Actually I was planning to stay in Taj Goa. But reviews pulled me to Grand Hyatt . I would highlight my points serially . Till our checkin, everything was polite and cordial .I checked into a bay view room with price of 15,000 plus per day , including breakfast , for 5 days .
a) Day 1 - We checked into the room - On entering the room , the AC was not working properly;we checked in in the evening . While going to sleep , the lights above the bed were not getting off. Night 1 am we had to call , the electricial came, he took out the fuse from the mains for the 3 lights , told it would be rectified the next day . We told him A/c was not working , He opened the AC vent , told there is a lot of dust , and came and fixed it after cleaning it . "now ur AC will work fine " , He told . Isn't this something to expect from a five star hotel before hand .
b) Day 2 - Morning my family member was unwell . I went to the hospital , Morning my breakfast was complimentary. I told about the unwellness and told , i would be packing the breakfast . Reception told " Yes Sir sure , No problem " . When I went to the breakfast area , no such communication was made, The dining area ppl are asking me whom did you talk to ? Why should I remember .. Then after long time it was sorted out , and i could get some breakfast to my Room after lots of fight , We then started for the day in afternoon.
c) Day 3 - We went for our sight seeing , on coming back , the House keeping had changed the bedsheet and blankets . When we were about to sleep , at around 1 am .. We normally used to start in afternoon and return in night 11 around... The blanket had blood stains .. GoD knows , if ever one customer has menstrual cycle and blood has come to blanket .. How come you can put such blanket in another room . " FIVE STAR HOTEL " u say . Night 1 am the house keeping person came and changed the blanket . he didnt have the courtesy of fitting the new blanket.. Threw the new blanket on bed .. Took the blood stained blanket and went !!
d) Day 4 : Morning , we went on to make coffee with the Kettle !! God save me , The Kettle wasn't working . It was not getting on ... The Bed where we slept , The head rest had dust accumulated and none had cleaned it since 5 days ..The same day , I tried to open the tap in the Bath tub , rusted water came out of it ..We gave up..
e) Day 5 :: This was icing on the cake. I had booked bay view rooms for 4 days with complimentary breakfast . I extended the stay by another day , bay view room with no breakfast . Since the previous day , I went for a cruise along with family , I had asked the receptionist a day before , to remove the complimentary breakfast from 4th day , and club it to the additional 5th day . The receptionist - a lady , told us she would get back . she called back and told , Sir its done your complimentary breakfast is moved to the next day !! We would be intimating to the Dining section !!The same day nite , the day before check out , we went to reception for the next day Break fast .... But as expected ..nothing was done .. Questions like " Whom did you talk to and all came " .. nothing had been informed to dining ... and the day breakfast we skipped , has been put as present ??? Strange ... After much fight .. the Receptionist who talked to us told no.. I asked you to inform dining .. Where does a customer run around and inform the dining ,,, n all... Rubbish.. They spoiled our day .. we were returning happy from Baga beach ..Horrible experience !!

f) The Check out Day :: I was really pissed off with all these stuff... 6th morning , I went for checkout ..As if this was not the end of all.. My checkout bill... Had phone calls made from land line , worth some Rs.200 .. Rs.200 is not a big deal .. I never used the phone for local calls or std calls ... But know what , the house keeping people come to ur room and while cleaning the rooms make personal calls from phones and we have to pay for them . Why ??After much fight .. the receptionist , removed the calls from phone...


Pros :: Yes 2 good things 1) The Valet parking people were very cordial
2) Chullah Restaurant

GRAND HYATT GOA , you people need to lift up your levels, Try to come to terms of 15K bucks room .. It was not close to Rs.5000 per day . I stayed in The Khyber Kashmir for rs.15000 per day , and you should go stay there and see the customer friendly environment and sophistication they provide .. 15K bucks per day , you dont pay to firefight everyday ... A strict NO to all GRAND HYATT hotels all over from my side. I should have stayed in Taj. Thanks for ruining my vacation !!!

The good: DINING. Meals at Chulha and The Verandah were world class. 

The bad: ROOMS. Very musty rooms, corridors and elevators. Rooms had mosquitoes and moths, and my ocean view balcony was littered with lizard dung on the walls, the floor, and the furniture that I did not even want to step out onto it.

The very bad: SERVICE. The teams across the property simply just did not seem "motivated'. With the exception of two individuals during my three night stay, the culture on the property was one that lacked energy and an understanding of what was required to deliver outstanding let alone, basic hospitality. I have decided to forgo my litany of complaints here out of sheer exhaustion from disappointment. 

Will not return.

I was here for three days with my colleagues and we have faced multiple issues. support and service orientation approach.

In short, property is 5 star but service level, attitude and behaviour of staff is very poor. 

Lot of possibility and scope for improvement if feedback is seriously taken by management.

Bad hotel bad service bad staff bad manegnent they don't respect the coustumer room is old furniture and breakfast are not good check in and out taking to mutch time and there rate is to high shulld be two stars.

First the pros, nice large number of rooms, a compact enough property for one to explore and enjoy every bit, quaint ruins in the midst of its nicely laid out lawns, really well made and picturesque interiors, a casino within the property and a popular, sumptuous Sunday brunch buffet. 

The staff was courteous for most, barring some from the room service team, but somehow it is shocking to see how they manage to make goof ups the way they did. I have to be fair and say the moment I pointed out the flaw or my unhappiness, there was immediate and prompt attention.

In our three nights stay, the following happened that warrant mention

(a) Dinner at Verandah, the Australian Grill Restaurant: I looked at the catch and chose a Red Snapper. The fish was to be charged based on weight, fair enough. Instead of seeking my consent once the fish was weighed, I was informed it would cost us US$ 85. I revolted and refused to accept the charges. I was politely told they assumed me to know the price of Red Snapper in Goa. It was only when I repeatedly refused that the staff agreed to charge me 40% of the quoted price. I also got a further 25% off on my final bill for being a Hyatt Gold Member.

(b) Room Service (night 2): The picture will explain it all. Food was served in a Stainless Steel Tiffin Carrier, with three sets of crockery/ cutlery but only one napkin, in a rundown dirty trolley. I was informed by the Room Service Crew, this time in a somewhat firm fashion that the style they follow for room service is 'picnic style' hence this was alright. Of course if an accompanying salad can be served properly, pre-plated why would the mains be in this shabby form is not something I got a convincing answer for. Upon protest, there was an immediate acknowledgment from the Executive Assistant Manager, goodies in the room and no charges for the meal.

(c) Extra bed in the room (night 3): Our booking was for two adults, two children with an extra bed in the room that we asked for upon check-in.

It worked alright for night one and two. The extra bed would be set at 8:00-8:30 PM and taken out the following morning. On the third night, we were informed all extra beds were taken hence we wouldn't get one. Argument given, since the bed was taken out in the morning, on our instructions they assumed we didn't need it. Of course that the same thing had been done for two nights on the trot and we had a booking for four in the room, didn't matter! We did get the bed after all.

I am not bothering to mention relatively minor infractions like a beer ordered at the poolside not being delivered, once again why won't you have a fully operational bar by the pool instead of getting your people to trek back and forth from the main building.

I'm attaching pictures, of some pretty sights in the property and of the picnic style dinner. I tried hard not to be severe, respecting the attention and honour given by many members of the staff, but for what I paid, the Hyatt brand, and a promise that was not delivered to, I felt I would be untrue not to write this out the way I have, full regard to the staff notwithstanding. 

It's not a place I will go back to for a family vacation.

To make sure my check in into the hotel was smooth,I had called the reservation team to give my preferences(twin bed in one of the rooms) a week ago also requested for an early c/in, a day prior I get a call asking for my time of arrival 10 mins later another call for the same.On checking in none of the preferences taken care of.Ppl at the desk whisked it off by saying checkin time 3pm while I had arrived at 11pm. I was told room would take 1/2hr but instead to one hour for one of the rooms to be ready. I was even fine with this since I was excited to explore and enjoy the facilities but this excitement was short lived as my bags didn't arrive until I called up the desk 4times and went down all the way from guesthouse 6 to the bell desk only to find my bags still lying there. I wouldn't really mind carrying my own bags at least it could have saved me two hours worth of boredom,I was really annoyed as my plans for lunch and for recreation had already gone for a toss.When I finally landed in the pool I decided to grab a bite ,the spicy burger I had ordered didnt turn out to be spicy at all and to my surprise the ordertaker also asked me indirectly whether have i given a deposit at the time of check-in, when i had asked him to post it to my room as i was in the pool and couldn't carry any money. To make things worse In the evening when one of my friends decided to take a quick nap around 8 before we headed for dinner people from the desk call up to ask What time should they keep my bill ready?I had already informed the hotel on multiple occasions that I have a flight to catch next day. I was just wondering I should have stayed at the Taj at agouda, at least I would have got the feeling they wanted me to stay and not to vacate their room ASAP.Being from the same hospitality industry I have an eye for detail and I came to know that the rooms given to me didn't seem to be perfect (minibar locked and empty,no iron board in the other room etc.) Hotel is a very beautiful property, lacks Empathy,too much professionalism can disturb your guest.

Right from the moment we checked in the staff was casual and careless about everything. Our luggage got misplaced and was found in another block after 2 hours, that too when we decided to take matters in our own hands. The staff is lethargic . Our food came after 1 hour and we ordered for additional indian breads it took another 45 mins. However the biggest incident happened on the last day when money was stolen from our bags. The hotel could not reach to any conclusion from their investigation and said the only solution is to file a police complaint. Our misplaced luggage made us more suspicious about the security of the hotel. Overall the property is built well but the staff is not trained to Hyatt standards. There is a huge difference in the experience at Park Hyatt and Grand. I would recommend park hyatt above it anyday. We had asked for a late checkout for 3 rooms and the hotel was empty on a monday but after initially agreeing to our request they insisted on checking out from a particular room which happened to be the room from where the theft had taken place. Also we had given the guarantee of 80 grands thru our card , they insisted we come to the lobby and settle the bill first and then go back to our rooms. Never seen this at any property across the world. Overall this hotel only flatters to deceive and i would say give it a miss. Goa has better options in terms of service

This stay was rather forgettable for my family, specially my child. Now many of you might think that this is totally personal experience. However, I strongly believe that Hyatt Management is responsible for this incident and the experience. 

I visited this property on 26th May and planned to stay by 29th May. I was given Room #7006, I visited the place with my family including 5 yr old child. 
The room had a big round table with center support, with a very heavy glass top. My child was trying to get apples from the table and the table including the unattached glass fell on her, slicing her smallest toe in to two parts. This all happened within 10 mins of entering room. 
Me and my wife were shocked to see her crying in pain, and her toe sliced in to two parts. 

I contacted the reception for immediate assistance, however there was no doctor available. When i asked for hospital, I was told about Manipal Hospital being the nearest hospital (at 6 km distance). There was a nearby hospital GMC, just next to hyatt (1.5 km), which was not communicated to me and I came to know about it next day.

The implication was that my child lost her toe because of the delay in treatment. 

Next morning I wanted to checkout as my child had to go through another surgery. I wanted to return to Pune as soon as possible. 
When I went to reception, The staff told me that points can not be refunded, I told him the reason and without checking anything I was given an answer as no again.

I informed the reception that the this type of table and its glass must be removed from all the rooms so that any other child will not get hurt however I was given answer we can not as all rooms have same structure and design. BTW, the glass is so heavy that it can easily fracture leg of an adult.

I strongly feel Grand Hyatt, Goa as being negligent in considering customer safety and care.
Additionally, I was totally turned down by the negative response, the hotel staff or management was not courteous enough to ask for child's health, or to compensate for medical expenses or refund my reservation fee. 

Fortunately or unfortunately I could not take pics of that table as I wanted to leave that place as soon as possible. Otherwise I would have shared it on this forum. 

I shall never visit again or recommend this place to anyone.

Highly disappointed wid the place....exciting upon entering but as soon as we entered the series of shocks started...the rooms promised wer not given in fact ppl tried convincing us Tht v booked the given rooms only and on Tht they made us have a burden by saying Tht v got an upgrade....that's silly.... The food experience is worst...ordered in the room...the food Tht came was not sufficient .... Wat v ordered

The food taste is very poor not as per a five star hotel, your office canteen will be better. When I check in the loo was not cleaned the pillow was stinking. The staff does not care about your bad experience, they don't even suggest a compensation.
Poor quality is the norm here. 
It should be a 1 star hotel.

I write this review while I'm staying in the hotel. I loved the hotel so much that I was going to give it 5 rating.
However the frontdesk staff has done everything possible to spoil our trip. When I checked in, I told the receptionist- Aswati that I was staying for a company function for 2 days and then for a personal trip one day. She committed to me that I can continue the same room for all 3 days

From day 2 onwards we started getting requests to check out. I was getting tired of repeatedly saying that I'm here for three days.
On day 3, the receptionist Krishna insisted that we change rooms and we refused as the hotel had committed to us on day 1 that we will not need to change rooms.

Now this is where the harassment started. The reception manager- Adit Canteenwala showed no understanding of our request and kept insisting that we change rooms. When we refused, they decided to not provide any housekeeping services. We've waited till 3:30pm and the room remains uncleaned.

I called the reception, vipin picked up, I asked him to get me to talk to the manager and I called thrice and that guy refused to come on the line.

Thanks for the hospitality.

It was the worst experience ever with pathetic service, it seemed like the staff here think that they are giving out free facilities at a shelter. They had a New Years Banquet which was absolutely the worst. More suitable as a cheap show at some cheap joint and definitely not in the class expected at a Hyatt. The Dinner on New Year's eve was another joke (On us!) with poor quality as well as choice.
The guys who clean the pathways create plumes of dust and yet don't bother to ensure that everything is tidy.
Only thing that worked OK was the WiFi!

Tortured by the music of a karoke party in the neighbouring room !! This was just the last straw in a string of poor quality service. We have been awake all night as the 'guest's of this other party' also rang the bell to our room 3 times ! Pity the staff !

Been here for the past 3 days and its a family get together with infants with us. Right from the word go ,all we encountered were one hiccup to another . Right from making us wait for our check in ,unbelievable pathetic service in the restaurants both from the kitchen and the waiters. The only saving grace was the pool. The biggest shocker came minutes before I write the review now. Ordered room service for 5 of us. And surprise.... The food was delivered in a lunch box casserole... undercooked meat... Phew... Lets not even talk of the mosquitos menace, non responsive call desk and guest services,Dysfunctional service system etc etc... Last words to any traveller planning a Goan holiday. AVOID this property, imagine if this is the state of affairs at new year at Goa Grand hyatt. Then god save its residents from their service on a random day.

We stayed in this property from 31 st December to 4 th January 2016,
Nice location but no service at all , if someone can live without room service , restaurant service and housekeeping then it's a good property to stay. 

Restaurant waiter forgot to serve the order , housekeeping forgot to serve ice , left used towels and pillow covers on room floor after cleaning ,room service took 1 hour to serve food. No personal touch or hospitality even for name sake.

We stayed at Grand Hyatt for 3 days to celebrate our 10th Anniversary. 

On our arrival at the bay view room, we found the room extremely dirty , bedsheets with blood stains , too many mosquitos and Blood marks on bathing robe too.

There was dust in the room all over. There was a layer of dust on the study table.I felt, we were given a shack in the name of a 5 star hotel. 

We made a complain about this to duty manager . She said , she will get it sorted in 30 min.

We had to wait for 90 min and kill our time after a long journey in the lobby area . It was quite painful to wait.

Anyway room was cleaned and they offered us a complimentary dinner for the next day in their restaurant .

After the dinner , I was asked to sign the cheque for which I said it was a complimentary dinner . The boys at the restaurant insisted that I sign for it as they had no message in their systems from the Duty Manager.

I had to follow up 3 times with the guest services to ensure that dinner is accounted for as complimentary. 




Next day and 2 days after that there were marriages booked in the hotel . Loudspeakers blaring Bollywood music which could be heard in the room was very annoying as it started from 6 Pm and ended very close to midnight. 

In front of our room,in the lawn chef's were preparing dinner for wedding guests .

I could not open the doors or pull the curtains of our room as you could see at least 50 people from hotel working /decorating and cooking dinner.

I think, it was one of the worst hotel experiences of my life . I have stayed in 5 star hotels for atleast last 15 years.
This was on of the most terrible experience.

I have made every effort not to photograph the staff preparing dinner in front of my room for 2 days.

I would never ever stay at Grand Hyatt even if they offer accomadation free of charge.

It takes a lot of pain to write a review within 15 hours of arriving at a hotel

The service quality is just appalling 

Reached the hotel at 2 15 and they were not ready with rooms. This was disappointing as they knew when we would be reaching before hand and we have 2 infants

After the usual expression of disappointment, suddenly one room is ready! 

Anyways we move to have lunch and after a wait for ten minutes, we were told that a la Carte might be restricted in serving. The stewards seem to be completely unaware of the infants and the fact that they r tired. 
Again, it takes stern talk to get what we need

The rooms are good but some equipment and silver like bar glasses and coffee machine still have signatures of the previous occupants

The most bewildering part is ROOM SERVICE. I have never ever been to a hotel where you take at least ten attempts to get to room service! And when I asked them, why is this. He said it is like that only as they have only guy to pick up the phone. WHAT!!!!!!

Finally we come to Bfast. We walk in, no one to serve water or ask for tea/coffee. Spread is disappointing and no service again

Just 2 days to go before we end this

Never ever come here again

Honestly, i wish I would have never shortlisted this hotel. 
From the garden facing room - which actually a generator facing room.

To restaurant which is actually a complete no-no to vegetarians. They do charge a full price for buffet but have only 3-4 options.
Add on to that, you are the last person to be cater since you might not get the tips from the indians guests.

Not to forget staff standing at the beach and pool side. They too have the same tendency to cater to the foreign guests as compared to Indian guests - obvious reasons tips.
There was no person at the beach side to help with towels and shades.

Above all, the services are too slow and lot many times the people involved do not respond.

Its been almost over an hour when I requested to speak to someone senior to express my concern and no one has contacted yet. Shows the importance of the customer.

It was not a good option. I Have stayed at Marriott and Taj Village earlier in Goa and would prefer them over Grand Hyatt or say rather not to go.

-Kunal

The connectivity to this hotel is not good. They charge more for transport than market rate. Airport transfers is complementary but if you want train station transfer it is chargeable. No reason was provided for this unfair treatment. The food is boring as same menu is repeated everyday. Service of food is so slow that you can't finish your food in less than 2 hours. So, if you are taking 3 time food your 6 hours a day are used in taking food only. The beach is peaceful. No waves in the sea. One advice - Bring one mosquito killing racquet with you as you will have to face mosquito menace here.

I am really upset as this was unexpected when we checked in .. specially when some one spends more than 55k for a 3 day stay i am writing this while we are still in the hotel ..We checked in on 30th November evening at around 6:00 pm and we are scheduled to check out tomorrow 3rd December.

Firstly , we had requested for an hour late check out on the day of our arrival as our flight is during the 2nd half .. we have an all meal package. We were told to check the tsame the next day.. We contacted them however were again told to check the status on 2nd December. .We spoke to someone at the reception today i.e. 2nd Dec and he agreed for a 1pm check out instead of 12 noon. .but today evening we got a call asking us to check out by 12 noon as the hotel is booked for a wedding starting tomorrow..

Secondly, Our's is an all meal package . .but today 2nd December when we went for dinner there was a sea food fest going on so the usual restaurant The dinning room was closed for dinner and we were asked to go to another restaurant called chulha..when we walked we were offered Indian buffet ..where supposedly a private family event had been organised ..We started our meal ..The spread was just about OK ..not as per the expectations. .While we we were eating we were also facing lot of stares from the family as if we were the unexpected guests eating their food some of them were even talking about us ..We could easily make out by their gestures that their understanding was it's their buffet. .We felt very humilated ..The worst part was that since it was a huge group they were making it uncomfortable for us ..A young boy in his twenties with beard was touching the food with his hands. .smelling it .. it was disgusting and very unhygienic .. We couldn't finish our meal and had to leave ..We spoke to the restaurant manager Swati and told her ..how they were behaving ..she apologised but by now. .I am already upset and disgusted. .as this is not what you expect from a 5star..Not coming here again for sure. .neither will I recommend it to anyone..

Unfriendly staff , horrible processes and callous attitude . Worst experience for a long long time. Entire hotel staff has a very careless attitude. They just want to get rid of you as soon as possible without even trying to understand your problem. Housekeeping staff doesn't clean your room till you call them up, this clearly shows how the staff behaviour is. Please Avoid staying at this property

Stayed for 3 days back in August. Wouldnt complain abut property.. well maintained but overall experience has been the worst i have ever experienced.

At the time of check in - Provided front desk staff with CC for pre authorization. $ 270 debited from account. During check out, realised dicing charges added which belonged to some other room No. took the front desk staff more than hour to rectify the error.

Finally i was told the remaining balance will be credited back in my card.

When i finally arrived back to my country from holiday, realized the front desk staff has debited the card in error and i was charged once again.

Its been over 2 months & No. of emails exchange with their finance team and senior manager but all you get told is its been investigated.. not they have stopped replying.

My bank has initiated the process at their end to recover the transaction which will take few weeks..

all i can request is, be careful when you hand over your CC to staff and check transaction details..

@hyatt.bambolim, shame on you, i wish i could write something positive but you left me with no choice..

Its really very worst experience for stay in this hotel for one night. What we have paid is all waste of money. The rooms which we have requested and paid such a big amount for one night is totally waste of money. 

Requested hyatt bambolim to please the money you are wasting in decorations in evening, just spen the money on good breakfast and others 

This hotel is not recommended to anyone who is coming for enjoying.

The hotel and grounds are nice, as are the staff that work in the restaurants, pool areas and housekeeping.

The location is somewhat out of the way in the middle of nowhere, and the hotel doesn't have a beach.

The management team at the hotel are terrible. When issues arise they simply don't know where to start, they chat endless babble at you, which just wastes your time.

Similar to other reviews we'd also warn you to watch out for their billing! Our credit card details were compromised following the card going out of our sight for the pre-authorisation, and thousands of  / $ were later spent. The management didn't understand the issue at all. Terrible experience.

There are so many other lovely hotels in Goa , I'd highly recommend you pick one of them eg Leela.

I won't be staying with Hyatt for a long time!

One of the best Architecture with one of the worse Service standard..! I am a Travel Professional and frequently travel with group (from 50 Person to 2500 Person) and manage their travel, conference, meeting, Sightseeing tour and other services..!

We had a meeting of 85 People at this property; and they have not well professional to use seating arrangement and meeting amenities..! Wash-room had very basis toilet paper; that a rode-side restaurant offer..!
