It was our first stay here, must admit, Staff made it a memorable one.

Constructed in a bylane, this peaceful property has a cool portuguse architecture; you must have that taste to enjoy!

The colourful hotel (yellow and white with accentuated red small building in middle) has a central pool with 24x7 bar and a grill is surrounded by palm and coconut treees that forms the signature style of the building.
Cosy modern rooms with private balconies add to the charm. 

Front office manager Rahul, an excellent professional, made every effort to make our stay comfortable.

The housekeeping staff is outstanding.
Sudip, Ankit, Satyendra from F&B left no stone unturned to make us happy.
A wonderful staff lady (sorry to have forgotten her name) is seen interacting with guests at front office and restaurant over the comfort!
Pool is clean, beds and towels fresh, dedicated pool for kids and plenty of drink choices will keep everyone occupied.
The ala carte beats any famous restaurant like fishermans cove etc in town. 
We had a ground floor room in tower Rosa that boasts biggest balconies, our kid had a great time.

Only downside I felt was no lifts and strong cartel of taxi operators outside that don Pt allow you to have self drive cars and we had to manage the entire 9 days tour (31 Dec 16-8Jan17) on a rented bike; was fun though!

In peak season every Monday is gala dinner. We were part of the great New year gala dinner and 'twas a good show summing up with fireworks to start the 2017 with a bang!

Best enjoyed: Nov-mid Feb!

Location is great, good food, good people, comfortable beds....I say- Go For It people and "keep it up Phoenix Park Inn"

My wife and I have just spent xmas 2016 at the phoenix park inn resort at Candolim North Goa. The hotel is situated down a small narrow track (car width) about 500 mtrs from the main Candolim/Calangute road, This road is packed with restaurants and shops and bars of all types, but because the hotel is away from this road it is generally very peacefull and quiet, The staff at the hotel are all very friendly and virtually all speak good English. The rooms are spacious and well equipped, good sized pool, perhaps not enough sun beds for this size of hotel. The price of drinks and food are reasonable. The large beach is only around 10 minutes from the hotel.

Lovely clean hotel with staff that could not do enough for us! The air con in the rooms is excellent and you get in room wifi also which is a bonus! The gala night was really good value for money which is on every Monday evening and the chicken lollipops are the best in candolim!

Such a great hotel to stay... few min waking distance to Candolim beach... excellent service and such a great smiling staff i am myself from the hospitality industry... it was so relaxing to see boys working during the breakfast at coffee shop always on their toes... rooms are big in size spacious and the balcony adds a delight... though i was at the backside of the hotel but green areas give you soothing eyes... elevator are the missing part... pool and the pool side bar is just awesome i had couple of drinks with live music it was such a wonderful evening. Check in was quick and we were offered welcome drinks on arrival... you can find a guy sitting just outside the hotel porch if you wanted to hire cab, or self driven scooty or car... food will cost you approx 500 to 700 per person if ordered separately... to sum up a very good hotel for stay with superb service.

If u r in North Goa and u have budget of 7.5k it is the best place to be . It's well maintained hotel with excellent facilities, good spacious rooms, including good swimming pool. It's in the market place and is in walkable distance from Candolim beach.

Excellent hotel very convenient for town and short walk to the fabulous beach. Great service from all the staff especially Harendra who looked after our nice big room. Room cleaned everyday with clean bedding and towels everyday. Buffet breakfast was good. English and Indian choices. Again very friendly staff in breakfast room.

Pool always very busy chairs reserved early every morning by people putting their towels on them not Germans but with such a great beach nearby it wasn't a problem. Gala night very good value and most enjoyable.

Very Cooperative and helpful staff. Nice and good place to stay. Breakfast is very good in taste. Manager is very polite and helpful. Hotel arranged taxi for me very fast as I was getting late. Only 500mt away from candolim beach I will definitely stay in this hotel again. Saurabh Gupta

Since 2014 , every year I have stayed in this hotel. Now this hotel becomes my second home in goa. Spacious room, delicious food, very friendly and caring staff. Location is very peaceful. U can have vehicle on rent at walking distance. North goa's famous beaches near to the hotel.

This lovely hotel is well placed just of the main road in Candolim - down a quiet side street, - nicely managed grounds, small pool and well sized rooms. Try to get one of the rooms overlooking the pool and a superior room, the rooms at the back don,t have a view. The staff are friendly and helpful. Kettle and fridge in room, with free coffee and tea supplied, powdered milk, so easier to go and buy some 'long life' from supermarket. Good range of food at breakfast.

Great hotel consisting of several smaller buildings around a charming pool area - a wonderful, relaxing oasis in the midst of bustling Candolim. Staff is amazing; efficient, friendly and serviceminded. Food is also good and drinks fantastic! Rooms are clean, laundry service is reliable, pool service great and reseption service impeccable. Location is great; it is close to the main street with shops, restaurants and supermarkets, and the beach is only about 10-15 min walk.

1. Reception: We were made very welcome. Although the check in was not until 12:00 we were allocated our room as soon as we arrived at around 9:00am.Sachin, the bell boy, helped with the bags. We were not happy with our room as it was not facing the pool, this was changed for us as soon as practical- without any fuss.
2 Room: Really nice room with a comfortable bed and balcony .The room was on the second floor and climbing the stairs was a bit of a challenge.Fridge full of drinks and there were snacks. The TV had multichannels. The Wi fI was a bit of hit and miss.
3.. Restaurant: There are no words to describe the efficiency of the staff here thanks to chef Deepak and his excellent team. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast was good with a wide variety of choices and sufficient to cater for everyones needs. All the waiters, Suman, Parimal, Ronald, Yagindra ( hope i got the correct name) - to name a few, could not do enough for you.Credit also goes to Manager Debujeet and Debu
4. Cleaning : These staff work from early morning to late night to keep the rooms absolutely clean. There is always a smile on their faces. Our special thanks to Soumesh who kept our room spotless. Always with a huge smile on his face. 
The hotel generally is kept clean through out. The only exception, I am afraid, was the pool. The water looked dirty and was most uninviting. To be fair the management were aware of this as the pool was being emptied on our last day and the maintenance team was working late at night to resolve the problem. 
We found the taxi drivers outside a bit intimidating and always hired ones from the main road. 
The music was too loud for our liking.

Me and my mate stayed at this hotel for a week from 16th Nov 2016 
Arriving the early hours of the morning we where promptly checked in and shown to our room,unfortunately there was just one (massive ) double bed , we told them that we needed two singles, our fault we should have requested this beforehand, so we said they could sort it the following day,
On waking up our bags were moved for us into a fresh room, lovely and clean, very spacious, with a balcony, very nice shower room , (toiletries hair drier etc) also tea coffee kettle fridge and mini bar
We bobbed into the restaurant at breakfast time and although we didn't eat anything there seemed to be a really good selection of food and plenty people eating ,
Evening time there was entertainment at the side of the pool, and the drinks were very very reasonably priced 
Every member of staff from the people on reception to porters , bar staff, gardeners , security, even maintenance, were polite , always spoke and had a smile for us, 
Don't be put off by the small street that leads up to the hotel ( it actually gives you rest bite from the noise of the traffic) your only one min walk from all the bars etc , and the little shops on that street will give you some good bargains :) ( I got my shirt for the plane journey home from one) 
I'm back in Candolim for Christmas and new year I wish I was staying back at the Phoenix park , but unfortunately had already booked somewhere different 
But I will be staying again without a doubt

Will be visiting very soon with friends for second trip this year itself. Previous experience was memorable with great hospitality from the staff. Stay was very comfortable felt like home with all the services.

What a lovely little resort! Recommend to all. Goa is full of small streets and this hotel is suitably located remotely away from the traffic noise. A perfect place for couples and families. Our room had all amenities, comfortable bed with pool view. This was our first visit to Goa and the receptionist and assistant front office manager went out of the way to assist with our travel plans. We mostly had dinner at the resort and food was always tasty and fresh. Pool was clean and pool bar had umpteen number of cocktails. Thank you Phoenix Park Goa for a memorable stay. We enjoyed our 2 nights in Goa and will definitely stay again.

Professionally Managed hotel, in all circumstances... Good room with brilliant F&B Team..Good place to spent some quality time with family..Thanks to entire team for made my stay valuable..Love u guys

This was a great stay the staff were great especially 'sundip' he made me very welcome and introduced me to some brits.. always nice to have a bit of home on holiday. The rooms were amazing and the staff if I needed anything were quick. Breakfast had plenty of options and was nice. Defo a 5 star hotel.

We stayed for 6 days. Hotel staff is excellent. Food was good. All staff were cordial and always came forward to offer service. The hotel has a excellent boutique hotel setting. Landscaping is good. Sitting in the balcony one can enjoy a cool drink while reading a book. 
The location of the hotel is a huge plus. Candolim is just the right place. The other locations we visited were quite a mad house. 
I recommend it to all. Shall revisit.

I booked a room in the hotel and it was my second time booking in the hotel. Some staffs were new this time, but they were well-behaved and very helpful. The reception guy had a nice smile on her face all the time, and it's really good! Service was good and the room was clean.
I had to visit a company near by Vasco, and they arranged me a taxi for both going and coming back, which was a great help to me.

They have a nice restaurant too, and the sea foods they serve are truly yummy! I liked the deep fried fish finger so much that it became the part of my daily breakfast in the hotel.

It was overall a nice experience again, and I will choose the hotel the next time also when I will be in Goa. Keep up the friendly and nice service!

We had a group at this hotel, the best part is we got all rooms Early check in, and Restaurant food and service is should be appreciated, Special Thanks to Mr.Prakar Gupta & Mr.Dharmender ,Mr.Rahul - Front office Manager& Mr.Debojith - F&B Manager, we really got very good support and timely quality service.... Looking forward to visit in future...

3 super names at Phoenix ... Michelle in customer relations and Amit at front desk really made it one of the most special trip for us. 

We planned the Babymoon n was taken care by them just like a family ... I was given room on the ground floor, food n fruits were served in the room to ensure it's not inconvenient for me in this condition.

Way to go Michelle and Amit... you guys are doing a fantabulous job !!

My stay was excellent and i got everything what they mentioned in my package. Staff behaviour,Room Neatness, Food everything was good. One suggestion on Swimming Pool maintenance it would be better it could have been cleaned daily basis and overall total stay was pleasant and Thanks for the Phoneix management for made my trip as wonderful. Special thanks to Manoj, Sudip, Ashish(House Keeping) and Anjitha(Receptionist) .

Condolim ia heart of goa i love goa.... And phoenix park inn it was my first time i visited..... The staff was very friendly they helped out in every way..... The service of staff very decent...... The resort location mind blowing.... The food was very tasty and with a good quality.... It lwas reasinoble rates.... With good nature around.... Thankyou very much phoenix park in for making my trip class.....

We stayed in this hotel from 25th Sep to 28th Sep. Hotel is just 50mts from Candolim Beach. Excellent food in terms of spread in the breakfast & dinner. Rooms were neat and clean. Very helpful staff. Easy Check-in and Check-out. In the evening they have arranged for entertainment program.

Stayed for five days with three of my friends. We had a really good time. The staff was very friendly, rooms were spacious and the resort was beautiful. Its located in Candolim so all the places are easily accessible.

Visited with my friends the resort is awasome,the resort has a lovely garden area,a very big pool and 24hrs pool bar.....the guys at the resturant are very nice Manoj Rajat Shalendar very helpful,housekeeping is very clean well maintaned rooms......we will always come to dis resort......awasome stay

I checked in this hotel on 4th Sept. I stayed there in room no #6303. Front Desk staff was good . Smooth Check in procedure nd they provided us welcome drink on arrival. All the bell desk staff was helpful, Specially Piyush and Sachin. So overall everything was fantastic . I will prefered to this hotel to all visiter who is coming to Goa for stay and fun . keep it team and keep going on.

This is the best hotel in goa i came across till now. Hospitality and everything is just awesome. You get to rent Activa just outside the hotel rom Prem bhai in new condition. Hotel staff is very friendly. Area is a plus point to it. You get a best food in this resort. Check in and checkout was not a headache. Welcomed with drinks and we were updated to Super delux room. It was jus too awesome. bEach is hardly % mins drive grom resort.

Stayed with my family,the resort is near to all main spots,very good pool area,good food specially the breakfast was very good,clean rooms,Spa boy was very good,infact all staff are very helpful,one can walk to the beach n market area,resort is really very nice n relaxing.

Amazing Resort....very good stay,amazing reception staff very helpful,restaurant,housekeeping,Pool area,inhouse Spa all very Nice, food is good, walkable from all important points,situated in the heart of the city a very good resort to relax and enjoy,all staff are very friendly...Thanks Phoenix Park Inn for a memorable holiday

When we entered in Phoenix Park Inn we are slightly worried about hotel but when we stayed here after two days I'm really surprise it's really a very good hotel, They cared their guest very politely, the room is very luxurious almost all facilities are available, food is very tasty, because we are RCI platinum member they offered us for complimentary breakfast. 
Best location resorts, Beach is approximately 1.2 km from hotel but due to rainy season there is no Shack, room service is very good, good wifi, all toiletry is available, I highly recommend this hotel for all our RCI members.

I was in Goa last month and booked a deluxe room through my tourist guide in Phoenix Inn Resort, Goa. As I heard it is a 4-star hotel so I had some pre-notions about the hotel like I was suspicious of the hospitality and dining there. I reached the hotel at 12 at night and was very tired but the refreshing kokum drink(welcome drink) was the feast started there to make me feel at home. I was surprised by the extremly humble front office service. Now comes to room, it was wonderful, very clean, and was equipped with the every comfort that one needs. The houskeeping department are so good and helping. The view is awesome from the window. The Candolium beach is just 10 minute walk from the hotel so it was an added advantage to choose Phoenix as my residing venue. I stayed 2 night and 3 days there and not a single time the hotel staff gave me a reason to complain. Hotel provide me picka nd drop facility to the airport at odd hours and I can confidently reccomadate the resort to every tourist in Goa.

The staffs, managers...the service...the hospitality- all are recommendable, I will definitely recommend this hotel to the visitors in Goa. The facilities, the pool, the food...everything is just great

We really had a great stay at Phoenix Park inn Goa. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Complementary Breakfast was superb one can get any kind of breakfast, The buffet Lunch and dinner was fabulous Most important you can easily access taxi and 2 wheeler rental just stepping out the hotel. All the staffs including security, Reception staffs, Room service and restaurants staffs were very friendly and cooperative to all the guests. The location of hotel is in North Goa(Condolim) which is one of the most happening place in Goa. So definitely it will be a great experience with Phoenix Park Inn Resort :)

It was a wonderful experience at Phoenix Park Inn. The property is located close to calangaut beach also not far from Candolim & Baga beach. 
Very nice and comfortable room. Friendly staff and Excellent food. 
Overall great hospitality. Will definitely stay at the same place on nxt visit.

Just arrived back after spending 3 weeks at this brilliant hotel. It's my second time staying here and won't be my last. 

When we arrived our room wasn't ready but it wasn't a major problem as friends we were with their room was, so we were able to use theirs till ours was ready. 

The staff can't do enough for you and the grounds are spotless. 

The hotel is down a side street off the main road so it's lovely and quiet. 

We had a pool facing room which was so nice and our room cleaner Harendra could t do enough to make our stay as pleasant. 

I do feel sorry for some staff the way some English tourist speak and treat them. They think they're their slaves. Moaning because they could t bring them a pot of tea quick enough when u could make it in a cup. 

An excellent hotel in a great location.

We booked the phoenix park & after reading some of the reviews we were optimistic, 
BUT I can honestly say i do not know what some people want, 
This hotel is Great Value for money, perfectly situated no traffic noise. Its spotless clean, The staff are always smiling friendly & happy to helpful in anyway they can. The food was delicious. 
We had a 14 night stay nothing was to much trouble. The room was cleaned daily with & bottled water - tea & coffee making facilities replenished daily, there was also a Fridge, Cable TV, 2 ceiling fans & air con & wifi in our room ALL FREE. NO upgrade needed. 
The down side only small balconies & only around 28 sunbeds which were full before 8am, 
( this did not bother us as we went down to the beach shack & spent the day there) If we wanted a lazy day. 
Before we went to Goa everyone was telling us its only toast for breakfast, They were wrong as at the Phoenix Park we got everything Eggs Boiled, scrambled, fried, Omelette (ham onion tomato cheese) etc - poached, all made to how you like it, Bacon, cereal, fruit, porridge, toast, Jams- honey, Indian Breakfast, also full menu for the rest of the day & room service if required. the bar was well stocked & nice & clean, not 24hrs anymore though because of complaints ( Not the staffs fault or the hotels). 
I would Recommend The Phoenix Park to anyone thinking of going to Candolim & I would definitely go back without a shadow of a doubt.
A big Thank You To All The Staff At Phoenix Park.

Stayed at the phoenix park from 28 Jan to 8 Feb can't complain at all. Staff were very helpful even when there was no teaspoons at breakfast. Good position a short walk from the beach, and the town. The taxi drivers outside the hotel were a bit intimidating but a firm no thanks done the trick. Candalim it's self is a very busy place changed a lot in 11 years since we were last here, found some of the local people were quite rude as if they resented us travellers. But over all had a very nice time. A big thank you to the staff of the phoenix park for a very nice stay.

Just came back home. We had wonderful 2 weeks in this great hotel.
Location is very good, no traffic noises from the main street.
Hotel staff is one of best I have ever met. They will do everything for you,
nothing is impossible.
Been in many places all around Goa for many times and I can tell you this is brilliant.
House cleaning works, room service is good and fast.
Very good renowated room. Wi-Fi works all around.
Next year again.

Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Phoenix Park Inn and can honestly say we loved it. The rooms are very nice and spacious, albeit the bed was just too hard for me to sleep but on telling the receptionist next day I had a lovely mattress topper put on which was lovely. Breakfast was really good, plenty to choose from although you do have to order your eggs cooked any way and ask for bacon. The gala night is excellent and the selection of food is vast. We found everyone really helpful and friendly, a massive thank you to our lovely housekeeper Sumesh who kept our room beautiful, Thank you so much to Smedha in reception for all your help. The hotel is in a perfect location just down a small side street so away from all the hustle and bustle and noise of the main road, perfect for shops and bars and just a 10 minute walk from all the beach road shops and bars as well. Now if I have one gripe it has to be the pool area, Its not massive so doesn't has a lot of sunbeds so it really does my head in when people are still claiming sunbeds at stupid o clock times in the morning putting their towels or books etc on the beds and then disappearing to the beach or shops for 3 or 4 hours then just saunter on back and claim the beds. I would however definitely stay again and am looking to book for next February, loved the place.

Arrived by taxi in the small hours and was quickly checked in by the officiant reception staff that were on at 2am in the morning, a guy from reception took our bags to block 2 as we followed, first impressions of the room were ok though the balcony was small but ok for 2 people to sit out and chill which I did with the help of the fridge bar till 4am, bed was a bit hard but ok, room was cleaned every day and clean towels privided,the bathroom was ample with endless hot water for showering, the breakfast spread was OK and always ordered an omelette as I went in, there were other dishes and plenty of fruit and cereals. I will say one of the good things about the hotel is that it is constantly being maintained and cleaned also is that it is about 100 metres from the main road so you very rarely here any car or bike horns that dominate India, beach is a 10 to 15 min walk but if you can't be bothered there is always the sound of someone saying "taxi" as you walk out of the hotel, I would certainly stay here again and would recommend others to give it a go.

I was very impressed with this hotel and could hardly find any faults. If I had to be picky then all I'd mention is the lack of sunloungers and chairs at the pool area, although the pool is not a huge size and January is a popular time for holidaymakers. At breakfast make sure you place your order for an omelette or eggs to your liking with one of the waiters as there isn't an area to queue and if you want bacon just ask. All staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay and as it's down a side road you don't hear the noise from the main road. Our room was spotless and we were given water and toilet roll every day. I'd like to give a special thank you to Chandan, the housekeeper who works really hard and asked every day if our room was ok and if we'd like it cleaned. There's a small kids' splash pool but otherwise this hotel is suited for adults. I'd definitely stay here again.

Just returned from Phoenix Park after a two weeks stay we were a party of Six adults. We have visited Goa many times and I have got to say this is the best hotel we have stayed in. All the staff were pleasant and helpful our room was cleaned daily clean bedding and towels+two bottles of water.We didn't upgrade we had a kingsize bed a flat screen TV mini fridge, kettle and tea and coffee.Breakfast was good offering Indian food, eggs toast juice tea and coffee
On our last day we were going to pay to keep a room on but we were given a room at 6pm for 2 hours so we all could shower and change
The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the beach and is close to shops and bars
We would definitely use this hotel again

Just returned from another stay at Phoenix Park Inn. I cannot rate this hotel any higher. Really comfortable, clean and friendly. Breakfast, food and drinks are great. Hotel room really comfortable, air con good, complimentary bottled water, tea/coffee daily in room. Excellent cleaning all over the hotel, lovely clean towels and bedding daily. The hotel has been refurbished during 2016 and I therefore think that all rooms including standard will be of good quality. One noticeable difference to year prior is that staff are asking for comments and checking on the comfort of your stay throughout, a good service as if you are unhappy about anything at all it will be dealt with quickly. Manager generally walks around all the Hotel and grounds checking that all is in order. We stayed over xmas and new year, did not stay in for the new year gala but wish we had of done after hearing other guests comments about the event. It both looked and sounded amazing. The staff worked so hard on this event in preparation and the tear down to restore all areas of the hotel ready for breakfast serving on new years day. If we had not already made prior arrangements with friends we would have stayed in for the Gala New Year and will surely take part next year. Well done Phoenix Park Inn and we look forward to seeing you again in December 2017

i stayed @ Phoenix Park inn By Radisson in November 2016 on my first anniverssary,
i bookd a premium room but hotel gave me a complimentary upgrade to newly renovated Deluxe room. Room was very great, big in size,, nice decoration. new bathroom... but without bathtub or Jacuzzi 

overall hotel is very nice with a great pool and separate pool for the kids breakfast was great with many options like parantha ,, poori bhaji,,, live dosa.,, live omellete of ur choice and many more things that a 4 star property offers.. 

overall it was a great experience.. will surely recommend everyone for the hotel as its not much far away from the most happening calangute beach,, just 4 km..

Awesome place to stay , value for money and staff is very cooperative, food is good , located very near to happening market and candolim beach. Overall good experience and I recommend people to choose this resort who wants peaceful stay and happening nearby

Had a great stay lots of choice for breakfast English or Indian will defiantly go back staff nothing to much trouble lovely people need moskito smokers around pool area at night lovely hotel entertainment most nights

We have stayed in candolim on 6 occasions over the last 14 years and we were very pleasantly surprised by the Phoenix Park Inn
The room was a standard double with a very modern (by Goan standards) shower room.
The room had been re modelled last season and the paint was fresh and bright.
The bed was a super king size and very comfortable.
The hotel overall was clean and well kept. It was a 10 min walk to the main beach and 5 mins to the main road where shops and restaurants were situated.
Breakfast was served in a large airy restaurant and was buffet style with both Indian and continental choices were on offer. Eggs, any style and bacon were cooked to order.
Tea making facilities were in the room as was the hairdryer.
We had a large open to the air balcony ( we were on the top floor) and it was lovely to sit out with a drink before we went out in the evening.
Typically the view from the balcony was lovely if you sat and looked straight out at the palm trees with a glimpse of the sea in the distance. But don't look down as it's the usual view!! Not quite so lovely. Not all the rooms had such lovely balconies but they all had one or a terrace.
The pool and outside bar area was very pleasant and clean and the staff all very helpful, polite and cheery.
The staff on reception were also very helpful and accommodating.
Can't emphasises how happy we were and we would go there again.

Here for a month, little oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Candolim! Nice pool and ample room to chill. The staff are very friendly and rooms are of superior quality for.Goa. believe me I have stayed all over in the 14 years that I have visited this area.can" fault it for what you pay. Prices for drink and food are the same as outside. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

We stayed in This hotel for 4 nights and the ambience and staff were great!! Breakfast Quality was average for an Indian taste. But the rooms were neat and clean and the hospitality was great. We would love to come back to this hotel.

Though we just stayed there for a day(as we didn't get a reservation in the lemon tree which is close to this hotel) we felt it was nice. The front desk people are not very cooperative, they didnt even offer us another room when we didnt like the room, the room was small... anyway on the whole the facilities were nice and the entire staff except for the front desk guys were smiling and cooperative... i would suggest you to please see which room you are booking before booking it, ask them to share a pic... yes they did help us take our luggage to another hotel in the end... so ya it was a good place...

Having recently returned home from our stay at the Phoenix park, we have to say that this has to be in the top ten in the candolim area. We have stayed at a few other places in Candolim but this was the best yet . Staff are forever helpful and polite at all times . Grounds are well maintained,as are the rooms. Breakfast has a great choice of both Indian and continental dishes all very good. 
Would highly recommend this great hotel, even the walk from the main road is closer to 200 yards rather than 300. 
Altogether great value for money !

We stayed b&b which was very good! The food looked lovely on the gala evening! 
We had a refurbished room which was really nice! We have been told they are standard with Thompson but by request with Thomas Cook. The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and a supply of bottled water!! Definitely recommend and stay there again!
The young man who cleaned our room (5410) was lovely!

It was our wedding anniversary to planned to visit Goa this year, we wanted to stay in North Goa so this was the best fit which suited us, the property is bit old design but is very good, rooms were quite good and equipped for all needs, it has a central pool but it was not that clean and maintained as it should have been, the candloim beach is walk able and you also get bike on rent from outside hotel, calanguate and baga beach are also within reach of 15 min, breakfast served in morning is good but options are limited, but if you are looking for good nice property in north goa than you can always consider this.

stayed at this hotel over new year for 2 weeks the rooms are spacious and clean. a big thank you to ganesh our cleaner . the best a/c ever. free wi fi too. fridge in room,kettle with free coffee and tea bags, breakfast was good grounds are kept nice. hotel made a real effort for new year it looked lovely .so if you want a nice hotel not far from anything stay at this hotel but reminder you are in goa we will be back again this year same dates

Spent three weeks at phoenix park over Christmas and new year hotel was just fine found all the staff friendly and helpful the lad that cleaned our room done a great job everyday the one issue we did have was when my wife caught the security guard trying to put the hotel cat into a plastic bag to dispose of it. She stopped this happening spoke to the manager who I must say was a very approachable man and ask him if it was ok to take the cat to a cat sanctuary to be rehomed. We did this and now the cat will have a happy life. I would definitely stay at phoenix park again

Rooms with pool view were great! very clean and well kept premises. The house staff were always smiling prompt and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. They went out of their way to accomodate our large family for dinner at their restaurant. They helped with room moves when they had better rooms available.

I would have given them five stars however a teenager in our group was injured quite badly by protruding screws at the bottom of their pool. The staff did not immediately fix the problem so another guest went in and tried to fix the screws in the pool as other children were also playing in the pool. A doctor was called who arrived within an hour. We had to take the child to an operating theatre for X-rays and to be stitched up by an orthopedic surgeon. With complaints, the resort said that they fixed the screws in the pool 2-3 days later. 

Despite this grave incident, it is a great resort, we would visit again. Their pool valve needs regular maintainance, so watch out for that valve. Otherwise you will enjoy your stay.

We stayed at this hotel over christmas and new year the room was very spacious and clean thanks to our cleaner Harendra who always had a smile and a welcome and always asked if the room was ok.The breakfast room was large and had a variety of foods available the waiters were very attentive and were willing to take your order for eggs bacon sausage etc, the two gala dinners we had were ok i am glad we did'nt have to pay for them as they were free to Thomsons guests.The hotel is in a quiet residential street but this seems to be overlooked by the hotel owners the pool bar which was close to our room served drinks some times until 05:30 to boozy Brits who had no respect for other guests by shouting swearing and singing songs,i like a drink as much as anybody but always behave and would have spoiled the sleep of the other guests which included families. I think the hotel should address this problem and maybe use the security guard who is employed there.This was the only blight on what was a very enjoyable holiday I would possibly return to this hotel but in a room away from the pool bar.

We spent 3 weeks over Xmas here and enjoyed our stay.
The hotel is in a good central location and the grounds are well kept.
Our room was large overlooking the pool with very effective A/C and cleaned daily to a good standard. 
The pool area wasn't very big and had the sunbed hoggers. It didn't bother us as we spend our days at the beach shacks.
The only negative was that the pool bar was open 24 hours. This wasn't a problem for the first 2 weeks but for the week after Christmas there was guests shouting, singing and generally been loud at the bar until 3.30 - 4am which was very close to our room. Also I woke up one morning to sit on the balcony to be greeted with a ring side view of one guest fighting and swearing with another and having to be restrained by a number of staff. Not what we want to see on holiday!
It's a really nice hotel but probably wouldn't return whilst there is a 24 hour bar operating.

Staff very friendly and helpful ,room very clean and recently updated, 10 min from beach everyone in hotel spoke, mainly English tourist's, overall brill holiday,only slight problem was mozzies at night round pool area,

We (2 families of 2 daults & 1 child each) returned last weekend from Goa after a 3N/4D stay at this resort. Overall we had a very good vacation & hence am going to overlook minor deficiencies, but rather look at the bigger picture around complete hospitality solutions that the resport provided. And the star of the place was the staff - housekeeping, restaurant, front desk...every one that we interacted was very helpful & courteous. The Candolim beach is around 10 mins walk from the property (there was no shuttle pickup/drop to the beach from the hotel, so plan as such) & plenty of restaurant options for all budgets on the Candolim-Aguada main road. Pleasant stay

Stayed for two weeks 02/12/2016 to 17/12/2016 two Adults
Room 2204
I upgraded to a superior room before travelling, 
The room was spacious and well fitted but in need of a bit of TLC, two ceiling fans and air con made the room very comfortable, could have done with more drawer space, but we managed.
Bath room was adequate (sink leaked but was fixed within 10mins)
clean towels every day if requested, two bottles of water supplied every day, balcony not suitable to sit out (a bit on the small side)
Room service very good but could leave the cleaning till late afternoon, a word with the cleaning lad resolved the problem.
Meals
We only had B&B, 
Breakfast was o/k, their was more choice if you wanted Indian, but there was enough choice for us.
Any type of egg, streaky bacon if requested,sausage?, toast cereal and the usual beverages.
Bar service good even if a bit slow at times (your on holiday)
Pool o/k,needed cleaning properly every day, only part cleaned some days, plenty of sun beds and towels.
Monday night Gala around the pool not to be missed, food was stunning.
Staff
Could not fault any of the staff, they were all very helpful in all matters.
All in all a very enjoyable holiday with a good hotel. Good price, good service, hotel needs a bit of TLC but your in India.
Before you book any trips via your holiday company check the local tour organizers they may just save you a few Rupees(we used Johns travels, you must do the House boat trip,

i have stayed at this hotel 3 years each time at christmas, I had amazing room 4003. i have to question hotel managementover a kitten at this hotel named it phoenix every morning came for a fuss and some milk. The security guard was told to catch the kitten and dispose of it kitten was squilling a guset named debbie saw the security guard which should be sacked hold it by its tail stuffed it into a plastic bag and shoulved it in a laundry van , debbie ran down stopped it and set it free, spoke to management they did not care any one going please ask were the cat is black and white, i can not stop there any more, i would ask every one to avoid this hotel

The hotel is located off the Candolim Calangute stretch. It's a good 10-15 minutes from the beach. The rooms are very good, great decor etc. However, there isn't much to do in the hotel apart from a swimming pool. Overall, its a decent hotel but you can get beachside properties for the same price.

We stayed here for 14 days, it was a lovely hotel, the rooms were very nice,spacious,has a fridge, and a safe for peace of mind,the bathroom was also spacious and the shower was perfect.we had bed and breakfast which had a good choice of food to suit all, the staff were all friendly and waited on you hand and foot if that's what you wanted.the only letdown really was the swimming pool as there were only 26 sun beds available at the time there are roughly about 150 rooms at the hotel so a few more sunbeds might have given us more of a chance, and we were told by other guests that pool was too cold anyway, the beach in candolim was fantastic,the shacks on the beach that were run by the local people had a good choice of menu for food and drinks, and they always liked a little chat,there were dogs and cows wondering the beach but if you left them alone they were ok.there are plenty of bars and restaurants which are only a five minute walk from the hotel, and the beach is about a ten minute walk so that was good.we did have money problems due to a change in their currency as we couldant get any money out to spend at the bars and shops which I believe is still going on.

I arrived a few nights ago late at night and received warm welcome by all. Shown to room and enjoyed great hospitality in dining room at breakfast. Few minor issues such as hot water and to quicky sorted by maintenance (both my ignorance not the hotel fault). Day 2 small problem with window closer...Harry in charge of housekeeping dealt with it fantastically well, room is beautiful, and guys looking after luggage to facilate the move were so gracious.

Just returned after a very good two week stay at this hotel. On arrival at the hotel the reception staff were very pleasant & had a very quick check in . We were allocated room 2302 which was a basic room but was very clean & quite modern for Indian standards & included flat screen tv, kettle , fridge & a hair dryer , plus a safe for a deposit of 10 which was refunded when you checked out. The dining area is very good with plenty of staff around to help you & the food was pretty good , & you must do the Gala night buffet ( about 7 a head ) the food was excellent. The bar is open 24/7 , but keep a check on your bar bill, pay it off EVERYDAY to many people were getting charged twice for drinks this was,nt the bar staffs fault but the receptions staff who weren't cancelling the bill.
The hotel has a very small pool area so most people go to the beach which is about a 15 minute walk, we could not use the pool as it had a filter problem & was a bit off putting. On a night time around the bar make sure you use plenty of mossie spray .But over all a very good hotel which we would return too.

We stayed in this hotel for two weeks and enjoyed our stay very much. It is in a decent location in Candolim, within walking distance of most restaurants and bars. also it is just far enough from the main street not to suffer from the noise of a multitude of motorbikes,taxis and buses with their constant pipping of horns and has taxi available outside. It is part of the Park Inns chain which itself is owned by Radisson hotels.

The hotel has rooms in separate blocks and are good quality. They have a large double or twin beds, tea and coffee making facilities,minibar, free bottles of water every day, air con a decent bathroom/walk in shower.and a balcony.
The location of our block was just down from the pool area which made it quieter but made the balcony a waste of time as it was opposite another block and always in the shade - if this is a requirement then it is wise to contact the hotel directly to ensure you get a pool view.
The pool area/bar was a nice place to be. The area gets plenty of sun. if it gets too hot, as the sun moves across, parts get slightly cooler so you can move around.

Unfortunately, having said that, when we visited the beach shacks were not open owing to licence delays which encouraged more people to stay by the pool. This meant that sunbeds could be at a premium, generally there aren't enough but with space for more generally lacking, it's a situation that is hard to improve, Our second week was better as more people went to the beach so it wouldn't normally be an issue.

Staff were great, very friendly and attentive. reception staff were helpful, pool bar staff very friendly and our room cleaner was very creative with his towel models!

I recommend the hotel - it has the odd issue but not serious ones, and would return.

Great hotel staff were wonderful, especially Suedip on the bar he was so good at his job 
The hotels picture do not do the hotel justice 
It is spotless and located in a great position.
The food was very good and the pool was cleaned everyday
Only thing was there wasn't enough sunbeds

Just need to inform holiday makers who are going to Goa and staying at the Phoenix park Inn resort, please be aware that if your flight is the 3-15 pm from Manchester you will arrive at the hotel approx 7-30 am but you won't be able to get into your rooms till 2 pm in the afternoon that is a six and a half hour wait. I don't blame the hotel because this is the hotel policy, but I do think that holiday makers should be informed by Thomsons so you can make a decision on whether to fly at that time or not

Located at candolim road, opposite lemon tree hotel. We had booked a premium room and it was nice and comfortable with a private sitting area with pool close by. Breakfast is nice and adequate and the staff is courteous. Within walking distance you get quality restaurant and supermarts. Beach is walking distance around 500m. Candolim is the best place to stay in this area and has the best places to eat. Overall a nice and pleasant stay.

I don't know why people complaint about staying in Goa, what I believe is, Goa is not there place to be spent in a room. The hotel is worth staying. Nice rooms with pool view and clean washrooms. Very near to the main road, where you can visit all the popular restaurants.. Breakfast spread is decent, not best.

Most friendly and helpful receptionist ever, so lovely and great first impression of hotel. Couldn't have been more sweet, giving me directions to a function I was attending along with a helpful map, ensuring parking in car park and facilitating an early check in. If nothing else had gone right with hotel this lady ensured I would have left with a good impression. Fortunately everything about the hotel was exceptional, and I don't give praise lightly. It was clean, stylish, roomy with excellent service .. restaurant where we had dinner. Food was beyond good and great value for money and service in both places attentive and efficient. Room itself was well equipped and comfortable. I could go on but suffice it to say I was very pleased with my stay, and although short and sweet this time, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

this property is situated near to the market and food hub and walking distance from the beach too. staff is courteous and property is tooooo good with a nice rooms. lot of variety in Breakfast and day to day activity is also a fun.

This is the 2nd visit to hotel. We booked a pool view room through thomsons, last year was very quiet at night but it seems that they now serve drinks until 3am at the pool bar, not once but most night we were kept awake by the noise. My advice to anyone who has booked a pool room to change it, unless you are a very heavy sleeper you won't get any!!!!! Breakfasts are not brilliant. Although the hotel is nice lack of sleep is not.

the hotel is nice , at the reception i thought that i made a mistake booking this hotel , there wasn't any lift at the hotel so had to climb 2 floors but after entering the room i was amazed , the room was very spacious and clean , its newly renovated but i was able to spot that the hotel is very old . my stay was worth the money i booked the room in august for November 16th and got one room at around 4000 per night , overall my experience was very nice .

Hi All , we stayed at Park Inn in October for our anniversary , we were 2 couples .
We enjoyed the hotel stay overall . Initially the room assigned to us was in a block where some maintenance work was happening , painters were all around . When we shared the feedback with the hotel , the front desk lady was kind enough to change our room . Our new room was fantastic & had an amazing pool view . Staff was very courteous & helpful . The steward who served us at the restaurant was very nice . Breakfast spread was average & the quality of food definitely needs improvement . There was improvement after sharing our feedback with the staff , however this needs some more improvement . The pool is beautiful & we really had a good time there . The staff decorated our room beautifully for our anniversary . Loved everything about the hotel except the food .

If you are looking at spending quality time in some of the best beaches in North Goa, Candolim is the place to be and Phoenix Inn is good choice to organize your stay.

Good:
Service and courteousness of the staff deserve a special mention. Big thank you to them!!
Swimming pool is good with a poolside bar available as well.
Prompt Room service.
Commendable Breakfast Buffet spread with North and South dishes included.
Close proximity to several beaches including Candolim & Sinquerium. Popular beaches like Calangute, Baga and Anjuna are all within 10km radius. Aguada fort is about 4km away.

Average:
There was renovation work carried out in one wing which restricted the balcony usage. Hopefully this is something that may finish soon and pose no further hindrance
Breakfast buffet tends to be chaotic at times. The management can certainly think of better management of the same. 
Overall food quality at the restaurant(Chapora) was good but not great and menu pricing was slightly on expensive side.There are multiple restaurants available in and around the restaurant offering equally good if not better food. 
Road connecting the resort and main-road is dim-light.

Stayed here for a week as part of downtime for a 3 week trip to India backpacking . I read some of the reviews here and wonder if people stayed in the same place . Our room was lovely fresh towels , soaps ,robes and water were provided everyday and the room was made up every time we asked our friendly chamber guy to do so usually at a time we were out . Breakfast was very good plenty of variety provided with western and Indian choices galore . The biggest compliment goes to the staff throughout the hotel they couldn't do enough to make your stay comfortable and were courteous to a fault after a few days we were dreading going home . My only criticism was we requested an airport pick up which was offered by the hotel and this failed to arrive after discussing this with Michelle at the front desk we were provided with one for the return leg of our journey . This place is close by to the local supermarket and restaurants a short walk away . The beach is only a few minutes away ,it's brilliantly located . I'd recommend a stay and have done to anyone .

this resort is in one of the quiet place of north goa in candolim. Its a great value for money. Rooms are neatly furnished and new. staff are very courteous. breakfast is g ood. the beach is just 500 metres from the resort. This is a wonderful beach where one can spend entire day. there are many bar and restaurants nearby too.overall a nice experience. thoroughly enjoyed my goa stay there.

A nice hotel excellent location for walking to shops restaurants and beach. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms good size and cleaned daily. Restaurant on site excellent good choices . Good pool and pool bar. Not a large complex so great for kids to play on the pool.

Resort is right in the heart of Candolim.Restaurants, beaches and shops are all easily accessible from here.our stay was comfortable for three good nights...the breakfast spread was good but not so great.few items were not cooked properly.and same items were repeated everyday...the staff should learn to manage the crowd swarming around the buffet table...and also change the menu to suit the guests... overall it was satisfying...pool was clean and beautiful.room was big enough and maintained well...service was really quick..worth every penny spent here....did not try lunch and dinner at the restaurant as we managed it outside....do try phoenix inn to enjoy ur goa vacation

I had read reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to book this Hotel.

I must say, that the experience turned out to be very good. The Hotel is a fantastic place to stay for the middle income family, and more so for people who are travelling alongwith families. It has a nice cozy swimming pool (and one for kids too) surrounded alongwith a small park, kids just love it! The food is awesome, with a complete meal provided. The location is perfect, with all major beaches of the North very close by...........It has famous properties such as the Taj Resort and Vijay Mallya's bungalow nearby.

The rooms are again..........just perfect......it had a plasma television, controlled air conditioning, clean / perfect washrooms,etc. however I did make sure that I book the best of the rooms and confirmed with the Hotel Front Desk umpteen number of times, that I was given the best of the rooms

If you are travelling to North Goa, this is the best place to stay!

Please note that the travel date is June 2010.

Stayed there for five days with family and friends . While the initial rooms alloted were not that great however the same same were changed once brought to the notice of staff. This place is close to candolim beach - 5 min walk from the hotel. This place is close to other important places like augda fort / beach as well. Must say that the hotel staff is very helpful and supportive. This resort provides you value for money.

Awesome place to stay! The experience here was the best for me. It is located near CANDOLIM BEACH. Yes, it's not near the beach, but that is pretty evident from all the sites that it has been listed on. It isn't one of those hotels which have 'beach resort' in their name but are located in the centre of the town. The things that I loved about the hotel are as below... Smooth check-in and check-out process. Polite & courteous staff (Mr. SATTU & TEAM) All the staff in the hotel that I interacted with were very polite and always helpful. Ambience The ambience of the hotel, whether it be the lobby or the room was really good. The rooms are spacious, neat and clean and so is the lobby. The food was amazing. The buffet breakfast we had was like a complete meal with everything on The menu that one can ask for. We opted for a buffet dinner after we tasted a couple of dishes on the first day and were impressed with the chef. 

There is some minor issue with the BATHROOMS, needs repairing issues else thngs was great.

The only issue with the hotel is TRANSPORTATION - Hotel doesnt own taxis so they hired/provide the local ones. Drivers are not in proper dress, car was in bad condition, rude and they shows tantrums as well. I guess HOTEL MANAGEMENT is lacking this issue they should own atleast 2 -3 taxis IN the name of the hotel which gives comfort level to get into the car at the airport. We only got a good taxi and driver while dropping means end of our tour.
Else everythng
